Lines.Text: before beginning , lay out the contents of the magic box kit . they should include ( clockwise from the left ) :
car adapter
large magic box
small magic box
wire strippers
also locate the magsafe charger you wish to modify .

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning, lay out the contents of the Magic Box kit. They should include (clockwise from the left): Car Adapter Large Magic Box Small Magic Box Wire Strippers Also locate the MagSafe charger you wish to modify.

Lines.Text: make sure that the power adapter is disconnected from the wall outlet and macbook .
use a pen to make a mark on the magsafe cable about 4 ( 10 cm ) from the magsafe connector .
use a pair of wire cutters or scissors to cut the cable at the mark you made about 4 inches from the magsafe connector . set aside the magsafe connector wire for later .
although the wires inside the cable are copper , they may damage some scissors . we recommend using wire cutters if possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure that the power adapter is disconnected from the wall outlet and MacBook. Use a pen to make a mark on the MagSafe cable about 4" (10 cm) from the MagSafe connector. Use a pair of [product|IF145-057|wire cutters] or scissors to cut the cable at the mark you made about 4 inches from the MagSafe connector. Set aside the MagSafe connector wire for later. Although the wires inside the cable are copper, they may damage some scissors. We recommend using wire cutters if possible.

Lines.Text: use a pen to make a mark about . 75 ( 2 cm ) from the cut end on the side of the cable attached to the power adapter .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pen to make a mark about .75" (2 cm) from the cut end on the side of the cable attached to the power adapter.

Lines.Text: before using the included wire strippers , we recommend cleaning the upper and lower flat areas where the tool grips the cable with de-greaser . the manufacturing process leaves a small amount of grease on these areas that may stain the white cable you are about to strip .

Steps.Text_raw: Before using the included wire strippers, we recommend cleaning the upper and lower flat areas where the tool grips the cable with de-greaser. The manufacturing process leaves a small amount of grease on these areas that may stain the white cable you are about to strip.

Lines.Text: there are four stripping holes of varying sizes on the wire stripper .
carefully position the cable in the largest ( innermost ) hole on the wire stripper and line up the edge of the jaws with the mark you just made as seen in the first picture .
squeeze the wire stripper to remove the outer cord tubing , revealing wire strands beneath .
if necessary , slide the outer sheath off the end of the cable .

Steps.Text_raw: There are four stripping holes of varying sizes on the wire stripper. Carefully position the cable in the largest (innermost) hole on the wire stripper and line up the edge of the jaws with the mark you just made as seen in the first picture. Squeeze the wire stripper to remove the outer cord tubing, revealing wire strands beneath. If necessary, slide the outer sheath off the end of the cable.

Lines.Text: gently move the fine wire strands aside to reveal an inner wire .
twist the loose outer wire strands together into a single twisted strand .
if you are handy with a soldering iron , tinning the ground lead after you twist it together will help keep it in one piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently move the fine wire strands aside to reveal an inner wire. Twist the loose outer wire strands together into a single twisted strand. If you are handy with a soldering iron, tinning the ground lead after you twist it together will help keep it in one piece.

Lines.Text: use a pen to make a mark about 3 /8 ( 1 cm ) away from the end of the inner wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pen to make a mark about 3/8" (1 cm) away from the end of the inner wire.

Lines.Text: using the wire stripper again , align the edge of its jaws with the second smallest hole on the pen mark made in the previous step .
squeeze the wire stripper to strip off the insulation on the inner wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the wire stripper again, align the edge of its jaws with the second smallest hole on the pen mark made in the previous step. Squeeze the wire stripper to strip off the insulation on the inner wire.

Lines.Text: as before , twist the center wire strands tightly into a single twisted strand .

Steps.Text_raw: As before, twist the center wire strands tightly into a single twisted strand.

Lines.Text: line up the outer and inner twisted strands side by side and trim the ends of both wires to make them equal in length .
do not trim too much !

Steps.Text_raw: Line up the outer and inner twisted strands side by side and trim the ends of both wires to make them equal in length. Do not trim too much!

Lines.Text: locate the large magic box .
remove the cover of the large magic box and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the Large Magic Box. Remove the cover of the Large Magic Box and set it aside.

Lines.Text: before attempting to insert the wires , note their correct orientation . the center wire should be inserted into the positive ( + ) terminal on the left and the outer wire should be inserted into the negative ( - ) terminal on the right .
use your thumb to push back the orange spring clamps on both terminals and insert both wires into their respective terminals . insert the wires as far in as possible .
make sure that exposed strands of the positive and negative wires do not touch each other when installed in their final positions in the terminals !

Steps.Text_raw: Before attempting to insert the wires, note their correct orientation. The center wire should be inserted into the positive (+) terminal on the left and the outer wire should be inserted into the negative (-) terminal on the right. Use your thumb to push back the orange spring clamps on both terminals and insert both wires into their respective terminals. Insert the wires as far in as possible. Make sure that exposed strands of the positive and negative wires do not touch each other when installed in their final positions in the terminals!

Lines.Text: replace the large magic box cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the Large Magic Box cover.

Lines.Text: congratulations ! you just modified the macbook power adapter to be capable of recharging the hyperjuice battery directly .
to charge a first generation hyperjuice battery , plug the male connector from the large magic box into the charge port on the hyperjuice battery .
to charge a hyperjuice 1.5 or hyperjuice 2 battery , use the short male to male cable that came in the kit to connect the large magic box to the dc in port on the hyperjuice battery .
the female connector has the higher voltage required to change the newer batteries .
the led light on the large magic box will be '''red''' during charging of the hyperjuice battery and will turn '''green''' when it is done charging .

Steps.Text_raw: Congratulations! You just modified the MacBook Power Adapter to be capable of recharging the HyperJuice battery directly. To charge a first generation HyperJuice battery, plug the male connector from the Large Magic Box into the CHARGE port on the HyperJuice battery. To charge a HyperJuice 1.5 or HyperJuice 2 battery, use the short male to male cable that came in the kit to connect the Large Magic Box to the DC IN port on the HyperJuice Battery. The female connector has the higher voltage required to change the newer batteries. The LED light on the Large Magic Box will be '''RED''' during charging of the HyperJuice battery and will turn '''GREEN''' when it is done charging.

Lines.Text: now let's repeat the process with the magsafe end of the cable and the small magic box .
on the the cable with the magsafe connector , as before , make a mark . 75 ( 2 cm ) from the cut end .

Steps.Text_raw: Now let's repeat the process with the MagSafe end of the cable and the Small Magic Box. On the the cable with the MagSafe connector, as before, make a mark .75" (2 cm) from the cut end.

Lines.Text: again , use the largest ( innermost ) stripping hole to remove the outer cord tubing at the mark you just made .

Steps.Text_raw: Again, use the largest (innermost) stripping hole to remove the outer cord tubing at the mark you just made.

Lines.Text: unravel the outer loose wire strands and twist them into a single strand .
if you are handy with a soldering iron , tinning the ground lead after you twist it together will help keep it in one piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Unravel the outer loose wire strands and twist them into a single strand. If you are handy with a soldering iron, tinning the ground lead after you twist it together will help keep it in one piece.

Lines.Text: make a mark on the inner wire 3 /8 ( 1 cm ) away from the cut end .

Steps.Text_raw: Make a mark on the inner wire 3/8" (1 cm) away from the cut end.

Lines.Text: align the second smallest hole with the pen mark made in the previous step .
strip off the inner tubing at the mark you just made to reveal the center wire strands .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the second smallest hole with the pen mark made in the previous step. Strip off the inner tubing at the mark you just made to reveal the center wire strands.

Lines.Text: twist the center wire strands tightly into a single twisted strand .
line up the outer and inner twisted strands side by side and trim the ends of both wires to make them equal in length .
do not trim too much !

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the center wire strands tightly into a single twisted strand. Line up the outer and inner twisted strands side by side and trim the ends of both wires to make them equal in length. Do not trim too much!

Lines.Text: locate the small magic box .
remove the cover of the small magic box and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the Small Magic Box. Remove the cover of the Small Magic Box and set it aside.

Lines.Text: as in step 13 , use your thumb to push back the orange spring clamps on both terminals and insert the center wire into the positive ( + ) terminal on the left and the outer wire into the negative ( - ) terminal on the right .
make sure that exposed strands of the positive and negative wires do not touch each other when installed in their final positions in the terminals !

Steps.Text_raw: As in step 13, use your thumb to push back the orange spring clamps on both terminals and insert the center wire into the positive (+) terminal on the left and the outer wire into the negative (-) terminal on the right. Make sure that exposed strands of the positive and negative wires do not touch each other when installed in their final positions in the terminals!

Lines.Text: replace the small magic box cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the Small Magic Box cover.

Lines.Text: with that , you have successfully modified the apple macbook power adapter with the magic boxes .

Steps.Text_raw: With that, you have successfully modified the Apple MacBook Power Adapter with the Magic Boxes.

Lines.Text: use the modified magsafe cable to power and recharge your macbook with hyperjuice external battery . the led light on the small magic box will light green during use .
connect the modified magsafe cable to the macbook car charger to power and recharge your macbook in the car .

connect the small magic box to the socket in the large magic box to regain the original functionality of the apple macbook power adapter , i . e . to power the macbook . we hope you like our magic box solution .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the modified MagSafe Cable to power and recharge your MacBook with HyperJuice external battery. The LED light on the Small Magic Box will light green during use. Connect the modified MagSafe Cable to the MacBook Car Charger to power and recharge your MacBook in the car. Connect the Small Magic Box to the socket in the Large Magic Box to regain the original functionality of the Apple MacBook Power Adapter, i.e. to power the MacBook. We hope you like our Magic Box solution.

Subject: MagSafe Modification Kit

Title: HP PSC 2410 Photosmart All-in-One Printer Scanner Glass Replacement
Category: HP PSC 2410 Photosmart All In One Printer

Lines.Text: carefully wedge the flathead 3 /32 screwdriver on the outer groove of the control panel faceplate .
follow the perimeter of the groove with the flathead 3 /32 screwdriver making sure to gently pry and lift upward until the control panel faceplate comes off .
take your time prying off the control panel faceplate . if too much pressure is applied , the control panel faceplate can break .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully wedge the flathead 3/32" screwdriver on the outer groove of the control panel faceplate. Follow the perimeter of the groove with the flathead 3/32" screwdriver making sure to gently pry and lift upward until the control panel faceplate comes off. Take your time prying off the control panel faceplate.  If too much pressure is applied, the control panel faceplate can break.

Lines.Text: once the control panel faceplate is off , look for the '''lock/unlock tab''' located underneath the off button .

to unlock and release the control panel , insert the flathead 3 /32 screwdriver into the tab and carefully push down . the control panel will then separate from the printer's base by sliding it downward a little .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the control panel faceplate is off, look for the '''Lock/Unlock tab''' located underneath the off button. To unlock and release the control panel, insert the flathead 3/32" screwdriver into the tab and carefully push down. The control panel will then separate from the printer's base by sliding it downward a little.

Lines.Text: underneath the control panel will be a flat grey ribbon cable . this cable is attached at the base of the green control board with the other end of the cable located on the back side of the printer's base .
carefully disconnect both ends of the flat grey ribbon cable to release the control panel in its entirety .
only pull from the connector portion of the cable , as pulling on the wires may damage them .

Steps.Text_raw: Underneath the control panel will be a flat grey ribbon cable. This cable is  attached at the base of the green control board with the other end of the cable located on the back side of the printer's base. Carefully disconnect both ends of the flat grey ribbon cable to release the control panel in its entirety. Only pull from the connector portion of the cable, as pulling on the wires may damage them.

Lines.Text: lift open the scanner lid and locate a black tab located at the center of the scanner bed .
using your finger push ( pull on some printers ) the tab towards the scanner lid . this will release the scanner lid

Steps.Text_raw: Lift open the scanner lid and locate a black tab located at the center of the scanner bed. Using your finger push (pull on some printers) the tab towards the scanner lid. This will release the scanner lid

Title: How to clean the HP PSC 2410 Photosmart All In One Printer callibration strip
Category: HP PSC 2410 Photosmart All In One Printer

Lines.Text: carefully wedge the flathead 3 /32 screwdriver on the outer groove of the control panel faceplate .
follow the perimeter of the groove with the flathead 3 /32 screwdriver making sure to gently pry and lift upward until the control panel faceplate comes off .
take your time prying off the control panel faceplate . if too much pressure is applied , the control panel faceplate can break .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully wedge the flathead 3/32" screwdriver on the outer groove of the control panel faceplate. Follow the perimeter of the groove with the flathead 3/32" screwdriver making sure to gently pry and lift upward until the control panel faceplate comes off. Take your time prying off the control panel faceplate.  If too much pressure is applied, the control panel faceplate can break.

Lines.Text: once the control panel faceplate is off , look for the '''lock/unlock tab''' located underneath the off button .

to unlock and release the control panel , insert the flathead 3 /32 screwdriver into the tab and carefully push down . the control panel will then separate from the printer's base by sliding it downward a little .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the control panel faceplate is off, look for the '''Lock/Unlock tab''' located underneath the off button. To unlock and release the control panel, insert the flathead 3/32" screwdriver into the tab and carefully push down. The control panel will then separate from the printer's base by sliding it downward a little.

Lines.Text: underneath the control panel will be a flat grey ribbon cable . this cable is attached at the base of the green control board with the other end of the cable located on the back side of the printer's base .
carefully disconnect both ends of the flat grey ribbon cable to release the control panel in its entirety .
only pull from the connector portion of the cable , as pulling on the wires may damage them .

Steps.Text_raw: Underneath the control panel will be a flat grey ribbon cable. This cable is  attached at the base of the green control board with the other end of the cable located on the back side of the printer's base. Carefully disconnect both ends of the flat grey ribbon cable to release the control panel in its entirety. Only pull from the connector portion of the cable, as pulling on the wires may damage them.

Lines.Text: lift open the scanner lid and locate a black tab located at the center of the scanner bed .
using your finger push ( pull on some printers ) the tab towards the scanner lid . this will release the scanner lid

Steps.Text_raw: Lift open the scanner lid and locate a black tab located at the center of the scanner bed. Using your finger push (pull on some printers) the tab towards the scanner lid. This will release the scanner lid

Lines.Text: once the scanner lid is removed use the phillips 1 ( torx on some printers ) screwdriver to remove the screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the scanner lid is removed use the Philips #1(Torx on some printers) Screwdriver to remove the screw.

Lines.Text: remove all four silver screws from the corners of the scanner glass cover with a t10 torx screwdriver .
organization is everything . remember to have your ifixit magnetic work mat next to you . it will help keep screws organized and in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove all four silver screws from the corners of the scanner glass cover with a T10 Torx Screwdriver. Organization is everything. Remember to have your iFixit Magnetic Work Mat next to you. It will help keep screws organized and in place.

Lines.Text: once you have removed the four torx screws , gently lift the scanner glass cover from the printer's base .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have removed the four torx screws, gently lift the scanner glass cover from the printer's base.

Lines.Text: turn the scanner glass over and place it on a clean surface .
moisten a lint-free cloth with alcohol and gently wipe down the calibration strip .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the scanner glass over and place it on a clean surface. Moisten a lint-free cloth with alcohol and gently wipe down the calibration strip.

Title: Disassembling Epson Stylus Photo 820 Top Cover

Lines.Text: to remove the top cover of the printer you have to first release it from several tabs .
note : this may take more than one person to complete .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the top cover of the printer you have to first release it from several tabs. Note: This may take more than one person to complete.

Lines.Text: these three are the easiest tabs to remove . they are located on the back side of the printer .
push the tab in with one of the plastic opening tools .
keep the tab pushed in by leveraging the tool between the tab and the hole . pull up on the case so that the tab doesn't lock back into place .
repeat this process with the furthermost right tab , then proceed with the middle tab .

Steps.Text_raw: These three are the easiest tabs to remove. They are located on the back side of the printer. Push the tab in with one of the plastic opening tools. Keep the tab pushed in by leveraging the tool between the tab and the hole. Pull up on the case so that the tab doesn't lock back into place. Repeat this process with the furthermost right tab, then proceed with the middle tab.

Lines.Text: note : it is recommended that step 3 and step 4 be completed simultaneously . the tabs are identical just on opposite sides .
viewing from the front of the printer , there is a tab in the lower left corner .
viewing the tab hole from the bottom of the printer .
insert the mini screwdriver into the marked hole and pry out the tab .
push in towards the blue sticker of the printer while pulling up on the case at the same time . use one of the tools to keep the tab pried open .
this tab is the easiest to break so be very careful .

Steps.Text_raw: Note: It is recommended that step 3 and step 4 be completed simultaneously. The tabs are identical just on opposite sides. Viewing from the front of the printer, there is a tab in the lower left corner. Viewing the tab hole from the bottom of the printer. Insert the mini screwdriver into the marked hole and pry out the tab. Push in towards the blue sticker of the printer while pulling up on the case at the same time. Use one of the tools to keep the tab pried open. This tab is the easiest to break so be very careful.

Lines.Text: there is another tab in the right corner of the printer ( viewing from the front ) .
viewing the tab hole from under the printer .
zoomed in on the tab hole .
follow the same instructions in step 3 to remove this tab .

Steps.Text_raw: There is another tab in the right corner of the printer (viewing from the front). Viewing the tab hole from under the printer. Zoomed in on the tab hole. Follow the same instructions in step 3 to remove this tab.

Lines.Text: the final two tabs can be more difficult to release . viewing from the front , they are located in the back left and right corners of the printer .
the release points for the tabs are located in holes on the depressed area of the base ( darker piece ) .
use the mini screwdriver to pry out the tab .
use one of the plastic tools to keep the tab pried out . once it releases push in towards the printer ( viewing from the side ) and pull up on the case .

Steps.Text_raw: The final two tabs can be more difficult to release. Viewing from the front, they are located in the back left and right corners of the printer. The release points for the tabs are located in holes on the depressed area of the base (darker piece). Use the mini screwdriver to pry out the tab. Use one of the plastic tools to keep the tab pried out. Once it releases push in towards the printer (viewing from the side) and pull up on the case.

Lines.Text: all of the tabs have now been released .
when trying to completely remove the cover , it gets caught on these two back components . maneuvering around these can be tricky .
push the cover to the right slightly and then push it backwards ( out of the screen in this picture ) . this should give it some wiggle room . repeat this as necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: All of the tabs have now been released. When trying to completely remove the cover, it gets caught on these two back components. Maneuvering around these can be tricky. Push the cover to the right slightly and then push it backwards (out of the screen in this picture). This should give it some wiggle room. Repeat this as necessary.

Lines.Text: now , pull the cover up and off .

Steps.Text_raw: Now, pull the cover up and off.

Subject: Top Cover

Title: Removing Numerical Keypad

Lines.Text: you can do this with most keyboards . i had an older dell keyboard model l100.

Steps.Text_raw: You can do this with most keyboards.  I had an older Dell keyboard model L100.

Lines.Text: turn the keyboard over and you will see 15 screws . remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the keyboard over and you will see 15 screws. Remove them.

Lines.Text: take the keyboard apart . you will find a white rubber sheet under the top part of the keyboard . cut off the part for the numerical keypad .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the keyboard apart. You will find a white rubber sheet under the top part of the keyboard. Cut off the part for the numerical keypad.

Lines.Text: fasten the top part of the keyboard and take the hacksaw to it . cut off the numerical keypad part . do not use power tools because you may produce toxic fumes and even activate fire alarm .

Steps.Text_raw: Fasten the top part of the keyboard and take the hacksaw to it. Cut off the numerical keypad part. Do not use power tools because you may produce toxic fumes and even activate fire alarm.

Lines.Text: on the bottom part of the keyboard , remove the three screws and the metal bar holding the keyboard pcb and fold the plastic sheet so it is out of your way when cutting .

Steps.Text_raw: On the bottom part of the keyboard, remove the three screws and the metal bar holding the keyboard PCB and fold the plastic sheet so it is out of your way when cutting.

Lines.Text: now mark the bottom part of the keyboard for another cut .

Steps.Text_raw: Now mark the bottom part of the keyboard for another cut.

Lines.Text: cut the bottom part of the keyboard too . fold or remove the plastic pcb out of the way when cutting .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the bottom part of the keyboard too.  Fold or remove the plastic PCB out of the way when cutting.

Lines.Text: screw the pcb and the metal bar back on .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw the PCB and the metal bar back on.

Lines.Text: assemble the rest of the keyboard , and fold the plastic sheet under your keyboard . do not cut it because it will render the keyboard useless .

Steps.Text_raw: Assemble the rest of the keyboard, and fold the plastic sheet under your keyboard.  Do not cut it because it will render the keyboard useless.

Lines.Text: since you have cut the portion of the keyboard with the supporting leg for tilting , supply it with a new leg . you can use a key from the numerical keypad .

Steps.Text_raw: Since you have cut the portion of the keyboard with the supporting leg for tilting, supply it with a new leg. You can use a key from the numerical keypad.

Lines.Text: tape the key to the keyboad

Steps.Text_raw: Tape the key to the keyboad

Lines.Text: presto , you are proud owner of a very geeky looking keyboard with even a piece of the pcb sticking out .

Steps.Text_raw: Presto, you are proud owner of a very geeky looking keyboard with even a piece of the PCB sticking out.

Title: Lite-On LightScribe SHM-165H6S Drive Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: insert an open paper clip into the small hole on the left side of the faceplate .
the tray should click open , extend it fully .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert an open paper clip into the small hole on the left side of the faceplate. The tray should click open, extend it fully.

Lines.Text: use an opening device to push in the black tabs on the left , right and bottom of the outer chassis to unhook the faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an opening device to push in the black tabs on the left, right and bottom of the outer chassis to unhook the faceplate.

Lines.Text: pull the faceplate away from the main chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the faceplate away from the main chassis.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 8.5 mm screws on the bottom chassis using a phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 8.5 mm screws on the bottom chassis using a Philips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: lift the top and bottom chassis straight up in order to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the top and bottom chassis straight up in order to remove them.

Lines.Text: extend the tray so that the belt is accessible .
remove the old belt using tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Extend the tray so that the belt is accessible. Remove the old belt using tweezers.

Lines.Text: carefully replace with the new belt by wrapping it around the larger gear first , followed by the smaller gear .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully replace with the new belt by wrapping it around the larger gear first, followed by the smaller gear.

Title: Linksys WAP 11 Antenna Replacement

Lines.Text: be sure the ethernet and power cables are disconnected from the device .
you should also unscrew the external plastic antennas . there is one antenna on each side of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure the ethernet and power cables are disconnected from the device. You should also unscrew the external plastic antennas. There is one antenna on each side of the device.

Lines.Text: to open the linksys wap11 , you will need a phillips 1 screwdriver and a pair of metal tweezers .

use the tweezers to remove the two rubber boots on the front two legs . the easiest way to do this is to insert the tweezers into the hole in the face of the boot . once you are hooked behind the boot , pull outwards .
this will reveal two small phillips-head screws . remove them .
keep these two screws together .

Steps.Text_raw: To open the Linksys WAP11, you will need a Phillips #1 screwdriver and a pair of metal tweezers. Use the tweezers to remove the two rubber boots on the front two legs. The easiest way to do this is to insert the tweezers into the hole in the face of the boot.  Once you are hooked behind the boot, pull outwards. This will reveal two small Phillips-head screws.  Remove them. Keep these two screws together.

Lines.Text: using two hands ( one on the front of the device and the other on the back ) apply pressure to the top and bottom seal while pulling the front and back away from each other .
this requires significant amount of force .
the seal is located where the blue plastic meets the black plastic . this is where you will apply pressure .

Steps.Text_raw: Using two hands (one on the front of the device and the other on the back) apply pressure to the top and bottom seal while pulling the front and back away from each other. This requires significant amount of force. The seal is located where the blue plastic meets the black plastic. This is where you will apply pressure.

Lines.Text: after the face of the device has been removed , slide the base of the device off to reveal the motherboard and other internal components .
when removing the base , do not damage the wires that are attached to the device .

Steps.Text_raw: After the face of the device has been removed, slide the base of the device off to reveal the motherboard and other internal components. When removing the base, do not damage the wires that are attached to the device.

Lines.Text: this is what the device looks like when it is fully opened .

Steps.Text_raw: This is what the device looks like when it is fully opened.

Lines.Text: using a phillips screwdriver remove the the three screws that fasten the main circuit board to the chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips screwdriver remove the the three screws that fasten the main circuit board to the chassis.

Lines.Text: using a pair of needle nose pliers , remove the nuts that secure the antenna ports to the rear panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a pair of needle nose pliers, remove the nuts that secure the antenna ports to the rear panel.

Lines.Text: using a soldering iron and desoldering wick , desolder and remove the two antennas from the motherboard .
the antenna can now be replaced with a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a soldering iron and desoldering wick, desolder and remove the two antennas from the motherboard. The antenna can now be replaced with a new one.

Title: How to clean the Epson Stylus Photo 1400

Lines.Text: turn off the printer .
remove all paper and cd/dvd tray .
disconnect power from wall socket .
disconnect usb cord from printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the printer. Remove all paper and CD/DVD tray. Disconnect power from wall socket. Disconnect USB cord from printer.

Lines.Text: use a soft brush to clean the sheet feeder .
if there are ink spots or dirt on the inside of the printer , use cloth to clean the plastic area shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a soft brush to clean the sheet feeder. If there are ink spots or dirt on the inside of the printer, use cloth to clean the plastic area shown.

Lines.Text: use cloth to clean the plastic parts and metal bar .
try not to touch the roller gears .

Steps.Text_raw: Use cloth to clean the plastic parts and metal bar. Try not to touch the roller gears.

Lines.Text: wipe off the roller on the bottom with the cloth .
clean off any dust on the plastic tray .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe off the roller on the bottom with the cloth. Clean off any dust on the plastic tray.

Title: Epson Stylus Photo 1400 Printhead Replacement

Lines.Text: turn off the printer .
disconnect all data connections coming into the printer such as usb , networkd cables , firewire , etc . as well as removing the power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the printer. Disconnect all data connections coming into the printer such as USB, networkd cables, firewire, etc. as well as removing the power cord.

Lines.Text: locate the ieee cover in the back .
gently slide cover to the right to unlatch then pull to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the IEEE cover in  the back. Gently slide cover to the right to unlatch then pull to remove it.

Lines.Text: using a 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the four 10 mm screws shown .
remove the 6 mm screw that holds the rear housing in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the four 10mm screws shown. Remove the 6mm screw that holds the rear housing in place.

Lines.Text: remove the rear housing by pulling it backwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rear housing by pulling it backwards.

Lines.Text: insert the flathead screwdriver or plastic pry tool into the cutouts of the lower housing .
release the two tabs of the side housing by lifting the tool in an upward motion
remove the side housing by pulling it outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the flathead screwdriver or plastic pry tool into the cutouts of the lower housing. Release the two tabs of the side housing by lifting the tool in an upward motion Remove the side housing by pulling it outwards.

Lines.Text: both side housings are attached by the same type of mechanism .
using the same method , remove the other side housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Both side housings are attached by the same type of mechanism. Using the same method, remove the other side housing.

Lines.Text: lift the paper support .
open the printer cover and front cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the paper support. Open the printer cover and front cover.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm phillips 2 screws from the sides of the printer .
remove the three 6 mm phillips 2 screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm Phillips #2 screws from the sides of the printer. Remove the three 6mm Phillips #2 screws.

Lines.Text: detach the tabs from the pins on each side by pulling it outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the tabs from the pins on each side by pulling it outwards.

Lines.Text: remove the two 10 mm phillips 2 screws on the front of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 10 mm Phillips #2 screws on the front of the printer.

Lines.Text: disconnect the cable on the side by carefully pulling it outwards .
you may need to gently rock the cable up and down while pulling .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the cable on the side by carefully pulling it outwards. You may need to gently rock the cable up and down while pulling.

Lines.Text: remove the upper housing by lifting it upwards .
it's easier to lift the housing by gripping it from the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the upper housing by lifting it upwards. It's easier to lift  the housing by gripping it from the bottom.

Lines.Text: insert a flathead screwdriver into the hole on the right side of the frame .
turn the screwdriver counterclockwise until it stops .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a flathead screwdriver into the hole on the right side of the frame. Turn the screwdriver counterclockwise until it stops.

Lines.Text: move the carriage unit to the center .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the carriage unit to the center.

Lines.Text: open the cartridge cover .
remove all the ink cartridges inside .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the cartridge cover. Remove all the ink cartridges inside.

Lines.Text: using a plastic opening tool , disengage the two upper tab on the side of the carriage unit .
with a spudger or plastic opening tool , disengage the lower tab .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a plastic opening tool, disengage the two upper tab on the side of the carriage unit. With a spudger or plastic opening tool, disengage the lower tab.

Lines.Text: slide the cover upward and rotate it around the hinge by 90.

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the cover upward and rotate it around the hinge by 90°.

Lines.Text: the csic assembly sits inside the carriage unit .
reaching from the back of the carriage unit , disengage the two tabs that hold the csic assembly in place .
the tabs can be difficult to disengage . the second image shows the rear of csic assembly .
the third image shows where the tabs lock onto the carriage unit .
remove the csic assembly from the carriage unit .

Steps.Text_raw: The CSIC assembly sits inside the carriage unit. Reaching from the back of the carriage unit, disengage the two tabs that hold the CSIC assembly in place. The tabs can be difficult to disengage. The second image shows the rear of CSIC assembly. The third image shows where the tabs lock onto the carriage unit. Remove the CSIC assembly from the carriage  unit.

Lines.Text: using tweezers , disengage the right tab from the back right panel of the carriage unit .
push the tweezers towards the front of the printer while pulling up on the right panel .
when the tab is disengaged , you can pull the panel upwards slightly to prevent the tab from engaging .

Steps.Text_raw: Using tweezers, disengage the right tab from the back right panel of the carriage  unit. Push the tweezers towards the front of the printer while pulling up on the right panel. When the tab is disengaged, you can pull the panel upwards slightly to prevent the tab from engaging.

Lines.Text: using the tweezers , disengage the left tab from the back left .
push the tweezers towards the front of the printer while pulling on the left side upwards .
when both tabs are disengaged , the part is slightly raised .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the tweezers, disengage the left tab from the back left. Push the tweezers towards the front of the printer while pulling on the left side upwards. When both tabs are disengaged, the part is slightly raised.

Lines.Text: lift csic assembly up and out of the carriage unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift CSIC assembly up and out of the Carriage Unit.

Lines.Text: the printhead is the part with 6 nozzles .
remove the three 8 mm 2 phillips screws that secure the printhead .

Steps.Text_raw: The printhead is the part with 6 nozzles. Remove the three 8 mm  #2 Phillips screws that secure the printhead.

Lines.Text: remove the printhead from the carriage unit by lifting it up vertically .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printhead from the carriage unit by lifting it up vertically.

Lines.Text: disconnect the two ribbon cables on the back of the printhead .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the two ribbon cables on the back of the printhead.

Subject: Printhead

Title: Epson Stylus Photo 1400 Paper Eject Frame Assembly Replacement

Lines.Text: turn off the printer .
disconnect all data connections coming into the printer such as usb , networkd cables , firewire , etc . as well as removing the power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the printer. Disconnect all data connections coming into the printer such as USB, networkd cables, firewire, etc. as well as removing the power cord.

Lines.Text: locate the ieee cover in the back .
gently slide cover to the right to unlatch then pull to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the IEEE cover in  the back. Gently slide cover to the right to unlatch then pull to remove it.

Lines.Text: using a 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the four 10 mm screws shown .
remove the 6 mm screw that holds the rear housing in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the four 10mm screws shown. Remove the 6mm screw that holds the rear housing in place.

Lines.Text: remove the rear housing by pulling it backwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rear housing by pulling it backwards.

Lines.Text: insert the flathead screwdriver or plastic pry tool into the cutouts of the lower housing .
release the two tabs of the side housing by lifting the tool in an upward motion
remove the side housing by pulling it outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the flathead screwdriver or plastic pry tool into the cutouts of the lower housing. Release the two tabs of the side housing by lifting the tool in an upward motion Remove the side housing by pulling it outwards.

Lines.Text: both side housings are attached by the same type of mechanism .
using the same method , remove the other side housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Both side housings are attached by the same type of mechanism. Using the same method, remove the other side housing.

Lines.Text: lift the paper support .
open the printer cover and front cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the paper support. Open the printer cover and front cover.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm phillips 2 screws from the sides of the printer .
remove the three 6 mm phillips 2 screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm Phillips #2 screws from the sides of the printer. Remove the three 6mm Phillips #2 screws.

Lines.Text: detach the tabs from the pins on each side by pulling it outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the tabs from the pins on each side by pulling it outwards.

Lines.Text: remove the two 10 mm phillips 2 screws on the front of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 10 mm Phillips #2 screws on the front of the printer.

Lines.Text: disconnect the cable on the side by carefully pulling it outwards .
you may need to gently rock the cable up and down while pulling .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the cable on the side by carefully pulling it outwards. You may need to gently rock the cable up and down while pulling.

Lines.Text: remove the upper housing by lifting it upwards .
it's easier to lift the housing by gripping it from the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the upper housing by lifting it upwards. It's easier to lift  the housing by gripping it from the bottom.

Lines.Text: hold the ink tube and draw out the waste ink tube by pulling on both tubes in opposite directions .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the ink tube and draw out the waste ink tube by pulling on both tubes in opposite directions.

Lines.Text: remove the acetate tape that secure the connector cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the acetate tape that secure the connector cable.

Lines.Text: there are six screws that secure the printer mechanism .
using the 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the three 10 mm screws shown .

Steps.Text_raw: There are six screws that secure the printer mechanism. Using the #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the three 10mm screws shown.

Lines.Text: using the 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the last three 10 mm screws securing the printer mechanism .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the last three 10mm screws securing the printer mechanism.

Lines.Text: remove printer mechanism from lower housing by holding the handles and lifting it upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove printer mechanism from lower housing by holding the handles and lifting it upwards.

Lines.Text: remove the cd-r unit housing by releasing the two attaching points to the tray base .
pull it outwards diagonally one side at a time .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the CD-R unit housing by releasing the two attaching points to the tray base. Pull it outwards diagonally one side at a time.

Lines.Text: remove the left frame support plate by removing the two 6 mm screws that secure it .
pull it out by hand to free it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the left frame support plate by removing the two 6mm screws that secure it. Pull it out by hand to free it.

Lines.Text: using the 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the four 6 mm screws .
remove the two 8 mm screws .
the screws are located on the lower sections of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the four 6mm screws. Remove the two 8mm screws. The screws are located on the lower sections of the printer.

Lines.Text: two guide pins secure the paper ej assy in place .
remove the two guide pins on the cd/dvd tray base by pulling each pin outward .

Steps.Text_raw: Two guide pins secure the paper EJ assy in place. Remove the two guide pins on the CD/DVD tray base by pulling each pin outward.

Lines.Text: remove the paper ej frame assy by pulling the it towards you .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the paper EJ frame assy by pulling the it towards you.

Title: Liquid Damage Technique

Lines.Text: power down and unplug the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Power down and unplug the device.

Lines.Text: remove the antennas from the back of the device . to do this , follow steps 1 and 2 of installing the antennas guide : guide6735

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the antennas from the back of the device. To do this, follow steps 1 and 2 of      Installing the Antennas Guide: [guide|6735]

Lines.Text: remove the two black rubber feet of the device using the screwdriver . the feet are located on the bottom towards the front .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two black rubber feet of the device using the screwdriver. The feet are located on the bottom towards the front.

Lines.Text: once the feet are removed , two small screws will be visible . with a small screwdriver , unscrew them . screws are phillips head , 4.35 mm in diameter , 7.88 mm in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the feet are removed, two small screws will be visible. With a small screwdriver, unscrew them. Screws are phillips head, 4.35 mm in diameter, 7.88 mm in length.

Lines.Text: to remove the front blue panel , grip firmly and place thumbs in the two notches on top . push thumbs forward while keeping a firm grip on bottom .
this may require a bit of force .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the front blue panel, grip firmly and place thumbs in the two notches on top. Push thumbs forward while keeping a firm grip on bottom. This may require a bit of force.

Lines.Text: now slide the bottom panel forward and remove it so the top casing is isolated from the bottom casing and motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Now slide the bottom panel forward and remove it so the top casing is isolated from the bottom casing and motherboard.

Lines.Text: unscrew the nut on the outer side of the back casing . remove the nut and the washer from both antenna mounts .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the nut on the outer side of the back casing. Remove the nut and the washer from both antenna mounts.

Lines.Text: from here , remove the wires and nuts connected to the back panel by pulling the nuts through the holes .
now the top casing has been removed and isolated from the rest of the device . from here , you can make repairs to the top casing .
once the top panel is removed the main board will still be attached to the bottom panel .

Steps.Text_raw: From here, remove the wires and nuts connected to the back panel by pulling the nuts through the holes. Now the top casing has been removed and isolated from the rest of the device. From here, you can make repairs to the top casing. Once the top panel is removed the main board will still be attached to the bottom panel.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two screws that connect the motherboard to the bottom casing .
the motherboard and bottom casing should be completely separated at this point . this allows for replacement of the motherboard and/ or its components as well as the bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two screws that connect the motherboard to the bottom casing. The motherboard and bottom casing should be completely separated at this point.  This allows for replacement of the motherboard and/ or its components as well as the bottom casing.

Lines.Text: if the spilled substance is dry use a cleaning tool such as a toothbrush with soft bristles , so you do not damage the device , to brush off as much of the foreign material as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: If the spilled substance is dry use a cleaning tool such as a toothbrush with soft bristles, so you do not damage the device, to brush off as much of the foreign material as possible.

Lines.Text: dry off circuit board with kitchen paper ; using other types of paper products such as toilet paper will fall apart . be sure not to rub but carefully apply pressure to dry up wet spots .

Steps.Text_raw: Dry off circuit board with kitchen paper; using other types of paper products such as toilet paper will fall apart. Be sure not to rub but carefully apply pressure to dry up wet spots.

Lines.Text: clean off the components to make sure the rest of the residue comes off by using a chemical gasoline or another solvent that contains one substance that evaporates quickly .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean off the components to make sure the rest of the residue comes off by using a chemical gasoline or another solvent that contains one substance that evaporates quickly.

Title: Dell E193FPc Display Bezel Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the monitor screen-down so the back screws are exposed .
remove the four 11.9 mm phillips 2 screws securing the stand to the back of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the monitor screen-down so the back screws are exposed. Remove the four 11.9 mm Phillips #2 screws securing the stand to the back of the monitor.

Lines.Text: gently lift and pull away the stand at a slight angle away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift and pull away the stand at a slight angle away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: locate the two holes on the bottom of the monitor .
insert a plastic opening tool or spudger into the holes and gently pry the plastic apart along the groove .
this task is much easier if two people pry simultaneously at each hole .
continue prying along the entire edge of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two holes on the bottom of the monitor. Insert a plastic opening tool or spudger into the holes and gently pry the plastic apart along the groove. This task is much easier if two people pry simultaneously at each hole. Continue prying along the entire edge of the monitor.

Lines.Text: when finished prying , the plastic will partially fall away from the rest of the monitor .
do not try to fully remove the front frame yet . the frame is still attached to the buttons .
while holding the frames together , carefully flip the monitor over so it faces screen down .
gently lift and remove remove the rear case from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: When finished prying, the plastic will partially fall away from the rest of the monitor. Do not try to fully remove the front frame yet. The frame is still attached to the buttons. While holding the frames together, carefully flip the monitor over so it faces screen down. Gently lift and remove remove the rear case from the monitor.

Lines.Text: locate the green interface button board .
remove the three 9.71 mm phillips 2 screws holding the interface button board to the display bezel .
lift the monitor interior away from the front cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the green interface button board. Remove the three 9.71 mm Phillips #2 screws holding the interface button board to the display bezel. Lift the monitor interior away from the front cover.

Subject: Display Bezel

Lines.Text: remove the three 14.3 mm t7 torx screws from the bottom of airport .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 14.3mm T7 Torx screws from the bottom of AirPort.

Lines.Text: remove the 5.1 mm phillips screw from the bottom of the airport . this screw is located under the identification sticker . you will have to remove the sticker or make a hole to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5.1mm Phillips screw from the bottom of the AirPort. This screw is located under the identification sticker. You will have to remove the sticker or make a hole to remove it.

Lines.Text: lift the bottom and top casing straight apart and then lift metal casing straight up from the bottom plastic casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the bottom and top casing straight apart and then lift metal casing straight up from the bottom plastic casing.

Lines.Text: unplug the black connector on the top of the metal casing by gently pulling horizontally .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the black connector on the top of the metal casing by gently pulling horizontally.

Lines.Text: remove the four 4.3 mm phillips screws from the bottom of the metal casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 4.3mm phillips screws from the bottom of the metal casing.

Lines.Text: lift and separate the top and bottom of the metal casing . you will now expose the motherboard and the airport card .
to remove the airport card , gently pull the plastic tab horizontally .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and separate the top and bottom of the metal casing. You will now expose the motherboard and the AirPort card. To remove the AirPort card, gently pull the plastic tab horizontally.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the three 5.0 mm phillips screws from the heat sink .
lift to remove the heat sink from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the three 5.0mm phillips screws from the heat sink. Lift to remove the heat sink from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the five 7.5 mm phillips screws from the motherboard .
lift and separate the motherboard from the bottom metal casing .
there will be a loose hexagonal female screw extender under the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the five 7.5mm phillips screws from the motherboard. Lift and separate the motherboard from the bottom metal casing. There will be a loose hexagonal female screw extender under the motherboard.

Title: Acer AL1916 Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the monitor on a flat surface so that the back is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the monitor on a flat surface so that the back is facing up.

Lines.Text: grab the hinge cover with both hands on either side of the stand .
squeeze inwards with your thumbs and fingers and lift up to remove the hinge cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the hinge cover with both hands on either side of the stand. Squeeze inwards with your thumbs and fingers and lift up to remove the hinge cover.

Lines.Text: remove the four 12.1 mm phillips 2 screws that hold the stand to the monitor .
support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling .
lift up to detach the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 12.1 mm Phillips #2 screws that hold the stand to the monitor. Support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling. Lift up to detach the stand.

Lines.Text: remove the five 9.5 mm phillips 2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 9.5 mm Phillips #2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor.

Lines.Text: starting at the corner of the monitor , wedge the small plastic opening tool between the back cover and the display bezel .
tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel .
continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off .
a reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting at the corner of the monitor, wedge the small plastic opening tool between the back cover and the display bezel. Tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel. Continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off. A reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel.

Lines.Text: reposition the monitor so that the back is facing up .
grab the corners of the monitor and jiggle them upwards to detach the back cover from the inside of the monitor .
lift the back cover up .

Steps.Text_raw: Reposition the monitor so that the back is facing up. Grab the corners of the monitor and jiggle them upwards to detach the back cover from the inside of the monitor. Lift the back cover up.

Lines.Text: remove the two 5.7 mm phillips 2 screws located on either side of the emi shield .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 5.7 mm Phillips #2 screws located on either side of the EMI shield.

Lines.Text: using a nut driver ( or if necessary , needle-nose pliers ) , remove the two nuts on either side of the vga input .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a nut driver (or if necessary, needle-nose pliers), remove the two nuts on either side of the VGA input.

Lines.Text: grab the metal casing by the sides and slide it down towards the bottom of the monitor .
lift up to remove the metal casing .
beware , metal casing is sharp !

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the metal casing by the sides and slide it down towards the bottom of the monitor. Lift up to remove the metal casing. Beware, metal casing is sharp!

Lines.Text: remove the beige control cable to the left of the vga input by pulling it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the beige control cable to the left of the VGA input by pulling it up.

Lines.Text: remove the rainbow-colored power cable by pulling it straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rainbow-colored power cable by pulling it straight up.

Lines.Text: remove the display cable located at the top of the motherboard by pulling it out towards the top of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the display cable located at the top of the motherboard by pulling it out towards the top of the monitor.

Lines.Text: remove the three 7.7 mm phillips 2 screws from the motherboard , and take out the motherboard by lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 7.7 mm Phillips #2 screws from the motherboard, and take out the motherboard by lifting it up.

support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling .
lift up to detach the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 12.1 mm Phillips #2 screws that hold the stand to the monitor. Support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling. Lift up to detach the stand.

Lines.Text: remove the five 9.5 mm phillips 2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 9.5 mm Phillips #2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor.

Lines.Text: starting at the corner of the monitor , wedge the small plastic opening tool between the back cover and the display bezel .
tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel .
continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off .
a reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting at the corner of the monitor, wedge the small plastic opening tool between the back cover and the display bezel. Tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel. Continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off. A reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel.

Lines.Text: reposition the monitor so that the back is facing up .
grab the corners of the monitor and jiggle them upwards to detach the back cover from the inside of the monitor .
lift the back cover up .

Steps.Text_raw: Reposition the monitor so that the back is facing up. Grab the corners of the monitor and jiggle them upwards to detach the back cover from the inside of the monitor. Lift the back cover up.

Lines.Text: remove the two 5.7 mm phillips 2 screws located on either side of the emi shield .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 5.7 mm Phillips #2 screws located on either side of the EMI shield.

Lines.Text: using a nut driver ( or if necessary , needle-nose pliers ) , remove the two nuts on either side of the vga input .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a nut driver (or if necessary, needle-nose pliers), remove the two nuts on either side of the VGA input.

Lines.Text: grab the metal casing by the sides and slide it down towards the bottom of the monitor .
lift up to remove the metal casing .
beware , metal casing is sharp !

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the metal casing by the sides and slide it down towards the bottom of the monitor. Lift up to remove the metal casing. Beware, metal casing is sharp!

Lines.Text: remove the three gold 7.5 mm phillips 2 screws and one silver 8.3 mm phillips 2 screw from the power supply .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three gold 7.5 mm Phillips #2 screws and one silver 8.3 mm Phillips #2 screw from the power supply.

Lines.Text: remove the two pieces of yellow tape on the left side of the power supply .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two pieces of yellow tape on the left side of the power supply.

Lines.Text: remove the four little white clips located underneath the pieces of tape by lifting up on their left side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four little white clips located underneath the pieces of tape by lifting up on their left side.

Lines.Text: with the needle-nose pliers , remove the four display connectors by pulling directly left .

Steps.Text_raw: With the needle-nose pliers, remove the four display connectors by pulling directly left.

Lines.Text: remove the display cable located at the top of the circuit board by pulling it out towards the top of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the display cable located at the top of the circuit board by pulling it out towards the top of the monitor.

Lines.Text: turn the monitor on its side so that the power supply and circuit board are facing to the right
remove the two 6.6 mm phillips 2 screws located on both sides of the metal casing ( four screws total ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor on its side so that the power supply and circuit board are facing to the right Remove the two 6.6 mm Phillips #2 screws located on both sides of the metal casing (four screws total).

Lines.Text: set the monitor back down so that the power supply and circuit board are facing you .
feed all four of the connector wires down through the metal casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the monitor back down so that the power supply and circuit board are facing you. Feed all four of the connector wires down through the metal casing.

Lines.Text: grab the sides of the metal casing and lift up .
turn the display over to see the front ; you are ready replace the broken display with a new one !

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the sides of the metal casing and lift up. Turn the display over to see the front; you are ready replace the broken display with a new one!

Subject: Display

Title: Netgear WGR614v9 Antenna Replacement

Lines.Text: rotate the device so that the bottom is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the device so that the bottom is facing up.

Lines.Text: lift up all four rubber pads on the bottom of the router with the plastic opening tool .
be careful not to pull the rubber pads all the way out when lifting as they are difficult to reinsert .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up all four rubber pads on the bottom of the router with the plastic opening tool. Be careful not to pull the rubber pads all the way out when lifting as they are difficult to reinsert.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 11.8 mm t-8 torx screws from the bottom of the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 11.8 mm T-8 torx screws from the bottom of the router.

Lines.Text: lift the bottom casing straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the bottom casing straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: remove the clear plastic casing by lifting it straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the clear plastic casing by lifting it straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: separate the motherboard from the top shell by lifting it straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the motherboard from the top shell by lifting it straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: rotate the motherboard so that the top is facing up .
set the motherboard on a flat clean surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the motherboard so that the top is facing up. Set the motherboard on a flat clean surface.

Lines.Text: do not refer to the pictures in this step for proper de-soldering and soldering techniques . they are for illustration purposes only .
refer to this guide for proper de-soldering and soldering techniques .
be patient . this may take some time depending on the quality of your soldering iron .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not refer to the pictures in this step for proper de-soldering and soldering techniques. They are for illustration purposes only. Refer to this [guide|750|link|stepid=4049] for proper de-soldering and soldering techniques. Be patient. This may take some time depending on the quality of your soldering iron.

Lines.Text: peel off the yellow tape holding the wires .
set the tape aside on a clean surface so that it can be reused .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel off the yellow tape holding the wires. Set the tape aside on a clean surface so that it can be reused.

Lines.Text: extend the antenna outwards from the device so that it is straight .
locate the clips that hold the antenna onto the router .
push the clips in with one hand and pull the antenna out with your other hand . slightly twist the antenna until it becomes free from the hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Extend the antenna outwards from the device so that it is straight. Locate the clips that hold the antenna onto the router. Push the clips in with one hand and pull the antenna out with your other hand. Slightly twist the antenna until it becomes free from the hole.

Lines.Text: pull out the antenna as well as the connected wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out the antenna as well as the connected wire.

Subject: Antenna

Title: How to clean Lite-On LightScribe SHM-165H6S lens

Lines.Text: insert an open paper clip into the small hole on the left side of the faceplate .
the tray should click open , extend it fully .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert an open paper clip into the small hole on the left side of the faceplate. The tray should click open, extend it fully.

Lines.Text: use an opening device to push in the black tabs on the left , right and bottom of the outer chassis to unhook the faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an opening device to push in the black tabs on the left, right and bottom of the outer chassis to unhook the faceplate.

Lines.Text: pull the faceplate away from the main chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the faceplate away from the main chassis.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 8.5 mm screws on the bottom chassis using a phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 8.5 mm screws on the bottom chassis using a Philips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: lift the top and bottom chassis straight up in order to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the top and bottom chassis straight up in order to remove them.

Lines.Text: clean the lens .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean the lens.

Title: Lite-On LightScribe SHM-165H6S Faceplate/Eject button Replacement

Lines.Text: insert an open paper clip into small hole on left side of faceplate .
the tray should click open , use your hands to gently extend it fully .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert an open paper clip into small hole on left side of faceplate. The tray should click open, use your hands to gently extend it fully.

Lines.Text: push in black tabs on left , right and bottom of outer chassis to unhook faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Push in black tabs on left, right and bottom of outer chassis to unhook faceplate.

Lines.Text: pull face plate away from main chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull face plate away from main chassis.

Lines.Text: locate the two tabs on the underside of the tray cover .
pry the tabs loose and remove cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two tabs on the underside of the tray cover. Pry the tabs loose and remove cover.

Lines.Text: remove and replace faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove and replace faceplate.

Subject: Faceplate/Eject button

Title: Linksys WRT54GS v2 Antenna Ports Replacement

Lines.Text: turn the router over so that all four of its feet are facing upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the router over so that all four of its feet are facing upwards.

Lines.Text: remove the rubber inserts inside the the two purple feet located on the router's front case .
this may be a challenge , so try the following two methods :
use a plastic opening tool . insert the flat end of the tool into the seam and slowly pry the rubber feet out .
use a metal spudger . insert the point of the metal spudger directly into the hole of the rubber feet and pry the insert out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rubber inserts inside the the two purple feet located on the router's front case. This may be a challenge, so try the following two methods: Use a plastic opening tool. Insert the flat end of the tool into the seam and slowly pry the rubber feet out. Use a metal spudger. Insert the point of the metal spudger directly into the hole of the rubber feet and pry the insert out.

Lines.Text: use a phillips 2 screwdriver to remove the two 5.8 mm screws holding the front case to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips #2 Screwdriver to remove the two 5.8 mm screws holding the front case to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: squeeze the sides of the router's backcase inward and pull off the purple front case . it is helpful to have a second person assist you for this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the sides of the router's backcase inward and pull off the purple front case. It is helpful to have a second person assist you for this step.

Lines.Text: slide the board unit out and up .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the board unit out and up.

Lines.Text: flip the circuit board over and use a phillips 2 screwdriver to remove the 6.9 mm screw holding the board to the back case .
slide the back cover out and away from the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the  circuit board over and use a Phillips #2 Screwdriver to remove the 6.9mm screw holding the board to the back case. Slide the back cover out and away from the circuit board.

Lines.Text: turn the circuit board over and identify which solder connection you will desolder .
the solder connections shown in red hold the right antenna port in place . there is one more attachment for this antenna on the other side of the board .
the solder connections shown in blue hold the left antenna port in place . desolder these 4 points to remove the antenna port .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the circuit board over and identify which solder connection you will desolder. The solder connections shown in red hold the right antenna port in place. There is one more attachment for this antenna on the other side of the board. The solder connections shown in blue hold the left antenna port in place. Desolder these 4 points to remove the antenna port.

Lines.Text: turn on your soldering iron and allow it to get to its highest temperature setting ( minimum 600 ºf ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn on your soldering iron and allow it to get to its highest temperature setting (minimum 600ºF).

Lines.Text: desolder the connection by following ifixit's guide to repairing soldered connections : guide750.

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the connection by following iFixit's guide to repairing soldered connections: [guide|750].

Subject: Antenna Ports

Title: Disassembling HP Photosmart c3180 Top Panel

Lines.Text: before disassembling your printer , be sure that the printer has been unplugged .
rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise so that the side panel next to control panel is facing you .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the left side panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Before disassembling your printer, be sure that the printer has been unplugged. Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise so that the side panel next to control panel is facing you. Remove the two T10 12mm Torx screws from the left side panel.

Lines.Text: firmly pull the the back of the side panel until it separates from the body of the printer .
rotate the side panel upwards while pulling it towards yourself to remove the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pull the the back of the side panel until it separates from the body of the printer. Rotate the side panel upwards while pulling it towards yourself to remove the panel.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
grasp the paper tray and rotate it down .
insert your fingers into the slot in the printer door and pull to rotate the gate down .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Grasp the paper tray and rotate it down. Insert your fingers into the slot in the printer door and pull to rotate the gate down.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
grasp both sides of the side panel and pull it forward to remove the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Grasp both sides of the side panel and pull it forward to remove the panel.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
lift the scanner lid to expose the scanner glass .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Lift the scanner lid to expose the scanner glass.

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
inside the printer is a small white tab . press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard .
remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Inside the printer is a small white tab. Press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard. Remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body.

Subject: Top Panel

do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
inside the printer is a small white tab . press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard .
remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Inside the printer is a small white tab. Press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard. Remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body.

Lines.Text: set aside the printer body .
unscrew the t10 12 mm torx screw .
remove the plastic tab holding the glass in place .

carefully lift the scanner glass panel above the plastic barrier and pull it towards the control panel circuitry . it can take quite a bit of force to get the panel to slide out . if not removed carefully , the scanner glass can shatter

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the printer body. Unscrew the T10 12 mm Torx screw. Remove the plastic tab holding the glass in place. Carefully lift the scanner glass panel above the plastic barrier and pull it towards the control panel circuitry.  It can take quite a bit of force to get the panel to slide out.  If not removed carefully, the scanner glass can shatter

Lines.Text: slide the new panel of glass in to the tabs on the right side of the top panel .
place your thumb on top of the tab at the top of the panel . grip the outside edge of the panel and roll outward , allowing the scanner glass panel to fall into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the new panel of glass in to the tabs on the right side of the top panel. Place your thumb on top of the tab at the top of the panel. grip the outside edge of the panel and roll outward, allowing the scanner glass panel to fall into place.

Lines.Text: reattach the plastic piece which holds the scanner glass down and the 2.74 mm torx screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Reattach the plastic piece which holds the scanner glass down and the 2.74 mm Torx screw.

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the top panel of the printer. Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws from the top front of the printer

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board .
grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up . do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the Printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board. Grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up. Do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
using both hands , lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Using both hands, lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the power button circuit board from the support frame by pinching the left side , and pulling forward and to the left simultaneously .
push up on the tab holding the secondary control circuit board with the spudger and pull it forward to remove it .
be careful not to pull too hard on the cable connecting the power button control circuit board and the secondary control circuit board to the main circuit board

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the power button circuit board from the support frame by pinching the left side, and pulling forward and to the left simultaneously. Lines.Text: remove both of the ink cartridges by grabbing the front of the ink cartridge and pulling down .
make sure that the printer carriage is pushed all the way to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both of the ink cartridges by grabbing the front of the ink cartridge and pulling down. Make sure that the printer carriage is pushed all the way to the right.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the ink cartridge carriage to the main circuit board .
pull straight up to free the cable from the main circuit board . do not twist or wiggle the cable as doing so can damage it .
you may need to lift the carriage up with one hand in order to reach the cable with the free hand as shown .

using both hands , carefully lift the ink cartridge track off of the main body of the printer .
