Lines.Text: rotate the track 180 degrees and slide the printer carriage slightly to the left .
grasp the metal tab holding the encoding strip and pull it away from the track while pulling it up .
without releasing the metal tab , pull the encoding strip through the ink cartridge carriage . the encoding strip should slide out smoothly .

Title: Dell E193FPc Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the monitor screen-down so the back screws are exposed .
remove the four 11.9 mm phillips 2 screws securing the stand to the back of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the monitor screen-down so the back screws are exposed. Remove the four 11.9 mm Phillips #2 screws securing the stand to the back of the monitor.

Lines.Text: gently lift and pull away the stand at a slight angle away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift and pull away the stand at a slight angle away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: locate the two holes on the bottom of the monitor .
insert a plastic opening tool or spudger into the holes and gently pry the plastic apart along the groove .
this task is much easier if two people pry simultaneously at each hole .
continue prying along the entire edge of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two holes on the bottom of the monitor. Insert a plastic opening tool or spudger into the holes and gently pry the plastic apart along the groove. This task is much easier if two people pry simultaneously at each hole. Continue prying along the entire edge of the monitor.

Lines.Text: when finished prying , the plastic will partially fall away from the rest of the monitor .
do not try to fully remove the front frame yet . the frame is still attached to the buttons .
while holding the frames together , carefully flip the monitor over so it faces screen down .
gently lift and remove remove the rear case from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: When finished prying, the plastic will partially fall away from the rest of the monitor. Do not try to fully remove the front frame yet. The frame is still attached to the buttons. While holding the frames together, carefully flip the monitor over so it faces screen down. Gently lift and remove remove the rear case from the monitor.

Lines.Text: locate the green interface button board .
remove the three 9.71 mm phillips 2 screws holding the interface button board to the display bezel .
lift the monitor interior away from the front cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the green interface button board. Remove the three 9.71 mm Phillips #2 screws holding the interface button board to the display bezel. Lift the monitor interior away from the front cover.

Lines.Text: with the monitor facing down , remove the two 5.81 mm phillips 2 screws on the right side of the metal casing .
with the monitor still facing down , remove the two 5.81 mm phillips 2 screws on the left side of the casing .
do attempt to pull apart the casing . there are still wires holding the front and back together .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor facing down, remove the two 5.81 mm Phillips #2 screws on the right side of the metal casing. With the monitor still facing down, remove the two 5.81 mm Phillips #2 screws on the left side of the casing. Do attempt to pull apart the casing.  There are still wires holding the front and back together.

Lines.Text: using a 5 mm nut driver , unscrew the vga port's mounting screws from the metal casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a 5 mm nut driver, unscrew the VGA port's mounting screws from the metal casing.

Lines.Text: with the monitor facing down , gently lift the back case away from the rest of the monitor to expose the inverter board and mother board .
recall that the casing is still held together by several wires . do not attempt to fully remove the back casing .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor facing down, gently lift the back case away from the rest of the monitor to expose the inverter board and mother board. Recall that the casing is still held together by several wires. Do not attempt to fully remove the back casing.

Lines.Text: the inverter board is the smaller board in the corner .
remove the three 7.69 mm phillips 2 screws from the inverter board .
remove the two 7.69 mm phillips 2 grounding screws from the wire with the black connector .
gently pull the inverter board away from the case . note that the board is still connected to several components by wires .

Steps.Text_raw: The inverter board is the smaller board in the corner. Remove the three 7.69 mm Phillips #2 screws from the inverter board. Remove the two 7.69 mm Phillips #2 grounding screws from the wire with the black connector. Gently pull the inverter board away from the case. Note that the board is still connected to several components by wires.

Lines.Text: there is a wire connecting the motherboard to the inverter board . squeeze both sides of the connector and pull to remove it from the socket .
there is another wire connecting the button board to the inverter board . remove the second white wire connector .
a third wire connects the inverter board to the screen circuit board . remove the black wire connector .
the inverter board can now be fully removed .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a wire connecting the motherboard to the inverter board.  Squeeze both sides of the connector and pull to remove it from the socket. There is another wire connecting the button board to the inverter board. Remove the second white wire connector. A third wire connects the inverter board to the screen circuit board. Remove the black wire connector. The inverter board can now be fully removed.

Lines.Text: with the monitor facing down , remove the 5.84 mm phillips 2 screw from the metal sheet .
you can now open the device up . be careful , there are still wires attached to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor facing down, remove the 5.84 mm Phillips #2 screw from the metal sheet. You can now open the device up. Be careful, there are still wires attached to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: with the monitor facing down , lift the back cover up and lay it face up , exposing the motherboard .
remove the five 7.7 mm phillips 2 screws from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor facing down, lift the back cover up and lay it face up, exposing the motherboard. Remove the five 7.7 mm Phillips #2 screws from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: squeeze the plastic prong in the middle of the motherboard with a metal tweezer , while gently prying the other side with the plastic prying tool .
be careful when using the metal tweezers . make sure you do not make contact with any part that contains metal , for it may still have a charge . discharge all capacitors .
this is easiest when the monitor is positioned such that motherboard is beneath the metal casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the plastic prong in the middle of the motherboard with a metal tweezer, while gently prying the other side with the plastic prying tool. Be careful when using the metal tweezers. Make sure you do not make contact with any part that contains metal, for it may still have a charge. Discharge all capacitors. This is easiest when the monitor is positioned such that motherboard is beneath the metal casing.

Lines.Text: remove the connector to the power outlet from the motherboard .
remove the 4 connectors to the metal casing from the motherboard .
the motherboard can now be fully removed from the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the connector to the power outlet from the motherboard. Remove the 4 connectors to the metal casing from the motherboard. The motherboard can now be fully removed from the casing.

Subject: Motherboard

Lines.Text: lift and separate the top and bottom of the metal casing . you will now expose the motherboard and the airport card .
to remove the airport card , gently pull the plastic tab horizontally .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and separate the top and bottom of the metal casing. You will now expose the motherboard and the AirPort card. To remove the AirPort card, gently pull the plastic tab horizontally.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the three 5.0 mm phillips screws from the heat sink .
lift to remove the heat sink from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the three 5.0mm phillips screws from the heat sink. Lift to remove the heat sink from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the five 7.5 mm phillips screws from the motherboard .
lift and separate the motherboard from the bottom metal casing .
there will be a loose hexagonal female screw extender under the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the five 7.5mm phillips screws from the motherboard. Lift and separate the motherboard from the bottom metal casing. There will be a loose hexagonal female screw extender under the motherboard.

Lines.Text: desolder the six connections located under the usb .
refer to guide750 for soldering techniques .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the six connections located under the USB. Refer to [guide|750] for soldering techniques.

Subject: USB Port

Title: Disassembling HP Photosmart c3180 Feed Roller Assembly Removal

Lines.Text: before disassembling your printer , be sure that the printer has been unplugged .
rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise so that the side panel next to control panel is facing you .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the left side panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Before disassembling your printer, be sure that the printer has been unplugged. Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise so that the side panel next to control panel is facing you. Remove the two T10 12mm Torx screws from the left side panel.

Lines.Text: firmly pull the the back of the side panel until it separates from the body of the printer .
rotate the side panel upwards while pulling it towards yourself to remove the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pull the the back of the side panel until it separates from the body of the printer. Rotate the side panel upwards while pulling it towards yourself to remove the panel.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
grasp the paper tray and rotate it down .
insert your fingers into the slot in the printer door and pull to rotate the gate down .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Grasp the paper tray and rotate it down. Insert your fingers into the slot in the printer door and pull to rotate the gate down.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
grasp both sides of the side panel and pull it forward to remove the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Grasp both sides of the side panel and pull it forward to remove the panel.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
lift the scanner lid to expose the scanner glass .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Lift the scanner lid to expose the scanner glass.

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
inside the printer is a small white tab . press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard .
remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Inside the printer is a small white tab. Press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard. Remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body.

Lines.Text: set aside the top panel of the printer .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the top front of the printer

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the top panel of the printer. Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws from the top front of the printer

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board .
grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up . do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the Printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board. Grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up. Do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
using both hands , lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Using both hands, lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the power button circuit board from the support frame by pinching the left side , and pulling forward and to the left simultaneously .
push up on the tab holding the secondary control circuit board with the spudger and pull it forward to remove it .
be careful not to pull too hard on the cable connecting the power button control circuit board and the secondary control circuit board to the main circuit board

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the power button circuit board from the support frame by pinching the left side, and pulling forward and to the left simultaneously. Push up on the tab holding the secondary control circuit board with the spudger and pull it forward to remove it. Be careful not to pull too hard on the cable connecting the power button control circuit board and the secondary control circuit board to the main circuit board

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
lift the support frame off of the printer body with both hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Lift the support frame off of the printer body with both hands.

Lines.Text: remove the printer door and paper tray by putting them in the closed position and not laying flat then rotating them upwards lift the left side up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printer door and paper tray by putting them in the closed position and not laying flat then rotating them upwards lift the left side up.

Lines.Text: remove both of the ink cartridges by grabbing the front of the ink cartridge and pulling down .
make sure that the printer carriage is pushed all the way to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both of the ink cartridges by grabbing the front of the ink cartridge and pulling down. Make sure that the printer carriage is pushed all the way to the right.

Lines.Text: remove the t10 6 mm torx screw on the left side of the track assembly .
remove the t10 12 mm torx screw on the left side of the track assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the  T10 6 mm Torx screw on the left side of the track assembly. Remove the T10 12 mm Torx screw on the left side of the track assembly.

Lines.Text: gently push the ink cartridge carriage to the left side of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently push the ink cartridge carriage to the left side of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
remove the two t10 6 mm torx screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Remove the two T10  6 mm Torx screws.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the ink cartridge carriage to the main circuit board .
pull straight up to free the cable from the main circuit board . do not twist or wiggle the cable as doing so can damage it .
you may need to lift the carriage up with one hand in order to reach the cable with the free hand as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Remove the cable connecting the ink cartridge carriage to the main circuit board. Pull straight up to free the cable from the main circuit board.  Do not twist or wiggle the cable as doing so can damage it. You may need to lift the carriage up with one hand in order to reach the cable with the free hand as shown.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the connector holding the drive motor wires to the main circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the connector holding the drive motor wires to the main circuit board.

Lines.Text: slide the ink cartridge carriage all the way to the right side of the printer .
using both hands , carefully lift the ink cartridge track off of the main body of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the ink cartridge carriage all the way to the right side of the printer. Using both hands, carefully lift the  ink cartridge track off of the main body of the printer.

Lines.Text: set aside the ink cartridge carriage .
remove the three t10 12 mm torx screws holding the paper guide to the printer body .
lift the paper guide directly up to remove it and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the ink cartridge carriage. Remove the three T10 12mm Torx screws holding the paper guide to the printer body. Lift the paper guide directly up to remove it and set it aside.

Lines.Text: remove the four t10 12 mm torx screws from the roller holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four T10 12mm Torx screws from the roller holder.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic gear cover by pulling it away from the printer body and lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic gear cover by pulling it away from the printer body and lifting it up.

Lines.Text: remove the metal tab by rotating it away from the body of the printer and pulling up .
remove the brush by grasping it firmly by the base and lift straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the metal tab by rotating it away from the body of the printer and pulling up. Remove the brush by grasping it firmly by the base and lift straight up.

Lines.Text: remove the pad holder by lifting it straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the pad holder by lifting it straight up.

Lines.Text: remove the connector holding the feed roller motor to the logic board by pulling it strait up
remove the t10 12 mm torx screw on the roller panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the connector holding the feed roller motor to the logic board by pulling it strait up Remove the T10 12mm Torx screw on the roller panel.

Lines.Text: disconnect the page sensor from the logic board by pulling straight up on the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the page sensor from the logic board by pulling straight up on the connector.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 180 degrees and turn it up on to the front side , so that the back of the printer is facing up and the bottom facing you .
be careful because the feed roller assembly is now loose , but it is still attached to the main body of the printer .
push in the tab on the left side of the back panel and pull outward to remove the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 180 degrees and turn it up on to the front side, so that the back of the printer is facing up and the bottom facing you. Be careful because the feed roller assembly is now loose, but it is still attached to the main body of the printer. Push in the tab on the left side of the back panel and pull outward to remove the back panel.

Lines.Text: tilt the printer up until the bottom of the printer can be seen .
remove the t10 12 mm torx screw from the bottom panel .
grasp the top edge of the bottom panel and pull to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the printer up until the bottom of the printer can be seen. Remove the T10 12mm Torx screw from the bottom panel. Grasp the top edge of the bottom panel and pull to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove the black plastic cross member from the bottom of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black plastic cross member from the bottom of the printer.

Lines.Text: turn the printer back down so that it is sitting on the bottom panel and rotate the printer 180 degrees .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer back down so that it is sitting on the bottom panel and rotate the printer 180 degrees.

Lines.Text: remove the printer head cleaner by lifting the front of the printer head cleaner above the track and slide it forward .
this is an extremely difficult step . it can take quite a bit of force to lift the printer head cleaner above the track and it is easy to slip and hurt yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printer head cleaner by lifting the front of the printer head cleaner above the track and slide it forward. This is an extremely difficult step. It can take quite a bit of force to lift the printer head cleaner above the track and it is easy to slip and hurt yourself.

Lines.Text: this step can be performed with out rotating the printer , but we have rotated the printer for clarity .
grasp the left side of the feed roller assembly and pull towards the front of the printer and up to free the metal tab from the slot .

Steps.Text_raw: This step can be performed with out rotating the printer, but we have rotated the printer for clarity. Grasp the left side of the feed roller assembly and pull towards the front of the printer and up to free the metal tab from the slot.

Lines.Text: lift the feed roller assembly straight up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the feed roller assembly straight up to remove it.

Subject: Feed Roller Assembly Removal

Title: Acer AL1916 EMI Shield Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the monitor on a flat surface so that the back is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the monitor on a flat surface so that the back is facing up.

Lines.Text: grab the hinge cover with both hands on either side of the stand .
squeeze inwards with your thumbs and fingers and lift up to remove the hinge cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the hinge cover with both hands on either side of the stand. Squeeze inwards with your thumbs and fingers and lift up to remove the hinge cover.

Lines.Text: remove the four 12.1 mm phillips 2 screws that hold the stand to the monitor .
support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling .
lift up to detach the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 12.1 mm Phillips #2 screws that hold the stand to the monitor. Support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling. Lift up to detach the stand.

Lines.Text: remove the five 9.5 mm phillips 2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 9.5 mm Phillips #2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor.

Lines.Text: starting at the corner of the monitor , wedge the small plastic opening tool between the back cover and the display bezel .
tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel .
continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off .
a reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting at the corner of the monitor, wedge the small plastic opening tool between the back cover and the display bezel. Tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel. Continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off. A reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel.

Lines.Text: reposition the monitor so that the back is facing up .
grab the corners of the monitor and jiggle them upwards to detach the back cover from the inside of the monitor .
lift the back cover up .

Steps.Text_raw: Reposition the monitor so that the back is facing up. Grab the corners of the monitor and jiggle them upwards to detach the back cover from the inside of the monitor. Lift the back cover up.

Lines.Text: remove the two 5.7 mm phillips 2 screws located on either side of the emi shield .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 5.7 mm Phillips #2 screws located on either side of the EMI shield.

Lines.Text: using a nut driver ( or if necessary , needle-nose pliers ) , remove the two nuts on either side of the vga input .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a nut driver (or if necessary, needle-nose pliers), remove the two nuts on either side of the VGA input.

Lines.Text: grab the metal casing by the sides and slide it down towards the bottom of the monitor .
lift up to remove the metal casing .
beware , metal casing is sharp !

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the metal casing by the sides and slide it down towards the bottom of the monitor. Lift up to remove the metal casing. Beware, metal casing is sharp!

Subject: EMI Shield

Lines.Text: lay the monitor on a flat surface so that the back is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the monitor on a flat surface so that the back is facing up.

squeeze inwards with your thumbs and fingers and lift up to remove the hinge cover .

support the monitor while removing the screws to prevent the monitor from falling .
lift up to detach the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 9.5 mm Phillips #2 screws located around the perimeter of the monitor.

tilt the plastic opening tool up to separate the back cover from the display bezel .
continue around the perimeter of the monitor until the display bezel comes off .
a reasonable amount of force is necessary to detach the back cover from the display bezel .

Title: Linksys WRT54G Motherboard Component Replacement

Lines.Text: unfold the antennas straight away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unfold the antennas straight away from the device.

Lines.Text: remove the black caps from the antennas by pulling them away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black caps from the antennas by pulling them away from the device.

Lines.Text: unscrew each of the antennas from the wireless device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew each of the antennas from the wireless device.

Lines.Text: using a bit of force , remove the blue plastic case .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a bit of force, remove the blue plastic case.

Lines.Text: to remove the black casing that surrounds the green motherboard , slide the top half of the casing backwards . it only moves a very short distance .
pull the top piece upwards and away from the bottom to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the black casing that surrounds the green motherboard, slide the top half of the casing backwards. It only moves a very short distance. Pull the top piece upwards and away from the bottom to remove.

Lines.Text: locate the 2 m2.5x6 mm screws that attach the motherboard to the back case .
remove the two screws from the motherboard as indicated with the phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the 2 M2.5x6mm screws that attach the motherboard to the back case. Remove the two screws from the motherboard as indicated with the Phillips head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: once screws have been removed , slide the motherboard in the direction of its led lights .
lift motherboard up and away from the black lower casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Once screws have been removed, slide the motherboard in the direction of its LED lights. Lift motherboard up and away from the black lower casing.

Lines.Text: obtain a desoldering wick ( 750 ) .
make sure that the soldering iron is not resting on top of anything that would be damaged by the heat .

Steps.Text_raw: Obtain a desoldering wick ([product|IF145-079|Desoldering Braid]). Plug in soldering iron and allow to heat. For soldering information, refer to the iFixit soldering guide ([guide|750]). Make sure that the soldering iron is not resting on top of anything that would be damaged by the heat.

Lines.Text: identify the functional component which will be removed .
turn the board over so that the pins holding the component in are exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the functional component which will be removed. Turn the board over so that the pins holding the component in are exposed.

Lines.Text: desolder each pin using the ifixit soldering guide ( guide750 ) . gently remove functional component for replacement .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder each pin using the iFixit Soldering Guide ([guide|750]). Gently remove functional component for replacement.

Subject: Motherboard Component

remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the left side panel .

remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board .
grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up . do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection .

using both hands , lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer .

remove the t10 12 mm torx screw on the roller panel .

remove the t10 12 mm torx screw from the bottom panel .
grasp the top edge of the bottom panel and pull to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the printer up until the bottom of the printer can be seen. Remove the T10 12mm Torx screw from the bottom panel. Grasp the top edge of the bottom panel and pull to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove the black plastic cross member from the bottom of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black plastic cross member from the bottom of the printer.

Lines.Text: turn the printer back down so that it is sitting on the bottom panel and rotate the printer 180 degrees .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer back down so that it is sitting on the bottom panel and rotate the printer 180 degrees.

Lines.Text: remove the printer head cleaner by lifting the front of the printer head cleaner above the track and slide it forward .
this is an extremely difficult step . it can take quite a bit of force to lift the printer head cleaner above the track and it is easy to slip and hurt yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printer head cleaner by lifting the front of the printer head cleaner above the track and slide it forward. This is an extremely difficult step. It can take quite a bit of force to lift the printer head cleaner above the track and it is easy to slip and hurt yourself.

Lines.Text: this step can be performed with out rotating the printer , but we have rotated the printer for clarity .
grasp the left side of the feed roller assembly and pull towards the front of the printer and up to free the metal tab from the slot .

Steps.Text_raw: This step can be performed with out rotating the printer, but we have rotated the printer for clarity. Grasp the left side of the feed roller assembly and pull towards the front of the printer and up to free the metal tab from the slot.

Lines.Text: lift the feed roller assembly straight up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the feed roller assembly straight up to remove it.

Lines.Text: set aside the feed roller assembly .
push down on the tab that is on the power and usb back panel and then away from the printer to remove the power and usb back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the feed roller assembly. Push down on the tab that is on the power and USB back panel and then away from the printer to remove the power and USB back panel.

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the main circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12mm Torx screws from the main circuit board.

Lines.Text: remove the main circuit board by gently lifting it up from the back and pulling away from the front of the printer .
be careful not to lift to fast , as doing so can cause damage to the main circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the main circuit board by gently lifting it up from the back and pulling away from the front of the printer. Be careful not to lift to fast, as doing so can cause damage to the main circuit board.

Subject: Main Circuit Board

Title: HP Photosmart c3180 Feed Roller Replacement

Lines.Text: before disassembling your printer , be sure that the printer has been unplugged .
rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise so that the side panel next to control panel is facing you .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the left side panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Before disassembling your printer, be sure that the printer has been unplugged. Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise so that the side panel next to control panel is facing you. Remove the two T10 12mm Torx screws from the left side panel.

Lines.Text: firmly pull the the back of the side panel until it separates from the body of the printer .
rotate the side panel upwards while pulling it towards yourself to remove the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pull the the back of the side panel until it separates from the body of the printer. Rotate the side panel upwards while pulling it towards yourself to remove the panel.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
grasp the paper tray and rotate it down .
insert your fingers into the slot in the printer door and pull to rotate the gate down .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Grasp the paper tray and rotate it down. Insert your fingers into the slot in the printer door and pull to rotate the gate down.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
grasp both sides of the side panel and pull it forward to remove the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Grasp both sides of the side panel and pull it forward to remove the panel.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
lift the scanner lid to expose the scanner glass .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Lift the scanner lid to expose the scanner glass.

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Do not attempt to lift the top panel off the printer yet because it is still connected to the printer body by a cable.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
inside the printer is a small white tab . press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard .
remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Inside the printer is a small white tab. Press it inward with a spudger until a pop is heard. Remove the front panel by grasping its front and pulling away from the printer.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Remove the cable connecting the top panel of the printer to the power button assembly.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the top panel of the printer away from the printer body.

Lines.Text: set aside the top panel of the printer .
remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws from the top front of the printer

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the top panel of the printer. Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws from the top front of the printer

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board .
grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up . do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the Printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Remove the scanner cable from the main circuit board. Grasp the bottom of the cable and pull straight up. Do not wiggle it from side to side or twist it as this can damage the connection.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise .
using both hands , lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees clockwise. Using both hands, lift the scanner tray from the body of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the power button circuit board from the support frame by pinching the left side , and pulling forward and to the left simultaneously .
push up on the tab holding the secondary control circuit board with the spudger and pull it forward to remove it .
be careful not to pull too hard on the cable connecting the power button control circuit board and the secondary control circuit board to the main circuit board

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the power button circuit board from the support frame by pinching the left side, and pulling forward and to the left simultaneously. Push up on the tab holding the secondary control circuit board with the spudger and pull it forward to remove it. Be careful not to pull too hard on the cable connecting the power button control circuit board and the secondary control circuit board to the main circuit board

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
lift the support frame off of the printer body with both hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Lift the support frame off of the printer body with both hands.

Lines.Text: remove the printer door and paper tray by putting them in the closed position and not laying flat then rotating them upwards lift the left side up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printer door and paper tray by putting them in the closed position and not laying flat then rotating them upwards lift the left side up.

Lines.Text: remove both of the ink cartridges by grabbing the front of the ink cartridge and pulling down .
make sure that the printer carriage is pushed all the way to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both of the ink cartridges by grabbing the front of the ink cartridge and pulling down. Make sure that the printer carriage is pushed all the way to the right.

Lines.Text: remove the t10 6 mm torx screw on the left side of the track assembly .
remove the t10 12 mm torx screw on the left side of the track assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the  T10 6 mm Torx screw on the left side of the track assembly. Remove the T10 12 mm Torx screw on the left side of the track assembly.

Lines.Text: gently push the ink cartridge carriage to the left side of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently push the ink cartridge carriage to the left side of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the two t10 12 mm torx screws .
remove the two t10 6 mm torx screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two T10 12 mm Torx screws. Remove the two T10  6 mm Torx screws.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise .
remove the cable connecting the ink cartridge carriage to the main circuit board .
pull straight up to free the cable from the main circuit board . do not twist or wiggle the cable as doing so can damage it .
you may need to lift the carriage up with one hand in order to reach the cable with the free hand as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 90 degrees counter clockwise. Remove the cable connecting the ink cartridge carriage to the main circuit board. Pull straight up to free the cable from the main circuit board.  Do not twist or wiggle the cable as doing so can damage it. You may need to lift the carriage up with one hand in order to reach the cable with the free hand as shown.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the connector holding the drive motor wires to the main circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the connector holding the drive motor wires to the main circuit board.

Lines.Text: slide the ink cartridge carriage all the way to the right side of the printer .
using both hands , carefully lift the ink cartridge track off of the main body of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the ink cartridge carriage all the way to the right side of the printer. Using both hands, carefully lift the  ink cartridge track off of the main body of the printer.

Lines.Text: set aside the ink cartridge carriage .
remove the three t10 12 mm torx screws holding the paper guide to the printer body .
lift the paper guide directly up to remove it and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the ink cartridge carriage. Remove the three T10 12mm Torx screws holding the paper guide to the printer body. Lift the paper guide directly up to remove it and set it aside.

Lines.Text: remove the four t10 12 mm torx screws from the roller holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four T10 12mm Torx screws from the roller holder.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic gear cover by pulling it away from the printer body and lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic gear cover by pulling it away from the printer body and lifting it up.

Lines.Text: remove the metal tab by rotating it away from the body of the printer and pulling up .
remove the brush by grasping it firmly by the base and lift straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the metal tab by rotating it away from the body of the printer and pulling up. Remove the brush by grasping it firmly by the base and lift straight up.

Lines.Text: remove the pad holder by lifting it straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the pad holder by lifting it straight up.

Lines.Text: remove the connector holding the feed roller motor to the logic board by pulling it strait up
remove the t10 12 mm torx screw on the roller panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the connector holding the feed roller motor to the logic board by pulling it strait up Remove the T10 12mm Torx screw on the roller panel.

Lines.Text: disconnect the page sensor from the logic board by pulling straight up on the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the page sensor from the logic board by pulling straight up on the connector.

Lines.Text: rotate the printer 180 degrees and turn it up on to the front side , so that the back of the printer is facing up and the bottom facing you .
be careful because the feed roller assembly is now loose , but it is still attached to the main body of the printer .
push in the tab on the left side of the back panel and pull outward to remove the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the printer 180 degrees and turn it up on to the front side, so that the back of the printer is facing up and the bottom facing you. Be careful because the feed roller assembly is now loose, but it is still attached to the main body of the printer. Push in the tab on the left side of the back panel and pull outward to remove the back panel.

Lines.Text: tilt the printer up until the bottom of the printer can be seen .
remove the t10 12 mm torx screw from the bottom panel .
grasp the top edge of the bottom panel and pull to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the printer up until the bottom of the printer can be seen. Remove the T10 12mm Torx screw from the bottom panel. Grasp the top edge of the bottom panel and pull to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove the black plastic cross member from the bottom of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black plastic cross member from the bottom of the printer.

Lines.Text: turn the printer back down so that it is sitting on the bottom panel and rotate the printer 180 degrees .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer back down so that it is sitting on the bottom panel and rotate the printer 180 degrees.

Lines.Text: remove the printer head cleaner by lifting the front of the printer head cleaner above the track and slide it forward .
this is an extremely difficult step . it can take quite a bit of force to lift the printer head cleaner above the track and it is easy to slip and hurt yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printer head cleaner by lifting the front of the printer head cleaner above the track and slide it forward. This is an extremely difficult step. It can take quite a bit of force to lift the printer head cleaner above the track and it is easy to slip and hurt yourself.

Lines.Text: this step can be performed with out rotating the printer , but we have rotated the printer for clarity .
grasp the left side of the feed roller assembly and pull towards the front of the printer and up to free the metal tab from the slot .

Steps.Text_raw: This step can be performed with out rotating the printer, but we have rotated the printer for clarity. Grasp the left side of the feed roller assembly and pull towards the front of the printer and up to free the metal tab from the slot.

Lines.Text: lift the feed roller assembly straight up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the feed roller assembly straight up to remove it.

Lines.Text: set aside the printer base .
flip the feed roller assembly over so that its bottom and so that the feed roller is on the left side .

Steps.Text_raw: Set aside the printer base. Flip the feed roller assembly over so that its bottom and so that the feed roller is on the left side.

Lines.Text: remove the t10 12 mm screw holding the feed roller in place .
carefully pull apart the two plastic beams to free the feed roller and lift the feed roller out of the assemblage .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the T10 12mm screw holding the feed roller in place. Carefully pull apart the two plastic beams to free the feed roller and lift the feed roller out of the assemblage.

Subject: Feed Roller

Title: Epson Stylus Photo 1400 Housing Replacement

Lines.Text: turn off the printer .
disconnect all data connections coming into the printer such as usb , networkd cables , firewire , etc . as well as removing the power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the printer. Disconnect all data connections coming into the printer such as USB, networkd cables, firewire, etc. as well as removing the power cord.

Lines.Text: locate the ieee cover in the back .
gently slide cover to the right to unlatch then pull to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the IEEE cover in  the back. Gently slide cover to the right to unlatch then pull to remove it.

Lines.Text: using a 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the four 10 mm screws shown .
remove the 6 mm screw that holds the rear housing in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the four 10mm screws shown. Remove the 6mm screw that holds the rear housing in place.

Lines.Text: remove the rear housing by pulling it backwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rear housing by pulling it backwards.

Lines.Text: insert the flathead screwdriver or plastic pry tool into the cutouts of the lower housing .
release the two tabs of the side housing by lifting the tool in an upward motion
remove the side housing by pulling it outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the flathead screwdriver or plastic pry tool into the cutouts of the lower housing. Release the two tabs of the side housing by lifting the tool in an upward motion Remove the side housing by pulling it outwards.

Lines.Text: both side housings are attached by the same type of mechanism .
using the same method , remove the other side housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Both side housings are attached by the same type of mechanism. Using the same method, remove the other side housing.

Lines.Text: lift the paper support .
open the printer cover and front cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the paper support. Open the printer cover and front cover.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm phillips 2 screws from the sides of the printer .
remove the three 6 mm phillips 2 screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm Phillips #2 screws from the sides of the printer. Remove the three 6mm Phillips #2 screws.

Lines.Text: detach the tabs from the pins on each side by pulling it outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the tabs from the pins on each side by pulling it outwards.

Lines.Text: remove the two 10 mm phillips 2 screws on the front of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 10 mm Phillips #2 screws on the front of the printer.

Lines.Text: disconnect the cable on the side by carefully pulling it outwards .
you may need to gently rock the cable up and down while pulling .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the cable on the side by carefully pulling it outwards. You may need to gently rock the cable up and down while pulling.

Lines.Text: remove the upper housing by lifting it upwards .
it's easier to lift the housing by gripping it from the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the upper housing by lifting it upwards. It's easier to lift  the housing by gripping it from the bottom.

Subject: Housing

Title: Lite-On LightScribe SHM-165H6S Disc Tray Replacement

Lines.Text: insert an open paper clip into the small hole on the left side of the faceplate .
the tray should click open , extend it fully .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert an open paper clip into the small hole on the left side of the faceplate. The tray should click open, extend it fully.

Lines.Text: use an opening device to push in the black tabs on the left , right and bottom of the outer chassis to unhook the faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an opening device to push in the black tabs on the left, right and bottom of the outer chassis to unhook the faceplate.

Lines.Text: pull the faceplate away from the main chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the faceplate away from the main chassis.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 8.5 mm screws on the bottom chassis using a phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 8.5 mm screws on the bottom chassis using a Philips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: lift the top and bottom chassis straight up in order to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the top and bottom chassis straight up in order to remove them.

Lines.Text: extend the tray fully .
push the tab on the right side to the left .
push the tab on the left side to the left .
remove the tray carefully .

Steps.Text_raw: Extend the tray fully. Push the tab on the right side to the left. Push the tab on the left side to the left. Remove the tray carefully.

Lines.Text: guide the replacement tray under the beige tabs .
make sure the grey piece is slid to the right , so the grey nob is under the right-hand groove of the tray .
check to see that the tray extends and closes smoothly .

Steps.Text_raw: Guide the replacement tray under the beige tabs. Make sure the grey piece is slid to the right, so the grey nob is under the right-hand groove of the tray. Check to see that the tray extends and closes smoothly.

Subject: Disc Tray

Title: Microtek ScanMaker 5900 Stepper Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: loosen the screws on the serial port by turning them counter clockwise by hand .
after loosening the screws , pull the serial port out .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the screws on the serial port by turning them counter clockwise by hand. After loosening the screws, pull the serial port out.

Lines.Text: lift lid to its vertical position .
pull lid straight up to remove it from the scanner .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift lid to its vertical position. Pull lid straight up to remove it from the scanner.

Lines.Text: push the plastic opening tools into the crack between the top and the bottom of the chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the plastic opening tools into the crack between the top and the bottom of the chassis.

Lines.Text: after placing one plastic opening tool into the slit , slide other plastic opening tools along the slit to detach the top from the bottom of the chassis .
go all the way along the chassis until you can lift the upper lid .

Steps.Text_raw: After placing one plastic opening tool into the slit, slide other plastic opening tools along the slit to detach the top from the bottom of the chassis. Go all the way along the chassis until you can lift the upper lid.

Lines.Text: do not fully remove the lid until you remove the ribbon cable attached to the front of the upper lid .
do this by grabbing the upper lid from the sides and rotating it ninety degrees so it is perpendicular to the bottom lid .
grab the ribbon cable and gently pull it out of its slot with your fingers .
the upper lid can now safely be removed from the bottom lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not fully remove the lid until you remove the ribbon cable attached to the front of the upper lid. Do this by grabbing the upper lid from the sides and rotating it ninety degrees so it is perpendicular to the bottom lid. Grab the ribbon cable and gently pull it out of its slot with your fingers. The upper lid can now safely be removed from the bottom lid.

Lines.Text: locate the stepper motor . with the front of the scanner facing you , the motor is located at the top left .
disconnect the white connector from the vertical standing circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the stepper motor. With the front of the scanner facing you, the motor is located at the top left. Disconnect the white connector from the vertical standing circuit board.

Lines.Text: using a 2 phillips screwdriver , unscrew the two 7.7 mm screws holding the stepper motor in place .
the stepper motor will become loose , but not completely free .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a #2 Philips Screwdriver, unscrew the two 7.7mm screws holding the stepper motor in place. The stepper motor will become loose, but not completely free.

Lines.Text: using tweezers gently remove the tread from the black gear on the stepper motor .
the stepper motor will become completely free .

Steps.Text_raw: Using tweezers gently remove the tread from the black gear on the stepper motor. The stepper motor will become completely free.

Subject: Stepper Motor

Title: Microtek ScanMaker 5900 New Bulb Replacement

Lines.Text: loosen the screws on the serial port by turning them counter clockwise by hand .
after loosening the screws , pull the serial port out .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the screws on the serial port by turning them counter clockwise by hand. After loosening the screws, pull the serial port out.

Lines.Text: lift lid to its vertical position .
pull lid straight up to remove it from the scanner .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift lid to its vertical position. Pull lid straight up to remove it from the scanner.

Lines.Text: push the plastic opening tools into the crack between the top and the bottom of the chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the plastic opening tools into the crack between the top and the bottom of the chassis.

Lines.Text: after placing one plastic opening tool into the slit , slide other plastic opening tools along the slit to detach the top from the bottom of the chassis .
go all the way along the chassis until you can lift the upper lid .

Steps.Text_raw: After placing one plastic opening tool into the slit, slide other plastic opening tools along the slit to detach the top from the bottom of the chassis. Go all the way along the chassis until you can lift the upper lid.

Lines.Text: do not fully remove the lid until you remove the ribbon cable attached to the front of the upper lid .
do this by grabbing the upper lid from the sides and rotating it ninety degrees so it is perpendicular to the bottom lid .
grab the ribbon cable and gently pull it out of its slot with your fingers .
the upper lid can now safely be removed from the bottom lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not fully remove the lid until you remove the ribbon cable attached to the front of the upper lid. Do this by grabbing the upper lid from the sides and rotating it ninety degrees so it is perpendicular to the bottom lid. Grab the ribbon cable and gently pull it out of its slot with your fingers. The upper lid can now safely be removed from the bottom lid.

Lines.Text: after opening the chassis , you will see a white bulb spanning the width of the scanner .
lift up the black piece of plastic the bulb is attached to from the left hand side until it is perpendicular with the bottom lid of the scanner .

Steps.Text_raw: After opening the chassis, you will see a white bulb spanning the width of the scanner. Lift up the black piece of plastic the bulb is attached to from the left hand side until it is perpendicular with the bottom lid of the scanner.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to grab the plastic casing the wires are housed in .
gently jiggle the plastic back and forth until it can be pulled from its connection .
pull the wires out of the circuit board .
pull the wires up and out over the top of the plastic housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to grab the plastic casing the wires are housed in. Gently jiggle the plastic back and forth until it can be pulled from its connection. Pull the wires out of the circuit board. Pull the wires up and out over the top of the plastic housing.

Lines.Text: place the plastic housing back into the bottom lid of the scanner .
remove the plastic panel by gently pushing on the plastic latches with a plastic opening tool .
pull the bulb and wire out of its plastic casing .
the bulb is now free to be replaced .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the plastic housing back into the bottom lid of the scanner. Remove the plastic panel by gently pushing on the plastic latches with a plastic opening tool. Pull the bulb and wire out of its plastic casing. The bulb is now free to be replaced.

Subject: New Bulb
