Title: HP Deskjet 930c Disassembly to clean Waste Ink Reservoir

Lines.Text: carefully pry off the button board cover with a flat-head screwdriver .
unplug and remove the button board .
remove two screws that hold the printer's top piece in place with a tr8 torx security screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pry off the button board cover with a flat-head screwdriver. Unplug and remove the button board. Remove two screws that hold the printer's top piece in place with a TR8 Torx Security screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the printer's lid .
push in the tab shown to remove the top plastic assembly of the printer .
you don't have to remove the cartridge cover to do this . though removing the cover makes it easier , it is not a required step .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the printer's lid. Push in the tab shown to remove the top plastic assembly of the printer. You don't have to remove the cartridge cover to do this. Though removing the cover makes it easier, it is not a required step.

Lines.Text: remove the paper jam door from the printer by turning the dial from the locked position to the unlocked position .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the paper jam door from the printer by turning the dial from the locked position to the unlocked position.

Lines.Text: push and lift the tabs shown with a flat-head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Push and lift the tabs shown with a flat-head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the top casing from the printer .
unclip and pry off the side cover with a tr8 torx security screwdriver .
pry off the plastic casing with force ; the tr8 torx security screwdriver can help here .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top casing from the printer. Unclip and pry off the side cover with a TR8 Torx Security Screwdriver. Pry off the plastic casing with force; the TR8 Torx Security Screwdriver can help here.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic piece covering the motor that controls the waste ink assembly .
disconnect the motor connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic piece covering the motor that controls the waste ink assembly. Disconnect the motor connection.

Lines.Text: with the motor unplugged , move the ink cartridge carrier to the middle of the printer .
you can scroll the gear assembly with your finger if the carriage gets stuck .
remove four screws from the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: With the motor unplugged, move the ink cartridge carrier to the middle of the printer. You can scroll the gear assembly with your finger if the carriage gets stuck. Remove four screws from the back panel.

Lines.Text: press the clip marked in red .
slide it to the right .
lift and remove this side .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the clip marked in red. Slide it to the right. Lift and remove this side.

Lines.Text: press where marked with the arrow and lift the waste ink reservoir .
remove the motor and clean with high-pressured water .

Steps.Text_raw: Press where marked with the arrow and lift the waste ink reservoir. Remove the motor and clean with high-pressured water.

Title: Sceptre X9 Komodo VII Video Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: place the monitor face down .
remove the four 11.5 mm screws with a 2 phillips screwdriver .
remove the stand by pulling it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the monitor face down. Remove the four 11.5mm screws with a  #2 Phillips screwdriver. Remove the stand by pulling it out.

Lines.Text: remove two 11.5 mm screws with a 2 phillips screwdriver .
remove the plastic bar .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 11.5mm screws with a  #2 Phillips screwdriver. Remove the plastic bar.

Lines.Text: using a 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the six 7 mm screws at the circled locations .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a  #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the six 7mm screws at the circled locations.

Lines.Text: pry the monitor using the plastic opening tool to release the clips holding the cover on .
there are four clips on each side , four on the top , and one on the bottom .
you may hear a loud snapping noise when releasing the clips . do not be alarmed , it is natural .
once all the clips have been released , remove the cover by pulling it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the monitor using the plastic opening tool to release the clips holding the cover on. There are four clips on each side, four on the top, and one on the bottom. You may hear a loud snapping noise when releasing the clips.  Do not be alarmed, it is natural. Once all the clips have been released,  remove the cover by pulling it up.

Lines.Text: using the 2 phillips screwdriver , remove the one 6 mm screw .
unplug the indicated cable by pulling on the base .
slide the cover toward the top of the monitor .
remove the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the  #2 Phillips screwdriver, remove the one 6mm screw. Unplug the indicated cable by pulling on the base. Slide the cover toward the top of the monitor. Remove the cover.

Lines.Text: use caution when removing the connectors as they can easily break when removing .
disconnect the multi-pin connector at the top of the board by firmly grasping the connector and pulling to the side .
disconnect the multi-pin connector that runs between the video motherboard and the power supply motherboard . firmly grasp the connector and pull straight up .
a plastic opening tool can be used to assist in the removal of connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: Use caution when removing the connectors as they can easily break when removing. Disconnect the multi-pin connector at the top of the board by firmly grasping the connector and pulling to the side. Disconnect the multi-pin connector that runs between the video motherboard and the power supply motherboard. Firmly grasp the connector and pull straight up. A plastic opening tool can be used to assist in the removal of connectors.

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 /16 hex head screws from the vga connecter . use a pair of needle nose pliers if a wrench is not available .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3/16" hex head screws from the VGA connecter. Use a pair of needle nose pliers if a wrench is not available.

Lines.Text: remove the four 6.4 mm 2 phillips screws from the corners of the motherboard with a 2 phillips screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 6.4mm #2 Phillips screws from the corners of the motherboard with a #2 Phillips screwdriver.

Lines.Text: lift the motherboard straight up to remove it from the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the motherboard straight up to remove it from the back panel.

lif the back panel to reveal the lcd back cover .

remove the bezels from the lcd back cover ( the bezels should simply fall off once the screws are removed ) .

Lines.Text: use a 0 phillips to remove the three 4.5 mm screws located on the lcd back cover .
lift the inner panel to remove it .
disconnect the muti-pin connector on the lcd back cover by firmly pulling down on it .

there are tabs holding down the cover . you may have to use a bit of force to pry them open .
a small flat-blade screwdriver can be used to pry off lcd cover .

lift the top cover of the scanner .
carefully , pry the plastic frame surrounding the glass away from the printer hood using a plastic prying tool .
pull the frame out .

Title: HP Deskjet 1055 Scanner Glass Pane Replacement

Lines.Text: take all paper out of the paper tray . unplug the printer .
remove the plastic printer-control panel on the top left .
then , forcefully lift up the bottom of the panel while applying downward pressure with your thumb-as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Take all paper out of the paper tray. Unplug the printer. Remove the plastic printer-control panel on the top left. Then, forcefully lift up the bottom of the panel while applying downward pressure with your thumb-as shown.

Lines.Text: with your other hand , slide the top of the panel towards the back of the printer .
do not rip the white cable that connects the panel with the main body of the printer .
disconnect the ribbon by pinching the blue tab and pulling away from the green circuit board .
lift the panel free and set to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: With your other hand, slide the top of the panel towards the back of the printer. Do not rip the white cable that connects the panel with the main body of the printer. Disconnect the ribbon by pinching the blue tab and pulling away from the green circuit board. Lift the panel free and set to the side.

Lines.Text: place the plastic opening tool between the plastic cover and the mount on the printer .
pry the plastic cover towards the center of the printer .
pull up on the cover to remove it from the printer-as shown .
repeat the process on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the plastic opening tool between the plastic cover and the mount on the printer. Pry the plastic cover towards the center of the printer. Pull up on the cover to remove it from the printer-as shown. Repeat the process on the other side.

Lines.Text: to remove the glass panel , take out the four 14 mm ( 1 /2 inch ) screws with a t10 torx screwdriver .
don't lift the glass panel completely off because there are cables plugged into the underside .

Lines.Text: disconnect the white cables from the green motherboard by pinching the cable where it connects to the green motherboard . pull up , lightly .
set the lower part of the printer aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the white cables from the green motherboard by pinching the cable where it connects to the green motherboard. Pull up, lightly. Set the lower part of the printer aside.

Lines.Text: place the glass panel , face down , on a smooth surface .
remove the 14 mm ( 1 /2 in . ) screw from the white plastic tab on the side of the panel with a t10 torx screwdriver .

Title: Viewsonic VG1930wm disassembly and capacitor replacement

Lines.Text: here is the monitor as given to me . not a great monitor , but the price was right .
first to pop off the cover on the stand . use a flat tip screwdriver , or similar tool , to pop it off
there are tabs where the tool can be inserted and with small force the cover will pop off

Steps.Text_raw: Here is the monitor as given to me. Not a great monitor, but the price was right. First to pop  off the cover on the stand. Use a flat tip screwdriver, or similar tool, to pop it off There are tabs where the tool can be inserted and with small force the cover will pop off

Lines.Text: with the cover removed , the screws that hold the stand to the monitor become clearly visible .
remove the four phillips screws .
remove the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: With the cover removed, the screws that hold the stand to the monitor become clearly visible. Remove the four Phillips screws. Remove the stand.

Lines.Text: remove the two phillips screws from the back cover .
there are two tabs on the bottom to insert an opening tool . one on the left
and one on the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two Phillips screws from the back cover. There are two tabs on the bottom to insert an opening tool. One on the left and one on the right.

Lines.Text: insert a plastic opening tool in those tabs , slide the tool to the outside while exerting some side pressure .
this will loosen the bezel from the case .
continue to move it along the opening .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a plastic opening tool in those tabs, slide the tool to the outside while exerting some side pressure. This will loosen the bezel from the case. Continue to move it along the opening.

Lines.Text: the bottom will split relatively easy with the tool .
start at the split bottom and continue to move along the sides .
the bezel will continue to split . this is the toughest part of the job and will require some patience .

Steps.Text_raw: The bottom will split relatively easy with the tool. Start at the split bottom and continue to move along the sides. The bezel will continue to split. This is the toughest part of the job and will require some patience.

Lines.Text: with the bezel remove , the front panel of the monitor becomes visible . there are no screws that hold the panel in . it is the front bezel that holds it in place .
carefully lift the panel on the front , there are three cables that need to be removed .
remove the lvds cable . it is a simple push connector , just pull the cable upward .

Steps.Text_raw: With the bezel remove, the front panel of the monitor becomes visible. There are no screws that hold the panel in. It is the front bezel that holds it in place. Carefully lift the panel on the front, there are three cables that need to be removed. Remove the LVDS cable. It is a simple push connector, just pull the cable upward.

Lines.Text: lvds cable removed
ccfl cables removed
with the cables removed , just lift the panel up and away . the chassis and metal case for the electronic is next

Steps.Text_raw: LVDS cable removed CCFL cables removed With the cables removed, just lift the panel up and away. The chassis and metal case for the electronic is next

Lines.Text: remove the cable from the power button board . again , a simple push connector , remove the cable with a gentle pull .
remove the seven phillips screws . the screws are all 1 /2 with the exception of the center screws , that one is 1 /4
remove the bottom sheet metal , this will leave the cage for the electronics . remove the three phillips screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cable from the power button board. Again, a simple push connector, remove the cable with a gentle pull. Remove the seven Phillips screws. The screws are all 1/2" with the exception of the center screws, that one is 1/4" Remove the bottom sheet metal, this will leave the cage for the electronics. remove the three Phillips screws.

Lines.Text: the three phillips screws are 1 /4 in length .
with the screws removed , the top of the cage will open ,
and can now be separated in half .

Steps.Text_raw: The three Phillips screws are 1/4" in length. With the screws removed, the top of the cage will open, and can now be separated in half.

Lines.Text: here is the electronics for the panel . power board is to the left and video board to the right
the power board is fastened with 4 1 /4 inch phillips screws . remove those .
gently lift the board straight up , watch the connector on the right hand side .

Steps.Text_raw: Here is the electronics for the panel. Power board is to the left and video board to the right The power board is fastened with 4 1/4 inch Phillips screws. Remove those. Gently lift the board straight up, watch the connector on the right hand side.

Lines.Text: while gently lift the power board , the ground wire becomes visible .
remove the 5 mmx6 mm phillips screw .
with the four screws and the ground wire removed , lift the power board out of the cage . the component side can now be inspected .

Steps.Text_raw: While gently lift the power board, the ground wire becomes visible. Remove the 5mmx6mm Phillips screw. With the four screws and the ground wire removed, lift the power board out of the cage. The component side can now be inspected.

Lines.Text: here is the importance of a visual inspection .
blown caps , check bulges on top of caps ,
as well as charring on the board itself .
all of these capacitors have definitely failed . again , check the tops for bulging .
the power board has three fuses , those should be checked for continuity with a multimeter .

Steps.Text_raw: Here is the importance of a visual inspection. Blown caps, check bulges on top of caps, as well as charring on the board itself. all of these capacitors have definitely failed. Again, check the tops for bulging. The power board has three fuses, those should be checked for continuity with a multimeter.

Lines.Text: second fuse checked okay ,
as well as the third fuse . this fuse looks a bit different ,
and needs to be checked on the solder side of the board .

Steps.Text_raw: second fuse checked okay, as well as the third fuse. this fuse looks a bit different, and needs to be checked on the solder side of the board.

Lines.Text: the solder side shows the component to be desoldered c216 470 uf 25 v c213 680 uf 25 v c214 680 uf 25 v c212 680 uf 25 v c211 680 uf 25 v c215 470 uf 25 v c217 220 uf 25 v c12 220 uf 25 v c11 220 uf 25 v
desolder each cap with a solder wick , or solder sucker .

logic board with all the caps removed . note the hatched area on the logic board . this corresponds with the capacitors polarity marking . it is the negative lead , also has a shorter leg , that goes to the hatched area .
clearly visible is the charred area on the logic board at the transformer side

Steps.Text_raw: The solder side shows the component to be desoldered C216    470uF 25V C213    680uF 25V C214    680uF 25V C212    680uF 25V C211    680uF 25V C215    470uF 25V     C217    220uF 25V C12    220uF 25V C11    220uF 25V Desolder each cap with a solder wick, or solder sucker. Logic board with all the caps removed. Note the hatched area on the logic board. This corresponds with the capacitors polarity marking. It is the negative lead, also has a shorter leg, that goes to the hatched area. Clearly visible is the charred area on the logic board at the transformer side

Lines.Text: replace the capacitors with the appropriate ones . watch the polarity , match shorter leg side into hatched area
once the capacitors are inserted , bend the leads toward the logic board . this will ensure that the caps are tight to the board , it will also make it easier to solder them .
once they are soldered , cut the excess with a pair of side cutters or equivalent . all capacitors on this board are exchanged in the same way .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the capacitors with the appropriate ones. Watch the polarity, match shorter leg side into hatched area Once the capacitors are inserted, bend the leads toward the logic board. This will ensure that the caps are tight to the board, it will also make it easier to solder them. Once they are soldered, cut the excess with a pair of side cutters or equivalent. All capacitors on this board are exchanged in the same way.

Lines.Text: after reassembly of the monitor , hopefully the result will be the same . a functioning monitor : - )

Steps.Text_raw: After reassembly of the monitor, hopefully the result will be the same. A functioning monitor:-)

be careful with the paper tray and make sure it is evenly lifted through the rectangular hole in the plastic tray

Lines.Text: once all wires and screws have been removed , gently take the motherboard out of the printer .

if you do not know how to operate a soldering iron , do not attempt to finish this guide .
de-solder these eight solder joints on the bottom of the motherboard .
when reinstalling the motherboard back into the printer , solder the highlighted joints ( in orange markers in the second photo ) back onto the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all wires and screws have been removed, gently take the motherboard out of the printer. These wires are soldered onto the bottom of the PCB and must be de-soldered in order to completely detach the motherboard from the printer. If you do not know how to operate a soldering iron, do not attempt to finish this guide. De-solder these eight solder joints on the bottom of the motherboard. When reinstalling the motherboard back into the printer, solder the highlighted joints (in orange markers in the second photo) back onto the board.

Title: USB Cable Repair

Lines.Text: use wire cutters to remove the broken portion of the usb cable .
you should be left with two pieces of cable . if you had to remove the whole usb plug , you'll need a replacement plug . and yeah , you'll have to snip that one too .

Steps.Text_raw: Use wire cutters to remove the broken portion of the USB cable. You should be left with two pieces of cable. If you had to remove the whole USB plug, you'll need a replacement plug. And yeah, you'll have to snip that one too.

Lines.Text: with wire cutters or scissors , carefully strip the outer cable covering .
cut just the outer cover of the cable , and make sure to cut all the way around . don't cut any of the internal wires .
pull on the piece of cover that you've separated from the rest . you should be left with four exposed individual wires .
there should be four wires , and occasionally a piece of string too . if there are fewer wires , then you've clipped one off , and you need to trim the others and try this step again .
if there are more than 4 wires , you probably have a usb 3.0 cable . in this case , make sure that whatever wires you'll be reconnecting are both usb 3.0.

Steps.Text_raw: With wire cutters or scissors, carefully strip the outer cable covering. Cut just the outer cover of the cable, and make sure to cut all the way around. Don't cut any of the internal wires. Pull on the piece of cover that you've separated from the rest. You should be left with  four exposed individual wires. There should be four wires, and occasionally a piece of string too. If there are fewer wires, then you've clipped one off, and you need to trim the others and try this step again. If there are more than 4 wires, you probably have a USB 3.0 cable. In this case, make sure that whatever wires you'll be reconnecting are both USB 3.0.

Lines.Text: strip all the wires from both cables . you'll need about 1 /8 1 /4 , or about 1 /2 cm of exposed copper wire .
if you have a wire stripper , the wires will likely be 28 gauge , though they could sometimes be 26 gauge .

if you don't have a wire stripper , you can strip the wires exactly the same way as you exposed these wires : use wire cutters or scissors to gently cut the outer insulation , then pull off the insulation .
when stripping wires , do not cut or damage the copper wires . if you do damage the wire , cut off the damaged portion and try again .

Steps.Text_raw: Strip all the wires from both cables. You'll need about 1/8” – 1/4”, or about 1/2 cm of exposed copper wire. If you have a wire stripper, the wires will likely be 28 gauge, though they could sometimes be 26 gauge. If you don't have a wire stripper, you can strip the wires exactly the same way as you exposed these wires: use wire cutters or scissors to gently cut the outer insulation, then pull off the insulation. When stripping wires, do not cut or damage the copper wires. If you do damage the wire, cut off the damaged portion and try again.

Lines.Text: solder like-colored wires to each other .
there are many excellent guides for soldering online . alternatively , you might ask a geeky friend to do this step for you .

Steps.Text_raw: Solder like-colored wires to each other. There are many excellent guides for soldering online. Alternatively, you might ask a geeky friend to do this step for you.

Lines.Text: wrap each wire in electrical tape . make sure that there is no exposed copper .
this is mostly to make sure that the exposed wires don't touch . you don't need more than 1 /4 or 1 cm of tape for each wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Wrap each wire in electrical tape. Make sure that there is no exposed copper. This is mostly to make sure that the exposed wires don't touch. You don't need more than 1/4” or 1 cm of tape for each wire.

Lines.Text: wrap all the wires together in electrical tape to make it look better and last longer .

Steps.Text_raw: Wrap all the wires together in electrical tape to make it look better and last longer.

Title: Repair Mouse Buttons

Lines.Text: flip the mouse over and peel off the stickers on the perimeter of the bottom of the mouse

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the mouse over and peel off the stickers on the perimeter of the bottom of the mouse

Lines.Text: use the phillips 1 screwdriver to unscrew the six round head screws on the bottom of the mouse . those marked with squares are 9 mm in length , the rest are 5 mm in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #1 screwdriver to unscrew the six round head screws on the bottom of the mouse. Those marked with squares are 9 mm in length, the rest are 5 mm in length.

Lines.Text: grab the top shell of the mouse and lift up to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the top shell of the mouse and lift up to remove.

Lines.Text: the capacitors on this board can release stored electrical energy if touched .
touch your capacitor discharge tool to the capacitor leads on the board to release the stored energy . if leads are inaccessible , wait until you've removed the board from the mouse body .

Steps.Text_raw: The capacitors on this board can release stored electrical energy if touched. Touch your capacitor discharge tool to the capacitor leads on the board to release the stored energy. If leads are inaccessible, wait until you've removed the board from the mouse body.

Lines.Text: to remove the white wire connector on the bottom board , use a spudger underneath the white plug and pop it out ( this disconnects the upper board from the lower board ) .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the white wire connector on the bottom board, use a spudger underneath the white plug and pop it out (this disconnects the upper board from the lower board).

Lines.Text: remove the 5 mm round head screw holding the middle piece to the top piece .
the outermost shell will now separate from the middle structure .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5 mm round head screw holding the middle piece to the top piece. The outermost shell will now separate from the middle structure.

Lines.Text: take the plastic buttons ( the part that your fingers click ) and flip them over .
on the bottom , there should be little plastic towers . wearing these down can prevent the buttons from clicking properly .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the plastic buttons (the part that your fingers click) and flip them over. On the bottom, there should be little plastic towers. Wearing these down can prevent the buttons from clicking properly.

Lines.Text: file the bottoms of these towers flat to remove any ridges that prevent proper clicking .
make sure to file down both towers . in this image , one is left un-filed to show the difference .
this process can also be used for the other buttons on the mouse . use other guides to disassemble the mouse until the desired button is accessible , and then perform the same filing technique .

Steps.Text_raw: File the bottoms of these towers flat to remove any ridges that prevent proper clicking. Make sure to file down both towers. In this image, one is left un-filed to show the difference. This process can also be used for the other buttons on the mouse. Use other guides to disassemble the mouse until the desired button is accessible, and then perform the same filing technique.

Title: HP Deskjet F4480 Paper Roller Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: open the front access panel by placing your finger in the front slot and pulling gently .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the front access panel by placing your finger in the front slot and pulling gently.

Lines.Text: open the protective lid that is covering the glass . press gently against the base of the panel to remove the lid from the rest of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the protective lid that is covering the glass. Press gently against the base of the panel to remove the lid from the rest of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the '''four''' 9 mm t10 torx screws on the top .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the '''four''' 9mm T10 Torx screws on the top.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the top panel off of the printer .
do not tear or damage the '''two''' cables that connect the top lid to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the top panel off of the printer. Do not tear or damage the '''two''' cables that connect the top lid to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove the''' two''' cables by gripping each one close to their connection ports on the motherboard and gently disconnecting them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the''' two''' cables by gripping each one close to their connection ports on the motherboard and gently disconnecting them.

Lines.Text: detach the white ribbon cable .
remove the '''two''' 9 mm torx screws on either side of the white bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the white ribbon cable. Remove the '''two''' 9mm Torx screws on either side of the white bracket.

Lines.Text: remove the '''three''' black 9 mm torx screws and pull the black panel out from under the ink carriage .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the '''three''' black 9mm Torx screws and pull the black panel out from under the ink carriage.

Lines.Text: remove the '''five''' 9 mm torx screws on the silver panel .
pull out the silver panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the '''five''' 9mm Torx screws on the silver panel. Pull out the silver panel.

Lines.Text: remove the green yellow cable and the black white cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the green & yellow cable and the black & white cable.

Lines.Text: turn the printer over .
locate the gap at the bottom corner near the product information sticker .
reach a flat head screwdriver inside the gap and unlatch the silver tab .
a spudger tool is not the correct tool for this step , it has the potential to break .
for better visibility of the silver tab inside the gap , the use of a flashlight is recommended .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer over. Locate the gap at the bottom corner near the product information sticker. Reach a flat head screwdriver inside the gap and unlatch the silver tab. A spudger tool is not the correct tool for this step, it has the potential to break. For better visibility of the silver tab inside the gap, the use of a flashlight is recommended.

Lines.Text: remove the '''two''' 9 mm torx screws in order to detach the roller assembly from the system .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the '''two''' 9mm Torx screws in order to detach the roller assembly from the system.

Lines.Text: remove the roller assembly from the printer case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the roller assembly from the printer case.

Lines.Text: remove the '''two''' 6 mm torx screws using a t9 torx bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the '''two''' 6mm torx screws using a T9 Torx bit.

Lines.Text: remove the paper roller motor .
replace the old motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the paper roller motor. Replace the old motor.

Title: Top Shell

Lines.Text: flip the mouse over and peel off the stickers on the perimeter of the bottom of the mouse

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the mouse over and peel off the stickers on the perimeter of the bottom of the mouse

Lines.Text: use the phillips 1 screwdriver to unscrew the six round head screws on the bottom of the mouse . those marked with squares are 9 mm in length , the rest are 5 mm in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #1 screwdriver to unscrew the six round head screws on the bottom of the mouse. Those marked with squares are 9 mm in length, the rest are 5 mm in length.

Lines.Text: grab the top shell of the mouse and lift up to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the top shell of the mouse and lift up to remove.

Lines.Text: the capacitors on this board can release stored electrical energy if touched .
touch your capacitor discharge tool to the capacitor leads on the board to release the stored energy . if leads are inaccessible , wait until you've removed the board from the mouse body .

Steps.Text_raw: The capacitors on this board can release stored electrical energy if touched. Touch your capacitor discharge tool to the capacitor leads on the board to release the stored energy. If leads are inaccessible, wait until you've removed the board from the mouse body.

Lines.Text: to remove the white wire connector on the bottom board , use a spudger underneath the white plug and pop it out ( this disconnects the upper board from the lower board ) .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the white wire connector on the bottom board, use a spudger underneath the white plug and pop it out (this disconnects the upper board from the lower board).

Lines.Text: remove the 5 mm round head screw holding the middle piece to the top piece .
the outermost shell will now separate from the middle structure .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5 mm round head screw holding the middle piece to the top piece. The outermost shell will now separate from the middle structure.

Subject: Top Shell

the board will now pop off easily .

Title: NETGEAR WGT624 v3 Capacitor Replacement

Lines.Text: turn the device so that the bottom is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the device so that the bottom is facing up.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to carefully lift the rubber stops in each corner .
do not completely remove the rubber stops , because they are difficult to replace .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to carefully lift the rubber stops in each corner. Do not completely remove the rubber stops, because they are difficult to replace.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 4 11.8 mm t-8 torx screws from each corner of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 4 11.8 mm T-8 Torx screws from each corner of the device.

Lines.Text: lift the lower case straight up from the rest of the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the lower case straight up from the rest of the router.

Lines.Text: remove the clear plastic casing by lifting it straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the clear plastic casing by lifting it straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: separate the motherboard from the top shell by lifting it straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the motherboard from the top shell by lifting it straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: turn the motherboard so that the top is facing upwards .
place the motherboard on a clean flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the motherboard so that the top is facing upwards. Place the motherboard on a clean flat surface.

Lines.Text: locate the four capacitors .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the four capacitors.

Lines.Text: turn the motherboard so that the bottom is facing upwards .
locate the two soldered contacts for each capacitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the motherboard so that the bottom is facing upwards. Locate the two soldered contacts for each capacitor.

Lines.Text: do not refer to the pictures in this step for correct soldering and de-soldering techniques . they are solely for illustration purposes .
desolder the soldered connections between the capacitors and the motherboard , and pull the capacitor from the motherboard .
for proper soldering and de-soldering techniques , refer guide .
when reinstalling the capacitor , make sure the negative side of the capacitor is aligned with the shaded white region of the circle .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not refer to the pictures in this step for correct soldering and de-soldering techniques. They are solely for illustration purposes. Desolder the soldered connections between the capacitors and the motherboard, and pull the capacitor from the motherboard. For proper soldering and de-soldering techniques, refer [guide|750|here|stepid=4049]. When reinstalling the capacitor, make sure the negative side of the capacitor is aligned with the shaded white region of the circle.

Subject: Capacitor

Lines.Text: turn the device so that the bottom is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the device so that the bottom is facing up.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to carefully lift the rubber stops in each corner .
do not completely remove the rubber stops , because they are difficult to replace .

Lines.Text: unscrew the 4 11.8 mm t-8 torx screws from each corner of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 4 11.8 mm T-8 Torx screws from each corner of the device.

Lines.Text: lift the lower case straight up from the rest of the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the lower case straight up from the rest of the router.

Lines.Text: remove the clear plastic casing by lifting it straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the clear plastic casing by lifting it straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: separate the motherboard from the top shell by lifting it straight up from the router .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the motherboard from the top shell by lifting it straight up from the router.

Lines.Text: turn the motherboard , so that the top is facing upwards .
place the motherboard on a clean flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the motherboard, so that the top is facing upwards. Place the motherboard on a clean flat surface.

Lines.Text: remove the yellow tape that holds the wire .
make sure that you set the tape aside on a clean surface , so that it can be reused .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the yellow tape that holds the wire. Make sure that you set the tape aside on a clean surface, so that it can be reused.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to gently pull the metal bracket that connects the antenna to the motherboard .
the wire should now be completely separate from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to gently pull the metal bracket that connects the antenna to the motherboard. The wire should now be completely separate from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: extend the antenna away from the device , so that it becomes straight .

Steps.Text_raw: Extend the antenna away from the device, so that it becomes straight.

Lines.Text: find the clips that hold the antenna onto the router .
use one hand to push the clips in , while using your other hand to pull out the antenna . you may need to gently twist the antenna so it can separate from the hole .
the antenna may take considerable force to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Find the clips that hold the antenna onto the router. Use one hand to push the clips in, while using your other hand to pull out the antenna. You may need to gently twist the antenna so it can separate from the hole. The antenna may take considerable force to remove.

Lines.Text: completely separate the antenna and wire from the rest of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Completely separate the antenna and wire from the rest of the device.

Lines.Text: remove the metal frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the metal frame.

Lines.Text: turn over the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn over the motherboard.

Lines.Text: do not refer to the pictures in this step for correct soldering and de-soldering techniques . they are solely for illustration purposes .
desolder the four connections between the reset button and the motherboard
for proper soldering and desoldering techniques , refer guide .
pull the reset button from the other side of the mother board once the solder is liquid .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not refer to the pictures in this step for correct soldering and de-soldering techniques. They are solely for illustration purposes. Title: Temporary repairing Western Digital Essentials HD de-soldered USB connector

Lines.Text: use a large plastic opening tool along the rear panel :
there are 4 clips to release .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a large plastic opening tool along the rear panel: There are 4 clips to release.

Lines.Text: slide the cover along the plastic frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the cover along the plastic frame.

Lines.Text: slide off the largest plastic pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide off the largest plastic pieces.

Lines.Text: bend the second small plastic piece to release it from the rubber piece .
now you can slide it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Bend the second small plastic piece to release it from the rubber piece. Now you can slide it out.

Lines.Text: slide out the hard drive as shown in the picture
''make sure to slide as shown or you may damage the usb bridge logic board . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Slide out the hard drive as shown in the picture ''Make sure to slide as shown or you may damage the USB bridge logic board.''

Lines.Text: remove the 4 rubber piece from the plastic frame at each corner .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 4 rubber piece from the plastic frame at each corner.

Lines.Text: remove the rubber piece from the sata/usb bridge logic board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rubber piece from the  SATA/USB bridge logic board.

Lines.Text: remove both screws holding the retaining plate and the hard drive .
slide the retaining plate in order to disconnect the sata connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both screws holding the retaining plate and the hard drive. Slide the retaining plate in order to disconnect the SATA connector.

Lines.Text: remove both screws holding the retaining plate with the logic board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both screws holding the retaining plate with the logic board.

Lines.Text: use a tweezer to slightly bent the logic board contacts on the usb connector . the purpose is to ensure a good contact when the usb connector will be applied against the logic board .
in the first picture , you can see the contacts in the original position .
in the third picture , you can see the contacts in the bent position .
be careful , the contactors are fragile . just slightly bent them .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a tweezer to slightly bent the logic board contacts on the USB connector. The purpose is to ensure a good contact when the USB connector will be applied against the logic board. In the first picture, you can see the contacts in the original position. In the third picture, you can see the contacts in the bent position. Be careful, the contactors are fragile. Just slightly bent them.

Lines.Text: apply a piece of electrical tape on the back side of the logic board below the usb connector position .
this will prevent from any damage with the foldback paper clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply a piece of electrical tape on the back side of the logic board below the USB connector position. This will prevent from any damage with the Foldback Paper Clip.

Lines.Text: ''it is important to have the 2 following steps completed in a short time to guaranty a good quality gluing if you use an instant glue . ''
apply some glue on the logic board and below the usb connector .
do not apply glue on the rear part on the logic board and on the usb connector . it is important to ensure a good electrical contact between the connector and the logic board .
place the usb connector at is original place . use a magnifying glass to ensure all five contacts are well in place against the logic board contacts . you can use a tweezer to help .

Steps.Text_raw: ''It is important to have the 2 following steps completed in a short time to guaranty a good quality gluing if you use an instant glue.'' Apply some glue on the logic board and below the USB connector. Do not apply glue on the rear part on the logic board and on the USB connector. It is important to ensure a good electrical contact between the connector and the logic board. Place the USB connector at is original place. Use a magnifying glass to ensure all five contacts are well in place against the logic board contacts. You can use a tweezer to help.

Lines.Text: use a foldback paper clip to press the usb connector against the logic board .
once the paper clip is in place , ensure one more time that all contacts are well in place .
ensure that the glue is all dry before to continue . if you use an instant glue you should wait for a few hours anyway or you can refer on the instruction provided with the glue .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Foldback Paper Clip to press the USB connector against the logic board. Once the paper clip is in place, ensure one more time that all contacts are well in place. Ensure that the glue is all dry before to continue. If you use an instant glue you should wait for a few hours anyway or you can refer on the instruction provided with the glue.

Lines.Text: be careful , this temporary repair is very fragile . do not apply any tension on the usb connector or with the usb cable .
before to continue , you should ensure one more time that the connectors are well in place to prevent from any short circuit . i recommend to :
first , plug and apply the electrical power on the logic board only do not plug the hard drive or even the usb connector . wait for a minute if everything goes well !
you should use a hold computer if any available to you . your computer should be protected from a short circuit here but we never know . please don't use your brand new computer !
when you are ready to go :
plug the hard drive with the usb/sata bridge throug the sata connector .
carefully plug the usb connector to the logic board and your computer .
apply electrical power on the hard drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Be careful, this temporary repair is very fragile. Do not apply any tension on the USB connector or with the USB cable. Before to continue, you should ensure one more time  that the connectors are well in place to prevent from any short circuit. I recommend to: First, plug and apply the electrical power on the logic board only do not plug the hard drive or even the USB connector. Wait for a minute if everything goes well! You should use a hold computer if any available to you. Your computer should be protected from a short circuit here but we never know. Please don't use your brand new computer! When you are ready to go: Plug the hard drive with the USB/SATA bridge throug the SATA connector. Carefully plug the USB connector to the logic board and your computer. Apply electrical power on the hard drive.

Lines.Text: if everything goes well your usb hard drive should be recognized by the computer and you should be able to backup your data .
do not re-use this wd external case . the connector repair is too fragile and can break again at any time . you may lose your data one more time !

Steps.Text_raw: If everything goes well your USB hard drive should be recognized by the computer and you should be able to backup your data. Do not re-use this WD external case. The connector repair is too fragile and can break again at any time. You may lose your data one more time!

Title: Logitech Webcam Pro 9000 USB Cable Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the two 8 mm phillips0 screws on the back cover .
the motherboard is attaching the two covers together , so don't separate them entirely just yet .
there is a button that loosens as the phillips screws are removed . don't be alarmed if it falls out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 8mm Phillips#0 screws on the back cover. The motherboard is attaching the two covers together, so don't separate them entirely just yet. There is a button that loosens as the Phillips screws are removed. Don't be alarmed if it falls out.

Lines.Text: remove the four 6 mm phillips0 screws connecting the motherboard and front cover .
'''do not '''detach the wire connecting the motherboard to the front cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 6mm Phillips#0 screws  connecting the motherboard and front cover. '''DO NOT '''detach the wire connecting the motherboard to the front cover.

Lines.Text: grasp the white wire connector on the back of the motherboard to remove the usb cable .
wiggle the connector back and forth to remove it from the socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the white wire connector on the back of the motherboard to remove the USB cable. Wiggle the connector back and forth to remove it from the socket.

Lines.Text: desolder the joint on the front of the motherboard to completely detach the usb cable .
follow this guide to learn how to properly solder and desolder your parts .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the joint on the front of the motherboard to completely detach the USB cable. Follow this [guide|750|link] to learn how to properly solder and desolder your parts.

Lines.Text: wedge the pointy end of the spudger between the sliver e-ring and usb attachment base to extract the e-ring .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the pointy end of the spudger between the sliver E-ring and USB attachment base to extract the E-ring.

Lines.Text: feed the now free end of the usb cable through the back cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Feed the now free end of the USB cable through the back cover.

Subject: USB Cable

wiggle the connector back and forth to remove the front cover from the motherboard .

Title: Dell 1908FPb monitor power supply Replacement

Lines.Text: here is a dell 1908 fpb lcd monitor without the stand .
remove the four ( 4 ) phillips screws from the back of the monitor .
the four ( 4 ) screws are m3x10 machine screws

Steps.Text_raw: Here is a Dell 1908FPb LCD monitor without the stand. Remove the four (4) Phillips screws from the back of the monitor. The four (4) screws are M3x10 machine screws

Lines.Text: start removing the front bezel . it is a snap fit and can be removed by inserting ones fingertips between the bezel and the lcd panel .
at this time just unsnap the bezel .
continue to unsnap the bezel all the way around , with the side of the control buttons being last .

Steps.Text_raw: Start removing the front bezel. It is a snap fit and can be removed by inserting ones fingertips between the bezel and the LCD panel. At this time just unsnap the bezel. Continue to unsnap the bezel all the way around, with the side of the control buttons being last.

Lines.Text: unsnap the bezel at the button bar last . do not try to lift the bezel up just yet .
the ribbon cable from the button bar still attaches the bezel to the monitor .
with the bezel loose , but still in place , turn the monitor upside down .
lift the back cover of the monitor off and place it aside .
if the back does not come off easy , make sure that the front bezel is all the way unsnapped .

Steps.Text_raw: Unsnap the bezel at the button bar last. Do not try to lift the bezel up just yet. The ribbon cable from the button bar still attaches the bezel to the monitor. With the bezel loose, but still in place, turn the monitor upside down. Lift the back cover of the monitor off and place it aside. If the back does not come off easy, make sure that the front bezel is all the way unsnapped.

Lines.Text: here is the connector for the cable from the front button bar .
unhook the cable by simply flipping the black clip away from the cable side .
removing the cable will allow for the removal of the front bezel

Steps.Text_raw: Here is the connector for the cable from the front button bar. Unhook the cable by simply flipping the black clip away from the cable side. Removing the cable will allow for the removal of the front bezel

Lines.Text: remove the front bezel and set it aside .
next disconnect the usb ports
this connector is a simple pull connector . pull on the connector itself , not the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the front bezel and set it aside. Next disconnect the USB ports This connector is a simple pull connector. Pull on the connector itself, not the wires.

Lines.Text: next is the cover for the ccfl cables .
lift the middle security tab ,
and slide the cover into the opposite direction of the imprinted arrow
the cover can now be removed . clearly visible are the connectors from the inverter to the ccfl's . this monitor obviously uses four ( 4 ) tubes .

Steps.Text_raw: Next is the cover for the CCFL cables. Lift the middle security tab, and slide the cover into the opposite direction of the imprinted arrow the cover can now be removed. Clearly visible are the connectors from the inverter to the CCFL's. This monitor obviously uses four (4) tubes.

Lines.Text: use a screwdriver ( or your fingernails ) to lift the security tab
and remove the wire from the connector .
remove all four ( 4 ) connectors

Steps.Text_raw: Use a screwdriver (or your fingernails) to lift the security tab and remove the wire from the connector. Remove all four (4) connectors

Lines.Text: remove the two phillips screws on the right side of the panel .
the screws are m2x5
remove the two phillips screws on the left side of the panel . they are identical to the right side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two Phillips screws on the right side of the panel. The screws are M2x5 Remove the two Phillips screws on the left side of the panel. They are identical to the right side.

Lines.Text: do not remove the metal case from the panel yet . slide it upward in the direction of the arrow , this will make the display data connector more accessible
to remove the connector , squeeze both metal clips together . remove the cable by gently pulling on the connector , not the cable .
the panel and the metal case can now be separated . the power supply and the video board are both contained on the inside of the metal case .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not remove the metal case from the panel yet. Slide it upward in the direction of the arrow, this will make the display data connector more accessible To remove the connector, squeeze both metal clips together. Remove the cable by gently pulling on the connector, not the cable. The panel and the metal case can now be separated. The power supply and the video board are both contained on the inside of the metal case.

Lines.Text: this is the power supply ,
and the video board .
the power supply is mounted with four phillips screws and two plastic standoffs
remove the four screws . three of those are brass colored m3x5 , the bottom left is nickel colored m4x5 and is the grounding screw .

Steps.Text_raw: This is the power supply, and the video board. The power supply is mounted with four Phillips screws and two plastic standoffs Remove the four screws. Three of those are brass colored M3x5, the bottom left is nickel colored M4x5 and is the grounding screw.

Lines.Text: to loosen the plastic standoffs , use a pair of needle nose pliers ( or similar ) and squeeze the tops to free the board . once it is free , flip it over onto the video board .

the cable from the power supply to the video board does not come off easy . to ensure that the connector will not break , it may be necessary to remove it from the video board . for that , remove the video board .
remove the three phillips screws . they are m3x5

Steps.Text_raw: To loosen the plastic standoffs, use a pair of needle nose pliers (or similar) and squeeze the tops to free the board. Once it is free, flip it over onto the video board. The cable from the power supply to the video board does not come off easy. To ensure that the connector will not break, it may be necessary to remove it from the video board. For that, remove the video board. Remove the three Phillips screws. They are M3x5

Lines.Text: remove the four standoff screws . two from the vga connector and two from the dvi connector .
use a pair of pliers or a 4 mm socket to remove those .
remove the video board from the metal casing . there will be easy access to the cable with the power supply and the video board turned over .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four standoff screws. Two from the VGA connector and two from the DVI connector. Use a pair of pliers or a 4mm socket to remove those. Remove the video board from the metal casing. There will be easy access to the cable with the power supply and the video board turned over.

Lines.Text: disconnect the power supply connector from the video board .
the power supply can now either be replaced or repaired .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the power supply connector from the video board. The power supply can now either be replaced or repaired.

Title: Acer AL2216W Power Supply Capacitor Replacement

Lines.Text: '''if you are uncertain about holding parts like power supplies , it is best to follow all provided warnings . a discharge tool should also be built and kept on hand . '''
'''the filter capacitor is the most dangerous and is the most prone to holding a residual charge . '''
unplug the monitor and leave it unplugged for '''24-48 hours''' . if you plan on doing a filter capacitor replacement , wait '''5-7 days''' .

Steps.Text_raw: '''If you are uncertain about holding parts like power supplies, it is best to follow all provided warnings. A [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/Constructing+a+Capacitor+Discharge+Tool/2177|capacitor discharge tool] should also be built and kept on hand.''' '''The filter capacitor is the most dangerous and is the most prone to holding a residual charge.''' Unplug the monitor and leave it unplugged for '''24-48 hours'''. If you plan on doing a filter capacitor replacement, wait '''5-7 days'''.

Lines.Text: this monitor never came with a hinge cap . if yours still has it , snap it off from the points marked in black .

remove the stand from the monitor . the 4 screws that have to be removed are marked . while you do not need to remove these screws in a specific order , it is better to remove the bottom screws first .

Steps.Text_raw: This monitor never came with a hinge cap. If yours still has it, snap it off from the points marked in black. Remove the stand from the monitor. The 4 screws that have to be removed are marked. While you do not need to remove these screws in a specific order, it is better to remove the bottom screws first.

Lines.Text: remove 4 fine threaded screws from the back of the monitor . there is no particular order you need to follow here , since the screws behind the panel are the same length and type .
this screw is unique and only goes in one place . set it aside separately from the other screws . the thread on this screw is different from the others .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 4 fine threaded screws from the back of the monitor. There is no particular order you need to follow here, since the screws behind the panel are the same length and type. This screw is unique and only goes in one place. Set it aside separately from the other screws. The thread on this screw is different from the others.

Lines.Text: if the monitor has never been serviced , additional force may be required to open it . however , using too much will do more harm then good .

on the bottom of the monitor , there are four slots to open the monitor . to release these clips , use a jimmy or flathead screwdriver . '''warning : use of a flathead screwdriver will damage the plastic . '''

Steps.Text_raw: If the monitor has never been serviced, additional force may be required to open it. However, using too much will do more harm then good. On the bottom of the monitor, there are four slots to open the monitor. To release these clips, use a Jimmy or flathead screwdriver. '''Warning: Use of a flathead screwdriver will damage the plastic.'''

Lines.Text: if you are having trouble doing this , a pry tool can help . this issue is more likely to come up a monitor that has never been opened .
with the monitor unclipped on the bottom , pull the sides of the monitor up . do this slowly to avoid damaging the plastics and potentially the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: If you are having trouble doing this, a pry tool can help. This issue is more likely to come up a monitor that has never been opened. With the monitor unclipped on the bottom, pull the sides of the monitor up. Do this slowly to avoid damaging the plastics and potentially the panel.

Lines.Text: after these screws are removed , you will expose the power supply .
with the back of the monitor off , remove the 2 screws on the iec power connector .

Steps.Text_raw: After these screws are removed, you will expose the power supply. With the back of the monitor off, remove the 2 screws on the IEC power connector.

Lines.Text: if you do not have a nut driver on hand , needlenoose plyers can also be used for this step .
remove the 4 screw pins for the video cables from the monitor . use a '''5 mm nut''' bit/driver to remove the screw pins from the power supply shield .

Steps.Text_raw: If you do not have a Nut driver on hand, needlenoose plyers can also be used for this step. Remove the 4 screw pins for the video cables from the monitor. Use a '''5mm Nut''' bit/driver to remove the screw pins from the power supply shield.

Lines.Text: disconnect the ccfl tube cables from the power supply board .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the CCFL tube cables from the power supply board.

Lines.Text: the board does not interfere with disassembly and does not need to be removed .
disconnect the flat flex cable that goes to the control board .

Steps.Text_raw: The board does not interfere with disassembly and does not need to be removed. Disconnect the flat flex cable that goes to the control board.

Lines.Text: remove the 2 bottom screws that hold the power supply shield to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 2 bottom screws that hold the power supply shield to the monitor.

Lines.Text: on the right side of the monitor , remove the remaining screws holding the upper shield in place .
lift the lower plate up while removing the power supply shield to remove it from the monitor . once this is done , you will have access to the power supply .

removal of the lower shield is not required to access the power supply . however , removing it will make disassembly easier . if you choose to remove it , unclip the plastic tabs that are used to keep it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: On the right side of the monitor, remove the remaining screws holding the upper shield in place. Lift the lower plate up while removing the power supply shield to remove it from the monitor. Once this is done, you will have access to the power supply. Removal of the lower shield is not required to access the power supply. However, removing it will make disassembly easier. If you choose to remove it, unclip the plastic tabs that are used to keep it in place.

Lines.Text: '''if you see bulged capacitors , treat them as if they have residual charge . this may mean discharging them as a safety precation . '''
'''in most cases , the filter capacitor does not need to be replaced . if you need to replace this capacitor , discharge it before replacement . '''
'''the black screw ( marked in blue ) is a ground screw . it does not go anywhere else . it is also important that you avoid losing this screw . '''
only lift the power supply board at a slight angle . lifting it any more then this could result in pin or video processing board damage .
if you cannot find the original capacitors , it is okay to substitute the original capacitors with larger replacements . it is not necessary to match the capacitors used by the factory .
this capacitor is only used on older power supply boards . if your board has this capacitor , replacement is recommended but is generally not required unless there is obvious bulging or leakage .

with the power supply shield removed from the monitor , identify the power supply . along with the capacitors previously mentioned , take note of any additional capacitors that were not mentioned ( ex : capacitor by the inverter coil ) .
remove the 4 screws from the power supply . once this is done , lift the power supply up at a slight angle to clear the mounting holes so you can remove the power supply from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: '''If you see bulged capacitors, treat them as if they have residual charge. This may mean discharging them as a safety precation.''' '''In most cases, the filter capacitor does NOT need to be replaced. If you need to replace this capacitor, discharge it before replacement.''' '''The black screw (marked in Blue) is a ground screw. It does not go anywhere else. It is also important that you avoid losing this screw.''' Only lift the power supply board at a slight angle. Lifting it any more then this could result in pin or video processing board damage. If you cannot find the original capacitors, it is okay to substitute the original capacitors with larger replacements. It is not necessary to match the capacitors used by the factory. This capacitor is only used on older power supply boards. If your board has this capacitor, replacement is recommended but is generally not required unless there is obvious bulging or leakage. With the power supply shield removed from the monitor, identify the power supply. Along with the capacitors previously mentioned, take note of any additional capacitors that were not mentioned (ex: Capacitor by the inverter coil). Remove the 4 screws from the power supply. Once this is done, lift the power supply up at a slight angle to clear the mounting holes so you can remove the power supply from the monitor.

Lines.Text: if you are unsure of the position of the capacitors , write the polarity on the solder mask as a reference using a permanent marker . if you install the capacitors incorrectly , they will explode when given power . '''note : ''' these marks will wear off when the capacitor is soldered in .

Steps.Text_raw: If you are unsure of the position of the capacitors, write the polarity on the solder mask as a reference using a permanent marker. If you install the capacitors incorrectly, they will explode when given power. '''Note:''' These marks will wear off when the capacitor is soldered in.

Lines.Text: if you do not have flux on hand , add fresh solder to the capacitor leads .
do not use a lot of flux . using too much will complicate board cleaning later .
to prepare the board for capacitor replacement , put fresh flux or solder on the capacitor leads . this will help ease the removal process .

Steps.Text_raw: If you do not have flux on hand, add fresh solder to the capacitor leads. Do not use a lot of flux. Using too much will complicate board cleaning later. To prepare the board for capacitor replacement, put fresh flux or solder on the capacitor leads. This will help ease the removal process.

Lines.Text: do not touch the soldering iron while removing the old caps ! if you do not have something like helping hands , hold the board at an angle .
when one or two capacitors fail , the rest are likely to fail . for this reason , it is best to replace them as a set at once .
if you do not know how to solder , refer to this guide : guide750

take the board out to a place you can solder the new caps on . to remove the capacitors and heat one leg up while the solder is melted . lift the leg up once the solder is melted . this should be done for both sides of each capacitor you are replacing .

with the capacitors removed from the power supply board , take your desoldering braid and clean the old solder up . the desoldering braid needs to be lifted with the soldering iron or it will stick to the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not touch the soldering iron while removing the old caps! If you do not have something like Helping Hands, hold the board at an angle. When one or two capacitors fail, the rest are likely to fail. For this reason, it is best to replace them as a set at once. If you do not know how to solder, refer to this guide: [guide|750] Take the board out to a place you can solder the new caps on. To remove the capacitors and heat one leg up while the solder is melted. Lift the leg up once the solder is melted. This should be done for both sides of each capacitor you are replacing. With the capacitors removed from the power supply board, take your desoldering braid and clean the old solder up. The desoldering braid needs to be lifted with the soldering iron or it will stick to the board.

Lines.Text: it is important to check polarity before soldering the capacitors in . if the capacitors are incorrectly installed , they will explode when given power .
install your new capacitors . put your new capacitors in the corresponding holes and bend the leads to keep them from falling out .

Steps.Text_raw: It is important to check polarity BEFORE soldering the capacitors in. If the capacitors are incorrectly installed, they will explode when given power. Install your new capacitors. Put your new capacitors in the corresponding holes and bend the leads to keep them from falling out.

Lines.Text: once you have verified the polarity , solder the new capacitors in .
once the capacitor is soldered , cut the excess lead . do this for each replaced capacitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have verified the polarity, solder the new capacitors in. Once the capacitor is soldered, cut the excess lead. Do this for each replaced capacitor.

Lines.Text: after verifying there are no cold solder joints , clean the board . the best way do this is to use high concentration rubbing alcohol ( 91 or better ) .

Steps.Text_raw: After verifying there are no cold solder joints, clean the board. The best way do this is to use high concentration rubbing alcohol (91% or better).

Lines.Text: put the monitor back together and test it by giving it a signal . if your monitor works , an image should be produced .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the monitor back together and test it by giving it a signal. If your monitor works, an image should be produced.

do not remove the back panel yet , just gently lift it to reveal the lvds cable

Lines.Text: once more , the four wires from the inverter need to be fished through am opening in the back

okay , now it's test time . combine the yellow on/off wire with the black vin wire . that will be the positive connection , the red wire is ground and will be the negative . this inverter is rated 12-24 volt , so an old laptop power brick will be perfect .

data line connected to a computer and power to the inverter shows a great image . the only issue with this right now is that the power to the monitor and the backlight are separate . i did not find a suitable power source on the original power board . also , the brightness can not be adjusted with this hook up .

Title: Disassembling Buffalo MiniStation External Hard Drive (Thunderbolt & USB 3)

Lines.Text: run one of the heavy duty spudger's between the plastic top and the aluminium case . begin from the usb connector end and slide to one of the sides ; leave this in place .
there are no clips ( in mine anyway ) holding that case to the base , it's just a double sided sponge sticker .

Steps.Text_raw: Run one of the heavy duty spudger's between the plastic top and the aluminium case. Begin from the USB connector end and slide to one of the sides; leave this in place. There are no clips (in mine anyway) holding that case to the base, it's just a double sided sponge sticker.

Lines.Text: granted it takes some force , but if you can get at least the left and the right side to pull away equally it will eventually give and come loose .

the result is a plastic case , housing the hard drive and electronics but thats easy to disassemble one you have removed the outer aluminum cover , as thats all it is . there is no other connection , even the holes for connectivity are just flush , they play no part in holding in the hard drive chassis .

in fact , if you like you can push the rubber feet through the aluminum case , as thats also part of the inner assembly . just remember not to squeeze the aluminum case too tightly or malformed it as this in effect will just grip the internals even more making it even more difficult to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Granted it takes some force, but if you can get at least the left and the right side to pull away equally it will eventually give and come loose. The result is a plastic case, housing the hard drive and electronics but thats easy to disassemble one you have removed the outer aluminum cover, as thats all it is. There is no other connection, even the holes for connectivity are just flush, they play no part in holding in the hard drive chassis. In fact, if you like you can push the rubber feet through the aluminum case, as thats also part of the inner assembly. Just remember not to squeeze the aluminum case too tightly or malformed it as this in effect will just grip the internals even more making it even more difficult to remove.

Lines.Text: once the outer aluminium case it away your left with 4 small phillips screws holding the actual drive in place , twi either side .
take a small phillips screwdriver and remove these four screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the outer aluminium case it away your left with 4 small philips screws holding the actual drive in place, twi either side. Take a small philips screw driver and remove these four screws.

Lines.Text: here comes the fiddly bit and if you ask me ; overkill engineering .
in total , there are 12 plastic clips retaining a cage holding the hard drive in place . 4 on the long sides and 2 on the short . using a spudger , run the plastic in from the connectivity side .

these clips are remarkably bendy , but they will break , mine did . the point to remember is if they do , it's honestly no hardship as the screws are really the guys that keep the drive in place anyway .

once the assembly comes away from the white plastic top there is a black plastic piece that separates too . you are left with a thin steel enclosure protecting both the drive and logic board electronics .

Steps.Text_raw: Here comes the fiddly bit and if you ask me; overkill engineering. In total, there are 12 plastic clips retaining a cage holding the hard drive in place. 4 on the long sides and 2 on the short. Using a spudger, run the plastic in from the connectivity side. These clips are remarkably bendy, but they will break, mine did. The point to remember is if they do, it's honestly no hardship as the screws are really the guys that keep the drive in place anyway. Once the assembly comes away from the white plastic top there is a black plastic piece that separates too. You are left with a thin steel enclosure protecting both the drive and logic board electronics.

Lines.Text: if you fold back the steel enclosure you reveal the logic board attached to the hard drive by two small phillips screws .
thats it , your at the logic board . reassembly is the reverse of these instructions .

a key point and lesson learnt for me here . when placing the enclosure back inside the white plastic case , start with the steel enclosure but leave off the black plastic retainer until the drive is nested in the white case with the connectivity ports realigned . if not and you try to place it back as it came out , the retainer will crease the steel .

Steps.Text_raw: IF you fold back the steel enclosure you reveal the logic board attached to the hard drive by two small philips screws. Thats it, your at the logic board. Reassembly is the reverse of these instructions. A key point and lesson learnt for me here. When placing the enclosure back inside the white plastic case, start with the steel enclosure but leave off the black plastic retainer until the drive is nested in the white case with the connectivity ports realigned. If not and you try to place it back as it came out, the retainer will crease the steel.

Subject: External Hard Drive (Thunderbolt & USB 3)

Lines.Text: if at any point you see glass that seems cracked or broken , handle with care . broken glass is sharp and can cause serious damage .
lift up the lid . then be sure to examine the glass . if there are any cracks or broken fragments handle with extreme care .

Steps.Text_raw: If at any point you see glass that seems cracked or broken, handle with care.  Broken glass is sharp and can cause serious damage. Lift up the lid. Then be sure to examine the glass. If there are any cracks or broken fragments handle with extreme care.

Lines.Text: locate the black and white hinges .
gently lift out the black and white hinges .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the black and white hinges. Gently lift out the black and white hinges.

Lines.Text: next , locate and remove the four 10 mm screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, locate and remove the four 10mm screws.

Lines.Text: gently , pry off the top plate , starting from the back of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently, pry off the top plate, starting from the back of the printer.

Lines.Text: after you have taken off the plate , check to make sure that there is no broken glass . if there is broken glass handle it with gloves . broken glass , if handled improperly , can cause physical injury .

Steps.Text_raw: After you have taken off the plate, check to make sure that there is no broken glass. If there is broken glass handle it with gloves. Broken glass, if handled improperly, can cause physical injury.

Lines.Text: two white tabs are located on the sides of the black component that houses the scanner light . pull these tabs out , and set them aside .
remove black component by gently pulling it up from the black scanner belt .

Steps.Text_raw: Two white tabs are located on the sides of the black component that houses the scanner light. Pull these tabs out, and set them aside. Remove black component by gently pulling it up from the black scanner belt.

Lines.Text: when removing the light , you should be careful not to snap the plastic . if you do snap the plastic , handle with gloves and use extreme precaution , because the plastic may be sharp .
the light is in the middle of the black component . remove the light by prying up one side with the plastic opening tool and working your way to the other side of the light .
you may hear a snapping sound as the light detaches from the component .
once you have taken out the damaged light , replace it with a new light .

Steps.Text_raw: When removing the light, you should be careful not to snap the plastic. If you do snap the plastic, handle with gloves and use extreme precaution, because the plastic may be sharp. The light is in the middle of the black component. Remove the light by prying up one side with the plastic opening tool and working your way to the other side of the light. You may hear a snapping sound as the light detaches from the component. Once you have taken out the damaged light, replace it with a new light.
