Title: AirPort Extreme A1521 Internal Structure Replacement

Lines.Text: using a metal spudger , gently pry the cover off the bottom of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a metal spudger, gently pry the cover off the bottom of the device.

Lines.Text: four black internal wires , three thin and one thick , are connected to the logic board : three by small end clips and one by a larger end clip . handle the clips gently ; they break easily .
to detach the small clips from the connectors , place the flat end of the plastic spudger underneath the clip and gently lever it '''away from the center of the device''' .
to detach the large clip from its connector , place the flat end of the spudger on the clip and lever it '''upward''' out of the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Four black internal wires, three thin and one thick, are connected to the logic board: three by small end clips and one by a larger end clip. Handle the clips gently; they break easily. To detach the small clips from the connectors, place the flat end of the plastic spudger underneath the clip and gently lever it '''away from the center of the device'''. To detach the large clip from its connector, place the flat end of the spudger on the clip and lever it '''upward''' out of the connector.

Lines.Text: using two fingers , pinch the power supply wire and gently lift it upward . move it away from the metal plate .
next , unscrew the four 3.3 mm t8 torx screws and remove the metal plate .

the metal plate fits snugly into the gap . to reassemble the device , push the rounded edge of the plate into the gap first . this will wedge the gap open so that you can fit the rest of the plate into its proper place .

Steps.Text_raw: Using two fingers, pinch the power supply wire and gently lift it upward. Move it away from the metal plate. Next, unscrew the four 3.3mm T8 Torx screws and remove the metal plate. The metal plate fits snugly into the gap. To reassemble the device, push the rounded edge of the plate into the gap first. This will wedge the gap open so that you can fit the rest of the plate into its proper place.

Lines.Text: remove the t8 torx screwdriver head and replace it with the 60 mm extension ; then , add the t9 torx head .
loosen , but '''do not remove''' the two screws at the bottom of the 1.2-inch wide gap in the middle of the internal structure .
these screws are spring-loaded and will stay in the device , even when loosened ; however , it is still possible for them to be fully removed . be careful to '''only partially loosen''' them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the T8 Torx screwdriver head and replace it with the 60 mm extension; then, add the T9 Torx head. Loosen, but '''do not remove''' the two screws at the bottom of the 1.2-inch wide gap in the middle of the internal structure. These screws are spring-loaded and will stay in the device, even when loosened; however, it is still possible for them to be fully removed. Be careful to '''only partially loosen''' them.

Lines.Text: using only your fingers , gently compress the internal structure and pull evenly upward to remove it from the white case .

when you put the internal structure back into the case , gently compress it , and lower it most of the way into the case . stop lowering it when the top port has just entered the case . now push the two sides of the internal structure outward against the sides of the case .
finish lowering the internal structure the rest of the way into the case . the ports should be lined up with the openings in the case and should be flush against the sides of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Using only your fingers, gently compress the internal structure and pull evenly upward to remove it from the white case. When you put the internal structure back into the case, gently compress it, and lower it most of the way into the case. Stop lowering it when the top port has just entered the case. Now push the two sides of the internal structure outward against the sides of the case. Finish lowering the internal structure the rest of the way into the case. The ports should be lined up with the openings in the case and should be flush against the sides of the case.

pull the button assembly out a few inches and unplug the colored cables .

Lines.Text: locate the several multi-wire connectors on the board .

these connect several parts of each board together and consist of several different colors of wires . there is also a zip-tie holding the two sets of wires together that you can cut if it is getting in your way .

the metal plate fits snugly into the gap . to reassemble the device , push the rounded edge of the plate into the gap first . this will wedge the gap open so that you can fit the rest of the plate into its proper place .

Steps.Text_raw: Using two fingers, pinch the power supply wire and gently lift it upward. Move it away from the metal plate. Next, unscrew the four 3.3mm T8 Torx screws and remove the metal plate. The metal plate fits snugly into the gap. To reassemble the device, push the rounded edge of the plate into the gap first. This will wedge the gap open so that you can fit the rest of the plate into its proper place.

Lines.Text: remove the t8 torx screwdriver head and replace it with the 60 mm extension ; then , add the t9 torx head .
loosen , but '''do not remove''' the two screws at the bottom of the 1.2-inch wide gap in the middle of the internal structure .
these screws are spring-loaded and will stay in the device , even when loosened ; however , it is still possible for them to be fully removed . be careful to '''only partially loosen''' them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the T8 Torx screwdriver head and replace it with the 60 mm extension; then, add the T9 Torx head. Loosen, but '''do not remove''' the two screws at the bottom of the 1.2-inch wide gap in the middle of the internal structure. These screws are spring-loaded and will stay in the device, even when loosened; however, it is still possible for them to be fully removed. Be careful to '''only partially loosen''' them.

Lines.Text: using only your fingers , gently compress the internal structure and pull evenly upward to remove it from the white case .

when you put the internal structure back into the case , gently compress it , and lower it most of the way into the case . stop lowering it when the top port has just entered the case . now push the two sides of the internal structure outward against the sides of the case .
finish lowering the internal structure the rest of the way into the case . the ports should be lined up with the openings in the case and should be flush against the sides of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Using only your fingers, gently compress the internal structure and pull evenly upward to remove it from the white case. When you put the internal structure back into the case, gently compress it, and lower it most of the way into the case. Stop lowering it when the top port has just entered the case. Now push the two sides of the internal structure outward against the sides of the case. Finish lowering the internal structure the rest of the way into the case. The ports should be lined up with the openings in the case and should be flush against the sides of the case.

Lines.Text: eight 10.25 mm t8 torx screws secure the heat sink to the logic board . unscrew all eight screws .
remove the heat sinks from the logic board .

Steps.Text_raw: Eight 10.25 mm T8 Torx screws secure the heat sink to the logic board. Unscrew all eight screws. Remove the heat sinks from the logic board.

Lines.Text: wedge the corner of the plastic spudger under one of the silver antenna clips . gently lever the tip of the spudger away from the logic board to detach the antenna clip .
repeat this for all six clips .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the corner of the plastic spudger under one of the silver antenna clips. Gently lever the tip of the spudger away from the logic board to detach the antenna clip. Repeat this for all six clips.

Lines.Text: to release the logic board , unscrew four 5.5 mm t8 torx screws from the internal structure .
remove the logic board from the internal structure .

Steps.Text_raw: To release the logic board, unscrew four 5.5 mm T8 Torx screws from the internal structure. Remove the logic board from the internal structure.

Subject: Logic Board

Title: NEC LCD1770NX Screen Replacement

Lines.Text: place the monitor face down on a clean , flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the monitor face down on a clean, flat surface.

Lines.Text: firmly remove the back panel of the stand by pulling it up and away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly remove the back panel of the stand by pulling it up and away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 6 mm phillips ph2 screws to detach the stand enclosure from the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 6mm Phillips PH2 screws to detach the stand enclosure from the stand.

Lines.Text: firmly grasp the stand enclosure with your hand and slide it to base of stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grasp the stand enclosure with your hand and slide it to base of stand.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 14.5 mm phillips ph2 screws holding the stand to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 14.5mm Phillips PH2 screws holding the stand to the monitor.

Lines.Text: lift the the stand straight up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the the stand straight up to remove it.

Lines.Text: place the monitor screen face up .
pull the frame off by placing your fingers on the inside of the frame and pulling out and up , the frame should snap off .
continue your way around the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the monitor screen face up. Pull the frame off by placing your fingers on the inside of the frame and pulling out and up, the frame should snap off. Continue your way around the screen.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 7 mm screws from the bottom of the button assembly .
do not pull the button assembly out too quickly or with too much force ! damage to the wires can occur .
pull the button assembly out a few inches and unplug the colored cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 7mm screws from the bottom of the button assembly. Do not pull the button assembly out too quickly or with too much force! Damage to the wires can occur. Pull the button assembly out a few inches and unplug the colored cables.

Lines.Text: unscrew the gold colored 7 mm phillips 000 screw holding the button assembly to the monitor .
remove the button assembly from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the gold colored 7mm Phillips PH000 screw holding the button assembly to the monitor. Remove the button assembly from the monitor.

Lines.Text: with the monitor face-down , unscrew the 5 7 mm phillips ph2 screws around the outside of the enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor face-down, unscrew the 5 7mm Phillips PH2 screws around the outside of the enclosure.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 2 14.5 mm phillips ph2 screws located on the raised center of the enclosure .
carefully pull the enclosure off the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 2 14.5mm Phillips PH2 screws located on the raised center of the enclosure. Carefully pull the enclosure off the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 10 5 mm phillips ph2 screws holding the metal casing to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 10 5mm Philips PH2 screws holding the metal casing to the monitor.

Lines.Text: pull the the metal casing off of the monitor to reveal the motherboards .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull  the the metal casing off of the monitor to reveal the motherboards.

Lines.Text: unplug the pink and light blue attachments from the side of the brown board by pulling up on the tabs and gently pulling the cord out .
label where the plugs go .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the pink and light blue attachments from the side of the brown board by pulling up on the tabs and gently pulling the cord out. Label where the plugs go.

Lines.Text: unplug the 3 multicolored cables from the blue board by gently wiggling them back and forth while pulling up .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the 3 multicolored cables from the blue board by gently wiggling them back and forth while pulling up.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 4 5 mm phillips ph2 screws on the sides of the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 4 5mm Phillips PH2 screws on the sides of the monitor.

Lines.Text: begin opening the enclosure by slowing pulling up on back panel of the monitor .
the enclosure should still be attached by a cable ; this cable is held down by tape . remove this tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin opening the enclosure by slowing pulling up on back panel of the monitor. The enclosure should still be attached by a cable; this cable is held down by tape. Remove this tape.

Lines.Text: unplug the cable from the screen . it is still attached by a fragile black belt .
use a spudger to break the black ceramic belt to free the screen from the rest , allowing it to be replaced .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the cable from the screen. It is still attached by a fragile black belt. Use a spudger to break the black ceramic belt to free the screen from the rest, allowing it to be replaced.

Subject: Screen

to detach the small clips from the connectors , place the flat end of the plastic spudger underneath the clip and gently lever it '''away from the center of the device''' .
to detach the large clip from its connector , place the flat end of the spudger on the clip and lever it '''upward''' out of the connector .

Lines.Text: using only your fingers , gently compress the internal structure and pull evenly upward to remove it from the white case .

when you put the internal structure back into the case , gently compress it , and lower it most of the way into the case . stop lowering it when the top port has just entered the case . now push the two sides of the internal structure outward against the sides of the case .

Lines.Text: rotate the internal structure so that the white ports are facing away from you .
three 8.2 mm t8 torx screws connect the fan to the internal structure . unscrew all three .
dont lose the rubber grommets underneath the screws . these prevent you from damaging the device while dismantling it .

Don’t lose the rubber grommets underneath the screws. These prevent you from damaging the device while dismantling it.

Lines.Text: remove the fan from the device .
remove the fan gently ; it fits snugly and could damage the device if pulled roughly .

Title: NEC LCD1770NX Capacitor Replacement

Lines.Text: place the monitor face down on a clean , flat surface .

Lines.Text: firmly remove the back panel of the stand by pulling it up and away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly remove the back panel of the stand by pulling it up and away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 6 mm phillips ph2 screws to detach the stand enclosure from the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 6mm Phillips PH2 screws to detach the stand enclosure from the stand.

Lines.Text: firmly grasp the stand enclosure with your hand and slide it to base of stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grasp the stand enclosure with your hand and slide it to base of stand.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 14.5 mm phillips ph2 screws holding the stand to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 14.5mm Phillips PH2 screws holding the stand to the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the gold colored 7 mm phillips 000 screw holding the button assembly to the monitor .
remove the button assembly from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the gold colored 7mm Phillips PH000 screw holding the button assembly to the monitor. Remove the button assembly from the monitor.

Lines.Text: with the monitor face-down , unscrew the 5 7 mm phillips ph2 screws around the outside of the enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor face-down, unscrew the 5 7mm Phillips PH2 screws around the outside of the enclosure.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 2 14.5 mm phillips ph2 screws located on the raised center of the enclosure .
carefully pull the enclosure off the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 2 14.5mm Phillips PH2 screws located on the raised center of the enclosure. Carefully pull the enclosure off the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 10 5 mm phillips ph2 screws holding the metal casing to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 10 5mm Philips PH2 screws holding the metal casing to the monitor.

Lines.Text: pull the the metal casing off of the monitor to reveal the motherboards .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull  the the metal casing off of the monitor to reveal the motherboards.

Lines.Text: make a note or use a pen to mark which plugs correspond to which colors . ( pink or blue )
remove the four plugs on the brown circuit board by pulling up on the tabs and wiggling them out . you could also use a spudger to help you lift little clips holding them in .

Steps.Text_raw: Make a note or use a pen to mark which plugs correspond to which colors. (Pink or Blue) Remove the four plugs on the brown circuit board by pulling up on the tabs and wiggling them out. You could also use a spudger to help you lift little clips holding them in.

Lines.Text: locate the several multi-wire connectors on the board .

these connect several parts of each board together and consist of several different colors of wires . there is also a zip-tie holding the two sets of wires together that you can cut if it is getting in your way .
disconnect the three plastic connectors from the blue colored boards by pulling them up while wiggling them .
some force is necessary , it may also help to use the large needle nose pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the several multi-wire connectors on the board. These connect several parts of each board together and consist of several different colors of wires. There is also a zip-tie holding the two sets of wires together that you can cut if it is getting in your way. Disconnect the three plastic connectors from the blue colored boards by pulling them up while wiggling them. Some force is necessary, it may also help to use the [product|IF145-024|Large Needle Nose Pliers].

Lines.Text: locate the large black power plug .
using a phillips 1 screwdriver , unscrew the two 8 mm colts holding the black tabs to the metal frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the large black power plug. Using a [product|IF145-021|Phillips #1 Screwdriver], unscrew the two 8mm colts holding the black tabs to the metal frame.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the gold colored 10 mm phillips screw located near the black power plug . it holds in a wire that connects to the power plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the gold colored 10mm Philips screw located near the black power plug. It holds in a wire that connects to the power plug.

Lines.Text: remove 5 8 mm phillip1 screws , with a phillips 1 screwdriver , located in various places on the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 5 8mm Phillip1 screws, with a Philips 1 screwdriver,  located in various places on the board.

Lines.Text: lift the brown power supply board off of the frame and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brown power supply board off of the frame and set it aside.

Lines.Text: find the faulty capacitor on the board .
bad capacitors can be identified by swelling or bursting at the top .

Steps.Text_raw: Find the faulty capacitor on the board. Bad capacitors can be identified by swelling or bursting at the top.

Lines.Text: flip the board over and find the corresponding solder joints . capacitors have two joints on the opposite side of the circuit board .
make sure you identify the correct solder joints ! we wouldn't want you to desolder the wrong component !
remember which direction the white stripe on the capacitor is facing ! orientation is important for a capacitor ! the markings on the board should also remind which way to face the capacitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the board over and find the corresponding solder joints. Capacitors have two joints on the opposite side of the circuit board. Make sure you identify the correct solder joints! We wouldn't want you to desolder the wrong component! Remember which direction the white stripe on the capacitor is facing! Orientation is important for a capacitor! The markings on the board should also remind which way to face the capacitor.

Lines.Text: use a desoldering braid to remove the solder from the two joints .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a [product|IF145-018|Soldering Station] and [product|IF145-079|Desoldering Braid] to remove the solder from the two joints.

Lines.Text: remove the capacitor from the board , you may need to straighten out the leads before you can take it out easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the capacitor from the board, you may need to straighten out the leads before you can take it out easily.

Subject: Capacitor

Lines.Text: firmly remove the back panel of the stand by pulling it up and away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly remove the back panel of the stand by pulling it up and away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 6 mm phillips ph2 screws to detach the stand enclosure from the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 6mm Phillips PH2 screws to detach the stand enclosure from the stand.

Lines.Text: firmly grasp the stand enclosure with your hand and slide it to base of stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grasp the stand enclosure with your hand and slide it to base of stand.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 14.5 mm phillips ph2 screws holding the stand to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 14.5mm Phillips PH2 screws holding the stand to the monitor.

Lines.Text: lift the the stand straight up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the the stand straight up to remove it.

Lines.Text: place the monitor screen face up .
pull the frame off by placing your fingers on the inside of the frame and pulling out and up , the frame should snap off .
continue your way around the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the monitor screen face up. Pull the frame off by placing your fingers on the inside of the frame and pulling out and up, the frame should snap off. Continue your way around the screen.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 7 mm screws from the bottom of the button assembly .
do not pull the button assembly out too quickly or with too much force ! damage to the wires can occur .
pull the button assembly out a few inches and unplug the colored cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 7mm screws from the bottom of the button assembly. Do not pull the button assembly out too quickly or with too much force! Damage to the wires can occur. Pull the button assembly out a few inches and unplug the colored cables.

Lines.Text: unscrew the gold colored 7 mm phillips 000 screw holding the button assembly to the monitor .
remove the button assembly from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the gold colored 7mm Phillips PH000 screw holding the button assembly to the monitor. Remove the button assembly from the monitor.

Lines.Text: with the monitor face-down , unscrew the 5 7 mm phillips ph2 screws around the outside of the enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: With the monitor face-down, unscrew the 5 7mm Phillips PH2 screws around the outside of the enclosure.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 2 14.5 mm phillips ph2 screws located on the raised center of the enclosure .
carefully pull the enclosure off the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 2 14.5mm Phillips PH2 screws located on the raised center of the enclosure. Carefully pull the enclosure off the monitor.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 10 5 mm phillips ph2 screws holding the metal casing to the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 10 5mm Philips PH2 screws holding the metal casing to the monitor.

Lines.Text: pull the the metal casing off of the monitor to reveal the motherboards .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull  the the metal casing off of the monitor to reveal the motherboards.

Lines.Text: make a note or use a pen to mark which plugs correspond to which colors . ( pink or blue )
remove the four plugs on the brown circuit board by pulling up on the tabs and wiggling them out . you could also use a spudger to help you lift little clips holding them in .

Steps.Text_raw: Make a note or use a pen to mark which plugs correspond to which colors. (Pink or Blue) Remove the four plugs on the brown circuit board by pulling up on the tabs and wiggling them out. You could also use a spudger to help you lift little clips holding them in.

Lines.Text: locate the several multi-wire connectors on the board .

these connect several parts of each board together and consist of several different colors of wires . there is also a zip-tie holding the two sets of wires together that you can cut if it is getting in your way .
disconnect the three plastic connectors from the blue colored boards by pulling them up while wiggling them .
some force is necessary , it may also help to use the large needle nose pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the several multi-wire connectors on the board. These connect several parts of each board together and consist of several different colors of wires. There is also a zip-tie holding the two sets of wires together that you can cut if it is getting in your way. Disconnect the three plastic connectors from the blue colored boards by pulling them up while wiggling them. Some force is necessary, it may also help to use the [product|IF145-024|Large Needle Nose Pliers].

Lines.Text: locate the large black power plug .
using a phillips 1 screwdriver , unscrew the two 8 mm colts holding the black tabs to the metal frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the large black power plug. Using a [product|IF145-021|Phillips #1 Screwdriver], unscrew the two 8mm colts holding the black tabs to the metal frame.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the gold colored 10 mm phillips screw located near the black power plug . it holds in a wire that connects to the power plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the gold colored 10mm Philips screw located near the black power plug. It holds in a wire that connects to the power plug.

Lines.Text: remove 5 8 mm phillip1 screws , with a phillips 1 screwdriver , located in various places on the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 5 8mm Phillip1 screws, with a Philips 1 screwdriver,  located in various places on the board.

Lines.Text: lift the brown power supply board off of the frame and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brown power supply board off of the frame and set it aside.

Subject: Power Circuit Board

Title: Epson Stylus C84 Exterior Panel Disassembly

Lines.Text: turn the printer around so the printer's front is facing away from you . then , remove the rounded black panel from the paper guide by lifting it straight up .
left panel
right panel
printer front
back panel

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer around so the printer's front is facing away from you.  Then, remove the rounded black panel from the paper guide by lifting it straight up. Left Panel Right Panel Printer Front Back Panel

Lines.Text: wedge the flat end of the spudger between the top of the parallel cover and the right panel , and gently pry the upper edge cover away . completely remove the cover by hand if necessary . the parallel and usb ports should be exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the flat end of the spudger between the top of the “Parallel” cover and the right panel, and gently pry the upper edge cover away.  Completely remove the cover by hand if necessary.  The Parallel and USB ports should be exposed.

Lines.Text: next , turn the printer so that it's laying on its front side .
locate the two plastic prongs on the bottom of the right panel .
gently pinch the prongs together and push them with your fingers through the clips until they are free .
do not use extreme force or bend the prongs in such a way that they break .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, turn the printer so that it's laying on its front side. Locate the two plastic prongs on the bottom of the right panel. Gently pinch the prongs together and push them with your fingers through the clips until they are free. Do not use extreme force or bend the prongs in such a way that they break.

Lines.Text: wedge a wide-tipped blue plastic opening tool inside the gray tab on the upper left-hand corner of the right panel , next to the arrow .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a wide-tipped blue plastic opening tool inside the gray tab on the upper left-hand corner of the right panel, next to the arrow.

Lines.Text: push in the gray tab until it becomes separated from the rest of the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Push in the gray tab until it becomes separated from the rest of the panel.

Lines.Text: set the printer back down on its bottom .
wedge one of the blue plastic separators between the back of the right panel and the rest of the printers housing to keep it separated .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the printer back down on its bottom. Wedge one of the blue plastic separators between the back of the right panel and the rest of the printer’s housing to keep it separated.

Lines.Text: turn the printer around so the front is facing toward you .
open the printers cover , place your hand inside the right panel and unclip it from the rest of the printer with your thumb and forefinger .
do not use extreme force when unclipping the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer around so the front is facing toward you. Open the printer’s cover, place your hand inside the right panel and unclip it from the rest of the printer with your thumb and forefinger. Do not use extreme force when unclipping the panel.

Lines.Text: wedge a blue plastic separator between the plastic housing and the rest of the right panel and push the panel out from the inside to free it .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a blue plastic separator between the plastic housing and the rest of the right panel and push the panel out from the inside to free it.

Lines.Text: gently push the panel to the right to separate it from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently push the panel to the right to separate it from the printer.

Lines.Text: use the flat end of the spudger to push the white button next to the ink cartridge carrier .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flat end of the spudger to push the white button next to the ink cartridge carrier.

Lines.Text: gently slide the ink cartridge carrier by hand to the left to gain access to the inside of the left panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently slide the ink cartridge carrier by hand to the left to gain access to the inside of the left panel.

Lines.Text: turn the printer so that it's on its front side again . now there are two sets of prongs to undo for the left panel . repeat step 2 for each set of prongs .
do not use extreme force when removing the prongs .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer so that it's on its front side again.  Now there are two sets of prongs to undo for the left panel.  Repeat step #2 for each set of prongs. Do not use extreme force when removing the prongs.

Lines.Text: wedge a blue plastic separator in the gray tab on the upper right-hand corner of the left panel .
unclip the panel from inside the printer , and remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a blue plastic separator in the gray tab on the upper right-hand corner of the left panel. Unclip the panel from inside the printer, and remove it.

Lines.Text: turn the printer around so the front is facing away . use three wide-tip blue plastic opening tools and place them inside the notches on the back panel of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer around so the front is facing away.  Use three wide-tip blue plastic opening tools and place them inside the notches on the back panel of the printer.

Lines.Text: push on each notch until the retaining tabs are separated from the back plastic cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Push on each notch until the retaining tabs are separated from the back plastic cover.

Lines.Text: turn the printer around so the front is facing you and gently push up on each tab of the front plastic panel , above the arrows . make sure the prongs are detached from the clips .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer around so the front is facing you and gently push up on each tab of the front plastic panel, above the arrows.  Make sure the prongs are detached from the clips.

Lines.Text: gently pull the plastic housing upward to remove the back panel and reveal the inner components of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the plastic housing upward to remove the back panel and reveal the inner components of the printer.

Subject: Exterior Panel Disassembly

Title: Disassembling Visioneer OneTouch 7400 USB Outer Case

Lines.Text: on the bottom of the scanner , remove the screw at the top left side .

Steps.Text_raw: On the bottom of the scanner, remove the screw at the top left side.

Lines.Text: remove the rubber foot pad opposite the screw hole to expose a second screw hole .
remove the screw beneath the foot-pad .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rubber foot pad opposite the screw hole to expose a second screw hole. Remove the screw beneath the foot-pad.

Lines.Text: rotate the scanner so the screw hole is located on the top left hand side .
place the plastic opening tool between the top casement and bottom casement of scanner with the hook facing up .
gently pry the two casements apart beginning above the screw hole and working your way around .

note that the top and bottom casings are held together by a series of 6 tabs . there is one tab on each of the long sides of the scanner approximately 6 inches in from the corners . there are two tabs on each of the short sides of the scanner approximately 2.3 inches in from the corners . use the spudger to unhook the tab from the top casement .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the scanner so the screw hole is located on the top left hand side. Place the plastic opening tool between the top casement and bottom casement of scanner with the hook facing up. Gently pry the two casements apart beginning above the screw hole and working your way around. Note that the top and bottom casings are held together by a series of 6 tabs. There is one tab on each of the long sides of the scanner approximately 6 inches in from the corners. There are two tabs on each of the short sides of the scanner approximately 2.3 inches in from the corners.  Use the spudger to unhook the tab from the top casement.

Lines.Text: separate the two casement pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the two casement pieces.

Subject: Outer Case

Lines.Text: with consistent pressure on the glass , move your fingers down the sides until the glass is no longer stuck to the double-sided tape .

on the right hand side , the motherboard is attached to the ribbon . do not pull too hard .

gently pull the ribbon out of its bed .

be careful . the spring will fly .

the spool is a loose piece ; don't lose it .

lift off the metal plate if it does not come away with the screw .

the ribbon goes under the metal bar . gently pull the ribbon under the metal bar to remove it .

Lines.Text: lift the sensor bar from the scanner bed .

to finish removing the ribbon from the sensor bar , use the spudger to pry away the clear plastic piece securing the ribbon to the bar . detach the ribbon from the sensor bar by peeling it away from the double-sided tape .

Lines.Text: slowly pull the ribbon end straight out to remove it from the sensor bar .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly pull the ribbon end straight out to remove it from the sensor bar.

Title: Imation Superdisk USB Drive Plastic Housing Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the device over so the bottom is facing up .
you will know it is the bottom because there will be six silver screws visible .

Lines.Text: remove the usb converter device by gently pulling it out .
do not pull the converter device out by the cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the USB converter device by gently pulling it out. Do not pull the converter device out by the cord.

Lines.Text: remove the six silver screws using a small phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six silver screws using a small Phillips head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: slide the bottom plastic panel of the shell down so it is free of the end cap and the top panel .
lift panel free of device .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the bottom plastic panel of the shell down so it is free of the end cap and the top panel. Lift panel free of device.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic end cap by sliding it forward , freeing from the rest of the device .
you can identify the end cap by noting the label superdisk drive above where you would insert a floppy disk .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic end cap by sliding it forward, freeing from the rest of the device. You can identify the end cap by noting the label "SuperDisk Drive" above where you would insert a floppy disk.

Lines.Text: slide the metal housing out of the plastic shell .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the metal housing out of the plastic shell.

Title: NeatDesk™ Desktop Scanner Circuit Board Repair

Lines.Text: verify power is being supplied
using a multimeter on ac setting , check that wall outlet is 120 vac
''if not , then switch to another source . otherwise proceed to next step . ''
using a multimeter on dc setting , check that scanner wall power pack is providing 24 vdc

''if not , then locate and obtain another ( compatible ) power pack . '' unit should be obtained from manufacturer and if not available then the following is the rated specification at time of this guide ( input100-240 vac 1.0 a max 50-60 hz output24 vdc 0.75 a 18 w ) center positive polarity
high voltage present at wall outlet , be sure to pay attention when checking voltage with multimeter .
use caution when checking scanner wall power pack , so not to short out contacts .

Steps.Text_raw: Verify Power is being supplied Using a multimeter on AC setting, check that wall outlet is 120 Vac ''If not, then switch to another source. otherwise proceed to next step.'' Using a multimeter on DC setting, check that scanner wall power pack is providing 24 Vdc ''If not, then locate and obtain another ( Compatible ) power pack.'' Unit should be obtained from manufacturer and if not available then the following is the rated specification at time of this guide ( Input=100-240Vac 1.0A Max 50-60Hz Output=24Vdc 0.75A 18W ) Center Positive Polarity High voltage present at wall outlet, be sure to pay attention when checking voltage with multimeter. Use caution when checking scanner wall power pack, so not to short out contacts.

Lines.Text: unscrew bottom access cover .
use a 2 phillips screwdriver and carefully remove four ( 4 ) screws from bottom access panel .
''it may be advisable to have a magnet handy , in the event the screws are difficult to extract due to the recessed mounting hole . ''
open bottom access cover .
use a spudger or suction cup to pry open the access cover . pay attention to provided image and be sure to tilt cover as shown to make removal easy .
''circuit board is mounted to other side of access cover and wiring must be disconnected before access cover is completely removed . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew bottom access cover. Use a #2 Phillips Screwdriver and carefully remove Four (4) screws from bottom access panel. ''It may be advisable to have a magnet handy, in the event the screws are difficult to extract due to the recessed mounting hole.'' Open bottom access cover. Use a Spudger or Suction Cup to pry open the access cover. Pay attention to provided image and be sure to tilt cover as shown to make removal easy. ''Circuit board is mounted to other side of access cover and wiring must be disconnected before access cover is completely removed.''

Lines.Text: disconnect screwed on wires from circuit board .
use a 2 phillips screwdriver and carefully remove two ( 2 ) screws that are securing ground wires to circuit board shield/mounting holes . see image for locations .
''use caution so not to drop or loose screws as they are removed . it is advised to have a magnet nearby and cover areas where screws may fall into . ''
disconnect plugged in connectors and flat ribbon cable .
use a suitable pair of pliers , such as small needle nose and carefully grasp connectors then gently unplug in the sequence shown for easy access .
''use caution when handling flat ribbon cable to avoid cuts , bends or any damage to conductors . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect screwed on wires from circuit board. Use a #2 Phillips Screwdriver and carefully remove Two (2) screws that are securing ground wires to circuit board shield/mounting holes. See image for locations. ''Use caution so not to drop or loose screws as they are removed. It is advised to have a magnet nearby and cover areas where screws may fall into.'' Disconnect plugged in connectors and flat ribbon cable. Use a suitable pair of pliers, such as small needle nose and carefully grasp connectors then gently unplug in the sequence shown for easy access. ''Use caution when handling flat ribbon cable to avoid cuts, bends or any damage to conductors.''

Lines.Text: use a 2 phillips screwdriver and carefully remove four ( 4 ) screws from shield / circuit board mounting holes .
''be sure to exercise esd ( electro static discharge ) best practices . ''
''use an anti-static mat and wrist strap to avoid damaging sensitive electronic components of circuit board . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Use a #2 Phillips Screwdriver and carefully remove Four (4) screws from shield / circuit board mounting holes. ''Be sure to exercise ESD ( Electro Static Discharge ) best practices.'' ''Use an anti-static mat and wrist strap to avoid damaging sensitive electronic components of circuit board.''

Lines.Text: carefully examine circuit board and all components , closely using good lighting and a magnifier .
''look for defects such as : cracks , burn marks , signs of corrosion , swollen components , unusual looking solder joints . . . ''
see pictures for example of solder joint defect from this project .
''note that the defective solder joints were likely a factory flaw that eventually gave out or were caused by strain , due to too short of wiring as visible by connector angle . ''
''see step 3 for likely cause of strain on connector that resulted in fatigued solder joints . ( ref : exhibit - 1 ) ''

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully examine circuit board and all components, closely using good lighting and a magnifier. ''Look for defects such as: Cracks, Burn Marks, Signs of Corrosion, Swollen Components, Unusual Looking Solder Joints ...'' See pictures for example of Solder Joint Defect from this project. ''Note that the defective solder joints were likely a factory flaw that eventually gave out or were caused by strain, due to too short of wiring as visible by connector angle. '' ''See Step 3 for likely cause of strain on connector that resulted in fatigued solder joints. ( Ref: Exhibit - 1 )''

Lines.Text: verify the power path is complete by using a multimeter on continuity mode and check point to point starting at the incoming power connector to the next available point . continue as needed to verify there are no breaks in the circuit path .
''being this example was of a power related problem , it is advisable to check there are not any other issues that could disturb power flow . ''
''in this example it was found that not only the solder joints had defects , but the fuse was open ( likely due to power surge from poor connections ) ''

Steps.Text_raw: Verify the power path is complete by using a multimeter on continuity mode and check "point to point" starting at the incoming power connector to the next available point. Continue as needed to verify there are no breaks in the circuit path. ''Being this example was of a power related problem, it is advisable to check there are not any other issues that could disturb power flow.'' ''In this example it was found that not only the solder joints had defects, but the fuse was open ( Likely due to power surge from poor connections )''

Lines.Text: determine the type of repair needed
in this example , basic soldering was required . however , it may be possible other forms of repair are necessary for your particular application .
below are references to other guides that detail general forms of repair :
guide
electronics water damageelectronics water damage guide
guide
''many thanks for the contribution of others that developed these additional guides''

Steps.Text_raw: Determine the type of repair needed In this example, basic soldering was required. However, it may be possible other forms of repair are necessary for your particular application. Below are references to other guides that detail general forms of repair: [guide|750|Soldering and Desoldering Guide] [[Electronics Water Damage|Electronics Water Damage Guide]] [guide|6190|Electronics Skills 101 Guide] ''Many thanks for the contribution of others that developed these additional guides''

Lines.Text: look for any possible mistakes you may have made or other issues .
common mistakes can take place and could include : connectors or wiring in the worng place .
''look at these images and note how a wire can easily be pinched or damaged , resulting in a new problem . do you see the red wire in a mounting hole path ? ''

Steps.Text_raw: Look for any possible mistakes you may have made or other issues. Common mistakes can take place and could include: Connectors or Wiring in the "Worng" place. ''Look at these images and note how a wire can easily be pinched or damaged, resulting in a New Problem. Do you see the Red Wire in a mounting hole path ?''

Lines.Text: follow applicable sections of this guide in reverse as needed .
''note : did you take pictures during your disassembly ? ''

''taking pictures is always a good idea , as it helps you remember how something goes back together . . . . . however , there is also a much more important reason , and that is so you can create a guide and post it on ifixit ; - ) ''

Steps.Text_raw: Follow applicable sections of this guide in reverse as needed. ''NOTE: Did you take pictures during your disassembly ?'' ''Taking pictures is always a good idea, as it helps you remember how something goes back together ..... However, there is also a much more important reason, and that is so you can create a guide and post it on iFixit ;-) ''

Lines.Text: the moment you have been waiting for .
make sure your ducks are in a row
''be patient , don't rush , take any necessary precautions to avoid further damage of unit or associated devices . ''
start by keeping the unit isolated from other devices to prevent spreading damage in the event retest fails .
perform a systematic startup , by making sure the power switch is off , power connector is plugged into back of unit , then plugging in wall power pack into wall receptacle .
be prepared to disconnect power quickly by having a helper ready to unplug the wall power pack .
turn unit on and carefully observe if there is any sign of life , along with any issues such as electrical arching noise , smoke , smell . . .

Steps.Text_raw: The moment you have been waiting for. Make sure your "Ducks are in a row" ''Be patient, don't rush, take any necessary precautions to avoid further damage of unit or associated devices.'' Start by keeping the unit isolated from other devices to prevent spreading damage in the event retest fails. Perform a systematic startup, by making sure the power switch is off, power connector is plugged into back of unit, then plugging in wall power pack into wall receptacle. Be prepared to disconnect power quickly by having a helper ready to unplug the wall power pack. Turn unit on and carefully observe if there is any sign of life, along with any issues such as electrical arching noise, smoke, smell ...

Lines.Text: if you have been able to repair your unit then give thanks where it is due .
''share your wisdom and experience with others by developing a guide of your own using the following link : ''
( start a new page )

Steps.Text_raw: If you have been able to repair your unit then give thanks where it is due. ''Share your wisdom and experience with others by developing a guide of your own using the following link:'' [http://www.ifixit.com/New|iFixit ( Start a new page )]

Title: HP Deskjet D1660 Springs Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the back two 14.0 mm torx 10 screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the back two 14.0 mm Torx #10 screws.

Lines.Text: lay the printer on its back .
grab the paper tray by its right side and pull it to the left and up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the printer on its back. Grab the paper tray by its right side and pull it to the left and up.

Lines.Text: open the frontal access panel by lifting it from the top .
similar to the paper tray , grab it from the right side and pull it to the left and up .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the frontal access panel by lifting it from the top. Similar to the paper tray, grab it from the right side and pull it to the left and up.

Lines.Text: take out the two frontal 14.0 mm torx 10 screws .
carefully lift the frontal cover .
don't lift it up aggressively . a strip will be attached to it .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the two frontal 14.0 mm Torx #10 screws. Carefully lift the frontal cover. Don't lift it up aggressively. A strip will be attached to it.

Lines.Text: remove the five 13.0 mm torx 10 screws found on top of the frame .
remove the four 9.0 mm torx 10 smaller screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 13.0 mm Torx #10 screws found on top of the frame. Remove the four 9.0 mm Torx #10 smaller screws.

Lines.Text: lift the rail carefully as a strip and motor will be connected to the bottom part of the printer .
now detach the white strip and wires by gently lifting them up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the rail carefully as a strip and motor will be connected to the bottom part of the printer. Now detach the white strip and wires by gently lifting them up.

Lines.Text: locate the springs . they will be on the side of the metal frame .
using the tweezers , grab the loop of the spring that is connected to the bar .
remove the spring by lifting the loop .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the springs. They will be on the side of the metal frame. Using the tweezers, grab the loop of the spring that is connected to the bar. Remove the spring by lifting the loop.

Subject: Springs

Title: HP PSC 2355 Button Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: grasp the scanner lid cover from the front of the device and lift lid all the way up until it stands on its own .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the scanner lid cover from the front of the device and lift lid all the way up until it stands on its own.

Lines.Text: with two hands , grasp the lid on both sides near the hinges and lift straight up to release the lid from each hinge .

Steps.Text_raw: With two hands, grasp the lid on both sides near the hinges and lift straight up to release the lid from each hinge.

Lines.Text: once you have removed the scanner lid , locate the finger notch on inside the top left half of the bezel ( control ) panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have removed the scanner lid, locate the finger notch on inside the top left half of the bezel (control) panel.

Lines.Text: place your index finger in the notch and lift up to unsnap the panel .
set panel cover aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Place your index finger in the notch and lift up to unsnap the panel. Set panel cover aside.

Lines.Text: use a t9 torx screwdriver to remove the 0.9 cm screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T9 torx screwdriver to remove the 0.9 cm screw.

Lines.Text: from the front of the printer , remove the button panel by pulling it towards you while slightly lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: From the front of the printer, remove the button panel by pulling it towards you while slightly lifting it up.

Lines.Text: disconnect the white ribbon cable by grasping it between your thumb and index finger .
gently pull to release the ribbon from the green circuit board

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the white ribbon cable by grasping it between your thumb and index finger. Gently pull to release the ribbon from the green circuit board

Lines.Text: next , use the flat end of a spudger to pry loose the flat ribbon computer cable by the plastic connection end and carefully separate it from the prongs on the button panel .
the entire button panel should now be completely disconnected from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, use the flat end of a spudger to pry loose the flat ribbon computer cable by the plastic connection end and carefully separate it from the prongs on the button panel. The entire button  panel should now be completely disconnected from the printer.

Lines.Text: lay the panel on a flat surface with the backside facing up .
using a t9 torx screwdriver , remove all six 0.7 cm silver screws from the off-white plastic panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the panel on a flat surface with the backside facing up. Using a T9 torx screwdriver, remove all six 0.7 cm silver screws from the off-white plastic panel.

Lines.Text: gently lift the button panel off the plastic backing with rubber button mat .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the button panel off the plastic backing with rubber button mat.

Lines.Text: be careful not to lift out and lose the two clear plastic panel separators ( these are not fastened to the panel but can easily fall out of the panel if tilted ) . these are two small plastic parts that sit near the top right and left portions of the panel .
insert your new button panel . to reassemble your printer , follow these instructions in reverse order .

Steps.Text_raw: Be careful not to lift out and lose the two clear plastic panel separators (these are not fastened to the panel but can easily fall out of the panel if tilted). These are two small plastic parts that sit near the top right and left portions of the panel. Insert your new button panel. To reassemble your printer, follow these instructions in reverse order.

Subject: Button Panel

Title: HP PSC 2355 Scanner Glass Replacement

Lines.Text: grasp the scanner lid cover from the front of the device and lift lid all the way up until it stands on its own .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the scanner lid cover from the front of the device and lift lid all the way up until it stands on its own.

Lines.Text: with two hands , grasp the lid on both sides near the hinges and lift straight up to release the lid from each hinge .

Steps.Text_raw: With two hands, grasp the lid on both sides near the hinges and lift straight up to release the lid from each hinge.

Lines.Text: once you have removed the scanner lid , locate the finger notch on the inside top left half of the bezel ( control ) panel cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have removed the scanner lid, locate the finger notch on the inside top left half of the bezel (control) panel cover.

Lines.Text: place your index finger in the notch and lift up to unsnap the panel .
set panel cover aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Place your index finger in the notch and lift up to unsnap the panel. Set panel cover aside.

Lines.Text: use a t9 torx screwdriver to remove the 0.9 cm screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T9 torx screwdriver to remove the 0.9 cm screw.

Lines.Text: from the front of the printer , remove the button panel by pulling it towards you while slightly lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: From the front of the printer, remove the button panel by pulling it towards you while slightly lifting it up.

Lines.Text: disconnect the white ribbon cable by grasping it between your thumb and forefinger .
gently pull to release the ribbon from the green circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the white ribbon cable by grasping it between your thumb and forefinger. Gently pull to release the ribbon from the green circuit board.

Lines.Text: next , use a spudger to pry loose the flat ribbon computer cable by the plastic connection end and carefully separate it from the prongs on the button panel .
now the whole button should be completely disconnected from the printer .
set button panel aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, use a spudger to pry loose the flat ribbon computer cable by the plastic connection end and carefully separate it from the prongs on the button panel. Now the whole button should be completely disconnected from the printer. Set button panel aside.

Lines.Text: using the t9 torx screwdriver , unscrew the seven 0.9 cm black screws on the top plastic frame around the glass .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the T9 torx screwdriver, unscrew the seven 0.9 cm black screws on the top plastic frame around the glass.

Lines.Text: from the back of the printer , locate the two large plastic tabs as shown .
with your index fingers underneath each tab , gently and simultaneously pull the tabs towards you and upwards to release the tabs from the plastic clasps behind them .
once these tabs are released , you should be able to remove the whole plastic frame that holds the glass .

Steps.Text_raw: From the back of the printer, locate the two large plastic tabs as shown. With your index fingers underneath each tab, gently and simultaneously pull the tabs towards you  and upwards to release the tabs from the plastic clasps behind them. Once these tabs are released, you should be able to remove the whole plastic frame that holds the glass.

Lines.Text: gently lift the glass/plastic bed from the edge on the side opposite of the button/control panel section .
as shown in the second image , gently lift the glass pane up so that it is above the plastic tab that holds it into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the glass/plastic bed from the edge on the side opposite of the button/control panel section. As shown in the second image, gently lift the glass pane up so that it is above the plastic tab that holds it into place.

Lines.Text: proceed to slide the glass pane out and over the plastic tab to remove it completely from the plastic bed .
replace the glass with your new glass pane . to fully reassemble the printer , follow these instructions in reverse order .

Steps.Text_raw: Proceed to slide the glass pane out and over the plastic tab to remove it completely from the plastic bed. Replace the glass with your new glass pane. To fully reassemble the printer, follow these instructions in reverse order.

Title: Linksys E1200 Router Power Adapter Replacement

Lines.Text: take note of the wire labeling . each wire has either a stripe or text . when lining up the wires after cutting , it is critical that you keep stripe with stripe , and text with text . failure to do so will result in damage to the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Take note of the wire labeling. Each wire has either a Stripe or Text. When lining up the wires after cutting, it is critical that you keep Stripe with Stripe, and Text with Text. Failure to do so will result in damage to the device.

Lines.Text: begin by cutting the wire .
strip the wire .
seperate the two halves of each wire , and split the two with a utility knife . don't go too far ! you will need the extra space to overlay heatshrink before the soldering is down .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by cutting the wire. Strip the wire. Seperate the two halves of each wire, and split the two with a utility knife. Don't go too far! You will need the extra space to overlay HeatShrink before the soldering is down.

Lines.Text: twist the individual strands together to make a single pigtail .
overlay with the corresponding wire ( step 1 ) , and twist together , but not before sliding on the heatshrink .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the individual strands together to make a single pigtail. Overlay with the corresponding wire (Step 1), and twist together, but not before sliding on the HeatShrink.

Lines.Text: pull the wire seperation back far enough on at least one side to permit heat-shrink to slip over the wire insulation .
now the soldering . place the pre-heated iron on the wires on a heat-resistant , flame proof surface . make sure that the heat-shrink is nowhere near the soldering iron .
let it heat for a few sconds ( copper is an excellent conductor of heat ) , then touch the end of the solder to the wire . if fully heated , it should flow easily into the joint .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wire seperation back far enough on at least one side to permit Heat-Shrink to slip over the wire insulation. Now the soldering. Place the pre-heated iron on the wires on a heat-resistant, flame proof surface. Make sure that the Heat-Shrink is nowhere near the soldering iron. Let it heat for a few sconds (copper is an excellent conductor of heat), then touch the end of the solder to the wire. If fully heated, it should flow easily into the joint.

Lines.Text: to protect the solder job , you will need to slide the shrink wrap over the patch , then heat it so that it grips the wire securely . you can use a heat gun or the flat side of a soldering iron . be careful to not let it burn !
repeat for the other wire . repeat for the overall sheath .

Steps.Text_raw: To protect the solder job, you will need to slide the shrink wrap over the patch, then heat it so that it grips the wire securely. You can use a heat gun or the flat side of a soldering iron. Be careful to not let it burn! Repeat for the other wire. Repeat for the overall sheath.

Subject: Power Adapter

Title: Linksys e1200 Wireless Router Ethernet Port Replacement

Lines.Text: the pc board is loosely attached to the plastic base . note the micro-soldered terminals on the ethernet ports . these are very small and require significant expertise to desolder and replace .

Steps.Text_raw: The PC board is loosely attached to the plastic base. Note the micro-soldered terminals on the Ethernet ports. These are very small and require significant expertise to desolder and replace.

Lines.Text: do to modern manufacturing , you will need to cover the area in solder flux ; it is messy , so be careful .
prep your desoldering braid by pulling it into a shape that will allow it to contact the solder on the baord itself .
touch the soldering iron to the top of the contact after it has heated sufficiently ; the flux will melt , as will the solder , and both should flow into the desoldering braid .

Steps.Text_raw: Do to modern manufacturing, you will need to cover the area in solder flux; it is messy, so be careful. Prep your desoldering braid by pulling it into a shape that will allow it to contact the solder on the baord itself. Touch the soldering iron to the top of the contact after it has heated sufficiently; the flux will melt, as will the solder, and both should flow into the desoldering braid.

Lines.Text: after removing all of the solder from each terminal , you may try pushing out the ethernet port . if it won't go , you need to remove more solder .
if neccessary , you will need to make a custom tool to touch all of the contacts at once . this one is made of bent copper wire and can replace the tip on a pencil-style soldering iron .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing all of the solder from each terminal, you may try pushing out the ethernet port. If it won't go, you need to remove more solder. If neccessary, you will need to make a custom tool to touch all of the contacts at once. This one is made of bent copper wire and can replace the tip on a pencil-style soldering iron.

Lines.Text: once the ethernet port is removed , you may replace it ( or anything else you had to remove ) , and solder it to the circuit board .
you can find many fine soldering guides online , here is a reccommended one : remember to add flux to the joint prior to soldering .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the ethernet port is removed, you may replace it (or anything else you had to remove), and solder it to the circuit board. You can find many fine soldering guides online, here is a reccommended one: http://www.wikihow.com/Solder-%28Electronics%29 Remember to add flux to the joint prior to soldering.

Subject: Ethernet Port

Title: Disassembling the Linksys E1200

Lines.Text: opening the device will void your warranty .
anti-slip pads cover three screws that hold the device together . pry off the pads to access the screws .
remove the three screws .
save the pads for reassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Opening the device will void your warranty. Anti-slip pads cover three screws that hold the device together.  Pry off the pads to access the screws. Remove the three screws. Save the pads for reassembly.

Lines.Text: once the three screws are removed , the device is ready for disassembly .
push up on the rear flap while holding down on the rest of the body . this will open a small gap .
insert the plastic opening tool in the gap and begin prying on the corner .
continue to pry around the body of the case . separate both sides of the case with this method .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the three screws are removed, the device is ready for disassembly. Push up on the rear flap while holding down on the rest of the body. This will open a small gap. Insert the plastic opening tool in the gap and begin prying on the corner. Continue to pry around the body of the case. Separate both sides of the case with this method.

Lines.Text: once the sides are released , the front of the cover can be removed .
use a plastic opening tool to separate the front of the cover from the body .
it is helpful to use a different plastic opening tool as a wedge on the sides to prevent them from snapping back together .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the sides are released, the front of the cover can be removed. Use a plastic opening tool to separate the front of the cover from the body. It is helpful to use a different plastic opening tool as a wedge on the sides to prevent them from snapping back together.

Lines.Text: the cover can now be removed .
to repair anything on the circuit board , use the plastic opening tool to pull back on the two tabs holding it down .
use caution when pulling on the tabs as they are stiff and easy to break .
keep the tabs if they snap off . the tabs can be reattached with glue when reassembling the device .

Steps.Text_raw: The cover can now be removed. To repair anything on the circuit board, use the plastic opening tool to pull back on the two tabs holding it down. Use caution when pulling on the tabs as they are stiff and easy to break. Keep the tabs if they snap off.  The tabs can be reattached with glue when reassembling the device.

Lines.Text: if the antenna needs to be disconnected , desolder the connection and reattach it prior to reassembly .
if the ethernet ports , power port , or reset button are damaged , the large solder points allow you to replace them .
many components on the board cannot be serviced . these components were attached by a machine and cannot be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: If the antenna needs to be disconnected, desolder the connection and reattach it prior to reassembly. If the ethernet ports, power port, or reset button are damaged, the large solder points allow you to replace them. Many components on the board cannot be serviced. These components were attached by a machine and cannot be removed.
