Title: Repairing Billion Router BiPAC 7404VNPX VOIP

Lines.Text: turning the router over you find 4 rubber feet hiding 4 phillips head screws .
remove the screws and turn the router back upright .
the top of the case should now lift off .

Steps.Text_raw: Turning the Router over you find 4 rubber feet hiding 4 Philips head screws. Remove the screws and turn the router back upright. The top of the case should now lift off.

Lines.Text: the c928 capacitor 100 uf 25 v is the one talked about in the forum mentioned in the intro .
while i was checking the solder side of the board i noticed there was a bad solder joint on this cap . you cant see it at this resolution though .
while checking the state of the other caps on the board i noticed that this one 1000 uf 10 v was also showing signs of heat stress .
both capacitors were replaced .
you can see the new caps in position on the right .
for the princely sum au 1.20 in parts , 20 mins setting up , 5 mins to fix , 5 mins to put it all away i have saved myself aprox 200 for a new voip router : )

Steps.Text_raw: The C928 Capacitor 100uF 25v is the one talked about in the forum mentioned in the intro. While I was checking the solder side of the board I noticed there was a bad solder joint on this cap. You cant see it at this resolution though. While checking the state of the other caps on the board I noticed that this one 1000uF 10v was also showing signs of heat stress. Both capacitors were replaced. You can see the new caps in position on the right. For the princely sum AU $1.20 in parts, 20 mins setting up, 5 mins to fix, 5 mins to put it all away I have saved myself aprox $200 for a new VOIP router :)

Title: Repairing Monoprice Super Slim Optical USB Mouse with DPI Adjustment Scroll Wheel
Category: Monoprice Super Slim Optical USB Mouse with DPI Adjustment

Lines.Text: slide the tab on the bottom of the mouse to release the top panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the tab on the bottom of the mouse to release the top panel.

Lines.Text: remove the top panel from the mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top panel from the mouse.

Lines.Text: remove four 7 mm phillips 1 screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove four 7mm Phillips #1 screws.

Lines.Text: use a spudger to pry the upper shell from the mouse at the cord entrance .
move slowly . the upper case is connected to the mouse with delicate wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger to pry the upper shell from the mouse at the cord entrance. Move slowly. The upper case is connected to the mouse with delicate wires.

Lines.Text: lift the scroll wheel out of the mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the scroll wheel out of the mouse.

Lines.Text: wiggle the usb cord free of the mouse .
resist the temptation to yank the cord free . the wires are very delicate and soldered connections are weak

Steps.Text_raw: Wiggle the USB cord free of the mouse. Resist the temptation to yank the cord free. The wires are very delicate and soldered connections are weak

Lines.Text: remove one 3 mm phillips 1 screw .
the quantity and location of screws holding the board to the mouse depends on the manufacture date of this mouse . all screws should be easy to find .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove one 3mm Phillips #1 screw. The quantity and location of screws holding the board to the mouse depends on the manufacture date of this mouse. All screws should be easy to find.

Lines.Text: push the broken axle piece out of the socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the broken axle piece out of the socket.

Lines.Text: glue broken axle piece back onto the scroll wheel .

this repair will last only as long as your glue or epoxy holds . the axle will re-break with weak glue and heavy use . my axle survived several heavy use days , just long enough for monoprice to send me a new mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: Glue broken axle piece back onto the scroll wheel. This repair will last only as long as your glue or epoxy holds. The axle will re-break with weak glue and heavy use. My axle survived several heavy use days, just long enough for Monoprice to send me a new mouse.

Title: Cleaning the scroll wheel of  Logitech Cordless Click! Plus Rechargeable Mouse

Lines.Text: you will have 3 screws to take apart . in order to open the mouse . the first one is in the battery compartment , and when the mouse has never been opened , two other ones are hidden under the maker label , just cut crosswise , as you can see on the picture upper-right . of course , when the mouse has been opened once , the screws show , as here on the left .
if the mouse has never been opened , force your screwdriver through the crosses pointed by the arrows on the upper-right picture , and unscrew normally .
now you can take apart the cover from the sole of your mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: You will have 3 screws to take apart. in order to open the mouse. The first one is in the battery compartment, and when the mouse has never been opened, two other ones are hidden under the maker label, just cut crosswise, as you can see on the picture upper-right. Of course, when the mouse has been opened once, the screws show, as here on the left. If the mouse has never been opened, force your screwdriver through the crosses pointed by the arrows on the upper-right picture, and unscrew normally. Now you can take apart the cover from the "sole" of your mouse.

Lines.Text: so now you can see the guts of your mouse . mine was very dirty : the dust had gathered and compressed into hard felt .

here you can see how it works . the pink arrows point on a led source , a receiver is fixed symmetrically on the other side of the wheel , and the light is interrupted by the spoked wheel when you roll it . . . except that no light passes through when the wheel is too dirty .

so you have to unclog the light path . when it is so dirty , you have to take the wheel out , because there is more dirt under the wheel in its u-shaped socket than what you see on it , as you can see on the middle picture .
first , move gently out of the rim the spring pointed by the yellow arrow on the left picture , and let it rest on the left . beware not to pull it out of its axis .

then you will need a tool ( tweezers or so ) to grasp the dirt out of the plastic support of the wheel . i used a crustacean/snail two-teethed fork ; - ) . when done , blow out the last dirt particles .

Steps.Text_raw: So now you can see the guts of your mouse. Mine was very dirty: the dust had gathered and compressed into hard felt. Here you can see how it works. The pink arrows point on a led source, a receiver is fixed symmetrically on the other side of the wheel, and the light is interrupted by the spoked wheel when you roll it...  except that no light passes through when the wheel is too dirty. So you have to unclog  the light path. When it is so dirty, you have to take the wheel out, because there is more dirt under the wheel in its U-shaped socket than what you see *on* it, as you can see on the middle picture. First, move *gently* out of the rim the spring pointed by the yellow arrow on the left picture, and let it rest on the left. Beware not to pull it out of its axis. Then you will need a tool (tweezers or so) to grasp the dirt out of the plastic support of the wheel. I used a crustacean/snail two-teethed fork ;-) . When done, blow out the last dirt particles.

Lines.Text: when you have well cleaned the support of the wheel and the wheel itself , click carefully the wheel back in place .
don't forget to move back the spring in its original position in the rim of the wheel .
you can now put back together the two parts of the mouse , and fasten them with the 3 screws

Steps.Text_raw: When you have well cleaned the support of the wheel and the wheel itself, click carefully the wheel back in place. Don't forget to move back the spring in its original position in the rim of the wheel. You can now put back together the two parts of the mouse, and fasten them with the 3 screws

Title: Epson Stylus NX230 Front Button Replacement

Lines.Text: before beginning , make sure the printer is unplugged and turned off to avoid electric shock .
lift the top of the printer to see the inside .

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning, make sure the printer is unplugged and turned off to avoid electric shock. Lift the top of the printer to see the inside.

Lines.Text: locate the control panel , the part of the printer with the buttons on it .
push the control panel away from the outside of the printer , taking the panel out of the holes that hold it in place .
repeat the above step for the other side of the control panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the control panel, the part of the printer with the buttons on it. Push the control panel away from the outside of the printer, taking the panel out of the holes that hold it in place. Repeat the above step for the other side of the control panel.

Lines.Text: the front control panel is attached to the printer on both sides by a grey piece of plastic that runs on a track . remove the control panel from the track by pushing it away from the track on both sides .
the ribbon cable on the left side of the control panel , also known as the ribbon cable , must stay attached to the printer . if the cable becomes detached the front buttons will not be responsive .

Steps.Text_raw: The front control panel is attached to the printer on both sides by a grey piece of plastic that runs on a track. Remove the control panel from the track by pushing it away from the track on both sides. The ribbon cable on the left side of the control panel, also known as the ribbon cable, must stay attached to the printer. If the cable becomes detached the front buttons will not be responsive.

Lines.Text: flip the detached control panel over so that the buttons are facing down .
remove the two 3 mm phillips 2 screws from the back of the control panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the detached control panel over so that the buttons are facing down. Remove the two 3mm Phillips #2 screws from the back of the control panel.

Lines.Text: lift up the gray plastic piece .
remove the 3 mm phillips 2 screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up the gray plastic piece. Remove the 3mm Phillips #2 screw.

Lines.Text: split the control panel in half by gently pulling on both sides of the seam that runs through the control panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Split the control panel in half by gently pulling on both sides of the seam that runs through the control panel.

Lines.Text: separate the two pieces to reveal the green circuit board .
be sure to not detach the circuit board from the white tap .
remove the green circuit board by lifting it up gently with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the two pieces to reveal the green circuit board. Be sure to not detach the circuit board from the white tap. Remove the green circuit board by lifting it up gently with your hands.

Lines.Text: remove the buttons with the plastic opening tool by pressing the front panel down and lifting the buttons up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the buttons with the plastic opening tool by pressing the front panel down and lifting the buttons up.

Subject: Front Buttons

Title: Epson Stylus NX230 Scanner Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: check that the printer is unplugged to prevent shock .
turn the printer so the front buttons are facing away from you .

Steps.Text_raw: Check that the printer is unplugged to prevent shock. Turn the printer so the front buttons are facing away from you.

Lines.Text: locate the 3 mm phillips 0 screw in the top left corner of the printer .
remove the screw using a phillips head screwdriver .
store the screw in a safe place where you can access them later .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the 3mm Phillips #0 screw in the top left corner of the printer. Remove the screw using a Phillips head screwdriver. Store the screw in a safe place where you can access them later.

Lines.Text: flip the top of the printer up so that you can see the inside of the printer .
there is a white ribbon cable in the right top corner of the printer .
make sure that the white ribbon does not come detached from the right side of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the top of the printer up so that you can see the inside of the printer. There is a white ribbon cable in the right top corner of the printer. Make sure that the white ribbon does not come detached from the right side of the printer.

Lines.Text: lay the scanner face up so you can access the under side , and place something , such as a piece of styrofoam , underneath of it so that the white tape does not become detached .
locate the four 3 mm phillips 2 screws along the edge , and remove all of them .
store the screws in a safe place where you can access them later .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the scanner face up so you can access the under side, and place something, such as a piece of Styrofoam, underneath of it so that the white tape does not become detached. Locate the four 3mm Phillips #2 screws along the edge, and remove all of them. Store the screws in a safe place where you can access them later.

Lines.Text: locate the seam on between outer shell of the printer and the inside of the printer .
starting from the top of the printer , use the plastic opening tool to slowly pry the scanner apart along the seam .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the seam on between outer shell of the printer and the inside of the printer. Starting from the top of the printer, use the plastic opening tool to slowly pry the scanner apart along the seam.

Lines.Text: detach the bottom of the scanner .
flip the bottom of the scanner over so that it rests on top of the printer .
this gives you access to the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the bottom of the scanner. Flip the bottom of the scanner over so that it rests on top of the printer. This gives you access to the motor.

Lines.Text: gently lift the scanner bar in order to remove it from the scanner .
detach the white ribbon cable from the scanner bar .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the scanner bar in order to remove it from the scanner. Detach the white ribbon cable from the scanner bar.

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 mm phillips 2 screws on the underside of the scanner bar attached to the silver motor .
remove the motor from the scanner bar by gently pulling the motor upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3mm Phillips #2 screws on the underside of the scanner bar attached to the silver motor. Remove the motor from the scanner bar by gently pulling the motor upwards.

remove the 3 mm phillips 2 screw in the hole in the top left corner . this screw attaches the side panel to the printer .
store the screws in a safe place so you can access them later .

Lines.Text: flip and remove the top of the printer up so that you can see the inside .
there is a white strip in the top right corner of the printer called the ribbon cable .
make sure that the ribbon cable does not detach from the printer to prevent damaging the connection .

Lines.Text: align the printer so the front button panel faces to the right .
remove the 3 mm phillips 2 screw on the side of the printer in the top left corner .
store the screw in a safe place so you can access it later .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the printer so the front button panel faces to the right. Remove the 3mm Phillips #2 screw on the side of the printer in the top left corner. Store the screw in a safe place so you can access it later.

Lines.Text: take the right side of the bar of plastic that runs across the top of the inside of the printer and push it towards the left side of the printer .
take the left side of the bar and push it to the left and then to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the right side of the bar of plastic that runs across the top of the inside of the printer and push it towards the left side of the printer. Take the left side of the bar and push it to the left and then to the right.

Lines.Text: using your hands , detach the side panel from the printer .
take extra care with the locking mechanisms , which help keep the side panel on the printer .
you may need to use the plastic opening tools to pry apart the locking mechanisms .

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 mm phillips 2 screws attaching motherboard to the printer .
store the screws in a safe place so you can access them later .
the motherboard can now be removed from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3mm Phillips #2 screws attaching motherboard to the printer. Store the screws in a safe place so you can access them later. The motherboard can now be removed from the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3 mm phillips 2 screws attaching the motor to the printer .
store the screws in a safe place so you can access them later .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3mm Phillips #2 screws attaching the motor to the printer. Store the screws in a safe place so you can access them later.

Lines.Text: place the printer on it's side so that the motherboard's location is facing up .
push the motor up and out of the hole that it is in .
the motor will slide out of the hole at the top after that .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the printer on it's side so that the motherboard's location is facing up. Push the motor up and out of the hole that it is in. The motor will slide out of the hole at the top after that.

Title: Dell 1907FPc Monitor Power Supply Replacement
Category: Dell UltraSharp 1907FPc 19" LCD Monitor Power Supply Replacement

Lines.Text: carefully place the monitor face down on a flat surface , being careful to protect the display .
remove the four 10 mm phillips 2 screws from the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully place the monitor face down on a flat surface, being careful to protect the display. Remove the four 10 mm Phillips #2 screws from the back panel.

Lines.Text: flip the monitor back over , so that the display is facing you .
use a spudger to remove the front bezel by unsnapping it in a counter clockwise fashion , starting at the bottom right , and ending at the button panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the monitor back over, so that the display is facing you. Use a spudger to remove the front bezel by unsnapping it in a counter clockwise fashion, starting at the bottom right, and ending at the button panel.

be careful to not fully remove the bezel here , because a ribbon cable attaches the buttons to the monitor .

lift the back cover off of the rest of the monitor .

remove the one 5 mm phillips 2 screw .
remove the usb port cover by sliding it out and away from the monitor .

set this mechanism off to the side , taking care to keep it all in one piece .

Lines.Text: use the tweezers to lift up the seven security tabs that secure the back panel to the rest of the monitor .
if the security tabs are held down too tightly , use the spudger to pry them up , and then finish them off with the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tweezers to lift up the seven security tabs that secure the back panel to the rest of the monitor. If the security tabs are held down too tightly, use the spudger to pry them up, and then finish them off with the tweezers.

Lines.Text: lift up on the back panel to remove it from the rest of the monitor .
be careful when doing so , as the edges of the back panel can be very sharp .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up on the back panel to remove it from the rest of the monitor. Be careful when doing so, as the edges of the back panel can be very sharp.

Lines.Text: use the tweezers to remove the four connectors from the power supply board .
the power supply has several large capacitors ( they look like little cylinders ) , that can shock you if they discharge . be careful not to touch them as you continue to work .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tweezers to remove the four connectors from the power supply board. The power supply has several large capacitors (they look like little cylinders), that can shock you if they discharge. Be careful not to touch them as you continue to work.

Lines.Text: remove the five 7 mm phillips 2 screws from the power supply board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 7 mm Phillips #2 screws from the power supply board.

Lines.Text: open up the clip securing the wires running between the power supply and video boards .
gently remove the connector running from the video board to the power supply board .

Steps.Text_raw: Open up the clip securing the wires running between the power supply and video boards. Gently remove the connector running from the video board to the power supply board.

Lines.Text: the power supply board can now be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: The power supply board can now be removed.

Subject: Power Supply

Title: Disassembling Mouse Buttons for Logitech Wireless Gaming Mouse G700

Lines.Text: unplug the usb cord from the top of the mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the USB cord from the top of the mouse.

Lines.Text: power off the mouse . the power switch is located on the bottom of the mouse above the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Power off the mouse. The power switch is located on the bottom of the mouse above the battery.

Lines.Text: remove the battery as illustrated in the images .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the battery as illustrated in the images.

Lines.Text: peel off the four sticker pads located on the bottom of the mouse . they will be on the top , bottom and sides .
stick these pads onto a clean , flat surface for safe keeping as you continue to disassemble the mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel off the four sticker pads located on the bottom of the mouse. They will be on the top, bottom and sides. Stick these pads onto a clean, flat surface for safe keeping as  you continue to disassemble the mouse.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the five screws that were hidden under the sticker pads .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the five screws that were hidden under the sticker pads.

Lines.Text: carefully pry off the top of the mouse . this will remove the housing from the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pry off the top of the mouse. This will remove the housing from the circuit board.

Lines.Text: gently detach the four wires from the holder of the housing .
++view++ : underneath housing

Steps.Text_raw: Gently detach the four wires from the holder of the  housing. ++View++: Underneath housing

Lines.Text: remove the seven screws that hold the top housing , middle housing , and side keys together .
if disassembling for cleaning purposes , you need only to remove the four screws near the bottom in order to remove the top cover alone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the seven screws that hold the top housing, middle housing, and side keys together. If disassembling for cleaning purposes, you need only to remove the four screws near the bottom in order to remove the top cover alone.

Lines.Text: press the side keys toward the bottom of the housing .
this will detach the keys and wires from the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the side keys toward the bottom of the housing. This will detach the keys and wires from the housing.

Lines.Text: gently pry the lock holding both mouse buttons .
++view : ++ underneath housing ( still one piece )

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry the lock holding both mouse buttons. ++View:++ Underneath housing (still one piece)

Lines.Text: gently pry away the upper part of the housing .
++view : ++ housing divided into two pieces : top and middle

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry away the upper part of the housing. ++View:++ Housing divided into two pieces: top and middle

Lines.Text: unscrew the two screws holding the part that locks the function buttons .
++view : ++ underneath middle housing

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two screws holding the part that locks the function buttons. ++View:++ Underneath middle housing

Lines.Text: slowly remove the plastic part you just unscrewed .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly remove the plastic part you just unscrewed.

Lines.Text: carefully pull each button towards you .
do not misplace the small springs attached to the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull each button towards you. Do not misplace the small springs attached to the buttons.

Lines.Text: congratulations ! you are now able to clean the mouse .
be careful when reinstalling the screws . due to their small size , they strip the sockets easily if overtightened .

Steps.Text_raw: Congratulations! You are now able to clean the mouse. Be careful when reinstalling the screws.  Due to their small size, they strip the sockets easily if overtightened.

Title: Disassembling Corsair Vengeance M65 Mouse Body

Lines.Text: let's begin !
first , flip it over .
find two torx screws . use a t6 torx driver to unscrew these . i used a small flat head screwdriver to unscrew these because i did not have a t6 torx driver .

Steps.Text_raw: Let's begin! First, flip it over. Find two Torx screws. Use a T6 Torx driver to unscrew these. I used a small flat head screw driver to unscrew these because I did not have a T6 Torx driver.

Lines.Text: be careful with flat-head screwdriver ! alternatively open it bare handed .
do not separate the two halves too wide yet as there are delicate ribbon cables connecting the two halves !
push down where i am pointing out here . it should come apart fairly easily .

to open it bare handed , hold m65 with usb cord running straight downwards and force top surface of m65 upwards with your palm then pull m65 's rear edge upwardly with your hooked fingers of the same hand .

Steps.Text_raw: BE CAREFUL WITH FLAT-HEAD SCREWDRIVER! Alternatively open it bare handed. DO NOT SEPARATE THE TWO HALVES TOO WIDE YET AS THERE ARE DELICATE RIBBON CABLES CONNECTING THE TWO HALVES! Push down where I am pointing out here. It should come apart fairly easily. To open it bare handed, hold M65 with USB cord running straight downwards and force top surface of M65 upwards with your palm then pull M65's rear edge upwardly with your "hooked" fingers of the same hand.

Lines.Text: be gentle !
wiggle the front of the mouse and gently pull the top half towards the back .
slightly lift the top half about 5 mm !
there is a ribbon cable and a power cable attached to the top and bottom .
slowly ! wiggle the top ribbon cable out of its slot .
on the power cable , grip the plug itself and not the wires . pull the power cable from the bottom .
yay ! you got them apart !

Steps.Text_raw: BE GENTLE! Wiggle the front of the mouse and gently pull the top half towards the back. SLIGHTLY LIFT THE TOP HALF ABOUT 5mm! There is a ribbon cable and a power cable attached to the top and bottom. SLOWLY! Wiggle the top ribbon cable out of its slot. On the power cable, grip the plug itself and not the wires. Pull the power cable from the bottom. YAY! You got them apart!

Lines.Text: if you wish to go any further , please do so at your own risk . i have not gone further than this .

there are two screws that hold the pcb in place . one is longer than the other . the short one goes to where i am pointing . the long screw holds down a grounding wire . move the wire out of the way as you take out the board .

there is a ribbon cable that i am pointing at which you can pull out . there are some multi-colored wires that are plugged into the board . wiggle it out . move it to the side when you take the board out .
now lift the pcb out along with the scroll wheel . there should be some more screws which hold the metal to the plastic . undo those if you want to .

the sides come apart . you must take the mainboard out in order to take the sides off . there are two latches for the left side and four on the right side . the left side also has two screws securing it to the rest of the body .

Steps.Text_raw: If you wish to go any further, please do so at your own risk. I have not gone further than this. There are two screws that hold the PCB in place. One is longer than the other. The SHORT one goes to where I am pointing. The long screw holds down a grounding wire. Move the wire out of the way as you take out the board. There is a ribbon cable that I am pointing at which you can pull out. There are some multi-colored wires that are plugged into the board. Wiggle it out. Move it to the side when you take the board out. Now lift the PCB out along with the scroll wheel. There should be some more screws which hold the metal to the plastic. Undo those if you want to. The sides come apart. You must take the mainboard out in order to take the sides off. There are two latches for the left side and four on the right side. The left side also has two screws securing it to the rest of the body.

Title: Repairing Microsoft Wedge Touch Mouse Battery Cover Retaining Clip

Lines.Text: remove the battery if it is still installed and leave the battery cover open .
holding the mouse in your right hand with your thumb at the narrow edge and your index finger near the spot indicated by the blue arrow .

insert one of the long edges of the guitar pick in the gap indicated by the red arrow and use it to push the top toward the battery cover , at the same time slip the finger nail of your index finder into the gap along the thick edge .
with a little fiddling the wide edge should lift a bit near the blue arrow and the top should pop out of a pin just above the red arrow .
you should now be able to lift the wide edge of the top a little away from the body of the mouse and downwards a bit toward the thin edge releasing the top .
there are two cables attached to the back of the top so just get it loose for now .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the battery if it is still installed and leave the battery cover open. Holding the mouse in your right hand with your thumb at the narrow edge and your index finger near the spot indicated by the blue arrow. Insert one of the long edges of the guitar pick in the gap indicated by the red arrow and use it to push the top toward the battery cover, at the same time slip the finger nail of your index finder into the gap along the thick edge. With a little fiddling the wide edge should lift a bit near the blue arrow and the top should pop out of a pin just above the red arrow. You should now be able to lift the wide edge of the top a little away from the body of the mouse and downwards a bit toward the thin edge releasing the top. There are two cables attached to the back of the top so just get it loose for now.

Lines.Text: two ribbon cables need to be disconnected , you can slowly , carefully and gently pull them out without releasing the retaining clips , it may make releasing the clips easier .
to release the clip indicated by the red arrow , slip the tip of a small flat blade screwdriver under the middle of the black part of the clip and rotate it to rotate the black part up a bit .

to release the clip indicated by the blue arrows you need to apply pressure to the black clip near both of the arrows at the same time and slide the black clip upwards a bit . this may be easier if the cable has already been removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Two ribbon cables need to be disconnected, you can slowly, carefully and gently pull them out without releasing the retaining clips, it may make releasing the clips easier. To release the clip indicated by the red arrow, slip the tip of a small flat blade screwdriver under the middle of the black part of the clip and rotate it to rotate the black part up a bit. To release the clip indicated by the blue arrows you need to apply pressure to the black clip near both of the arrows at the same time and slide the black clip upwards a bit. This may be easier if the cable has already been removed.

Lines.Text: now that the top has been removed , check for any loose bits of plastic , if the you find anything , shake it out and save it .
remove the two phillips screws circled in red .
removing the two phillips screws circled in blue may make the following steps easier but is not absolutely necessary .
you may also want to remove the white ribbon cable to get it out of the way but it is not absolutely necessary .
the upper pcb is soldered to the battery leads , to avoid breaking the wires , take care not to pull on them or bend them any more than you must to complete the following steps .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the top has been removed, check for any loose bits of plastic, if the you find anything, shake it out and save it. Remove the two phillips screws circled in red. Removing the two phillips screws circled in blue may make the following steps easier but is not absolutely necessary. You may also want to remove the white ribbon cable to get it out of the way but it is not absolutely necessary. The upper PCB is soldered to the battery leads, to avoid breaking the wires, take care not to pull on them or bend them any more than you must to complete the following steps.

Lines.Text: rotate the upper board a little to expose the screws circled in red .
remove the two phillips screws circled in red .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the upper board a little to expose the screws circled in red. Remove the two phillips screws circled in red.

Lines.Text: slide a small phillips screwdriver between the upper pcb and the battery compartment to remove the screw circled in red .
there is a second screw hiding near the ribbon cable that connects the upper pcb to the lower pcb , loosen but to not remove this screw , to make it easier to put back together later .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide a small phillips screwdriver between the upper PCB and the battery compartment to remove the screw circled in red. There is a second screw hiding near the ribbon cable that connects the upper PCB to the Lower PCB, loosen but to not remove this screw, to make it easier to put back together later.

Lines.Text: insert a small flat blade screwdriver as shown and gently pry the lower pcb out from under the plastic retaining clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a small flat blade screw driver as shown and gently pry the lower PCB out from under the plastic retaining clip.

Lines.Text: use a small flat blade screwdriver to release the black retaining clip for the lower pcb ribbon cable .
detach the ribbon cable from the lower pcb

lift the left edge of the lower pcb until it slides off of the plastic positioning guide on the left side of the case and releases the lower pcb , rotate the lower pcb and pull it toward the thin edge of the case until the board comes free
you should not be able to remove the remaining portion of the battery cover release for repair from the bottom of the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a small flat blade screw driver to release the black retaining clip for the lower PCB ribbon cable. Detach the ribbon cable from the Lower PCB Lift the left edge of the lower PCB until it slides off of the plastic positioning guide on the left side of the case and releases the lower PCB, rotate the lower PCB and pull it toward the thin edge of the case until the board comes free You should not be able to remove the remaining portion of the battery cover release for repair from the bottom of the casing.

Lines.Text: use crazy glue to glue the pieces of the battery cover release clip back together .
make sure that you know how the pieces fit together before applying the glue and hold the pieces tightly together in the correct position for at least 30 seconds before trying to put the piece down .
wait a few minutes for the glue to set and then remove any excess glue .
test the strength of the bond , you may have to try gluing twice or try a different type of blue if you can't get a strong bond .

Steps.Text_raw: Use Crazy Glue to glue the pieces of the battery cover release clip back together. Make sure that you know how the pieces fit together before applying the glue and hold the pieces tightly together in the correct position for at least 30 seconds before trying to put the piece down. Wait a few minutes for the glue to set and then remove any excess glue. Test the strength of the bond, you may have to try gluing twice or try a different type of blue if you can't get a strong bond.

Lines.Text: start the reassembly , for the most part it involves reversing the disassembly steps but there are some things that need to be noted .
drop the battery cover clip back into the bottom of the case in the orientation shown in the previous step .

use a small flat blade screwdriver to pull the spring back and seat the tip of the spring behind the notch in the battery cover clip . carefully close and open the battery cover a few times to make sure that it is now staying closed properly .

reinsert the lower pcb , taking care to slide the back right corner in first , the screw that was loosened but not removed in step 5 holds a metal clip , the edge of the lower pcb has to slide into this clip .
push the left side of the lower pcb back until is can slide down over the vertical plastic alignment guide on the left edge of the case .

use a flat blade screwdriver to get the lower pcb back under the retaining clip at the left front in a similar way to how the board was removed , don't try to just push down on the board , the fit is so tight the board might crack .

make sure the lower pcb ribbon cable clip is in the up / released position , reinsert the lower pcb ribbon cable guiding it into position with a needle nose pliers , tweezers or forceps , be careful not to damage the cable and make sure that it is in far enough that only a tiny stripe of the ribbon contacts remains visible .
rotate the black retaining clip down to lock the ribbon in position . reinsert and tighten all of the silver screws that hold down the lower pcb .

Steps.Text_raw: Start the reassembly, for the most part it involves reversing the disassembly steps but there are some things that need to be noted. Drop the battery cover clip back into the bottom of the case in the orientation shown in the previous step. Use a small flat blade screwdriver to pull the spring back and seat the tip of the spring behind the notch in the battery cover clip. Carefully close and open the battery cover a few times to make sure that it is now staying closed properly. Reinsert the lower PCB, taking care to slide the back right corner in first, the screw that was loosened but not removed in step 5 holds a metal clip, the edge of the lower PCB has to slide into this clip. Push the left side of the lower PCB back until is can slide down over the vertical plastic alignment guide on the left edge of the case. Use a flat blade screw driver to get the lower PCB back under the retaining clip at the left front in a similar way to how the board was removed, don't try to just push down on the board, the fit is so tight the board might crack. Make sure the lower PCB ribbon cable clip is in the up / released position, reinsert the lower PCB ribbon cable guiding it into position with a needle nose pliers, tweezers or forceps, be careful not to damage the cable and make sure that it is in far enough that only a tiny stripe of the ribbon contacts remains visible. Rotate the black retaining clip down to lock the ribbon in position. Reinsert and tighten all of the silver screws that hold down the lower PCB.

Lines.Text: push down upper pcb , reinsert and tighten the 2 black screws , if you removed all 4 during disassembly , remember to put the lens and iris back under the upper pcb before pushing it down and tightening all 4 black screws .

reinstall the narrow brown ribbon , starting with the retaining clip pulled loose , there is a darker brown reinforcing strip on the non contact side of the ribbon , the edge of this strip can be pushed on with your fingernail or a small flat blade screwdriver or tweezers to push the cable in , the clip will push in as the cable is pushed in .
reinstall the white ribbon into both the upper pcb and the pcb attached to the top cover and rotate the black clips into the flat locked position .
hook the thin edge of the top cover over the thin edge of the main body of the mouse .
start closing the case by slipping the plastic retaining pin on the left side into its hole first then push down the right side clip over the metal clip .
reinstall the battery and close the battery cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Push down upper PCB, reinsert and tighten the 2 black screws, if you removed all 4 during disassembly, remember to put the lens and iris back under the upper PCB before pushing it down and tightening all 4 black screws. Reinstall the narrow brown ribbon, starting with the retaining clip pulled loose, there is a darker brown reinforcing strip on the non contact side of the ribbon, the edge of this strip can be pushed on with your fingernail or a small flat blade screw driver or tweezers to push the cable in, the clip will push in as the cable is pushed in. Reinstall the white ribbon into both the upper PCB and the PCB attached to the top cover and rotate the black clips into the flat locked position. Hook the thin edge of the top cover over the thin edge of the main body of the mouse. Start closing the case by slipping the plastic retaining pin on the left side into its hole first then push down the right side clip over the metal clip. Reinstall the battery and close the battery cover.

Title: Logitech MX518 Gaming Mouse Scroll wheel replacement for cleaning

Toolbox.Name: cleaning stuff q-tips and ipa sandpaper ...

Lines.Text: use a thin blade to peel up the corners and remove the mouse feet . they re-adhere very well , so be careful to not damage them or get the sticky side dirty .
unscrew the three screws that are now visible .
gently pull apart the top and bottom halves of the mouse . they will be connected by a wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a thin blade to peel up the corners and remove the mouse feet. They re-adhere very well, so be careful to not damage them or get the sticky side dirty. Unscrew the three screws that are now visible. Gently pull apart the top and bottom halves of the mouse. They will be connected by a wire.

Lines.Text: slide the scroll wheel up and out of the housing .
take the scroll wheel assembly apart and clean off any obvious debris .
look through each of the holes in the scroll wheel to check for debris that could be obstructing the optical sensor . use a needle to clean out any obstructions .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the scroll wheel up and out of the housing. Take the scroll wheel assembly apart and clean off any obvious debris. Look through each of the holes in the scroll wheel to check for debris that could be obstructing the optical sensor. Use a needle to clean out any obstructions.

Lines.Text: optional : if there is any material near the base of the mouse , under the scroll wheel , the sensor chip can be unscrewed and removed .
use a gas duster to remove any remaining dust from inside the mouse .

Steps.Text_raw: Optional: If there is any material near the base of the mouse, under the scroll wheel, the sensor chip can be unscrewed and removed. Use a gas duster to remove any remaining dust from inside the mouse.

Lines.Text: reassemble the scroll wheel .
if done correctly , the wheel should click while scrolling . the wheel should not spin freely .
optional : before reinserting the scroll wheel peg , apply lubricant if needed .

Steps.Text_raw: Reassemble the scroll wheel. If done correctly, the wheel should click while scrolling. The wheel should not spin freely. Optional: Before reinserting the scroll wheel peg, apply lubricant if needed.

Lines.Text: slide the scroll wheel back down into its housing .
make sure that the spring is aligned correctly .
place the top half of the mouse back on to the bottom half and screw the mouse together .
stick the mouse feet back on to their respective locations .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the scroll wheel back down into its housing. Make sure that the spring is aligned correctly. Place the top half of the mouse back on to the bottom half and screw the mouse together. Stick the mouse feet back on to their respective locations.

Subject: Scroll wheel

Title: Apple AirPort Extreme Model A1143 Case Replacement

Lines.Text: the back pad is held in with glue so use caution when removing to prevent tearing . low heat may be used to help remove the pad .
slowly peel off the rubber pad on the bottom of the device . start from one corner and peel with your fingers . use heat if necessary until pad is completely removed .

Steps.Text_raw: The back pad is held in with glue so use caution when removing to prevent tearing. Low heat may be used to help remove the pad. Slowly peel off the rubber pad on the bottom of the device. Start from one corner and peel with your fingers. Use heat if necessary until pad is completely removed.

Lines.Text: after removing the rubber pad , unscrew the five 5 mm phillips 00 screws in the holes of the back cover .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the rubber pad, unscrew the five 5mm phillips #00 screws in the holes of the back cover.

Lines.Text: lift up the back case from the perforated edge to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up the back case from the perforated edge to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove logic board and metal casing from outer case by prying from one side using a spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove logic board and metal casing from outer case by prying from one side using a spudger.

Title: Corsair Vengeance M65 Mouse Cable Replacement

Lines.Text: let's begin !
first , flip it over .
find two torx screws . use a t6 torx driver to unscrew these . i used a small flat head screwdriver to unscrew these because i did not have a t6 torx driver .

Steps.Text_raw: Let's begin! First, flip it over. Find two Torx screws. Use a T6 Torx driver to unscrew these. I used a small flat head screw driver to unscrew these because I did not have a T6 Torx driver.

Lines.Text: be careful with flat-head screwdriver ! alternatively open it bare handed .
do not separate the two halves too wide yet as there are delicate ribbon cables connecting the two halves !
push down where i am pointing out here . it should come apart fairly easily .

to open it bare handed , hold m65 with usb cord running straight downwards and force top surface of m65 upwards with your palm then pull m65 's rear edge upwardly with your hooked fingers of the same hand .

Steps.Text_raw: BE CAREFUL WITH FLAT-HEAD SCREWDRIVER! Alternatively open it bare handed. DO NOT SEPARATE THE TWO HALVES TOO WIDE YET AS THERE ARE DELICATE RIBBON CABLES CONNECTING THE TWO HALVES! Push down where I am pointing out here. It should come apart fairly easily. To open it bare handed, hold M65 with USB cord running straight downwards and force top surface of M65 upwards with your palm then pull M65's rear edge upwardly with your "hooked" fingers of the same hand.

Lines.Text: be gentle !
wiggle the front of the mouse and gently pull the top half towards the back .
slightly lift the top half about 5 mm !
there is a ribbon cable and a power cable attached to the top and bottom .
slowly ! wiggle the top ribbon cable out of its slot .
on the power cable , grip the plug itself and not the wires . pull the power cable from the bottom .
yay ! you got them apart !

Steps.Text_raw: BE GENTLE! Wiggle the front of the mouse and gently pull the top half towards the back. SLIGHTLY LIFT THE TOP HALF ABOUT 5mm! There is a ribbon cable and a power cable attached to the top and bottom. SLOWLY! Wiggle the top ribbon cable out of its slot. On the power cable, grip the plug itself and not the wires. Pull the power cable from the bottom. YAY! You got them apart!

Lines.Text: if you wish to go any further , please do so at your own risk . i have not gone further than this .

there are two screws that hold the pcb in place . one is longer than the other . the short one goes to where i am pointing . the long screw holds down a grounding wire . move the wire out of the way as you take out the board .

there is a ribbon cable that i am pointing at which you can pull out . there are some multi-colored wires that are plugged into the board . wiggle it out . move it to the side when you take the board out .
now lift the pcb out along with the scroll wheel . there should be some more screws which hold the metal to the plastic . undo those if you want to .

the sides come apart . you must take the mainboard out in order to take the sides off . there are two latches for the left side and four on the right side . the left side also has two screws securing it to the rest of the body .

Steps.Text_raw: If you wish to go any further, please do so at your own risk. I have not gone further than this. There are two screws that hold the PCB in place. One is longer than the other. The SHORT one goes to where I am pointing. The long screw holds down a grounding wire. Move the wire out of the way as you take out the board. There is a ribbon cable that I am pointing at which you can pull out. There are some multi-colored wires that are plugged into the board. Wiggle it out. Move it to the side when you take the board out. Now lift the PCB out along with the scroll wheel. There should be some more screws which hold the metal to the plastic. Undo those if you want to. The sides come apart. You must take the mainboard out in order to take the sides off. There are two latches for the left side and four on the right side. The left side also has two screws securing it to the rest of the body.

Lines.Text: well the guide to open it is here -- ( guide27423 )

to open this up i used a radioshack precision driver set ( 21 piece ) it was the only one i could buy with out going online and it only costed 10 dollars its a good little set for whats its worth , but really anything that can open this is fine .
step 1 once you opened it remove the power connector
step 2 remove the other connector but me gentle because they do brake/rip easily
do not remove the very long ribbon cable unless that's what you need to remove i never tried to remove it because it wasn't what i needed to fix but be careful

Steps.Text_raw: Well the guide to open it is here -->([guide|27423]) To open this up i used a RadioShack Precision Driver Set (21 piece) it was the only one i could buy with out going online and it only costed 10 dollars its a good little set for whats its worth, But really anything that can open this is fine. Step 1 Once you opened it remove the power connector Step 2 remove the other connector but me gentle because they do brake/rip easily DO NOT remove the very long ribbon cable unless that's what you need to remove i never tried to remove it because it wasn't what i needed to fix but be careful

Lines.Text: so when i first opened this i found my power connector in this sorry state but i guess it could have been worse .
step 3 start stripping the wires so that you can solder it , then run the wires threw the hole ( important )

step 4 dont forget to run the wires threw the hole so that the wires are inside the mouse not outside inside i cant stress this enough . so start soldering the wires red+red , white+ white , green+green , black+black , and that really thick black cable+plus the other thick cable or the silver one

Steps.Text_raw: So when i first opened this i found my power connector in this sorry state but i guess it could have been worse. Step 3 start stripping the wires so that you can solder it, then run the wires threw the hole(Important) Step 4 Dont forget to run the wires threw the hole so that the wires are INSIDE the mouse not outside INSIDE i cant stress this enough. So start soldering the wires red+red,white+ white,green+green,black+black, and that really thick black cable+plus the other thick cable or the silver one

oh and dont forget to rap the exposed wires in electrical tape ( will post pictures of repaired mouse later )

Title: Acer S200HL LCD Monitor Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: place the monitor screen face down .
firmly hold the base of the stand with one hand and the bottom of the monitor with the other hand .
pull the stand away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the monitor screen face down. Firmly hold the base of the stand with one hand and the bottom of the monitor with the other hand. Pull the stand away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to pry the back panel from the front panel .
start at one point of the crease and pry along the edge of the entire monitor for the best results .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to pry the back panel from the front panel. Start at one point of the crease and pry along the edge of the entire monitor for the best results.

Lines.Text: gently lift back panel away from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift back panel away from the monitor.

Lines.Text: be sure to keep track of where you place your screws . a magnetic mat is great for keeping your screws in one spot .
unscrew the four 7.5 mm phillips 2 screws connecting the motherboard to the metal casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure to keep track of where you place your screws. A magnetic mat is great for keeping your screws in one spot. Unscrew the four 7.5 mm Phillips #2 screws connecting the motherboard to the metal casing.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm hex screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm hex screws.

Lines.Text: gently lift the motherboard casing from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the motherboard casing from the monitor.

Lines.Text: the following steps give instructions for detaching the three connectors shown in the picture .

Steps.Text_raw: The following steps give instructions for detaching the three connectors shown in the picture.

Lines.Text: lift the black seal to release the small ribbon connector ( the no fuss ribbon cable connector ) from the motherboard .
the connector will be released from the motherboard immediately .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the black seal to release the small ribbon connector (the No Fuss Ribbon Cable connector) from the motherboard. The connector will be released from the motherboard immediately.

Lines.Text: lift the black seal to release the large ribbon connector ( the zif connector ) .
the connector will be released from the motherboard immediately .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the black seal to release the large ribbon connector (the ZIF connector). The connector will be released from the motherboard immediately.

Lines.Text: pull the bundled cable connector gently away from motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the bundled cable connector gently away from motherboard.

Lines.Text: gently lift the motherboard to remove it from the monitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the motherboard to remove  it from the monitor.

Title: Apple AirPort Extreme Model A1143 Wi-Fi Antenna Replacement

Lines.Text: the back pad is held in with glue so use caution when removing to prevent tearing . low heat may be used to help remove the pad .
slowly peel off the rubber pad on the bottom of the device . start from one corner and peel with your fingers . use heat if necessary until pad is completely removed .

Steps.Text_raw: The back pad is held in with glue so use caution when removing to prevent tearing. Low heat may be used to help remove the pad. Slowly peel off the rubber pad on the bottom of the device. Start from one corner and peel with your fingers. Use heat if necessary until pad is completely removed.

Lines.Text: after removing the rubber pad , unscrew the five 5 mm phillips 00 screws in the holes of the back cover .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the rubber pad, unscrew the five 5mm phillips #00 screws in the holes of the back cover.

Lines.Text: lift up the back case from the perforated edge to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up the back case from the perforated edge to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove logic board and metal casing from outer case by prying from one side using a spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove logic board and metal casing from outer case by prying from one side using a spudger.

Lines.Text: unhook the wires connecting the logic board to the metal casing by grabbing and pulling up on each connection with tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Unhook the wires connecting the logic board to the metal casing by grabbing and pulling up on each connection with tweezers.

Lines.Text: carefully push back the three metal tabs with your fingers on the sides of metal case .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully push back the three metal tabs with your fingers on the sides of metal case.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the metal case away from the logic board .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the metal case away from the logic board.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 5 mm 00 screws from each of the three antennas located on the sides of the metal casing .
pull away antennas from metal case .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 5mm #00 screws from each of the three antennas located on the sides of the metal casing. Pull away antennas from metal case.

Lines.Text: pull up the less visible silver tape that holds the antenna cords in place at the ends of the device using your fingers .
remove clear yellow tape that holds the cords to the outer casing in the same manner .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull up the less visible silver tape that holds the antenna cords in place at the ends of the device using your fingers. Remove clear yellow tape that holds the cords to the outer casing in the same manner.

Title: Acer AL1714 LCD Replacement

Lines.Text: turn the monitor facedown .
unscrew the 5 screws holding the back cover on .
(this may require flipping the monitor over and shaking the screws loose once they're already unscrewed )

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor facedown. Unscrew the 5 screws holding the back cover on. (This may require flipping the monitor over and shaking the screws loose once they're already unscrewed)

Lines.Text: take the edge tool or a metal ruler and insert it into the bezel .
apply pressure and push down .
do the same to the right side .
once the side of the bezel facing you is decoupled , take the back cover and pry it loose .
(this will require some force , you will hear a loud popping/snapping noises )

Steps.Text_raw: Take the edge tool or a metal ruler and insert it into the bezel. Apply pressure and push down. Do the same to the right side. Once the side of the bezel facing you is decoupled, take the back cover and pry it loose. (This will require some force, you will hear a loud popping/snapping noises)

Lines.Text: remove the power button circuit board flat flex cable from the power supply board under the metal cover .
pull the cord back and out of the way .
(it may be stuck down with adhesive )

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Power Button Circuit Board Flat Flex Cable from the Power Supply board under the metal cover. Pull the cord back and out of the way. (It may be stuck down with adhesive)

Lines.Text: unscrew the cord anchors for the vga port .
(use needle nose pliers if they're too tight for removal by hand )

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the cord anchors for the VGA port. (Use needle nose pliers if they're too tight for removal by hand)

Lines.Text: turn the monitor around .
unscrew the 1 screw holding the flat power cable cover in place .
lift up and remove the flat power cable cover .
(careful : it may be sharp )

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor around. Unscrew the 1 screw holding the Flat Power Cable cover in place. Lift up and remove the Flat Power Cable cover. (Careful: it may be sharp)

Lines.Text: unscrew the 5 screws holding the metal cage on .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 5 screws holding the metal cage on.

Lines.Text: turn the monitor around .
lift up on the back of metal cage , slightly .
pull the cage toward self .
(must be careful to free cover of the vga port and power supply input )

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor around. Lift up on the back of metal cage, slightly. Pull the  cage toward self. (Must be careful to free cover of the VGA port and power supply input)

Lines.Text: lift up on the flat flex cable holder tabs to release the cords .
lift up on the flat flex cables and bend them out of the working area .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up on the Flat Flex Cable holder tabs to release the cords. Lift up on the Flat Flex Cables and bend them out of the working area.

Lines.Text: unplug the 4 backlight wires from their ports on the power supply board .
(considering their size , the best way to unplug the backlight wires is by slowly jiggling and pulling the wires out of place )

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the 4 backlight wires from their ports on the Power Supply board. (Considering their size, the best way to unplug the backlight wires is by slowly jiggling and pulling the wires out of place)

Lines.Text: unscrew the 5 screws holding the power supply and video display boards .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 5 screws holding the Power Supply and Video Display boards.

Lines.Text: lift and remove the joined power supply and video display boards .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and remove the joined Power Supply and Video Display boards.

Lines.Text: carefully detach the power supply and video display boards at the connector joint .
(this step is not necessary to replace the lcd module . this step is only a safety precaution so as not to bend or break the power supply connector joint )

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully detach the Power Supply and Video Display boards at the connector joint. (This step is not necessary to replace the LCD Module. This step is only a safety precaution so as not to bend or break the Power Supply connector joint)

Lines.Text: remove the flat flex cable from the power button circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Flat Flex Cable from the Power Button Circuit board.

Lines.Text: grasp , lift , and remove the lcd module from the front panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp, lift, and remove the LCD Module from the front panel.

Lines.Text: the final product with the lcd module removed .

Steps.Text_raw: The final product with the LCD Module removed.

Title: AlphaSmart Pro Keyboard Replacement

Lines.Text: power off your alphasmart pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly .
remove all eight 1 cm phillips head screws from the back panel of the alphasmart pro with the phillips 00 screwdriver .
carefully separate the front panel from the back panel .
notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Power off your AlphaSmart Pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly. Remove all eight 1 cm Phillips head screws from the back panel of the AlphaSmart Pro with the Phillips #00 Screwdriver. Carefully separate the front panel from the back panel. Notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket .
gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket .
remove front panel from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket. Gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket. Remove front panel from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use the phillips 00 screwdriver to remove the four 1 cm screws from each corner of the keyboard .
gently lift the keyboard from the rear panel .
notice that the keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by two ribbon cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #00 Screwdriver to remove the four 1 cm screws from each corner of the keyboard. Gently lift the keyboard from the rear panel. Notice that the keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by two ribbon cables.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , gently pull the connector in the direction of the ribbon cable .
pull the ribbon cable to remove it from the connector .
repeat the exact steps above for the other ribbon cable .
while the large connector on the left must be pulled toward you in order to remove the ribbon cable , the smaller connector on the right must be pushed away from you .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, gently pull the connector in the direction of the ribbon cable. Pull the ribbon cable to remove it from the connector. Repeat the exact steps above for the other ribbon cable. While the large connector on the left must be pulled toward you in order to remove the ribbon cable, the smaller connector on the right must be pushed away from you.

Lines.Text: remove keyboard from motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove keyboard from motherboard.

Subject: Keyboard

Title: AlphaSmart Pro Front Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: power off your alphasmart pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly .
remove all eight 1 cm phillips head screws from the back panel of the alphasmart pro with the phillips 00 screwdriver .
carefully separate the front panel from the back panel .
notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Power off your AlphaSmart Pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly. Remove all eight 1 cm Phillips head screws from the back panel of the AlphaSmart Pro with the Phillips #00 Screwdriver. Carefully separate the front panel from the back panel. Notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket .
gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket .
you are now able to separate the front panel from the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket. Gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket. You are now able to separate the front panel from the back panel.

Lines.Text: looking at the front panel , use the phillips 00 screwdriver to remove the four phillips head 0.8 cm screws from each corner of the display motherboard .
lift the display screen and motherboard from the plastic front panel to separate the two pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Looking at the front panel, use the Phillips #00 screwdriver to remove the four Phillips head 0.8 cm screws from each corner of the display motherboard. Lift the display screen and motherboard from the plastic front panel to separate the two pieces.

Subject: Front Panel

Title: AlphaSmart Pro Individual Key Replacement

Lines.Text: insert the plastic opening tool or spudger into the side of the key you wish to remove , and press downward on the far end of the tool to pry the key up .
you may also pry the key up by simply using your finger and/or fingernail , however , it is easier to use an opening tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic opening tool or spudger into the side of the key you wish to remove, and press downward on the far end of the tool to pry the key up. You may also pry the key up by simply using your finger and/or fingernail, however, it is easier to use an opening tool.

Lines.Text: if the key you are removing is the spacebar ( like you see pictured here ) , you should find a single spring placed on one of two circular spots located one the right and left side underneath the key .
remove the spring and place it to the side so it doesn't get lost .
it does not matter which of the two circular spots the spring is on .
there is only one spring per spacebar . if the spring is missing , don't worry the spacebar will work fine without it but it will work better when the spring is attached .

Steps.Text_raw: If the key you are removing is the spacebar (like you see pictured here), you should find a single spring placed on one of two circular spots located one the right and left side underneath the key. Remove the spring and place it to the side so it doesn't get lost. It does not matter which of the two circular spots the spring is on. There is only one spring per spacebar. If the spring is missing, don't worry — the spacebar will work fine without it — but it will work better when the spring is attached.

Lines.Text: if you wish to remove another key besides the spacebar , the same methods of removal apply .
you should hear a popping or snapping sound when the key has been removed .
unlike the spacebar key , all the other keys do not have a spring .

Steps.Text_raw: If you wish to remove another key besides the spacebar, the same methods of removal apply. You should hear a "popping" or "snapping" sound when the key has been removed. Unlike the spacebar key, all the other keys do not have a spring.

Lines.Text: to replace the key ( s ) , simply align the center cylindrical post ( s ) with the center holes .
use your index finger to press down on the middle of the key . you should hear it click into place .

Steps.Text_raw: To replace the key(s), simply align the center cylindrical post(s) with the center holes. Use your index finger to press down on the middle of the key. You should hear it "click" into place.

Subject: Individual Key

Lines.Text: turn the monitor facedown .
unscrew the 5 screws holding the back cover on .
(this may require flipping the monitor over and shaking the screws loose once they're already unscrewed )

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor facedown. Unscrew the 5 screws holding the back cover on. (This may require flipping the monitor over and shaking the screws loose once they're already unscrewed)

Lines.Text: take the edge tool or a metal ruler and insert it into the bezel .
apply pressure and push down .
do the same to the right side .
once the side of bezel facing you is decoupled , take the back cover and pry it loose .

pull the cord back and out of the way .
(it may be stuck down with adhesive )

Lines.Text: turn the monitor around .
unscrew the 1 screw holding the flex power cable cover .
lift up and remove the flex power cable cover .

Lines.Text: unscrew the 5 screws holding the metal cage on .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 5 screws holding the metal cage on.

Lines.Text: turn the monitor around .
lift up on the back of the metal cage slightly .
pull the cage toward self .
(must be careful to free the cover of the vga port and power supply input )

Lines.Text: lift up on the flat flex cable holder tabs to release cords .

(this step is not necessary for the removal and replacement of the power button circuit board )
(this is only a precaution so as not to bend or break the connector joint between the two boards )

Lines.Text: grasp , lift , and remove the lcd module from the front panel .

if you cannot unscrew the washer with your finger , you may need to use a small wrench to grab the washer .

gently lower the key so the narrow teeth of the key are resting on the notch ( circled in red ) just below the opening at the top of the case .
if you plan to continue working on the device , check that this key is in place before finally closing the device .

Title: D-Link EBR-2310 Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: begin by placing the wired router face down .
locate the two black plastic screw coverings at the top of the device and remove them with your fingers .
the two bottom plastic screw coverings do not need to be taken off .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by placing the wired router face down. Locate the two black plastic screw coverings at the top of the device and remove them with your fingers. The two bottom plastic screw coverings do not need to be taken off.

Lines.Text: using a phillips ph2 screwdriver head , unscrew the two top screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Philips PH2 screwdriver head, unscrew the two top screws.

Lines.Text: using a plastic opening tool , trace the edges of the router on all sides . gently pry the device until it eventually snaps open .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a plastic opening tool, trace the edges of the router on all sides.  Gently pry the device until it eventually snaps open.

Lines.Text: once you have removed the top black case of the router , remove the silver casing surrounding the logic board .
it should easily snap out of place .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have removed the top black case of the router, remove the silver casing surrounding the logic board. It should easily snap out of place.

Lines.Text: locate the two screws at the bottom of the logic board .
using the same ph2 head on your phillips screwdriver , unscrew these screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two screws at the bottom of the logic board. Using the same PH2 head on your Philips screwdriver, unscrew these screws.

Lines.Text: now that you have removed all screws and the surrounding silver casing , pop the logic board out from the bottom component of the router .
you have now removed the logic board from your device .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that you have removed all screws and the surrounding silver casing, pop the logic board out from the bottom component of the router. You have now removed the logic board from your device.

Subject: Logic Board

Title: D-Link EBR-2310 disassembly for cleaning

Lines.Text: begin by placing the wired router face down .
locate the two black plastic screw coverings at the top of the device and remove them with your fingers .
the two bottom plastic screw coverings do not need to be taken off .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by placing the wired router face down. Locate the two black plastic screw coverings at the top of the device and remove them with your fingers. The two bottom plastic screw coverings do not need to be taken off.

Lines.Text: using a phillips ph2 screwdriver head , unscrew the two top screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Philips PH2 screwdriver head, unscrew the two top screws.

Lines.Text: using a plastic opening tool , trace the edges of the router on all sides . gently pry the device until it eventually snaps open .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a plastic opening tool, trace the edges of the router on all sides.  Gently pry the device until it eventually snaps open.

Lines.Text: once you have removed the top black case of the router , remove the silver casing surrounding the logic board .
it should easily snap out of place .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have removed the top black case of the router, remove the silver casing surrounding the logic board. It should easily snap out of place.

Lines.Text: locate the two screws at the bottom of the logic board .
using the same ph2 head on your phillips screwdriver , unscrew these screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two screws at the bottom of the logic board. Using the same PH2 head on your Philips screwdriver, unscrew these screws.

Lines.Text: now that you have removed all screws and the surrounding silver casing , pop the logic board out from the bottom component of the router .
you have now removed the logic board from your device .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that you have removed all screws and the surrounding silver casing, pop the logic board out from the bottom component of the router. You have now removed the logic board from your device.

Lines.Text: once you have completely removed your logic board from its casing , look for any large dust particles and/or other dirt inside the router . gently remove these particles with your fingers .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have completely removed your logic board from its casing, look for any large dust particles and/or other dirt inside the router. Gently remove these particles with your fingers.

Lines.Text: locate the blue rubber wire coverings near the main cable connections of your motherboard . make sure that these are standing upright .
if they are not , gently use your wire tweezers to rearrange them in the correct upright position .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the blue rubber wire coverings near the main cable connections of your motherboard.  Make sure that these are standing upright. If they are not, gently use your wire tweezers to rearrange them in the correct upright position.

Lines.Text: locate the upright wire tube towards the middle left of the motherboard .
make sure that the wires are evenly spaced , not directly touching one another on the tube .
if the wires are not evenly spaced , gently use your spudger tool to separate them .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the upright wire tube towards the middle left of the motherboard. Make sure that the wires are evenly spaced, not directly touching one another on the tube. If the wires are not evenly spaced, gently use your spudger tool to separate them.

Lines.Text: using a soft cloth , gently wipe the top side of the motherboard .
be sure not to miss any small crevices .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a soft cloth, gently wipe the top side of the motherboard. Be sure not to miss any small crevices.

Lines.Text: using your cloth , gently wipe the metal slates around the cable connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your cloth, gently wipe the metal slates around the cable connectors.

Lines.Text: turn the motherboard on its back side and completely wipe away any small particles .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the motherboard on its back side and completely wipe away any small particles.

Lines.Text: fully wipe the top and bottom cases of the router .
dust easily gets stuck in these areas , especially the bottom case .

Steps.Text_raw: Fully wipe the top and bottom cases of the router. Dust easily gets stuck in these areas, especially the bottom case.

Lines.Text: wipe the cable connector compartments using the same soft cloth .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe the cable connector compartments using the same soft cloth.

Lines.Text: using a soft bristle toothbrush , brush the insides of the cable connectors in order to remove any hard-to-reach dust .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a soft bristle toothbrush, brush the insides of the cable connectors in order to remove any hard-to-reach dust.

Lines.Text: using the same toothbrush , brush the tiny crevices on the back side of the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the same toothbrush, brush the tiny crevices on the back side of the motherboard.

Lines.Text: after you have thoroughly brushed the back side of the motherboard , begin to do the same with the front side .
you have now cleaned the inside of your router . ventilation and performance should be excellent .

Steps.Text_raw: After you have thoroughly brushed the back side of the motherboard, begin to do the same with the front side. You have now cleaned the inside of your router.  Ventilation and performance should be excellent.

unscrew the 1 screw holding the flat power cable cover on .
