(careful : this may be sharp )

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor around. Unscrew the 1 screw holding the Flat power Cable cover on. Lift up and remove the Flat Power Cable cover. (Careful: this may be sharp)

Lines.Text: unscrew the 5 screws holding the metal cage on .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 5 screws holding the metal cage on.

Lines.Text: turn the monitor around .
lift the back of the metal cage slightly .
pull the cage toward self .
(must be careful to free the cover of the vga port and the power supply input )

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the monitor around. Lift the back of the metal cage slightly. Pull the cage toward self. (Must be careful to free the cover of the VGA port and the power supply input)

Lines.Text: lift the flat flex cable holder tabs to release the cables .
lift up on the flat flex cables and bend them out of the working area .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the Flat Flex Cable holder tabs to release the cables. Lift up on the Flat Flex Cables and bend them out of the working area.

Lines.Text: unplug the 4 backlight wires from their ports on the power supply board .
(considering their size , the best way to unplug the backlight wires is by slowly jiggling the wires out of place )

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the 4 backlight wires from their ports on the Power Supply Board. (Considering their size, the best way to unplug the backlight wires is by slowly jiggling the wires out of place)

Lines.Text: unscrew the 5 screws holding the power supply and video display boards .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 5 screws holding the Power  Supply and Video Display boards.

Lines.Text: lift and remove the joined boards .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and remove the joined boards.

Lines.Text: carefully detach the two boards at their connector joint .
replace outlined part .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully detach the two boards at their connector joint. Replace outlined part.

Subject: Video Display Board

Title: Canon PIXMA MP620B Command Screen Replacement

Lines.Text: open top lid of the printer to reveal the scanner

Steps.Text_raw: Open top lid of the printer to reveal the scanner

Lines.Text: insert the spudger tool into the top lid in between the blue and the black panels .
use this tool to pry the two panels apart

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the spudger tool into the top lid  in between the blue and the black panels. Use this tool to pry the two panels apart

Lines.Text: after these two panels are separated , set the top panel to the side for now

Steps.Text_raw: After these two panels are separated, set the top panel to the side for now

Lines.Text: unplug the two wires shown at the right of the command screen

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the two wires shown at the right of the command screen

Lines.Text: unscrew the four screws shown to detach the command screen from the printer

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four screws shown to detach the command screen from the printer

Lines.Text: take the detached command screen off of the printer and replace .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the detached command screen off of the printer and replace.

Title: AlphaSmart Pro Rear Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: power off your alphasmart pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly .
remove all eight 1 cm phillips head screws from the back panel of the alphasmart pro with the phillips 00 screwdriver .
carefully separate the front panel from the back panel .
notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Power off your AlphaSmart Pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly. Remove all eight 1 cm Phillips head screws from the back panel of the AlphaSmart Pro with the Phillips #00 Screwdriver. Carefully separate the front panel from the back panel. Notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket .
gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket .
remove front panel from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket. Gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket. Remove front panel from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use the phillips 00 screwdriver to remove the four 1 cm screws from each corner of the keyboard .
gently lift the keyboard from the rear panel .
notice that the keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by two ribbon cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #00 Screwdriver to remove the four 1 cm screws from each corner of the keyboard. Gently lift the keyboard from the rear panel. Notice that the keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by two ribbon cables.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , gently pull the connector in the direction of the ribbon cable .
pull the ribbon cable to remove it from the connector .
repeat the exact steps above for the other ribbon cable .
while the large connector on the left must be pulled toward you in order to remove the ribbon cable , the smaller connector on the right must be pushed away from you .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, gently pull the connector in the direction of the ribbon cable. Pull the ribbon cable to remove it from the connector. Repeat the exact steps above for the other ribbon cable. While the large connector on the left must be pulled toward you in order to remove the ribbon cable, the smaller connector on the right must be pushed away from you.

Lines.Text: remove keyboard from motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove keyboard from motherboard.

Lines.Text: flip the alphasmart pro over so that the rear panel is facing upward .
using a spludger , carefully disconnect the battery prongs , located in the battery compartment .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the AlphaSmart Pro over so that the rear panel is facing upward. Using a spludger, carefully disconnect the battery prongs, located in the battery compartment.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 00 screwdriver , remove the four 0.8 cm screws from the motherboard .
carefully lift the motherboard away from the rear panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #00 Screwdriver, remove the four 0.8 cm screws from the motherboard. Carefully lift the motherboard away from the rear panel.

Lines.Text: rear panel is separated from motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Rear panel is separated from motherboard.

Subject: Rear Panel

Title: Repairing Samsung SyncMaster 245B Power supply

Lines.Text: disconnect power cord
turn monitor face down on cloth to avoid scratches
remove stand by releasing screws around plate
with opener tool or screwdriver work around the edges to release the clips that hold together front bezel and back cover
remove back cover
remove cables to ccfl ( background illumination lamps ) and front bezel buttons
remove cage containing pcbs , release screws and remove smsp pcb ( power supply with power inlet connector )

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect power cord Turn monitor face down on cloth to avoid scratches Remove Stand by releasing screws around plate With opener tool or screwdriver work around the edges to release the clips that hold together front bezel and back cover Remove back cover Remove cables to CCFL (Background illumination lamps) and front bezel buttons Remove cage containing PCBs, release screws and remove SMSP PCB (Power supply with power inlet connector)

Lines.Text: red marked resistors are 68 ohm about 1 watt . measure if they have 68 ohm and replace if not
put back together and test .

Steps.Text_raw: Red marked resistors are 68Ohm about 1Watt. Measure if they have 68Ohm and replace if not Put back together and test.

Title: Samsung SyncMaster 2443 Backlight Inverter Replacement

Lines.Text: remove power cord .
remove the display stand by removing the two screws on the round plate on the backside of the monitor
open up the backside of the display ( display placed face down on cloth to avoid scratches ) by carefully releasing the snapped in latches using a screwdriver or opener tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove power cord. Remove the display stand by removing the two screws on the round plate on the backside of the monitor Open up the backside of the display (display placed face down on cloth to avoid scratches) by carefully releasing the snapped in latches using a screwdriver or opener tool.

Lines.Text: the metal cage housing the pcbs as just stuck to the backside of the lcd .
carefully remove adhesive strips , release the cables to lcd and front panel buttons .
remove smps pcb ( switching mode power supply ) by removing screws around .

Steps.Text_raw: The metal cage housing the PCBs as just stuck to the backside of the LCD. Carefully remove adhesive strips, release the cables to LCD and front panel buttons. Remove SMPS PCB (switching mode power supply) by removing screws around.

Lines.Text: from power board desolder transformer . it has 6 pins on one and 4 pins on the other side .
replace with new transformer .

Title: Verizon M1424WR Refresh Button Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the device so that the bottom is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device so that the bottom is facing up.

Lines.Text: insert the plastic-opening tool under the silver labeled casing .
carefully pry at different intervals around the silver labeled casing to separate the silver casing from the top and bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic-opening tool under the silver labeled casing. Carefully pry at different intervals around the silver labeled casing to separate the silver casing from the top and bottom casing.

Lines.Text: unscrew the five 10-mm screws on the bottom of the router using a phillips 0 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the five 10-mm screws on the bottom of the router using a Phillips #0 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use a plastic-opening tool and pry the top casing from the bottom casing to expose the circuit board in the bottom half of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic-opening tool and pry the top casing from the bottom casing to expose the circuit board in the bottom half of the device.

Lines.Text: locate the refresh button .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the refresh button.

Lines.Text: apply pressure with your finger to the black tab that retains the refresh button while using your other hand to pull the bottom of the refresh button from the post .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply pressure with your finger to the black tab that retains the refresh button while using your other hand to pull the bottom of the refresh button from the post.

Title: Dynex DX-WEGRTR Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the two phillips 00 screws in the bottom of the device securing the casing .
two 7.8 mm phillips screws
both of the screws are covered by the blue sticker , so they won't be visible instantly . try feeling the plastic with your screwdriver until you find the hollow openings .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two Phillips #00 screws in the bottom of the device securing the casing. Two 7.8 mm Phillips screws Both of the screws are covered by the blue sticker, so they won't be visible instantly. Try feeling the plastic with your screwdriver until you find the hollow openings.

Lines.Text: gently pry the edge of the vessel with a plastic opening tool , the previously used screwdriver , or your hands . move your tool around all the edges of the router until you get all four of the plastic holders .
when prying off the front edge of the router , be careful to not insert your tool too deep into the device , for you may damage the led connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry the edge of the vessel with a plastic opening tool, the previously used screwdriver, or your hands. Move your tool around all the edges of the router until you get all four of the plastic holders. When prying off the front edge of the router, be careful to not insert your tool too deep into the device, for you may damage the LED connectors.

Lines.Text: use your handy phillips screwdriver to unscrew the phillips 00 screw to the lower left side of the motherboard .
one 4.4 mm phillips 00 screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your handy Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the Phillips #00 screw to the lower left side of the motherboard. One 4.4 mm Phillips #00 screw.

Lines.Text: carefully slide the plastic housing of the antennas ( the back cover of the router ) up and out of its slot .
you may need to move the motherboard at this time in order to giggle the antenna's housing off .

be sure to remove the cable connecting the motherboard and the antenna from its holding compartment at the right edge of the router ( see image two ) . pulling on either the motherboard or the antenna's housing while the cable is still secured may damage either or both components .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully slide the plastic housing of the antennas (the back cover of the router) up and out of its slot. You may need to move the motherboard at this time in order to giggle the antenna's housing off. Be sure to remove the cable connecting the motherboard and the antenna from its holding compartment at the right edge of the router (See image two). Pulling on either the motherboard or the antenna's housing while the cable is still secured may damage either or both components.

Lines.Text: finally , remove the motherboard from its place making sure to not pull the cable connecting the antennas .

Steps.Text_raw: Finally, remove the motherboard from its place making sure to not pull the cable connecting the antennas.

Subject: Motherboard

Title: Epson Stylus NX305 Scanner Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure that the printer is not plugged in before working on it .
orient the printer so that the back of it is facing you .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure that the printer is not plugged in before working on it. Orient the printer so that the back of it is facing you.

Lines.Text: locate the 3 mm phillips 0 screw that is on the right-hand side of the printer .
using a phillips head screwdriver , remove the screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the 3mm Phillips #0 screw that is on the right-hand side of the printer. Using a Phillips head screwdriver, remove the screw.

Lines.Text: open up the lid of the printer .
with the printer facing away from you , lift up on the right hand side of the lid of the printer and slide it to the left to remove it .
be careful not to remove the white ribbon and wires that are connected .

Steps.Text_raw: Open up the lid of the printer. With the printer facing away from you, lift up on the right hand side of the lid of the printer and slide it to the left to remove it. Be careful not to remove the white ribbon and wires that are connected.

Lines.Text: with the printer facing you , open the lid of the scanner to expose the 3 mm phillips 0 screw at the top left of the scanner .
using a phillips head screwdriver , remove the screw .

Steps.Text_raw: With the printer facing you, open the lid of the scanner to expose the 3mm Phillips #0 screw at the top left of the scanner. Using a Phillips head screwdriver, remove the screw.

Lines.Text: locate the six 3 mm phillips 2 screws under the lid of the printer and remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the six 3mm Phillips #2 screws under the lid of the printer and remove them.

Lines.Text: locate the three clips on the front side of the printer lid .
use the plastic opening tool to release the clips and carefully pry open the lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the three clips on the front side of the printer lid. Use the plastic opening tool to release the clips and carefully pry open the lid.

Lines.Text: locate the belt that is attached to the scanner motor and remove it by carefully stretching off of the gear .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the belt that is attached to the scanner motor and remove it by carefully stretching off of the gear.

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 mm phillips 2 screws from the scanner motor assembly .
carefully lift the scanner motor assembly out of the housing making sure not to damage the wiring .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3mm Phillips #2 screws from the scanner motor assembly. Carefully lift the scanner motor assembly  out of the housing making sure not to damage the wiring.

Lines.Text: flip over the scanner motor assembly to expose the scanner motor .
remove the two 3 mm phillips 2 screws from the assembly and remove the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip over the scanner motor assembly to expose the scanner motor. Remove the two 3mm Phillips #2 screws from the assembly and remove the motor.

Subject: Scanner Motor

Lines.Text: there are a few tabs on the top of the panel that hook down and into the black side panel . insert the tool in-between the black panel and the blue panel as shown and pull the two pieces apart .
you will hear some snapping . don't panic : this is just the hooks un-clipping .

Steps.Text_raw: There are a few tabs on the top of the panel that hook down and into the black side panel. Insert the tool in-between the black panel and the blue panel as shown and pull the two pieces apart. You will hear some snapping. Don't panic: this is just the hooks un-clipping.

Lines.Text: unscrew 2 screws from the back right black panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew 2 screws from the back right black panel.

Lines.Text: there is a tab you will have to push down to remove the part .
once the tab is released the cover must be gently lifted away from the rest of the device to disengage the clips .
you will hear some snapping . don't panic : this is just the clips un-clipping .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a tab you will have to push down to remove the part. Once the tab is released the cover must be gently lifted away from the rest of the device to disengage the clips. You will hear some snapping. Don't panic: this is just the clips un-clipping.

Lines.Text: after unclipping all the hooks , pull off the black side panel to reveal the inner circuit boards .

Steps.Text_raw: After unclipping all the hooks, pull off the black side panel to reveal the inner circuit boards.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two screws shown .
the angle for unscrewing the two screws can be somewhat challenging , try not to get too frustrated

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two screws shown. The angle for unscrewing the two screws can be somewhat challenging, try not to get too frustrated

Lines.Text: there is a large white wire that leads to the usb chip . as you are pulling out the chip , detach the wire .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a large white wire that leads to the USB chip. As you are pulling out the chip, detach the wire.

Title: Canon PIXMA MP620B Ink Head Replacement

Lines.Text: there are a few tabs on the top of the panel that hook down and into the black side panel . insert the tool in-between the black panel and the blue panel as shown and pull the two pieces apart .
you will hear some snapping . don't panic : this is just the hooks un-clipping .

Steps.Text_raw: There are a few tabs on the top of the panel that hook down and into the black side panel. Insert the tool in-between the black panel and the blue panel as shown and pull the two pieces apart. You will hear some snapping. Don't panic: this is just the hooks un-clipping.

Lines.Text: repeat the same process as the left side panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat the same process as the left side panel.

Lines.Text: unhook the lid support by sliding the hook down and to the left . make sure the support is fully disconnected before proceeding .

Steps.Text_raw: Unhook the lid support by sliding the hook down and to the left. Make sure the support is fully disconnected before proceeding.

Lines.Text: remove the four black screws on the back panels from both the left and right side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four black screws on the back panels from both the left and right side.

Lines.Text: remove the scanner by pulling the side panels out until the scanner pin is free . set the scanner aside .
the scanner will still be attached with wires on the right side . be careful not to yank the part away from the main body of the printer

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the scanner by pulling the side panels out until the scanner pin is free.  Set the scanner aside. The scanner will still be attached with wires on the right side. Be careful not to yank the part away from the main body of the printer

Lines.Text: press down on the clip on the left side of the printer until it clicks , and pull the panel free .

Steps.Text_raw: Press down on the clip on the left side of the printer until it clicks, and pull the panel free.

Lines.Text: press down on the clip on the right side panel until it clicks , and the pull the panel free .

Steps.Text_raw: Press down on the clip on the right side panel until it clicks, and the pull the panel free.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic cover by depressing the clip located on the right side of the printer . press the clip inwards until it clicks , and then lift the cover upwards and off the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic cover by depressing the clip located on the right side of the printer. Press the clip inwards until it clicks, and then lift the cover upwards and off the printer.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three screws holding the rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three screws holding the rail.

Lines.Text: remove the cord by pulling upwards on it and unhooking it from the pulleys on either end .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cord by pulling upwards on it and unhooking it from the pulleys on either end.

Lines.Text: remove the ink head by pulling it away from the rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the ink head by pulling it away from the rail.

Subject: Ink Head

Title: AlphaSmart Pro Display Screen Replacement

Lines.Text: power off your alphasmart pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly .
remove all eight 1 cm phillips head screws from the back panel of the alphasmart pro with the phillips 00 screwdriver .
carefully separate the front panel from the back panel .
notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Power off your AlphaSmart Pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly. Remove all eight 1 cm Phillips head screws from the back panel of the AlphaSmart Pro with the Phillips #00 Screwdriver. Carefully separate the front panel from the back panel. Notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket .
gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket .
you are now able to separate the front panel from the back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket. Gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket. You are now able to separate the front panel from the back panel.

Lines.Text: looking at the front panel , use the phillips 00 screwdriver to remove the four phillips head 0.8 cm screws from each corner of the display motherboard .
lift the display screen and motherboard from the plastic front panel to separate the two pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Looking at the front panel, use the Phillips #00 screwdriver to remove the four Phillips head 0.8 cm screws from each corner of the display motherboard. Lift the display screen and motherboard from the plastic front panel to separate the two pieces.

Lines.Text: to remove the small motherboard from the display screen , use the flat needle nose pliers or the angled tweezers to carefully bend the 12 metal tabs so that they can be pushed through the small slots .
you must also lift up the transparent tape that covers two of these tabs .
separate the display screen and small motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the small motherboard from the display screen, use the flat needle nose pliers or the angled tweezers to carefully bend the 12 metal tabs so that they can be pushed through the small slots. You must also lift up the transparent tape that covers two of these tabs. Separate the display screen and small motherboard.

Subject: Display Screen

Title: AlphaSmart Pro Lithium Coin Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: removing the lithium coin battery will erase existing files . make sure all important files have been safely transferred to another device before attempting to remove the lithium coin battery .
power off your alphasmart pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly .
remove the eight 1 cm phillips head screws from the back panel of the alphasmart pro with the phillips 00 screwdriver .
carefully separate the front panel from the back panel .
notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Removing the lithium coin battery will erase existing files. Make sure all important files have been safely transferred to another device before attempting to remove the lithium coin battery. Power off your AlphaSmart Pro device and remove the batteries before beginning disassembly. Remove the eight 1 cm Phillips head screws from the back panel of the AlphaSmart Pro with the Phillips #00 Screwdriver. Carefully separate the front panel from the back panel. Notice that the front and back panels are still connected by a ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: to remove the ribbon cable , use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket .
gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the ribbon cable, use the spudger to lift each side of the connector from the socket. Gently pull up on the connector to completely remove the connector from the socket.

Lines.Text: with the front panel removed , locate the lithium coin battery at the top left corner of the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: With the front panel removed, locate the lithium coin battery at the top left corner of the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use the spudger , plastic opening tool , or your finger/fingernail to lift up the lithium coin battery .
slide the battery out from underneath the clip that holds it in place .
the positive side of the battery is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the spudger, plastic opening tool, or your finger/fingernail to lift up the lithium coin battery. Slide the battery out from underneath the clip that holds it in place. The positive side of the battery is facing up.

Subject: Lithium Coin Battery

Title: Apple Airport Extreme Model A1408 Antenna Replacement

Lines.Text: caution : the heat gun and hair dryer can get very hot . do not put your hands or any other body part too close to either device . also , do not touch the back pad right after heating it .
use a blow dryer or heat gun on a medium to high heat setting on the back pad to loosen the glue that attaches it to the device .

Steps.Text_raw: CAUTION: The heat gun and hair dryer can get very hot. Do not put your hands or any other body part too close to either device. Also, do not touch the back pad right after heating it. Use a blow dryer or heat gun on a medium to high heat setting on the back pad to loosen the glue that attaches it to the device.

Lines.Text: to avoid ripping the back pad , gently peel it back from one corner until the pad is completely off .
use heat in areas where the glue is not loose enough .
you may need to reattach the back pad with double-sided tape if the glue is not tacky enough to stick the pad back on .

Steps.Text_raw: To avoid ripping the back pad, gently peel it back from one corner until the pad is completely off. Use heat in areas where the glue is not loose enough. You may need to reattach the back pad with double-sided tape if the glue is not tacky enough to stick the pad back on.

Lines.Text: after removing the back pad , unscrew the five 5 mm phillips 00 screws in the large , deep holes in the plastic casing . the plastic casing should come off easily after removing all the screws .
when installing the plastic back cover , ensure the lip is aligned with the ports on the back of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the back pad, unscrew the five 5 mm Phillips #00 screws in the large, deep holes in the plastic casing. The plastic casing should come off easily after removing all the screws. When installing the plastic back cover, ensure the lip is aligned with the ports on the back of the device.

Lines.Text: insert a narrow plastic opening tool into one of the notches . apply moderate force to pull the metal casing from the plastic outer casing . you can use the rim of the outer case as leverage . you should hear a click when the metal casing detaches .
after you hear the click , remove the inner metal case from the outer case using your hands . it should not take very much force .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a narrow plastic opening tool into one of the notches. Apply moderate force to pull the metal casing from the plastic outer casing. You can use the rim of the outer case as leverage. You should hear a click when the metal casing detaches. After you hear the click, remove the inner metal case from the outer case using your hands. It should not take very much force.

Lines.Text: remove the four wires coming from the antennas by pinching the cable at the tip and gently pulling up on it until it pops out of the socket .
repeat for the remaining three wires .
you might need to wiggle the wire to free it from the socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four wires coming from the antennas by pinching the cable at the tip and gently pulling up on it until it pops out of the socket. Repeat for the remaining three wires. You might need to wiggle the wire to free it from the socket.

Lines.Text: separate the logic board from the inner metal casing by gently pushing up on the logic board from the bottom while holding down the casing edges .
pull the logic board away from the metal casing to separate the two .

Lines.Text: remove the tape that attaches the wire to the logic board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tape that attaches the wire to the logic board.

Lines.Text: lift wire out of its port . you should have one free end now .

Title: Apple Airport Extreme Model A1408 WiFi Card Replacement

Lines.Text: caution : the heat gun and hair dryer can get very hot . do not put your hands or any other body part too close to either device . also , do not touch the back pad right after heating it .
use a blow dryer or heat gun on a medium to high heat setting on the back pad to loosen the glue that attaches it to the device .

Steps.Text_raw: CAUTION: The heat gun and hair dryer can get very hot. Do not put your hands or any other body part too close to either device. Also, do not touch the back pad right after heating it. Use a blow dryer or heat gun on a medium to high heat setting on the back pad to loosen the glue that attaches it to the device.

Lines.Text: to avoid ripping the back pad , gently peel it back from one corner until the pad is completely off .
use heat in areas where the glue is not loose enough .
you may need to reattach the back pad with double-sided tape if the glue is not tacky enough to stick the pad back on .

Steps.Text_raw: To avoid ripping the back pad, gently peel it back from one corner until the pad is completely off. Use heat in areas where the glue is not loose enough. You may need to reattach the back pad with double-sided tape if the glue is not tacky enough to stick the pad back on.

Lines.Text: after removing the back pad , unscrew the five 5 mm phillips 00 screws in the large , deep holes in the plastic casing . the plastic casing should come off easily after removing all the screws .
when installing the plastic back cover , ensure the lip is aligned with the ports on the back of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the back pad, unscrew the five 5 mm Phillips #00 screws in the large, deep holes in the plastic casing. The plastic casing should come off easily after removing all the screws. When installing the plastic back cover, ensure the lip is aligned with the ports on the back of the device.

Lines.Text: insert a narrow plastic opening tool into one of the notches . apply moderate force to pull the metal casing from the plastic outer casing . you can use the rim of the outer case as leverage . you should hear a click when the metal casing detaches .
after you hear the click , remove the inner metal case from the outer case using your hands . it should not take very much force .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a narrow plastic opening tool into one of the notches. Apply moderate force to pull the metal casing from the plastic outer casing. You can use the rim of the outer case as leverage. You should hear a click when the metal casing detaches. After you hear the click, remove the inner metal case from the outer case using your hands. It should not take very much force.

Lines.Text: remove the four wires coming from the antennas by pinching the cable at the tip and gently pulling up on it until it pops out of the socket .
repeat for the remaining three wires .
you might need to wiggle the wire to free it from the socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four wires coming from the antennas by pinching the cable at the tip and gently pulling up on it until it pops out of the socket. Repeat for the remaining three wires. You might need to wiggle the wire to free it from the socket.

Lines.Text: remove the 5 mm phillips 00 screw from the right side of the wifi card .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5 mm Phillips #00 screw from the  right side of the WiFi card.

Lines.Text: do not pull the wifi card directly up or you may damage the slot and the logic board .
remove the wifi card by gripping it on both sides and gently pulling it directly out of the slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not pull the WiFi card directly up or you may damage the slot and the logic board. Remove the WiFi card by gripping it on both sides and gently pulling it directly out of the slot.

Title: Verizon M1424WR Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the device so that the bottom is facing up .

Lines.Text: insert the plastic-opening tool under the silver labeled casing .
carefully pry at different intervals around the silver labeled casing to separate the silver casing from the top and bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic-opening tool under the silver labeled casing. Carefully pry at different intervals around the silver labeled casing to separate the silver casing from the top and bottom casing.

Lines.Text: unscrew the five 10-mm screws on the bottom of the router using a phillips 0 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the five 10-mm screws on the bottom of the router using a Phillips #0 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use a plastic-opening tool and pry the top casing from the bottom casing to expose the circuit board in the bottom half of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic-opening tool and pry the top casing from the bottom casing to expose the circuit board in the bottom half of the device.

Lines.Text: locate the two 10-mm screws on either side of the circuit board .
unscrew the two 10-mm screws using a phillips 0 screwdriver .
keep track of the red rubber washer you remove from underneath one of the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two 10-mm screws on either side of the circuit board. Unscrew the two 10-mm screws using a Phillips #0 screwdriver. Keep track of the red rubber washer you remove from underneath one of the screws.

Lines.Text: lift the front of the circuit board up from the bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the front of the circuit board up from the bottom casing.

Lines.Text: pull the circuit board towards you until it is separate from the bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the circuit board towards you until it is separate from the bottom casing.

Title: Verizon M1424WR Capacitor Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the device so that the bottom is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device so that the bottom is facing up.

Lines.Text: insert the plastic-opening tool under the silver labeled casing .
carefully pry at different intervals around the silver labeled casing to separate the silver casing from the top and bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic-opening tool under the silver labeled casing. Carefully pry at different intervals around the silver labeled casing to separate the silver casing from the top and bottom casing.

Lines.Text: unscrew the five 10-mm screws on the bottom of the router using a phillips 0 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the five 10-mm screws on the bottom of the router using a Phillips #0 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use a plastic-opening tool and pry the top casing from the bottom casing to expose the circuit board in the bottom half of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic-opening tool and pry the top casing from the bottom casing to expose the circuit board in the bottom half of the device.

Lines.Text: locate the two 10-mm screws on either side of the circuit board .
unscrew the two 10-mm screws using a phillips 0 screwdriver .
keep track of the red rubber washer you remove from underneath one of the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two 10-mm screws on either side of the circuit board. Unscrew the two 10-mm screws using a Phillips #0 screwdriver. Keep track of the red rubber washer you remove from underneath one of the screws.

Lines.Text: lift the front of the circuit board up from the bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the front of the circuit board up from the bottom casing.

Lines.Text: pull the circuit board towards you until it is separate from the bottom casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the circuit board towards you until it is separate from the bottom casing.

Lines.Text: locate the capacitor .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the capacitor.

Lines.Text: flip the circuit board over .
locate the two prongs on the flip side that are attached to the capacitor on the top side .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the circuit board over. Locate the two prongs on the flip side that are attached to the capacitor on the top side.

Lines.Text: touch the hot soldering iron to each prong in order to melt the solder around them .
flip the circuit board and pull out the capacitor from its place while the solder is still hot .
for help with soldering techniques , click topic : solderinghere .

Steps.Text_raw: Touch the hot soldering iron to each prong in order to melt the solder around them. Flip the circuit board and pull out the capacitor from its place while the solder is still hot. For help with soldering techniques, click [[Topic:Soldering|here]].

Lines.Text: insert the new capacitor through the circuit board so that the prongs are exposed on the flip side .
heat the prongs up with the soldering iron and touch a soldering wire to the hot prongs to attach the capacitor to the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the new capacitor through the circuit board so that the prongs are exposed on the flip side. Heat the prongs up with the soldering iron and touch a soldering wire to the hot prongs to attach the capacitor to the board.

Subject: Capacitor

Title: CM Storm QuickFire Rapid Switch Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the keycap of the key whose switch you'd like to replace by following the guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the keycap of the key whose switch you'd like to replace by following the [guide|31871|small keycap replacement guide] or l[guide|32202|arge keycap replacement guide].

Lines.Text: using a phillips 0 screwdriver , remove the . 5cm screw from the back of the keyboard .
this will void your warranty !
when inserting the screw after replacing the switch , make sure to not screw in too tight . this may cause erratic behavior with the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Philips #0 screwdriver, remove the .5cm screw from the back of the keyboard. This will void your warranty! When inserting the screw after replacing the switch, make sure to not screw in too tight. This may cause erratic behavior with the keyboard.

Lines.Text: wedge a plastic opening tool between the rear plate and rim of the keyboard and slide it through the circled areas to separate the plastic hooks that mount the rim to the rear plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a plastic opening tool between the rear plate and rim of the keyboard and slide it through the circled areas to separate the plastic hooks that mount the rim to the rear plate.

Lines.Text: firmly grasp the bottom panel of the keyboard and carefully detach it from the rest of the board .
do not put strain on the ribbon cable when lifting the bottom panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grasp the bottom panel of the keyboard and carefully detach it from the rest of the board. Do not put strain on the ribbon cable when lifting the bottom panel.

Lines.Text: detach the 4-pin cable from the bottom panel of the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the 4-pin cable from the bottom panel of the keyboard.

Lines.Text: desolder the joints holding the switch to the board .
remove the switch and solder the new switch in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the joints holding the switch to the board. Remove the switch and solder the new switch in place.

Subject: Switch

this will void your warranty !
when inserting the screw after fixing the faulty led , make sure to not screw in too tight . this may cause erratic behavior with the keyboard .

do not put strain on the ribbon cable when lifting the bottom panel .

Lines.Text: detach the 4-pin cable from the bottom panel of the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the 4-pin cable from the bottom panel of the keyboard.

Lines.Text: the joints holding the faulty led and switch to the pcb .
slide the faulty led out and replace it with the functional one .

Title: CM Storm QuickFire Rapid O-ring: Large Keycap Installation

Lines.Text: remove keycaps surrounding the key you'd like to install an o-ring under by following the guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove keycaps surrounding the key you'd like to install an O-ring under by following the [guide|31871|remove small keycaps guide].

Lines.Text: pull the large keycap upward with your fingers until the cap separates from the plastic rings underneath the cap . if the metal bar beneath the cap comes loose during removal , snap it back in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the large keycap upward with your fingers until the cap separates from the plastic rings underneath the cap. If the metal bar beneath the cap comes loose during removal, snap it back in place.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic rings from the keycap .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic rings from the keycap.

Lines.Text: place the o-rings around the nubs underneath the keycap at each circled locations .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the O-rings around the nubs underneath the keycap at each circled locations.

Title: HP Photosmart Premium e-All-in-One C310a Power Button Replacement

Lines.Text: tilt the touchscreen as far forward as possible .
remove the two ( 2 ) 15 mm t-10 torx screws from behind the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the touchscreen as far forward as possible. Remove the two (2) 15mm T-10 Torx screws from behind the screen.

Lines.Text: once the screws are removed , apply a steady upward force on the front bottom corners of the screen until it pops loose .
be careful to not move the screen too far from the printer before disconnecting it . you may damage the connections within the printer if you do .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screws are removed, apply a steady upward force on the front bottom corners of the screen until it pops loose. Be careful to not move the screen too far from the printer before disconnecting it. You may damage the connections within the printer if you do.

Lines.Text: before removing the ribbon cable , flip the black bar up to unlock the cable . grab the blue area of the cable near the connector and pull straight out of the socket .
pull this plug straight out of the socket slowly .
be careful when pulling out these ribbon cables . if you pull too hard or don't unlock the cable , you can damage the connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Before removing the ribbon cable, flip the black bar up to unlock the cable. Grab the blue area of the cable near the connector and pull straight out of the socket. Pull this plug straight out of the socket slowly. Be careful when pulling out these ribbon cables. If you pull too hard or don't unlock the cable, you can damage the connection.

Lines.Text: once the ribbon cables have been removed , your screen should be free of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the ribbon cables have been removed, your screen should be free of the printer.

Lines.Text: lift the scanning cover until it is vertical .
press on the cover near the two hinges .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the scanning cover until it is vertical. Press on the cover near the two hinges.

Lines.Text: pull the plate from the middle away from the printer until the tab is free .
slide the plate towards the back of the printer until the latches are released .
remove both side plates before you proceed .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the plate from the middle away from the printer until the tab is free. Slide the plate towards the back of the printer until the latches are released. Remove both side plates before you proceed.

Lines.Text: remove the five ( 5 ) 15 mm t10 torx screws .
lift the scanner surface from the front where the screen was to remove it .
if you are only trying to clean the glass , stop here and follow the instructions in reverse order to reassemble your device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five (5) 15mm T10 Torx screws. Lift the scanner surface from the front where the screen was to remove it. If you are only trying to clean the glass, stop here and follow the instructions in reverse order to reassemble your device.

Lines.Text: make sure you are careful with the glass , as it can cut you if it breaks .
apply force to the glass near where it is joined with the scanner surface .
once the glass is removed , insert your new replacement glass and make sure it is firmly attached to the scanner surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure you are careful with the glass, as it can cut you if it breaks. Apply force to the glass near where it is joined with the scanner surface. Once the glass is removed, insert your new replacement glass and make sure it is firmly attached to the scanner surface.

Lines.Text: pull the side of the cover plate away from the printer until it is off of the locking peg .
pull the middle of the cover plate away from the printer until the tab in the middle is free .
slide the cover plate to the right to disengage the latch .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the side of the cover plate away from the printer until it is off of the locking peg. Pull the middle of the cover plate away from the printer until the tab in the middle is free. Slide the cover plate to the right to disengage the latch.

Lines.Text: remove the 7 mm t7 torx screw holding the board to the cover panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 7mm T7 Torx screw holding the board to the cover panel.

Lines.Text: lift the power button board off the holding peg .
the power button board is now free from the cover panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the power button board off the holding peg. The power button board is now free from the cover panel.

Subject: Power Button

Title: HP Photosmart Premium C309g TouchSmart Display Screen  Replacement

Lines.Text: open the top of printer . the printer should appear as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the top of printer. The printer should appear as shown.

Lines.Text: use the blue plastic opening tool to pry the trim pieces all the way around the printer .
loosen the pieces around the edges before pulling to remove from the printer .
pull the ( 4 ) trim pieces off and set them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the blue plastic opening tool to pry the trim pieces all the way around the printer. Loosen the pieces around the edges before pulling to remove from the printer. Pull the (4) trim pieces off and set them aside.

Lines.Text: using the blue plastic opening tool , pull from the middle and then slide back to remove the side panels .
the side trim pieces need to be removed before the front trim pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the blue plastic opening tool, pull from the middle and then slide back to remove the side panels. The side trim pieces need to be removed before the front trim pieces.

Lines.Text: using the t9 torx security screwdriver bit , unscrew the five 12 mm screws shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the T9 Torx Security screwdriver bit, unscrew the five 12mm screws shown.

Lines.Text: the scanner flap is attached by a clip that can be dislodged by pulling it gently away from the printer .
keeping the scanner flap upright , slide it toward the unattached clip in order to dislodge the second clip .
both clips will come unattached and you can set the scanner flap aside .

Steps.Text_raw: The scanner flap is attached by a clip that can be dislodged by pulling it gently away from the printer. Keeping the scanner flap upright, slide it toward the unattached clip in order to dislodge the second clip. Both clips will come unattached and you can set the scanner flap aside.

Lines.Text: lift the scanner glass piece from the printer and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the scanner glass piece from the printer and set it aside.

Lines.Text: gently pull the display screen away from the printer .
locate unscrew the two 12 mm screws using the t9 torx security screwdriver bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the display screen away from the printer. Locate & unscrew the two 12mm screws using the T9 Torx Security screwdriver bit.

Lines.Text: place thumb and forefinger where shown and pull this piece away from the printer .
do not pull it away too hard . the piece is still connected by wiring ribbon .

Steps.Text_raw: Place thumb and forefinger where shown and pull this piece away from the printer. Do not pull it away too hard. The piece is still connected by wiring ribbon.

Lines.Text: pull both wiring ribbons out from the display screen piece . this will separate the piece from the printer .
use tweezers if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull both wiring ribbons out from the display screen piece. This will separate the piece from the printer. Use tweezers if necessary.

Lines.Text: push forward and down to release the retaining piece . this will detach the display screen from the front panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Push forward and down to release the retaining piece. This will detach the display screen from the front panel.

Lines.Text: set the display screen face down .
locate and unscrew all four 12 mm screws on the back on the display screen using the t9 torx security screwdriver bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the display screen face down. Locate and unscrew all four 12mm screws on the back on the display screen using the T9 Torx Security screwdriver bit.

Lines.Text: lift the back of the display screen to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the back of the display screen to remove it.

Lines.Text: open the top of the printer . the printer should appear as shown .

Lines.Text: use the blue plastic opening tool to pry the trim pieces all the way around the printer .
loosen the pieces around the edges before pulling to remove from the printer .
pull the ( 4 ) trim pieces off and set them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the blue plastic opening tool to pry the trim pieces all the way around the printer. Loosen the pieces around the edges before pulling to remove from the printer. Pull the (4) trim pieces off and set them aside.

Lines.Text: using the blue plastic opening tool , pull from the middle and then slide back to remove the side panels .
the side trim pieces need to be removed before the front trim pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the blue plastic opening tool, pull from the middle and then slide back to remove the side panels. The side trim pieces need to be removed before the front trim pieces.

Lines.Text: using the t9 torx security screwdriver bit , unscrew the five 12 mm screws shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the T9 Torx Security screwdriver bit, unscrew the five 12mm screws shown.

Lines.Text: the scanner flap is attached by a clip that can be dislodged by pulling it gently away from the printer .
keeping the scanner flap upright , slide it toward the unattached clip in order to dislodge the second clip .
both clips will come unattached and you can set the scanner flap aside .

Steps.Text_raw: The scanner flap is attached by a clip that can be dislodged by pulling it gently away from the printer. Keeping the scanner flap upright, slide it toward the unattached clip in order to dislodge the second clip. Both clips will come unattached and you can set the scanner flap aside.

Lines.Text: lift the scanner glass piece from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the scanner glass piece from the printer.

Lines.Text: the scanner glass is attached to the plastic piece with adhesive tape .
pull off the glass and re-set new piece of glass .

Title: HP Photosmart Premium C309g Wireless Card Replacement

Lines.Text: open the top of the printer as shown .
the wireless card is located on the left side of the printer if you are viewing it from the front .

Title: HP Deskjet 3000 j310a Repair Control Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: begin to disassemble the printer by disconnecting from all power sources and computers . keep cords separate and allow the printer to cool for 5 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin to disassemble the printer by disconnecting from all power sources and computers.  Keep cords separate and allow the printer to cool for 5 minutes.

Lines.Text: flip the printer upside down and locate the cover on the left hand side . it is rectangular shape and is held in place by two screws . unscrew these screws and take off cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the printer upside down and locate the cover on the left hand side.  It is rectangular shape and is held in place by two screws.  Unscrew these screws and take off cover.

Lines.Text: to release the tray from the printer , you must manually pull it out . hold the tray and push towards one side of the printer . then pull away from the printer towards the other side . keep output tray separate .

Steps.Text_raw: To release the tray from the printer, you must manually pull it out.  Hold the tray and push towards one side of the printer.  Then pull away from the printer towards the other side.  Keep output tray separate.

Lines.Text: turn the printer upside down . locate the four screws holding the cover in place . these will be on the edges of the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer upside down.  Locate the four screws holding the cover in place. These will be on the edges of the cover.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four screws , keeping them separate . turn the printer back right side up

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four screws, keeping them separate.  Turn the printer back right side up

Lines.Text: place fingers on the edge of the red cover . begin to pull upwards to release the top portion , working your way around the printer . make sure that it does not fall back into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Place fingers on the edge of the red cover.  Begin to pull upwards to release the top portion, working your way around the printer.  Make sure that it does not fall back into place.

Lines.Text: once the top is loose , there will still be a connection wire between the printer and the cover . this wire will be about one inch wide and white , located under the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the top is loose, there will still be a connection wire between the printer and the cover.  This wire will be about one inch wide and white, located under the buttons.

Lines.Text: detach the wire from the printer by pulling the blue-sealed end from the white holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the wire from the printer by pulling the blue-sealed end from the white holder.

Lines.Text: now that the top cover is removed from the printer body you will need to separate the control panel from the maroon panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the top cover is removed from the printer body you will need to separate the control panel from the maroon panel.

Lines.Text: the control panel is connected to the maroon panel by four plastic hooks ( two are seen in the picture and the other two are opposite them ) . using a plastic opening tool pry each hook out of its locked position .

Steps.Text_raw: The control panel is connected to the maroon panel by four plastic hooks (two are seen in the picture and the other two are opposite them). Using a plastic opening tool pry each hook out of its locked position.

Lines.Text: you will need to remove the button , button circuit board , and screen in order to replace the control panel .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need to remove the button, button circuit board, and screen in order to replace the control panel.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three screws indicated in the image . unplug the connection from the screen , lift up the board , and remove from the panel . pull the button out .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three screws indicated in the image. Unplug the connection from the screen, lift up the board, and remove from the panel. Pull the button out.

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool pry the black tabs back and lift the screen out of the control panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool pry the black tabs back and lift the screen out of the control panel.

Subject: Control Panel

Title: HP Officejet J3680 Keypad Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the plug from the outlet and from the back of the device
remove the usb cable from your computer and from the back of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plug from the outlet and from the back of the device Remove the USB Cable from your computer and from the back of the device.

Lines.Text: using your torx t10 screwdriver , remove the screws indicated in the picture . screws are 13 mm in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your Torx T10 screwdriver, remove the screws indicated in the picture. Screws are 13mm in length.

Lines.Text: using your torx t10 screwdriver , remove the screws indicated in the picture . screws are 13 mm in length

Steps.Text_raw: Using your Torx T10 screwdriver, remove the screws indicated in the picture. Screws are 13mm in length

Lines.Text: in step 2 , you removed the screw from the blue indicated area .
gently pop off the black cover that the phone rests on . underneath this cover , you will find two more screws .
using your torx t10 screwdriver , remove the screws indicated in the picture . screws are 13 mm in length

Steps.Text_raw: In step 2, you removed the screw from the blue indicated area. Gently pop off the black cover that the phone rests on. Underneath this cover, you will find two more screws. Using your Torx T10 screwdriver, remove the screws indicated in the picture. Screws are 13mm in length

Lines.Text: using your torx t10 screwdriver , remove the screws indicated in the picture . screws are 13 mm in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your Torx T10 screwdriver, remove the screws indicated in the picture. Screws are 13mm in length.

Lines.Text: once the rear plastic panel has been removed , you are ready to replace and repair the necessary parts .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the rear plastic panel has been removed, you are ready to replace and repair the necessary parts.

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , pry off the front black plastic panel on screen area . this panel has the hp symbol on the front .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, Pry off the front black plastic panel on screen area. This panel has the HP symbol on the front.

Lines.Text: using the t10 torx screwdriver , unscrew the 7 screws on the panel indicated in the picture . these screws are 13 mm in length .
then , remove this panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the T10 Torx screwdriver, unscrew the 7 screws on the panel indicated in the picture. These screws are 13mm in length. Then, remove this panel.

Lines.Text: pull off the rubber buttons . this will come off easily .
you will see the green motherboard underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull off the rubber buttons. This will come off easily. You will see the green motherboard underneath.

Lines.Text: remove black paper tray by pulling it straight out . if you are standing directly in front of it , you will be pulling it toward you .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove black paper tray by pulling it straight out. If you are standing directly in front of it, you will be pulling it toward you.

Lines.Text: pull off the entire black front panel ( where the motherboard rest on ) by unfolding it forward ( as if youre fixing a paper jam ) and pull it forward until it pops off .
begin with the right side first . once the right side is free , do the same on the left side .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull off the entire black front panel (where the motherboard rest on) by unfolding it forward (as if you’re fixing a paper jam) and pull it forward until it pops off. Begin with the right side first. Once the right side is free, do the same on the left side.

Lines.Text: follow the wires from the left side of the keypad motherboard ( on the panel you just removed ) to the main motherboard and carefully unplug the wires from the main motherboard ( located in the upper left corner . )

Steps.Text_raw: Follow the wires from the left side of the keypad motherboard (on the panel you just removed) to the main motherboard and carefully unplug the wires from the main motherboard (located in the upper left corner.)

Lines.Text: wiggle wires through the hole in the bottom left corner of the printer so that the keypad motherboard panel disconnects completely from the printer .
to easily fit it through the hole , turn the white piece at the tip of the wires horizontally .

Steps.Text_raw: Wiggle wires through the hole in the bottom left corner of the printer so that the keypad motherboard panel disconnects completely from the printer. To easily fit it through the hole, turn the white piece at the tip of the wires horizontally.

Lines.Text: finally , pull wires upward , where the black tape on the wires is .
the green motherboard will become disconnected from the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Finally, pull wires upward, where the black tape on the wires is. The green motherboard will become disconnected from the panel.

Lines.Text: reverse the steps to replace your new keypad motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Reverse the steps to replace your new keypad motherboard.

Subject: Keypad Motherboard

Lines.Text: pull the narrower cord out of its connection , holding the blue-sealed end .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the narrower cord out of its connection, holding the blue-sealed end.

Steps.Text_raw: Move the hard drive forward and angle downwards so that the larger cord is easier to hold.  Pull out of connection holding the cord from the blue-sealed end.

Lines.Text: the hard drive will remain loosely attached because of the wires . do not disconnect these , but lift out of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: The hard drive will remain loosely attached because of the wires.  Do not disconnect these, but lift out of the printer.

Lines.Text: locate the belt , and the wheel it is around . the wheel will be on top of the metal piece on the far right side .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the belt, and the wheel it is around.  The wheel will be on top of the metal piece on the far right side.

Lines.Text: pull the belt tightly to this side , creating enough slack to lift the belt from the wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the belt tightly to this side, creating enough slack to lift the belt from the wheel.

Lines.Text: push the ink cartridge to the center of the printer so that the wheel on the opposite side is visible . then lift the belt from that wheel .

Lines.Text: locate the narrow hard drive on the left side of the printer . unscrew the screw holding it in place , then disconnect the cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the narrow hard drive on the left side of the printer.  Unscrew the screw holding it in place, then disconnect the cord.

Lines.Text: remove the hard drive , keeping separate from printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the hard drive, keeping separate from printer.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screws that are holding the metal structure in place . this includes the screw that is on the right side near the wheel the carriage driver belt was around . be sure to note the size of the screws and where they go .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screws that are holding the metal structure in place.  This includes the screw that is on the right side near the wheel the carriage driver belt was around. Be sure to note the size of the screws and where they go.

Lines.Text: on the left side , between the wall of the printer and the metal piece , there will be a spring connecting the two . use the tweezers to detach the spring and keep separate .

Steps.Text_raw: On the left side, between the wall of the printer and the metal piece, there will be a spring connecting the two.  Use the tweezers to detach the spring and keep separate.

Lines.Text: on the right side of the printer there will also be a spring . again , disconnect this spring using the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: On the right side of the printer there will also be a spring.  Again, disconnect this spring using the tweezers.

Lines.Text: now releasing the metal structure will be possible . on the left side of the structure , locate the wheel that the carriage driver belt was around . push this wheel through the larger opening it sits in .

Steps.Text_raw: Now releasing the metal structure will be possible.  On the left side of the structure, locate the wheel that the Carriage Driver Belt was around.  Push this wheel through the larger opening it sits in.

Lines.Text: lift the metal structure from the printer , which will include the ink cartridge holders .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the metal structure from the printer, which will include the ink cartridge holders.

Lines.Text: locate the metal bar that will be running parallel to the metal structure that was just removed . locate the washer at one end .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the metal bar that will be running parallel to the metal structure that was just removed.  Locate the washer at one end.

Lines.Text: use the tweezers to pry off the washer , then slide the belt out . lift the ink cartridge holder from the metal piece , separating the two .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tweezers to pry off the washer, then slide the belt out.  Lift the ink cartridge holder from the metal piece, separating the two.

Lines.Text: locate the white , ink cartridge holder . find the three connections to the black part , this will be towards the base where the white paper is .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the white, ink cartridge holder.  Find the three connections to the black part, this will be towards the base where the white paper is.

Lines.Text: push the white connections out of where they are held in the black part . this will detach the cartridge holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the white connections out of where they are held in the black part.  This will detach the cartridge holder.

Lines.Text: on the cartridge holder , locate the screws holding the green hard drive in place . unscrew these screws .

Steps.Text_raw: On the cartridge holder, locate the screws holding the green hard drive in place.  Unscrew these screws.

Lines.Text: on the front portion , detach the white paper from the holder . there will be six tabs that can be pushed though the paper to do this .

Steps.Text_raw: On the front portion, detach the white paper from the holder.  There will be six tabs that can be pushed though the paper to do this.

Lines.Text: thread the white paper through the whole so that the latch holding the cartridge belt is visible .

Steps.Text_raw: Thread the white paper through the whole so that the latch holding the cartridge belt is visible.

Lines.Text: locating where the belt is held in place , there will be a metal cover protecting it . to remove this piece , use the tweezers to push the tabs holding it in place off .

Steps.Text_raw: Locating where the belt is held in place, there will be a metal cover protecting it.  To remove this piece, use the tweezers to push the tabs holding it in place off.

Lines.Text: this will release the belt . discard the old belt and place the new one on .

Steps.Text_raw: This will release the belt.  Discard the old belt and place the new one on.

Title: D-Link EBR-2310 LED Light Replacement

Lines.Text: begin by placing the wired router face down .
locate the two black plastic screw coverings at the top of the device and remove them with your fingers .
the two bottom plastic screw coverings do not need to be taken off .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by placing the wired router face down. Locate the two black plastic screw coverings at the top of the device and remove them with your fingers. The two bottom plastic screw coverings do not need to be taken off.

Lines.Text: using a phillips ph2 screwdriver head , unscrew the two top screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Philips PH2 screwdriver head, unscrew the two top screws.

Lines.Text: using a plastic opening tool , trace the edges of the router on all sides . gently pry the device until it eventually snaps open .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a plastic opening tool, trace the edges of the router on all sides.  Gently pry the device until it eventually snaps open.

Lines.Text: once you have removed the top black case of the router , remove the silver casing surrounding the logic board .
it should easily snap out of place .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have removed the top black case of the router, remove the silver casing surrounding the logic board. It should easily snap out of place.

Lines.Text: locate the two screws at the bottom of the logic board .
using the same ph2 head on your phillips screwdriver , unscrew these screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two screws at the bottom of the logic board. Using the same PH2 head on your Philips screwdriver, unscrew these screws.

Lines.Text: now that you have removed all screws and the surrounding silver casing , pop the logic board out from the bottom component of the router .
you have now removed the logic board from your device .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that you have removed all screws and the surrounding silver casing, pop the logic board out from the bottom component of the router. You have now removed the logic board from your device.

Lines.Text: locate the problematic led light on the motherboard .
using a plastic opening tool , very gently tilt its black base backwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the problematic LED light on the motherboard. Using a plastic opening tool, very gently tilt its black base backwards.

Lines.Text: using your soft finger , tilt the led light base backwards so that the actual light is facing upside down , at a 180 degree angle from the others .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your soft finger, tilt the LED light base backwards so that the actual light is facing upside down, at a 180 degree angle from the others.

Lines.Text: with a pair of tweezers , gently pry the led light back and forth between its connecting wires until it is able to be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: With a pair of tweezers, gently pry the LED light back and forth between its connecting wires until it is able to be removed.

Lines.Text: you should now have a removed led light , ready to be replaced with a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: You should now have a removed LED light, ready to be replaced with a new one.

Subject: LED Light

Title: HP Deskjet 3000 j310a Ink Cartridge Holder Replacement

Lines.Text: begin to disassemble the printer by disconnecting from all power sources and computers . keep cords separate and allow the printer to cool for 5 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin to disassemble the printer by disconnecting from all power sources and computers.  Keep cords separate and allow the printer to cool for 5 minutes.

Lines.Text: flip the printer upside down and locate the cover on the left hand side . it is rectangular shape and is held in place by two screws . unscrew these screws and take off cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the printer upside down and locate the cover on the left hand side.  It is rectangular shape and is held in place by two screws.  Unscrew these screws and take off cover.

Lines.Text: to release the tray from the printer , you must manually pull it out . hold the tray and push towards one side of the printer . then pull away from the printer towards the other side . keep output tray separate .

Steps.Text_raw: To release the tray from the printer, you must manually pull it out.  Hold the tray and push towards one side of the printer.  Then pull away from the printer towards the other side.  Keep output tray separate.

Lines.Text: turn the printer upside down . locate the four screws holding the cover in place . these will be on the edges of the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the printer upside down.  Locate the four screws holding the cover in place. These will be on the edges of the cover.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four screws , keeping them separate . turn the printer back right side up

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four screws, keeping them separate.  Turn the printer back right side up

Lines.Text: place fingers on the edge of the red cover . begin to pull upwards to release the top portion , working your way around the printer . make sure that it does not fall back into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Place fingers on the edge of the red cover.  Begin to pull upwards to release the top portion, working your way around the printer.  Make sure that it does not fall back into place.

Lines.Text: once the top is loose , there will still be a connection wire between the printer and the cover . this wire will be about one inch wide and white , located under the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the top is loose, there will still be a connection wire between the printer and the cover.  This wire will be about one inch wide and white, located under the buttons.

Lines.Text: detach the wire from the printer by pulling the blue-sealed end from the white holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the wire from the printer by pulling the blue-sealed end from the white holder.

Lines.Text: the hard drive is in the upper left hand corner of the printer . locate , then unscrew , the three screws that are holding it in place . take not of the size of the screws and where they were located .

Steps.Text_raw: The hard drive is in the upper left hand corner of the printer.  Locate, then unscrew, the three screws that are holding it in place.  Take not of the size of the screws and where they were located.

Lines.Text: pull the narrower cord out of its connection , holding the blue-sealed end .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the narrower cord out of its connection, holding the blue-sealed end.

Lines.Text: move the hard drive forward and angle downwards so that the larger cord is easier to hold . pull out of connection holding the cord from the blue-sealed end .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the hard drive forward and angle downwards so that the larger cord is easier to hold.  Pull out of connection holding the cord from the blue-sealed end.

Lines.Text: the hard drive will remain loosely attached because of the wires . do not disconnect these , but lift out of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: The hard drive will remain loosely attached because of the wires.  Do not disconnect these, but lift out of the printer.

Lines.Text: locate the belt , and the wheel it is around . the wheel will be on top of the metal piece on the far right side .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the belt, and the wheel it is around.  The wheel will be on top of the metal piece on the far right side.

Lines.Text: pull the belt tightly to this side , creating enough slack to lift the belt from the wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the belt tightly to this side, creating enough slack to lift the belt from the wheel.

Lines.Text: push the ink cartridge to the center of the printer so that the wheel on the opposite side is visible . then lift the belt from that wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the ink cartridge to the center of the printer so that the wheel on the opposite side is visible.  Then lift the belt from that wheel.

Lines.Text: locate the narrow hard drive on the left side of the printer . unscrew the screw holding it in place , then disconnect the cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the narrow hard drive on the left side of the printer.  Unscrew the screw holding it in place, then disconnect the cord.

Lines.Text: remove the hard drive , keeping separate from printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the hard drive, keeping separate from printer.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screws that are holding the metal structure in place . this includes the screw that is on the right side near the wheel the carriage driver belt was around . be sure to note the size of the screws and where they go .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screws that are holding the metal structure in place.  This includes the screw that is on the right side near the wheel the carriage driver belt was around. Be sure to note the size of the screws and where they go.

Lines.Text: on the left side , between the wall of the printer and the metal piece , there will be a spring connecting the two . use the tweezers to detach the spring and keep separate .

Steps.Text_raw: On the left side, between the wall of the printer and the metal piece, there will be a spring connecting the two.  Use the tweezers to detach the spring and keep separate.

Lines.Text: on the right side of the printer there will also be a spring . again , disconnect this spring using the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: On the right side of the printer there will also be a spring.  Again, disconnect this spring using the tweezers.

Lines.Text: now releasing the metal structure will be possible . on the left side of the structure , locate the wheel that the carriage driver belt was around . push this wheel through the larger opening it sits in .

Steps.Text_raw: Now releasing the metal structure will be possible.  On the left side of the structure, locate the wheel that the Carriage Driver Belt was around.  Push this wheel through the larger opening it sits in.

Lines.Text: lift the metal structure from the printer , which will include the ink cartridge holders .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the metal structure from the printer, which will include the ink cartridge holders.

Lines.Text: locate the metal bar that will be running parallel to the metal structure that was just removed . locate the washer at one end .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the metal bar that will be running parallel to the metal structure that was just removed.  Locate the washer at one end.

Lines.Text: use the tweezers to pry off the washer , then slide the belt out . lift the ink cartridge holder from the metal piece , separating the two .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tweezers to pry off the washer, then slide the belt out.  Lift the ink cartridge holder from the metal piece, separating the two.

Lines.Text: locate the white portion of the ink cartridge holder , and find the three connections to the black portion .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the white portion of the ink cartridge holder, and find the three connections to the black portion.

Lines.Text: at the three connections , push the white part out of the black openings . this will separate the white and black parts .

Steps.Text_raw: At the three connections, push the white part out of the black openings.  This will separate the white and black parts.

Lines.Text: insert the new ink cartridge holder where the previous one was .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the new ink cartridge holder where the previous one was.

Subject: Ink Cartridge Holder
