Title: Brother MFC-490CW Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: unscrew these three 12.1 mm screws holding the control panel in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew these three 12.1mm screws holding the control panel in place.

Lines.Text: lift up the front panel from the device .
gently lift up and pull out the data cables that attach the panel to the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up the front panel from the device. Gently lift up and pull out the data cables that attach the panel to the printer.

Lines.Text: before removing the unit , apply a 2 to 3 pieces of tape to secure the top and bottom of the unit .
lift the scanner unit .
gently twist the top portion of the arm . the top portion should release from the scanner unit .
rotate the arm approximately 45 degrees to remove the bottom portion of the arm from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Before removing the unit, apply a 2 to 3 pieces of tape to secure the top and bottom of the unit. Lift the scanner unit. Gently twist the top portion of the arm. The top portion should release from the scanner unit. Rotate the arm approximately 45 degrees to remove the bottom portion of the arm from the device.

Lines.Text: slide the unit either to the left or right and begin the push the unit away from the device .
once one hinge is separated from the device , begin to remove the other hinge from device .
gently place the unit on the work surface .
be careful not to pull too hard . the wires connecting the unit from the device must be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the unit either to the left or right and begin the push the unit away from the device. Once one hinge is separated from the device, begin to remove the other hinge from device. Gently place the unit on the work surface. Be careful not to pull too hard. The wires connecting the unit from the device must be removed.

Lines.Text: while it is not necessary to use a prying tool , use a thin prying to to lift the panels .
from the back of the device , use the expose portion of the panel and gently begin to remove the panel away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: While it is not necessary to use a prying tool, use a thin prying to to lift the panels. From the back of the device, use the expose portion of the panel and gently begin to remove the panel away from the device.

Lines.Text: from the back of the device , use the exposed portion of the panel to begin to lift the panel away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: From the back of the device, use the exposed portion of the panel to begin to lift the panel away from the device.

Lines.Text: before removing the cables , create a diagram of the locations of the different cables . then , label the cables with some tape or using post-its .
remove the three power cables that connect the scanner to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Before removing the cables, create a diagram of the locations of the different cables. Then, label the cables with some tape or using post-its. Remove the three power cables that connect the scanner to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 12.1 mm screw to remove the ground wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 12.1mm screw to remove the ground wire.

Lines.Text: gently pull the data away from the motherboard .
slide the cable out of the slots to remove the cable from the device .
the scanner unit is now separated . place the unit and ground screw in a safe part of the workspace until needed for re-assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the data away from the motherboard. Slide the cable out of the slots to remove the cable from the device. The scanner unit is now separated. Place the unit and ground screw in a safe part of the workspace until needed for re-assembly.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three 14.1 mm screws .
unscrew the 12.1 mm screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three 14.1mm screws. Unscrew the 12.1mm screw.

Lines.Text: pull the paper tray away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the paper tray away from the device.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 8 mm screw at the center of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 8mm screw at the center of the device.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 14.1 mm screws holding the panel in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 14.1mm screws holding the panel in place.

Lines.Text: this cable needs to be removed to allow the removal of the device cover .
gently remove the red power cable from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: This cable needs to be removed to allow the removal of the device cover. Gently remove the red power cable from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: gently push the upper-left tab of the cover and separate the hinged portion of the cover from the rest of the device .
once one side of free , slide the other side away from the device .
pull the cover away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently push the upper-left tab of the cover and separate the hinged portion of the cover from the rest of the device. Once one side of free, slide the other side away from the device. Pull the cover away from the device.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , loosen the two clipped portions of the cover located at the back-center of the device .
once the clips are free the rest of the cover can be lifted up and away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, loosen the two clipped portions of the cover located at the back-center of the device. Once the clips are free the rest of the cover can be lifted up and away from the device.

Lines.Text: push the left and right clipped portion of the cover away from the device .
pull the cover away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the left and right clipped portion of the cover away from the device. Pull the cover away from the device.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three 8.3 mm screws from the mother cover .
lift the cover away from the device . be careful , the cover may get stuck from the ethernet port . simply slide the cover until it clears the port .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three 8.3mm screws from the mother cover. Lift the cover away from the device. Be careful, the cover may get stuck from the Ethernet port. Simply slide the cover until it clears the port.

Lines.Text: gently pull the five power cables away from the motherboard .

Lines.Text: label the different cables before removing them from the motherboard .
gently lift the five power cables away from the motherboard .

Lines.Text: label the white cable before removing the cable . it will also be helpful the add a label to the port where the white power cable is inserted .

Steps.Text_raw: Label the white cable before removing the cable. It will also be helpful the add a label to the port where the white power cable is inserted.

Lines.Text: squeeze the clips of the cover protecting the orange cable .
lift the cover away from the motherboard and set is aside .
gently lift the orange power cable away from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the clips of the cover protecting the orange cable. Lift the cover away from the motherboard and set is aside. Gently lift the orange power cable away from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: to avoid any confusion , create a diagram of the location of the data cables and label the cables .
gently , lift the cables away from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: To avoid any confusion, create a diagram of the location of the data cables and label the cables. Gently, lift the cables away from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 12.1 mm screws .
lift the motherboard away from the rest of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: From the back of the device, use the exposed portion of the panel to begin to lift the panel away from the device.

Lines.Text: before removing the cables , create a diagram of the locations of the different cables . then , label the cables with some tape or post-its .
remove the three power cables that connect the scanner to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Before removing the cables, create a diagram of the locations of the different cables. Then, label the cables with some tape or Post-Its. Remove the three power cables that connect the scanner to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 12.1 mm screw to remove the ground wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 12.1mm screw to remove the ground wire.

Lines.Text: gently pull the data cable away from the motherboard .
slide the cable out of the slots to remove the cable from the device .
the scanner unit is now separated . place the unit and ground screw in a safe part of the workspace until needed for re-assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the data cable away from the motherboard. Slide the cable out of the slots to remove the cable from the device. The scanner unit is now separated. Place the unit and ground screw in a safe part of the workspace until needed for re-assembly.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three 14.1 mm screws .
unscrew the 12.1 mm screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three 14.1mm screws. Unscrew the 12.1mm screw.

Lines.Text: pull the paper tray away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the paper tray away from the device.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 8 mm screw at the center of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 8mm screw at the center of the device.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 14.1 mm screws holding the panel in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 14.1mm screws holding the panel in place.

Lines.Text: this cable needs to be removed to allow the removal of the device cover .
gently remove the red power cable from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: This cable needs to be removed to allow the removal of the device cover. Gently remove the red power cable from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: gently push the upper-left tab of the cover and separate the hinged portion of the cover from the rest of the device .
once one side is free , slide the other side away from the device .
pull the cover away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently push the upper-left tab of the cover and separate the hinged portion of the cover from the rest of the device. Once one side is free, slide the other side away from the device. Pull the cover away from the device.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , loosen the two clipped portions of the cover located at the back-center of the cover .
once the clips are free the rest of the cover can be lifted up and away from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, loosen the two clipped portions of the cover located at the back-center of the cover. Once the clips are free the rest of the cover can be lifted up and away from the device.

Lines.Text: gently pull the wire to the left so the end of the wire is released .
slide the wire away from the top of the print head unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the wire to the left so the end of the wire is released. Slide the wire away from the top of the print head unit.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , press down on the plastic housing of the carriage that the print head rests on .
slide the print head to the left of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, press down on the plastic housing of the carriage that the print head rests on. Slide the print head to the left of the device.

Lines.Text: slide the print head until it is at the end of the rail .
push the print head unit towards the back of the device and lift the unit from the back rail .
gently , release the other end of the print head to release it from the front rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the print head until it is at the end of the rail. Push the print head unit towards the back of the device and lift the unit from the back rail. Gently, release the other end of the print head to release it from the front rail.

Lines.Text: using the spudger , press the spring section of the white pulley .
release the conveyor from the pulley while the spring is still compressed .
remove the conveyor from the gear on the other side of the device .
optional : slide the conveyor off the print head .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the spudger, press the spring section of the white pulley. Release the conveyor from the pulley while the spring is still compressed. Remove the conveyor from the gear on the other side of the device. Optional: Slide the conveyor off the print head.

Lines.Text: squeeze the ends of the cover , then release the cover , revealing the processor unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the ends of the cover, then release the cover, revealing the processor unit.

Lines.Text: slide the black cap away from the port .
slide the data cable out of the port .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the black cap away from the port. Slide the data cable out of the port.

Lines.Text: lift the processor out of the print head .
slide the cables attached to the processor away from the print head unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the processor out of the print head. Slide the cables attached to the processor away from the print head unit.

Lines.Text: remove the metal clip holding the nozzle unit .
lift the unit from the rest of the print head unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the metal clip holding the nozzle unit. Lift the unit from the rest of the print head unit.

Subject: Print head

Title: Oculus Rift DK1 Control Box Bottom Cover Replacement

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to carefully pry off the four rubber feet from the control box .
you have now revealed the four 9 mm phillips 1 screws underneath the rubber feet .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to carefully pry off the four rubber feet from the control box. You have now revealed the four 9 mm Phillips #1 screws underneath the rubber feet.

Lines.Text: use a phillips 1 screwdriver to unscrew the four 9 mm phillips screws on the bottom of the control box .
you can now remove the bottom lid of the control box . it should come apart easily .

Title: Oculus Rift Control Box Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to carefully pry off the four rubber feet from the control box .
you have now revealed the four 9 mm phillips 1 screws underneath the rubber feet .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to carefully pry off the four rubber feet from the control box. You have now revealed the four 9 mm Phillips #1 screws underneath the rubber feet.

Lines.Text: use a phillips 1 screwdriver to unscrew the four 9 mm phillips screws on the bottom of the control box .
you can now remove the bottom lid of the control box . it should come apart easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips #1 Screwdriver to unscrew the four 9mm Phillips screws on the bottom of the control box. You can now remove the bottom lid of the control box. It should come apart easily.

Lines.Text: use your finger ( s ) to start lifting the motherboard from the control box casing . while doing so , use your other hand to push the dvi connector into the control box casing .
when the dvi connector has cleared the casing , lift the motherboard .
be careful ! there should be two sets of wires still connected to the control box - do not tug on them . simply flip the motherboard over to access these wires .
when reassembling the device , ensure that all of the wires are clear of the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your finger(s) to start lifting the motherboard from the control box casing. While doing so, use your other hand to push the DVI connector into the control box casing. When the DVI connector has cleared the casing, lift the motherboard. Be careful! There should be two sets of wires still connected to the control box - do not tug on them. Simply flip the motherboard over to access these wires. When reassembling the device, ensure that all of the wires are clear of the buttons.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool or your fingernails to disconnect the grey wire connectors . to make removal easier , pry the left and right edges to carefully remove the connector .
do so for both of the wires attached to the motherboard .
now fully separate the motherboard from the control box casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool or your fingernails to disconnect the grey wire connectors. To make removal easier, pry the left and right edges to carefully remove the connector. Do so for both of the wires attached to the motherboard. Now fully separate the motherboard from the control box casing.

Subject: Control Box  Motherboard

Title: Zebra GK420d Printhead Replacement

Lines.Text: release side tabs .
remove any media
note : you can turn the light blue gear to force the spindle arms to remain apart , that way you don't have to hold them .

Steps.Text_raw: Release Side Tabs. Remove any media Note: You can turn the light blue gear to force the spindle arms to remain apart, that way you don't have to hold them.

Lines.Text: loosen the captured phillips screw to release the guard .
close the lid and slide the guard toward the back of the printer to free it .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the captured phillips screw to release the guard. Close the lid and slide the guard toward the back of the printer to free it.

Lines.Text: remove the 5 phillips screws .
remove the recessed phillips screw . it may not be possible to use a driver to remove this screw .
gently unplug the two ribbon cables attached to the underside of the lid cover .
note which direction the contacts on the ribbon cables are facing for reassembly .
if there is enough slack on the ribbon cable traveling down the side of the printer , it is not necessary to unplug it . the lid may rest next to the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5 Phillips Screws. Remove the recessed Phillips Screw. It may not be possible to use a driver to remove this screw. Gently unplug the two ribbon cables attached to the underside of the lid cover. Note which direction the contacts on the ribbon cables are facing for reassembly. If there is enough slack on the ribbon cable traveling down the side of the printer, it is not necessary to unplug it. The lid may rest next to the printer.

Lines.Text: slide the grounding cable hook toward the front of the printer to release it from the retaining spring .
thread the grounding cable away from the printhead and the lid latches .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the grounding cable hook toward the front of the printer to release it from the retaining spring. Thread the grounding cable away from the printhead and the lid latches.

Lines.Text: apply downward pressure on the retaining spring .
use a spudger to release the plastic tab holding in the retaining spring .
once the edge of the retaining spring has cleared the plastic tab , you can slide the retaining spring out of the printer .
the retaining spring can only be removed out of one side of the printer .
clearing the plastic tab holding the retaining spring in place requires a fair bit of force and coordination . it is possible to damage the plastic tab .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply downward pressure on the retaining spring. Use a spudger to release the plastic tab holding in the retaining spring. Once the edge of the retaining spring has cleared the plastic tab, you can slide the retaining spring out of the printer. The retaining spring can only be removed out of one side of the printer. Clearing the plastic tab holding the retaining spring in place requires a fair bit of force and coordination. It is possible to damage the plastic tab.

Lines.Text: press the plastic tab holding the printhead in place .
once the edge of the printhead is clear of the plastic tab , you can pull it away from the lid to give yourself more room .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the plastic tab holding the printhead in place. Once the edge of the printhead is clear of the plastic tab, you can pull it away from the lid to give yourself more room.

Lines.Text: gently remove the two cables on each end of the printhead .
it may be helpful to have the lid closed and latched during this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the two cables on each end of the printhead. It may be helpful to have the lid closed and latched during this step.

Subject: Printhead

you have now revealed the four 9 mm phillips 1 screws underneath the rubber feet .

you can now remove the bottom lid of the control box . it should come apart easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips #1 Screwdriver to unscrew the four 9mm Phillips screws on the bottom of the control box. You can now remove the bottom lid of the control box. It should come apart easily.

Lines.Text: use your finger ( s ) to start lifting the motherboard from the control box casing . while doing so , use your other hand to push the dvi connector into the control box casing .
when the dvi connector has cleared the casing , lift the motherboard .
be careful ! there should be two sets of wires still connected to the control box - do not tug on them . simply flip the motherboard over to access these wires .
when reassembling the device , ensure that all of the wires are clear of the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your finger(s) to start lifting the motherboard from the control box casing. While doing so, use your other hand to push the DVI connector into the control box casing. When the DVI connector has cleared the casing, lift the motherboard. Be careful! There should be two sets of wires still connected to the control box - do not tug on them. Simply flip the motherboard over to access these wires. When reassembling the device, ensure that all of the wires are clear of the buttons.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool or your fingernails to disconnect the grey wire connectors . to make removal easier , pry the left and right edges to carefully remove the connector .
do so for both of the wires attached to the motherboard .
now fully separate the motherboard from the control box casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool or your fingernails to disconnect the grey wire connectors. To make removal easier, pry the left and right edges to carefully remove the connector. Do so for both of the wires attached to the motherboard. Now fully separate the motherboard from the control box casing.

Lines.Text: you now have the motherboard separated from the control box .
identify the buttons that are not working .

Steps.Text_raw: You now have the motherboard separated from the control box. Identify the buttons that are not working.

Lines.Text: for each button that needs to be replaced , use a soldering iron and soldering braid to desolder the four metal points .
be careful ! soldering iron is hot .

Steps.Text_raw: For each button that needs to be replaced, use a soldering iron and soldering braid to desolder the four metal points. Be careful! Soldering iron is hot.

Lines.Text: now that each button with issues is desoldered , use tweezers to grab each button and detach from the motherboard .
if the button does not come off easily , go back to the previous step and ensure each of the four metal points are properly desoldered .

Title: Oculus Rift DK1 Display Replacement

Lines.Text: to remove the lenses , turn the right lens clockwise a quarter turn and the left lens counter-clockwise a quarter turn .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the lenses, turn the right lens clockwise a quarter turn and the left lens counter-clockwise a quarter turn.

Lines.Text: use a phillips 01 screwdriver to unscrew the four 9 mm phillips 01 screws . ( two screws are shown in the picture , and two more screws are on the left side across from the right screws . )

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips #01 screwdriver to unscrew the four 9 mm Phillips #01 screws. (Two screws are shown in the picture, and two more screws are on the left side across from the right screws.)

Lines.Text: carefully lift the headstrap from the display . the two parts should separate easily enough with some force .
once the headstrap assembly and display box are separated , the headstrap assembly can be set aside . you will be working with the display box for the rest of this guide !

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the headstrap from the display. The two parts should separate easily enough with some force. Once the headstrap assembly and display box are separated, the headstrap assembly can be set aside. You will be working with the display box for the rest of this guide!

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , pry open the display box to reveal the lcd ( liquid crystal display ) screen . run the plastic opening tool around all four edges . prying open the box may take a good amount of force .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, pry open the display box to reveal the LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) screen. Run the plastic opening tool around all four edges. Prying open the box may take a good amount of force.

Lines.Text: run the plastic opening tool along the bottom edge under the lcd screen to separate the adhesive holding the lcd to the display box .
lift the screen up to reveal the wires and circuit board .
ensure that all wires are in the right place upon reassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Run the plastic opening tool along the bottom edge under the LCD screen to separate the adhesive holding the LCD to the display box. Lift the screen up to reveal the wires and circuit board. Ensure that all wires are in the right place upon reassembly.

Lines.Text: remove the wires from the circuit board on the lcd display using your fingernail or a plastic opening tool . this may take some pushing and pulling of the plastic piece .
don't pull on the wires ! be sure to only pry the plastic part .
you can now completely separate the lcd screen from the rest of the device !

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wires from the circuit board on the LCD display using your fingernail or a plastic opening tool. This may take some pushing and pulling of the plastic piece. Don't pull on the wires! Be sure to only pry the plastic part. You can now completely separate the LCD screen from the rest of the device!

Subject: Display

Title: Logitech M215 Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: the battery compartment cover is located on the top of the mouse . the seam running horizontally across the mouse is the top of the cover .
there is a button to pop off the cover . it is located on the bottom of the mouse . you may need to press hard on this button to pop the cover .
if the button does not work , you will need to pry off the cover . you can use your fingernails or a prying tool in order to do this , as seen in the third image .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery compartment cover is located on the top of the mouse. The seam running horizontally across the mouse is the top of the cover. There is a button to pop off the cover. It is located on the bottom of the mouse. you may need to press hard on this button to pop the cover. If the button does not work, you will need to pry off the cover. You can use your fingernails or a prying tool in order to do this, as seen in the third image.

Lines.Text: remember to insert the new battery in the same orientation as the old one . the positive ( plus ) end should be facing away from the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Remember to insert the new battery in the same orientation as the old one. The positive (plus) end should be facing away from the buttons.

Subject: Battery

Title: Logitech M215 Button Plate Replacement

Lines.Text: the battery compartment cover is located on the top of the mouse . the seam running horizontally across the mouse is the top of the cover .
there is a button to pop off the cover . it is located on the bottom of the mouse . you may need to press hard on this button to pop the cover .
if the button does not work , you will need to pry off the cover . you can use your fingernails or a prying tool in order to do this , as seen in the third image .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery compartment cover is located on the top of the mouse. The seam running horizontally across the mouse is the top of the cover. There is a button to pop off the cover. It is located on the bottom of the mouse. you may need to press hard on this button to pop the cover. If the button does not work, you will need to pry off the cover. You can use your fingernails or a prying tool in order to do this, as seen in the third image.

Lines.Text: remember to insert the new battery in the same orientation as the old one . the positive ( plus ) end should be facing away from the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Remember to insert the new battery in the same orientation as the old one. The positive (plus) end should be facing away from the buttons.

Lines.Text: the pads on the underside of the mouse hide the screws . remove these first . you may need to use your fingernails or a prying tool .
there will be two 0.5 mm phillips head screws . both will be underneath the bottom two pads .

Steps.Text_raw: The pads on the underside of the mouse hide the screws. Remove these first. You may need to use your fingernails or a prying tool. There will be two 0.5mm phillips head screws. Both will be underneath the bottom two pads.

Lines.Text: pry the top cover off . you may need to use a pry tool to help .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the top cover off. You may need to use a pry tool to help.

Lines.Text: use your fingernail to carefully remove the two skid stickers from the fat ( non-button ) end of the bottom of the mouse to reveal two phillips head screws . remove these , then unclip the bottom cover . don't get the sticky dusty . now remove buttons ; they're both attached by one 0.5 mm phillips head screw . it is located in the center of the top cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your fingernail to carefully remove the two skid stickers from the fat (non-button) end of the bottom of the mouse to reveal two Philips head screws. Remove these, then unclip the bottom cover. Don't get the sticky dusty. Now remove buttons; they're both attached by one 0.5mm Phillips head screw. It is located in the center of the top cover.

Lines.Text: the button are now only attached by a small overhang near the front . you will need to use the pry tool to push the button plate off of this overhang as shown .
the button plate should be able to be completely removed at this point .

Steps.Text_raw: The button are now only attached by a small overhang near the front. You will need to use the pry tool to push the button plate off of this overhang as shown. The button plate should be able to be completely removed at this point.

Subject: Button Plate

Title: Oculus Rift Development Kit 2 Camera Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the filter from the camera as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the filter from the camera as shown.

Lines.Text: remove the cover plate from the front face of the camera using the ifixit opening pick .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cover plate from the front face of the camera using the iFixit Opening Pick.

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 /16 j 000 screws .
lift the back plate off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3/16" J #000 screws. Lift the back plate off.

Lines.Text: gently tug on the wires to free them from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently tug on the wires to free them from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3 /16 phillips 000 from the four corners of the motherboard .
remove the two 1 /4 phillips 0 screws shown to release the motherboard from the enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3/16" Phillips #000 from the four corners of the motherboard. Remove the two 1/4" Phillips #0 screws shown to release the motherboard from the enclosure.

Subject: Camera Motherboard

Title: Oculus Rift Development Kit 2 Headset Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: remove front cover plate .
unplug the usb and hdmi cables from the oculus rift dk2.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove front cover plate. Unplug the USB and HDMI cables from the Oculus Rift DK2.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3 /8 phillips 0 screws from the inner portion of the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3/8" Phillips #0 screws from the inner portion of the headset.

Lines.Text: with the screws removed , gently pull the headband frame apart from the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: With the screws removed, gently pull the headband frame apart from the headset.

Lines.Text: with the oculus facing up , twist the right lens clockwise and lift it out . repeat for the left lens twisting counterclockwise instead .

Steps.Text_raw: With the Oculus facing up, twist the right lens clockwise and lift it out. Repeat for the left lens twisting counterclockwise instead.

Lines.Text: using tweezers , carefully lift the four rubber plugs as shown . they are a bit snug and you may need to jiggle them free with the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Using tweezers, carefully lift the four rubber plugs as shown. They are a bit snug and you may need to jiggle them free with the tweezers.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3 /8 screws attaching the eyewear enclosure to the front casing .
read the next step before removing the faceplate !

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3/8" screws attaching the eyewear enclosure to the front casing. Read the next step before removing the faceplate!

Lines.Text: carefully separate the faceplate and the cover . gently rest the cover plate on top of the faceplate as shown in the pictures .
do not use excessive force when separating these two pieces . there is a delicate ribbon cable connected to each .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully separate the faceplate and the cover. Gently rest the cover plate on top of the faceplate as shown in the pictures. Do not use excessive force when separating these two pieces. There is a delicate ribbon cable connected to each.

Lines.Text: gently pull out the small side tabs on the ribbon cable connector as shown to release the cable .
push the tabs away from you , with the headset oriented as pictured . carefully slide the ribbon cable out .
the headset should now be two separate pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull out the small side tabs on the ribbon cable connector as shown to release the cable. Push the tabs away from you, with the headset oriented as pictured. Carefully slide the ribbon cable out. The headset should now be two separate pieces.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three 1 /4 phillips 00 screws as pictured and use the tweezers to lift them out .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three 1/4" Phillips #00 screws as pictured and use the tweezers to lift them out.

Lines.Text: lift the tape and gently pry up the video data ribbon cable using the plastic opening tool as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the tape and gently pry up the video data ribbon cable using the plastic opening tool as shown.

Lines.Text: gently pry back the motherboard clips to release the motherboard . the motherboard should now lift free .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry back the motherboard clips to release the motherboard. The motherboard should now lift free.

Title: Oculus Rift Development Kit 2 Display Screen Replacement

Lines.Text: remove front cover plate .
unplug the usb and hdmi cables from the oculus rift dk2.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove front cover plate. Unplug the USB and HDMI cables from the Oculus Rift DK2.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3 /8 phillips 0 screws from the inner portion of the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3/8" Phillips #0 screws from the inner portion of the headset.

Lines.Text: with the screws removed , gently pull the headband frame apart from the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: With the screws removed, gently pull the headband frame apart from the headset.

Lines.Text: with the oculus facing up , twist the right lens clockwise and lift it out . repeat for the left lens twisting counterclockwise instead .

Steps.Text_raw: With the Oculus facing up, twist the right lens clockwise and lift it out. Repeat for the left lens twisting counterclockwise instead.

Lines.Text: using tweezers , carefully lift the four rubber plugs as shown . they are a bit snug and you may need to jiggle them free with the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Using tweezers, carefully lift the four rubber plugs as shown. They are a bit snug and you may need to jiggle them free with the tweezers.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3 /8 screws attaching the eyewear enclosure to the front casing .
read the next step before removing the faceplate !

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3/8" screws attaching the eyewear enclosure to the front casing. Read the next step before removing the faceplate!

Lines.Text: carefully separate the faceplate and the cover . gently rest the cover plate on top of the faceplate as shown in the pictures .
do not use excessive force when separating these two pieces . there is a delicate ribbon cable connected to each .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully separate the faceplate and the cover. Gently rest the cover plate on top of the faceplate as shown in the pictures. Do not use excessive force when separating these two pieces. There is a delicate ribbon cable connected to each.

Lines.Text: gently pull out the small side tabs on the ribbon cable connector as shown to release the cable .
push the tabs away from you , with the headset oriented as pictured . carefully slide the ribbon cable out .
the headset should now be two separate pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull out the small side tabs on the ribbon cable connector as shown to release the cable. Push the tabs away from you, with the headset oriented as pictured. Carefully slide the ribbon cable out. The headset should now be two separate pieces.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three 1 /4 phillips 00 screws as pictured and use the tweezers to lift them out .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three 1/4" Phillips #00 screws as pictured and use the tweezers to lift them out.

Lines.Text: lift the tape and gently pry up the video data ribbon cable using the plastic opening tool as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the tape and gently pry up the video data ribbon cable using the plastic opening tool as shown.

Lines.Text: gently pry back the motherboard clips to release the motherboard . the motherboard should now lift free .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry back the motherboard clips to release the motherboard. The motherboard should now lift free.

Lines.Text: remove the six 1 /4 phillips 1 screws as shown . there should be two on each short side , and one on each long side .
gently lift the plastic screen holder and display screen away from the remaining piece of the faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 1/4" Phillips #1 screws as shown. There should be two on each short side, and one on each long side. Gently lift the plastic screen holder and display screen away from the remaining piece of the faceplate.

Title: Oculus Rift Development Kit 2 Cable Hub Replacement

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tools , pry open the cable hub .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tools, pry open the cable hub.

Lines.Text: carefully pry the cable away from the cable hub motherboard . it is attached with hot glue and should be removed easily .
note that the cable is soldered on to the board . when prying the cable away from the hot glue , pull gently so as not to damage the soldered wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pry the cable away from the cable hub motherboard. It is attached with hot glue and should be removed easily. Note that the cable is soldered on to the board. When prying the cable away from the hot glue, pull gently so as not to damage the soldered wire.

Lines.Text: desolder the wires as illustrated . this can be done by heating up the solder connecting the board and the wire . when the solder is liquified , pull the wire away from the board .
need some help ? follow this guide to learn soldering basics .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the wires as illustrated. This can be done by heating up the solder connecting the board and the wire. When the solder is liquified, pull the wire away from the board. Need some help? Follow this [guide|750|guide] to learn soldering basics.

Subject: Cable Hub

Title: Water Dancing Speakers Refill

Lines.Text: you will need to have a clean work space , water dancing speakers , super glue , mineral water , and phillips screwdriver ready .
unplug the usb cable powering your speakers before you continue .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need to have a clean work space, water dancing speakers, super glue, mineral water, and Phillips screw driver ready. Unplug the USB cable powering your speakers before you continue.

Lines.Text: using the phillips screwdriver remove the 4 screws seen on the back of speakers .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the phillips screw driver remove the 4 screws seen on the back of speakers.

Lines.Text: once the four screws are taken out you will need to slide the bottom piece from the water canister .
when the two are separated set the water canister bottom facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the four screws are taken out you will need to slide the bottom piece from the water canister. When the two are separated set the water canister bottom facing up.

Lines.Text: on the bottom of the water canister you will see a hole where the water was inserted . there will be a black plug covering the hole .
using your screwdriver you can pry the plug out .
once the plug is taken out you can refill the speakers . only refill the speakers with one inch of water .

Steps.Text_raw: On the bottom of the water canister you will see a hole where the water was inserted. There will be a black plug covering the hole. Using your screw driver you can pry the plug out. Once the plug is taken out you can refill the speakers. Only refill the speakers with one inch of water.

Lines.Text: after the water is filled to approximately one inch . super glue the hole shut and let dry .

Steps.Text_raw: After the water is filled to approximately one inch. Super glue the hole shut and let dry.

Lines.Text: when the glue is dry slide speaker back on to water canister .
once they are put together place back panel on and insert the four screws .
repeat steps 2 through 6 on second speaker .

Steps.Text_raw: When the glue is dry slide speaker back on to water canister. Once they are put together place back panel on and insert the four screws. repeat steps 2 through 6 on second speaker.

Subject: Water plug & water

Title: Logitech M215 Scroll Wheel Replacement

Lines.Text: the battery compartment cover is located on the top of the mouse . the seam running horizontally across the mouse is the top of the cover .
there is a button to pop off the cover . it is located on the bottom of the mouse . you may need to press hard on this button to pop the cover .
if the button does not work , you will need to pry off the cover . you can use your fingernails or a prying tool in order to do this , as seen in the third image .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery compartment cover is located on the top of the mouse. The seam running horizontally across the mouse is the top of the cover. There is a button to pop off the cover. It is located on the bottom of the mouse. you may need to press hard on this button to pop the cover. If the button does not work, you will need to pry off the cover. You can use your fingernails or a prying tool in order to do this, as seen in the third image.

Lines.Text: remember to insert the new battery in the same orientation as the old one . the positive ( plus ) end should be facing away from the buttons .

Steps.Text_raw: Remember to insert the new battery in the same orientation as the old one. The positive (plus) end should be facing away from the buttons.

Lines.Text: use your fingernail to carefully remove the two skid stickers from the fat ( non-button ) end of the bottom of the mouse to reveal two phillips head screws . remove these , then unclip the bottom cover . don't get the sticky dusty . now remove buttons ; they're both attached by one 0.5 mm phillips head screw . it is located in the center of the top cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your fingernail to carefully remove the two skid stickers from the fat (non-button) end of the bottom of the mouse to reveal two Philips head screws. Remove these, then unclip the bottom cover. Don't get the sticky dusty. Now remove buttons; they're both attached by one 0.5mm Phillips head screw. It is located in the center of the top cover.

Lines.Text: the button are now only attached by a small overhang near the front . you will need to use the pry tool to push the button plate off of this overhang as shown .
the button plate should be able to be completely removed at this point .

Steps.Text_raw: The button are now only attached by a small overhang near the front. You will need to use the pry tool to push the button plate off of this overhang as shown. The button plate should be able to be completely removed at this point.

Lines.Text: use the prying tool to remove the scroll wheel . the wheel is held in place by two pegs which stick into the plastic holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the prying tool to remove the scroll wheel. The wheel is held in place by two pegs which stick into the plastic holder.

Subject: Scroll Wheel

Title: Saitek X52 Pro Disassembly

Lines.Text: patience : )
you need 2 small screw drives with a phillips ( cross ) ph1 head and torx ( star ) t10 head .
a list of screw drive heads can be hound here

Steps.Text_raw: Patience :) You need 2 small screw drives with a Phillips (cross) PH1 head and Torx (star) T10 head. A list of screw drive heads can be hound here http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_screw_drives

Lines.Text: please take a moment and note how your joystick is assembled and all the parts that can be dettached . i recommend taking a few photos before dismantling it .
with the phillips screwdrive unscrew the 1 to 4 screws in fig . 1.
using the torx t10 head , unscrew the 5 ( fig . 1 ) , 6 , 7 and 8 screws ( fig . 2 )
screws 5 6 have a larger thread pace than 7 8 , although the heads are the same . so please take care when you screw them back on ( fig . 3 ) .
using your hand , unscrew 9 ( fig . 2 ) . please note that you cannot completely remove this screw , but you don't need to do this anyway .

Steps.Text_raw: Please take a moment and note how your joystick is assembled and all the parts that can be dettached. I recommend taking a few photos before dismantling it. With the Phillips screwdrive unscrew the #1 to #4 screws in Fig. 1. Using the Torx T10 head, unscrew the #5 (Fig. 1), #6, #7 and #8 screws (Fig. 2) Screws 5 & 6 have a larger thread pace than 7 & 8, although the heads are the same. So please take care when you screw them back on (Fig. 3). Using your hand, unscrew #9 (Fig. 2). Please note that you cannot completely remove this screw, but you don't need to do this anyway.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the plastic bracket and the support holding the pinkie trigger by pushing it towards the trigger ( fig . 4 ) .
'''do not''' force its removal , or you can break it .
be careful not to break the pinkie trigger wire !
remove the stick cover that will expose the contacts and wiring ( fig . 5 )

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the plastic bracket  and the support holding the "Pinkie trigger" by pushing it towards the trigger (Fig. 4). '''DO NOT''' force its removal, or you can break it. Be careful not to break the Pinkie trigger wire! Remove the stick cover that will expose the contacts and wiring (Fig. 5)

Lines.Text: note the small metal plate .
bend it just a little from the middle so that pushing the trigger actually pushes the small '''blue''' switch inside the stick .
test the trigger before putting back the plastic cover
remember when screwing the screws that 56 go to the bottom sides and 78 go at the top .

Steps.Text_raw: Note the small metal plate. Bend it just a little from the middle so that pushing the trigger actually pushes the small '''blue''' switch inside the stick. Test the trigger before putting back the plastic cover Remember when screwing the screws that 5&6 go to the bottom sides and 7&8 go at the top.

Title: How To Fix Sticky Keyboard Keys on a MacBook

Lines.Text: before getting started make sure to completely turn off your computer .
click on the apple in the upper left-hand corner of your computer screen . a drop down menu will appear .
click shut down .

Steps.Text_raw: Before getting started make sure to completely turn off your computer. Click on the apple in the upper left-hand corner of your computer screen. A drop down menu will appear. Click "shut down".

Lines.Text: dip a q-tip in isopropanol , and wipe around each sticky key .
make sure the q-tip is damp , not dripping .
you may need multiple q-tips , as they get pretty dirty .

Steps.Text_raw: Dip a q-tip in isopropanol, and wipe around each sticky key. Make sure the q-tip is damp, not dripping. You may need multiple q-tips, as they get pretty dirty.

Lines.Text: use a toothpick to remove crumbs or debris from under the sticky keys .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a toothpick to remove crumbs or debris from under the sticky keys.

Lines.Text: now test out your keys . if they are still sticky continue on to step 5.

Steps.Text_raw: Now test out your keys. If they are still sticky continue on to Step 5.

Lines.Text: use a spudger or plastic opening tool to pry up sticky keys .
insert the spudger under the side of a key .
lift up .
use your fingers to twist the key off .
to avoid damaging your laptop , use a spudger or plastic opening tool rather than the butter knife shown in the image .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger or plastic opening tool to pry up sticky keys. Insert the spudger under the side of a key. Lift up. Use your fingers to twist the key off. To avoid damaging your laptop, use a spudger or plastic opening tool rather than the butter knife shown in the image.

Lines.Text: when you are removing a key if one or both of these white plastic pieces come off the key board , don't worry . they are called key carriers and are very easy to put back on .
if one part of the carrier is still in the keyboard , remove it so you have both in you hands .
look at the second picture and align the two piece then push them together . there should be a soft clicking sound .
in the same alignment as the second picture , place the carrier in the spot on the keyboard where it came off and press firmly into place .

Steps.Text_raw: When you are removing a key if one or both of these white plastic pieces come off the key board, don't worry. They are called key carriers and are very easy to put back on. If one part of the carrier is still in the keyboard, remove it so you have both in you hands. Look at the second picture and align the two piece then push them together. There should be a soft clicking sound. In the same alignment as the second picture, place the carrier in the spot on the keyboard where it came off and press firmly into place.

Lines.Text: put soap and warm water in a cup .
as you remove the keys , put them in the soapy water .
let the keys soak for 10 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Put soap and warm water in a cup. As you remove the keys, put them in the soapy water. Let the keys soak for 10 minutes.

Lines.Text: wipe down your keyboard with q-tips damp with rubbing alcohol .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe down your keyboard with q-tips damp with rubbing alcohol.

Lines.Text: optional : if your keys are particularly sticky use rubbing alcohol and a q-tip to wipe the back of the keys .
dry the keys completely with a paper towel .

Steps.Text_raw: Optional: If your keys are particularly sticky use rubbing alcohol and a q-tip to wipe the back of the keys. Dry the keys completely with a paper towel.

Lines.Text: pop the keys back on :
first align the key and press firmly into place .
then , move your finger side to side until you hear a double clicking sound .

Steps.Text_raw: Pop the keys back on: First align the key and press firmly into place. Then, move your finger side to side until you hear a double clicking sound.

Title: How to Replace Keys on a Keyboard

Lines.Text: loosen the key by prying all four corners gently with your spudger .
make sure your keyboard is unplugged before performing any of these steps .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the key by prying all four corners gently with your spudger. Make sure your keyboard is unplugged before performing any of these steps.

Lines.Text: wedge the tip of the spudger under the bottom of the key and carefully lift up until the key pops loose .
if the key will not come out , or seems like too much force is needed , try step one again .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the tip of the spudger under the bottom of the key and carefully lift up until the key pops loose. If the key will not come out, or seems like too much force is needed, try step one again.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to remove any contaminants that were preventing the key from being pressed down from the now open hole on your keyboard .
do not to grab the actual button , as breaking that could damage your keyboard permanently .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to remove any contaminants that were preventing the key from being pressed down from the now open hole on your keyboard. Do not to grab the actual button, as breaking that could damage your keyboard permanently.

Lines.Text: clean your keys with compressed air by blowing around the removed key .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean your keys with compressed air by blowing around the removed key.

Lines.Text: push in the clean keys until you hear a popping sound .
the keys should click in easily , so if you are having trouble try realigning the key with its hole .
if you removed multiple keys , make sure they are in their proper spot and orientation .

Steps.Text_raw: Push in the clean keys until you hear a popping sound. The keys should click in easily, so if you are having trouble try realigning the key with its hole. If you removed multiple keys, make sure they are in their proper spot and orientation.

Subject: Individual Keys

Title: Dell Photo Printer 720 Encoder Strip Replacement

Lines.Text: use a phillips head 2 screwdriver to remove the 4 screws located on the bottom of the dell photo printer 720.

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips head #2 screwdriver to remove the 4 screws located on the bottom of the Dell Photo Printer 720.

Lines.Text: use a spudger to wedge between the cover and base of the printer ( where the light grey and black portions meet ) .
pry apart the light grey cover from the black base .
gently flip the printer upright to its standard position and carefully lift off the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger to wedge between the cover and base of the printer (where the light grey and black portions meet). Pry apart the light grey cover from the black base. Gently flip the printer upright to its standard position and carefully lift off the cover.

Lines.Text: slide the ink cartridge from the right side to the middle left so it is out of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the ink cartridge from the right side to the middle left so it is out of the way.

Lines.Text: grab ahold of the encoder strip on the right side . gently tug the strip outward and swing the end piece towards you to unhook the encoder from the prong .
carefully unhook the opposite end of the encoder strip to full disconnect the part .
to replace new encoder strip , reattach each end to the hooks by reversing previous steps .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab ahold of the encoder strip on the right side. Gently tug the strip outward and swing the end piece towards you to unhook the encoder from the prong. Carefully unhook the opposite end of the encoder strip to full disconnect the part. To replace new encoder strip, reattach each end to the hooks by reversing previous steps.

Subject: Encoder Strip

Title: How to Hack Epson L200's Waste Ink Pad

Lines.Text: a wild epson printer appears .
turn it around and look for a small door .

Steps.Text_raw: A wild Epson Printer appears. Turn it around and look for a small door.

Lines.Text: locate the small door on the back and open it .
you will find the tube that drains the waste ink to the ink pad .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the small door on the back and open it. You will find the tube that drains the waste ink to the ink pad.

Lines.Text: as you can see , the pad is full with waste ink and is larger than the small door that gives you access to it , meaning it is not meant to be changed by mortals .

Steps.Text_raw: As you can see, the pad is full with waste ink and is larger than the small door that gives you access to it, meaning it is not meant to be changed by mortals.

Lines.Text: with a pair of tweezers gently pull the ink tube from the ink container .
be careful not to grab it from the tube so as not to damage it .

Steps.Text_raw: With a pair of tweezers gently pull the ink tube from the ink container. Be careful not to grab it from the tube so as not to damage it.

Lines.Text: with the help of a syringe or anything that can suck liquid , clean the remaining ink from the tube .
i also went ahead and cleared the pad from as much ink as i could , it can buy you a bit more life span to the pad if you are in a hurry to print and not have the replacement items for this hack .
i did not have a syringe at the time and used a desolder pump , takes way longer though .

Steps.Text_raw: With the help of a syringe or anything that can suck liquid, clean the remaining ink from the tube. I also went ahead and cleared the pad from as much ink as I could, it can buy you a bit more life span to the pad if you are in a hurry to print and not have the replacement items for this hack. I did not have a syringe at the time and used a desolder pump, takes way longer though.

Lines.Text: cut a 6 piece of the aquarium tubing and grab a connector .
connect the printer tube to the aquarium tubing you just cut with the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut a 6" piece of the aquarium tubing and grab a connector. Connect the printer tube to the aquarium tubing you just cut with the connector.

Lines.Text: put a connector on the end of the aquarium tube and connect it to the top of the bottle . make sure that there is no chance of spilling or else you will have a big black spot of ink under your printer .
i inserted another connector on the top side of the bottle to release any pressure created by the ink coming in and the air in the bottle .

Steps.Text_raw: Put a connector on the end of the aquarium tube and connect it to the top of the bottle. Make sure that there is no chance of spilling or else you will have a big black spot of ink under your printer. I inserted another connector on the top side of the bottle to release any pressure created by the ink coming in and the air in the bottle.

Lines.Text: i placed the bottle in a lower elevation than the printer so that the ink can travel down the tube easier .
check periodically to empty the waste ink bottle .

Steps.Text_raw: I placed the bottle in a lower elevation than the printer so that the ink can travel down the tube easier. Check periodically to empty the waste ink bottle.

Title: BRCK v1 Modem  Replacement

Lines.Text: place the face of the device showing brck face up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the face of the device showing BRCK face up.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four screws(4mm hex head) on the corners of the device with a Hex 2.0 Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the top cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top cover.

++'''caution'''++ by cutting the zip tie , you void any manufacturer warranty you may have on the device .

Lines.Text: remove the connection located on the edge of the modem .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the connection located on the edge of the modem.

Lines.Text: slightly lift the modem to reveal the brown ribbon connector and metal connection plate , located on the bottom of the modem .

Steps.Text_raw: Slightly lift the modem to reveal the brown ribbon connector and metal connection plate, located on the bottom of the modem.

Lines.Text: using your tweezers , gently push on the metal plate and slide it down toward the base of the modem to release the locking mechanism .
lower the plate and gently pull the ribbon out of the face plate .
++'''caution'''++ be extremely gentle while preforming this step . the ribbon is brittle and prone to breaking if bent too much . make sure you go slowly so that you do not damage the device .

Make sure you go slowly so that you do not damage the device.

Lines.Text: remove the modem from the device .

Lines.Text: remove the top cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top cover.

Lines.Text: cut the black zip tie holding the modem down .
++'''caution'''++ by cutting the zip tie , you void any manufacturer warranty you may have on the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the black zip tie holding the modem down. ++'''Caution'''++ By cutting the zip tie, you void any manufacturer warranty you may have on the device.

Lines.Text: remove the connection located on the edge of the modem .

Lines.Text: using your tweezers , gently push on the metal plate and slide it down toward the base of the modem to release the locking mechanism .
lower the plate and gently pull the ribbon out of the face plate .
++'''caution'''++ be extremely gentle while preforming this step . the ribbon is brittle and prone to breaking if bent too much . make sure you go slowly so that you do not damage the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your tweezers, gently push on the metal plate and slide it down toward the base of the modem to release the locking mechanism. Lower the plate and gently pull the ribbon out of the face plate. ++'''Caution'''++ Be extremely gentle while preforming this step. The ribbon is brittle and prone to breaking if bent too much. Make sure you go slowly so that you do not damage the device.

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the red, black, and yellow wire connection by lifting up.

slide the ribbon out from under the clip to free the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully insert tweezers under the black tab, and lift to release the clip. Slide the ribbon out from under the clip to free the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove outside rubber covers by lifting them out of place .

lift and pull out of place .
