Title: How to disassemble for cleaning

Lines.Text: remove 10 screws ( 8 mm ) securing the back plate .
remove 4 screws ( 7 mm , ball head ) securing the handrest plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 10 screws (8mm) securing the back plate. Remove 4 screws (7mm, ball head) securing the handrest plate.

Lines.Text: lift the handrest plate and pull it free , away from the rest of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the handrest plate and pull it free, away from the rest of the unit.

Lines.Text: after unscrewing , the back plate is now loose , and can be lifted gently to separate it .
lift up the primary cable to free it from the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: After unscrewing, the back plate is now loose, and can be lifted gently to separate it. Lift up the primary cable to free it from the casing.

Lines.Text: remove 9 screws ( 5 mm ) that are securing the membrane layers .
remove the plastic holder but retain it in a safe place , as it is used to restrict the data cable from moving freely and will need to be returned .
gently pull the data cable ( black/red ) to disconnect it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 9 screws (5mm) that are securing the membrane layers. Remove the plastic holder but retain it in a safe place, as it is used to restrict the data cable from moving freely and will need to be returned. Gently pull the data cable (black/red) to disconnect it.

Lines.Text: start to gently remove the membrane cover , peeling off the layers beneath it as well .
'''caution''' : take care not to damage the striped grey data cables , which connect all the layers .

Steps.Text_raw: Start to gently remove the membrane cover, peeling off the layers beneath it as well. '''Caution''': take care not to damage the striped grey data cables, which connect all the layers.

Lines.Text: peel off the plastic membrane .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel off the plastic membrane.

Lines.Text: push with moderate force to separate the keyframe ( beige ) from the front plate ( black ) .
you should apply pressure at each hook ( marked in blue ) .

optional : prior to completing this step , remove all keycaps from the frame ( step 9 ) . this may make it easier for you to apply pressure to the board , with less fear of breakage from undue force .

Steps.Text_raw: Push with moderate force to separate the keyframe (beige) from the front plate (black). You should apply pressure at each hook (marked in blue). Optional: prior to completing this step, remove all keycaps from the frame (Step 9). This may make it easier for you to apply pressure to the board, with less fear of breakage from undue force.

Lines.Text: photos .

Steps.Text_raw: Photos.

Lines.Text: push out each keycap using mild pressure from your finger .
you should push from the inside ( beige frame ) to the outside . do not push the keys the other way around .
optional : using a blunt tool ( like the end of a screwdriver ) can help you push out the keycaps quicker than fingers .
tip : store the keycaps safely in a plastic container , in order of rows . it is very easy to lose keys .

Steps.Text_raw: Push out each keycap using mild pressure from your finger. You should push from the inside (beige frame) to the outside. Do not push the keys the other way around. Optional: Using a blunt tool (like the end of a screwdriver) can help you push out the keycaps quicker than fingers. Tip: Store the keycaps safely in a plastic container, in order of rows. It is very easy to lose keys.

Lines.Text: to return the keycaps to the frame , push them in using your fingers from the front .
call up your photo of the keyboard layout and review it to ensure you are placing each keycap in the right order and place .
you may need to consult a guide on the qwerty ( or other relevant layout ) keyboard layout to ensure you are familiar with the correct key order when reassembling the keycaps .

Steps.Text_raw: To return the keycaps to the frame, push them in using your fingers from the front. Call up your photo of the keyboard layout and review it to ensure you are placing each keycap in the right order and place. You may need to consult a guide on the QWERTY (or other relevant layout) keyboard layout to ensure you are familiar with the correct key order when reassembling the keycaps.

Lines.Text: the following keys have a long metal brace to support them . '''to remove''' : gently push with great care out of the frame .
shift ( 2 keys )
enter
backspace
keypad plus ( + )
keypad enter
keypad zero/insert ( 0 )
space bar

Steps.Text_raw: The following keys have a long metal brace to support them. '''To remove''': gently push with great care out of the frame. SHIFT (2 keys) Enter Backspace Keypad Plus (+) Keypad Enter Keypad Zero/Insert (0) Space Bar

Lines.Text: observe the correct alignment for the metal brace . the brace must sit tight in its dedicated , raised rack .
place the keycap over the top of the hole , and push it down gently . unlike the other normal keycaps , you should feel some resistance when doing so .
now , push the keycap with greater force until a click is heard .
check that the key moves as one , by pressing with your finger on its left and right hand sides to confirm that the key moves effortlessly without obstruction .

Steps.Text_raw: Observe the correct alignment for the metal brace. The brace must sit tight in its dedicated, raised rack. Place the keycap over the top of the hole, and push it down gently. Unlike the other normal keycaps, you should feel some resistance when doing so. Now, push the keycap with greater force until a click is heard. Check that the key moves as one, by pressing with your finger on its left and right hand sides to confirm that the key moves effortlessly without obstruction.

push the panel upward to remove it from the printer .
there is a connector attached to the back of the panel . flip the front cover towards you gently and proceed to the next step .

gently flip the internal protective cover counterclockwise .
be careful when lifting the internal protective cover . there is a connector attached to the cover .

Lines.Text: remove the protective cover by lifting it away from the printer with both hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the protective cover by lifting it away from the printer with both hands.

Lines.Text: remove the connector that binds the cartridge access door to the motherboard by pinching the blue part of the connector with two fingers and pulling it away from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the connector that binds the cartridge access door to the motherboard by pinching the blue part of the connector with two fingers and pulling it away from the motherboard.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cables that connect the cartridge access door to the motherboard by pinching the front of the cable box with two fingers and pulling it away from the motherboard.

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to snap off the left-side clip and push the clip outward.

detach the scanner glass by slowly moving the glass side away from the back side of the cartridge access door .
find the rectangular scanner piece that has a white light strip .

remove the 2.0 mm screw by using a hex screwdriver and rotating the screw counterclockwise to detach the metal plate from the motor .

Title: HP Envy 7640 Paper Roller Replacement

Lines.Text: open the printer by pushing upwards on the plastic tabs located on the sides of the printer .
remove the opening assist from its purchase by pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger .
remove the spring-loaded clip attached to the top of the printer by pushing it off of the hook .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the printer by pushing upwards on the plastic tabs located on the sides of the printer. Remove the opening assist from its purchase by pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger. Remove the spring-loaded  clip attached to the top of the printer by pushing it off of the hook.

Lines.Text: remove the last ten 12 mm screws by placing the torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise .

remove the last two 12 mm screws by placing the torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise ; the screen plate can now be separated from the printer by pushing out and to the right .

take out the inner plastic frame ( this piece is removeable after having removed the ten 12 mm screws outlined in the first bullet ) by grasping the frame with both hands and carefully pulling the frame away from the printer body .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the last ten 12mm screws by placing the Torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise. Remove the last two 12mm screws by placing the Torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise;  the screen plate can now be separated from the printer by pushing out and to the right. Take out the inner plastic frame (this piece is removeable after having removed the ten 12 mm screws outlined in the first bullet)  by grasping the frame with both hands and carefully pulling the frame away from the printer body.

Lines.Text: grasp the gray lever of the black plastic cover of the rollers and gently pull the lever up and to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the gray lever of the black plastic cover of the rollers and gently pull the lever up and to the right.

Lines.Text: press the lever outwards and away from the paper rollers with one hand .
pull the paper rollers up and out of your hp printer with one hand while the other continues to depress the lever away from the paper rollers .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the lever outwards and away from the paper rollers with one hand. Pull the paper rollers up and out of your HP printer with one hand while the other continues to depress the lever away from the paper rollers.

Subject: Paper Roller

Title: HP Envy 7640 Screen Replacement

Lines.Text: open the printer by pushing upwards against the plastic tabs on the printer body's sides .
remove the opening assist by pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger .
remove the spring-loaded clip attached to the top of the printer by pushing it off of the hook .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the printer by pushing upwards against the plastic tabs on the printer body's sides. Remove the opening assist by  pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger. Remove the spring-loaded clip attached to the top of the printer by pushing it off of the hook.

Lines.Text: place the t9 torx screwdriver in the screw slot and turn counterclockwise to remove the two 12 mm screws that hold the screen manifold to the printer .
push with minimal force to the right to dislodge the manifold from the printer body .
lift the panel up and turn it over to reveal the green micro-controller board underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the T9 Torx screwdriver in the screw slot and turn counterclockwise to remove the two 12 mm screws that hold the screen manifold to the printer. Push with minimal force to the right to dislodge the manifold from the printer body. Lift the panel up and turn it over to reveal the green micro-controller board underneath.

Lines.Text: undo the two connectors by gently pulling them away from the board .
remove the last connector by flipping the tab up and pulling away from the board while also pulling left .
remove the five 6.5 mm screws from the board using the t6 torx screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Undo the two connectors by gently pulling them  away from the board. Remove the last connector by flipping the tab up and pulling away from the board while also pulling left. Remove the five  6.5 mm screws from the board using the T6 Torx screwdriver.

Lines.Text: insert the plastic opening tool into the space between the green board and the printer manifold and push downwards to dislodge the green board .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic opening tool into the space between the green board and the printer manifold and push downwards to dislodge the green board.

Lines.Text: peel back the tape that holds the screen in place .
insert the plastic opening tool between the white screen backing and the screen to pry the screen backing from the adhesive that holds it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel back the tape that holds the screen in place. Insert the plastic opening tool between the white screen backing and the screen to pry the screen backing from the adhesive that holds it in place.

Subject: Screen

Steps.Text_raw: Press the lever outwards and away from the paper rollers with one hand. Pull the paper rollers up and out of your HP printer with one hand while the other continues to depress the lever away from the paper rollers.

Lines.Text: pull the side panels up and away from the printer to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the side panels up and away from the printer to remove them.

Lines.Text: detach all the cables by gently pulling on them at their base in the direction of origin ( for top connectors pull up and for bottom connectors pull down ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach all the cables by gently pulling on them at their base in the direction of origin (for top connectors pull up and for bottom connectors pull down).

Lines.Text: remove the last two connectors found at the top of the motherboard by grasping the tan portion adjacent to the motherboard and pulling up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the last two connectors found at the top of the motherboard by grasping the tan portion adjacent to the motherboard and pulling up.

Lines.Text: remove the four 7 mm screws from the motherboard by placing the torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slots and turning counterclockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 7 mm screws from the motherboard by placing the Torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slots and turning counterclockwise.

Lines.Text: start to remove the motherboard from the device by lifting the left hand side of the motherboard out from the printer shell with minimal force .
push the clip's head away from the motherboard to release the right hand side of the motherboard from the printer shell .
remove the back connector by firmly grasping the tan portion of the connector adjacent to the motherboard and pulling in toward the printer to dislodge the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Start to remove the motherboard from the device by lifting the left hand side of the motherboard out from the printer shell with minimal force. Push the clip's head away from the motherboard to release the right hand side of the motherboard from the printer shell. Remove the back connector by firmly grasping the tan portion of the connector adjacent to the motherboard and pulling in toward the printer to dislodge the motherboard.

Subject: Motherboard

Title: HP Envy 7640 Printhead Replacement

Lines.Text: open the printer by pushing upwards on the plastic tabs located on the sides of the printer .
remove the opening assist from its purchase by pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger .
remove the spring-loaded clip attached to the top of the printer by pushing it off of the hook .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the printer by pushing upwards on the plastic tabs located on the sides of the printer. Remove the opening assist from its purchase by pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger. Remove the spring-loaded  clip attached to the top of the printer by pushing it off of the hook.

Lines.Text: remove the last ten 12 mm screws by placing the torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise .

remove the last two 12 mm screws by placing the torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise ; the screen plate can now be separated from the printer by pushing out and to the right .

take out the inner plastic frame ( this piece is removeable after having removed the ten 12 mm screws outlined in the first bullet ) by grasping the frame with both hands and carefully pulling the frame away from the printer body .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the last ten 12mm screws by placing the Torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise. Remove the last two 12mm screws by placing the Torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slot and turning counterclockwise;  the screen plate can now be separated from the printer by pushing out and to the right. Take out the inner plastic frame (this piece is removeable after having removed the ten 12 mm screws outlined in the first bullet)  by grasping the frame with both hands and carefully pulling the frame away from the printer body.

Lines.Text: grasp the gray lever of the black plastic cover of the rollers and gently pull the lever up and to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the gray lever of the black plastic cover of the rollers and gently pull the lever up and to the right.

Lines.Text: press the lever outwards and away from the paper rollers with one hand .
pull the paper rollers up and out of your hp printer with one hand while the other continues to depress the lever away from the paper rollers .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the lever outwards and away from the paper rollers with one hand. Pull the paper rollers up and out of your HP printer with one hand while the other continues to depress the lever away from the paper rollers.

Lines.Text: pull the side panels up and away from the printer to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the side panels up and away from the printer to remove them.

Lines.Text: detach all the cables by gently pulling on them at their base in the direction of origin ( for top connectors pull up and for bottom connectors pull down ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach all the cables by gently pulling on them at their base in the direction of origin (for top connectors pull up and for bottom connectors pull down).

Lines.Text: remove the last two connectors found at the top of the motherboard by grasping the tan portion adjacent to the motherboard and pulling up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the last two connectors found at the top of the motherboard by grasping the tan portion adjacent to the motherboard and pulling up.

Lines.Text: remove the four 7 mm screws from the motherboard by placing the torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slots and turning counterclockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 7 mm screws from the motherboard by placing the Torx 9 screwdriver in the screw slots and turning counterclockwise.

Lines.Text: start to remove the motherboard from the device by lifting the left hand side of the motherboard out from the printer shell with minimal force .
push the clip's head away from the motherboard to release the right hand side of the motherboard from the printer shell .
remove the back connector by firmly grasping the tan portion of the connector adjacent to the motherboard and pulling in toward the printer to dislodge the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Start to remove the motherboard from the device by lifting the left hand side of the motherboard out from the printer shell with minimal force. Push the clip's head away from the motherboard to release the right hand side of the motherboard from the printer shell. Remove the back connector by firmly grasping the tan portion of the connector adjacent to the motherboard and pulling in toward the printer to dislodge the motherboard.

Lines.Text: place the t9 torx screwdriver in the screw slot and turn counterclockwise to extract the single 14 mm screw .
using the blunt tweezers , detach the spring by grasping the end attached to the fuser assembly and pulling out and away .
using the blunt tweezers , remove the black , ribbed washer by prying away from the print rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the T9 Torx screwdriver in the screw slot and turn counterclockwise to extract the single 14 mm screw. Using the blunt tweezers, detach the  spring by grasping the end attached to the fuser assembly and pulling out and away. Using the blunt tweezers, remove the black, ribbed washer by prying away from the print rail.

Lines.Text: using the blunt tweezers , remove the spring via the same method outlined in the previous step .
firmly grasp the print rail and gently guide it out of the slot in the fuser assembly by pulling away from the printer body .
because this rail is what guides the printhead , it will be greased . dress accordingly to avoid unwanted stains .
because the printhead sits on this rail , be sure to brace the printhead as you retract the print rail to avoid any unwanted damage .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the blunt tweezers, remove the spring via the same method outlined in the previous step. Firmly grasp the print rail and gently guide it out of the slot in the fuser assembly by pulling away from the printer body. Because this rail is what guides the printhead, it will be greased. Dress accordingly to avoid unwanted stains. Because the printhead sits on this rail, be sure to brace the printhead as you retract the print rail to avoid any unwanted damage.

Lines.Text: place the t9 torx screwdriver in the screw slot and turn counterclockwise to remove the single 12 mm screw .
grasp the black , elastic band firmly and pull out and away from the white plastic pulley ; the printhead can now be lifted out of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the T9 Torx screwdriver in the screw slot and turn counterclockwise to remove the single 12 mm screw. Grasp the black, elastic band firmly and pull out and away from the white plastic pulley; the printhead can now be lifted out of the printer.

Subject: Printhead

Title: HP Officejet Pro 6835 Cover Disassembly

Lines.Text: open the main lid as far as it will go .
use a plastic opening tool to gently pry off the hinge on the right side by pushing it to the left and off the hook .
open the lid further .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the main lid as far as it will go. Use a plastic opening tool to gently pry off the hinge on the right side by pushing it to the left and off the hook. Open the lid further.

Lines.Text: use a t9 torx screwdriver to remove a total of ten ( 10 ) 12 mm screws from the main cover by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise .
the two screws above the screen assembly are deep so you may need a long screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T9 torx screwdriver to remove a total of ten (10) 12mm screws from the main cover by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise. The two screws above the screen assembly are deep so you may need a long screwdriver.

Lines.Text: grab the main cover and lift it up slightly .
do not pull toothere is a cable connecting the cover to the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the main cover and lift it up slightly. Do not pull too—there is a cable connecting the cover to the printer.

Lines.Text: grab the base of the white ribbon cable connecting the cover to the base of the printer and pull it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the base of the white ribbon cable connecting the cover to the base of the printer and pull it out.

Title: HP Envy 5660 LCD Replacement

Lines.Text: lift the scanner to open up the printer cartridge access area .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the scanner to open up the printer cartridge access area.

Lines.Text: remove the two 12 mm screws with a t10 bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 12 mm screws with a T10 bit.

Lines.Text: use a metal spudger to pry open the front panel .
work your way all the way around the front panel doing the same .
gently flip the cover over , exposing the motherboard .
there will be loud popping sounds when the cover is being separated from the rest of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a metal spudger to pry open the front panel. Work your way all the way around the front panel doing the same. Gently flip the cover over, exposing the motherboard. There will be loud popping sounds when the cover is being separated from the rest of the printer.

Lines.Text: remove the four 4.5 mm screws from the motherboard with a t6 bit .
gently remove the motherboard from the top of the lcd , but make sure the ribbon cables are still attached .
beware damaging the white ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 4.5 mm screws from the motherboard with a T6 bit. Gently remove the motherboard from the top of the LCD, but make sure the ribbon cables are still attached. Beware damaging the white ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: remove the four 5 mm screws with a t6 bit , allowing you to separate the lcd from the cover ,

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 5 mm screws with a T6 bit, allowing you to separate the LCD from the cover,

Lines.Text: place the metal spudger underneath the lcd and gently lift up to remove the lcd .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the metal spudger underneath the LCD and gently lift up to remove the LCD.

Subject: LCD

remove the opening assist from its purchase by pushing it toward the front of the printer with a nylon spudger .

pull the paper rollers up and out of your hp printer with one hand while the other continues to depress the lever away from the paper rollers .

Title: HP Officejet Pro 6835 Carriage Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: open the main lid as far as it will go .
use a plastic opening tool to gently pry off the hinge on the right side by pushing it to the left and off the hook .
open the lid further .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the main lid as far as it will go. Use a plastic opening tool to gently pry off the hinge on the right side by pushing it to the left and off the hook. Open the lid further.

Lines.Text: use a t9 torx screwdriver to remove a total of ten ( 10 ) 12 mm screws from the main cover by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise .
the two screws above the screen assembly are deep so you may need a long screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T9 torx screwdriver to remove a total of ten (10) 12mm screws from the main cover by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise. The two screws above the screen assembly are deep so you may need a long screwdriver.

Lines.Text: grab the main cover and lift it up slightly .
do not pull toothere is a cable connecting the cover to the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the main cover and lift it up slightly. Do not pull too—there is a cable connecting the cover to the printer.

Lines.Text: grab the base of the white ribbon cable connecting the cover to the base of the printer and pull it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the base of the white ribbon cable connecting the cover to the base of the printer and pull it out.

Lines.Text: using tweezers , pinch the top of the spring located on the right side of the printhead .
pull the spring up and around the hook of the carriage to remove the spring from the printhead .
use the same procedure to remove the left spring .
the springs may fly out of the printer once you remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Using tweezers, pinch the top of the  spring located on the right side of the printhead. Pull the spring up and around the hook of the carriage to remove the spring from the printhead. Use the same procedure to remove the left spring. The springs may fly out of the printer once you remove them.

Lines.Text: pinch the left most white cable located on the back of the printhead with your tweezers .
pull the cable to remove it from the printhead .
continue this process to remove all three white cable from the printhead .

Steps.Text_raw: Pinch the left most white cable located on the back of the printhead with your tweezers. Pull the cable to remove it from the printhead. Continue this process to remove all three white cable from the printhead.

Lines.Text: lift the printhead off the printer to expose the last white cable .
pinch the the last cable with the tweezers .
pull the cable to disconnect it from the printhead .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the printhead off the printer to expose the last white cable. Pinch the the last cable with the tweezers. Pull the cable to disconnect it from the printhead.

Lines.Text: using the tweezers , remove the right side of the metal clamp that is holding the metal frame in place by pulling up .
with the tweezers , unhook the metal coil side of the clamp and pull up to remove it completely .
repeat these steps on the other side of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the tweezers, remove the right side of the metal clamp that is holding the metal frame in place by pulling up. With the tweezers, unhook the metal coil side of the clamp and pull up to remove it completely. Repeat these steps on the other side of the printer.

Lines.Text: on the right side of the printer , remove the screw ( 6 mm t9 ) holding the carriage belt wheel by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: On the right side of the printer, remove the screw (6mm T9) holding the carriage belt wheel by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise.

Lines.Text: using the tweezers , remove the metal clamp directly under the screw that was just removed by pulling up .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the tweezers, remove the metal clamp directly under the screw that was just removed by pulling up.

Lines.Text: using one hand , loosen the carriage belt around the wheel by compressing the spring against the wheel .
while still compressing the spring , use your other hand to grab the spring and wheel and pull up to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Using one hand, loosen the carriage belt around the wheel by compressing the spring against the wheel. While still compressing the spring, use your other hand to  grab the spring and wheel and pull up to remove them.

Lines.Text: unwrap the carriage belt from the hook on the other side of the printer using the tweezers by pulling to the left and up .

Steps.Text_raw: Unwrap the carriage belt from the hook on the other side of the printer using the tweezers by pulling to the left and up.

Lines.Text: grab the metal rod connected to the carriage .
push the rod to the left and lift up the right end .
lift the metal rod completely out of the printer by lifting straight up , and slide the rod out of the carriage by pushing the left end to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the metal rod connected to the carriage. Push the rod to the left and lift up the right end. Lift the metal rod completely out of the printer by lifting straight up, and slide the rod out of the carriage by pushing the left end to the right.

Lines.Text: flip the carriage upside down .
using the metal tweezers , remove the clamp over the carriage belt by first pulling up on the back of the clamp , then on the front .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the carriage upside down. Using the metal tweezers, remove the clamp over the carriage belt by first pulling up on the back of the clamp, then on the front.

Lines.Text: remove the carriage belt by holding the carriage in one hand and pulling the carriage belt up with the other .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the carriage belt by holding the carriage in one hand and pulling the carriage belt up with the other.

Subject: Carriage Belt

Steps.Text_raw: Using the tweezers, remove the right side of the metal clamp that is holding the metal frame in place by pulling up. With the tweezers, unhook the metal coil side of the clamp and pull up to remove it completely. Repeat these steps on the other side of the printer.

Lines.Text: on the right side of the printer , remove the screw ( 6 mm t9 ) holding the carriage belt wheel by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: On the right side of the printer, remove the screw (6mm T9) holding the carriage belt wheel by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise.

Lines.Text: using the tweezers , remove the metal clamp directly under the screw that was just removed by pulling up .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the tweezers, remove the metal clamp directly under the screw that was just removed by pulling up.

Lines.Text: using one hand , loosen the carriage belt around the wheel by compressing the spring against the wheel .
while still compressing the spring , use your other hand to grab the spring and wheel and pull up to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Using one hand, loosen the carriage belt around the wheel by compressing the spring against the wheel. While still compressing the spring, use your other hand to  grab the spring and wheel and pull up to remove them.

Lines.Text: unwrap the carriage belt from the hook on the other side of the printer using the tweezers by pulling to the left and up .

Steps.Text_raw: Unwrap the carriage belt from the hook on the other side of the printer using the tweezers by pulling to the left and up.

Lines.Text: grab the metal rod connected to the carriage .
push the rod to the left and lift up the right end .
lift the metal rod completely out of the printer by lifting straight up , and slide the rod out of the carriage by pushing the left end to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the metal rod connected to the carriage. Push the rod to the left and lift up the right end. Lift the metal rod completely out of the printer by lifting straight up, and slide the rod out of the carriage by pushing the left end to the right.

Lines.Text: flip the carriage upside down .
using the metal tweezers , remove the clamp over the carriage belt by first pulling up on the back of the clamp , then on the front .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the carriage upside down. Using the metal tweezers, remove the clamp over the carriage belt by first pulling up on the back of the clamp, then on the front.

Lines.Text: remove the carriage belt by holding the carriage in one hand and pulling the carriage belt up with the other .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the carriage belt by holding the carriage in one hand and pulling the carriage belt up with the other.

Lines.Text: use the tweezers to push the three latches out of the back of the carriage one at a time .
the metal bracket will fall off after unhooking the latches , so make sure to hold it in place with one hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tweezers to push the three latches out of the back of the carriage one at a time. The metal bracket will fall off after unhooking the latches, so make sure to hold it in place with one hand.

Lines.Text: with barcode label right-side up , grab the right side of the chip and pull it off the carriage .

Steps.Text_raw: With "Barcode Label" right-side up, grab the right side of the chip and pull it off the carriage.

Lines.Text: the four ( 4 ) connectors should come out easily . if they do not , you can use tweezers to push them out from the top .

Steps.Text_raw: The four (4) connectors should come out easily. If they do not, you can use tweezers to push them out from the top.

Lines.Text: turn the carriage on its side with the ends of the cables on the top side .
using the tweezers , remove one side of the black bracket by pushing the side closest to you downwards .
repeat this process on the far side to remove the bracket completely .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the carriage on its side with the ends of the cables on the top side. Using the tweezers, remove one side of the black bracket by pushing the side closest to you downwards. Repeat this process on the far side to remove the bracket completely.

Lines.Text: hold the ribbon cables with one hand and use the other hand to pull off the plastic bracket .
it may be helpful to take the cables out one at a time if you can't fit them all through at once .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the ribbon cables with one hand and use the other hand to pull off the plastic bracket. It may be helpful to take the cables out one at a time if you can't fit them all through at once.

Lines.Text: pull the cables out of the carrier by gripping the carrier with one hand and pulling all of the cables together with your other hand in the opposite direction .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the cables out of the carrier by gripping the carrier with one hand and pulling all of the cables together with your other hand in the opposite direction.

Lines.Text: flip the carrier on the side .
remove the screw ( t6 6 mm ) on the side of the carrier by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise .
lift off the plastic cover by pulling it up off the carrier .
remove the black latch by pulling the ribbon cable out of the carrier by pulling straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the carrier on the side. Remove the screw (T6 6mm) on the side of the carrier by turning the screwdriver counterclockwise. Lift off the plastic cover by pulling it up off the carrier. Remove the black latch by pulling the ribbon cable out of the carrier by pulling straight up.

Subject: Carriage

Title: Samsung U28E510 Jog Button Replacement

Lines.Text: start by removing the screen bezel .
use a pair of spudgers to pry between the bezel and the rest of the monitor .
ideally use plastic tools as this step could damage the edges of the screencover .
lay monitor on its back and pull off screen cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing the screen bezel. Use a pair of spudgers to pry between the bezel and the rest of the monitor. Ideally use plastic tools as this step could damage the edges of the screencover. lay monitor on its back and pull off screen cover.

Lines.Text: flip the monitor over so that it is facedown .
remove the single screw in the middle using a 2 phillips screwdriver .
remove the backing to reveal the jog button .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the monitor over so that it is facedown. remove the single screw in the middle using a #2 Phillips screwdriver. Remove the backing to reveal the Jog Button.

Lines.Text: disconnect signal cable to power supply board .
remove and replace jog button .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect signal cable to power supply board. Remove and replace jog button.

Subject: Jog Button

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8620 Power Adapter Replacement

Lines.Text: turn off the printer and remove the power cable .
remove two 13 mm t9 screws using a t9-torx screwdriver . turn counterclockwise until the screws are released .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the printer and remove the power cable. Remove two 13mm T9 screws using a T9-Torx screwdriver. Turn counterclockwise  until the screws are released.

Lines.Text: open the front door by placing your finger on the indented groove on the left side of the printer and pulling down
this will give you access to the two t9-torx 13 mm screws that need to be removed to release the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the front door by placing your finger on the indented groove on the left side of the printer and pulling down This will give you access to the two T9-TORX 13mm screws that need to be removed to release the panel.

Lines.Text: remove the two 13 mm screws with a t9-torx screwdriver by turning counter-clockwise ( left ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 13mm screws with a T9-TORX screwdriver by turning counter-clockwise (left).

Lines.Text: gently remove the left side panel by placing your palm flat against the surface and pulling down .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the left side panel by placing your palm flat against the surface and pulling down.

Lines.Text: remove two screws 13 mm screws with a t9-torx screwdriver by rotating them counterclockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two screws 13mm screws with a T9-Torx  screwdriver by rotating them counterclockwise.

Lines.Text: unplug the black cable .
move all the cables and wires to the top of the motherboard to allow the power adapter underneath to be removed freely .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the black cable . Move all the cables and wires to the top of the motherboard to allow the power adapter underneath to be removed freely.

Lines.Text: gently bend the black ribbon cable .
remove the four 8 mm t8 screw underneath the ribbon cable by rotating it counterclockwise with a t8 -torx screwdriver .
take out the black plastic cover and the colored wires connected to it .
now you have cleared a passage for the power adapter to be taken out .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently bend the  black ribbon cable. Remove the  four 8mm T8 screw underneath the ribbon cable by rotating it counterclockwise with a T8 -Torx screwdriver. Take out the black plastic cover and the colored wires connected to it. Now you have cleared a passage for the power adapter  to be taken out.

Lines.Text: gently pulling out the power adapter .
be careful with all the wires when pulling out the adapter .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pulling  out the power adapter. Be careful with all the wires when pulling out the adapter.

Subject: Power Adapter

Title: Samsung U28E510 Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: start by removing the screen bezel .
use a pair of spudgers to pry between the cover and the rest of the monitor .
ideally use plastic tools as this step could damage the edges of the screencover .
lay monitor on its back and pull off screen cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing the screen bezel. Use a pair of spudgers to pry between the cover and the rest of the monitor. Ideally use plastic tools as this step could damage the edges of the screencover. Lay monitor on its back and pull off screen cover.

Lines.Text: flip the monitor over so that it is facedown .
remove the single screw in the middle using a 2 phillips screwdriver .
remove backing to reveal signal/power board in center .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the monitor over so that it is facedown. Remove the single screw in the middle using a #2 Phillips screwdriver. Remove backing to reveal signal/power board in center.

Lines.Text: ensure to grip the connection plugs when removing wires to prevent damage to wires .
unplug wires connected to supply ( one on the left and one on right ) .
disconnect the signal ribbon cable .
pull the motherboard shield offit's adhered in place by tape , so some force may be needed .

Steps.Text_raw: Ensure to grip the connection plugs when removing wires to prevent damage to wires. Unplug wires connected to supply (one on the left and one on right). Disconnect the signal ribbon cable. Pull the motherboard shield off—it's adhered in place by tape, so some force may be needed.

Lines.Text: lay piece upside down .
use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the two screws that secure the motherboard .
lift the motherboard out of the metal shield .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay piece upside down. Use a #2 Phillips screwdriver to remove the two screws that secure the motherboard. Lift the motherboard out of the metal shield.

Subject: Motherboard

Title: Samsung U28E510 Low Voltage Display Signal Board Replacement

Lines.Text: start by removing the screen bezel .
use a pair of spudgers to pry between the bezel and the rest of the monitor .
ideally use plastic tools as this step could damage the edges of the screencover .
lay monitor on its back and pull off screen cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing the screen bezel. Use a pair of spudgers to pry between the bezel and the rest of the monitor. Ideally use plastic tools as this step could damage the edges of the screencover. lay monitor on its back and pull off screen cover.

Lines.Text: flip the monitor over so that it is face down .
remove the single screw in the middle using a 2 phillips screwdriver .
remove the backing to reveal the low voltage display signal board .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the monitor over so that it is face down. Remove the single screw in the middle using a #2 Phillips screwdriver. Remove the backing to reveal the Low Voltage Display Signal Board.

Lines.Text: remove the 4 holding screws using a 0 phillips screwdriver .
lift the cover to expose the lvds board while taking care to prevent removal of the white fogged plastic cover . this plastic cover keeps the wire ribbons safe from accidental damage .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 4 holding screws using a #0 Phillips screwdriver. Lift the cover to expose the LVDS Board while taking care to prevent removal of the white fogged plastic cover. This plastic cover keeps the wire ribbons safe from accidental damage.

Lines.Text: disconnect the input signal ribbon cable from the top of the board .
disconnect the output signal ribbon cables by using a plastic sprudger to lift the connection lock .
remove and replace the lvds board .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the input signal ribbon cable from the top of the board. Disconnect the output signal ribbon cables by using a plastic sprudger to lift the connection lock. Remove and replace the LVDS Board.

Subject: Low Voltage Display Signal Board

Title: HP Officejet 4630 Fax Feeder Replacement

Lines.Text: lift the fax feeder cover until it stands on its own .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the fax feeder cover until it stands on its own.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to unclasp the hinge that holds the feeder cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to unclasp the hinge that holds the feeder cover.

Lines.Text: lift the green tab to remove the fax feeder from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the green tab to remove the fax feeder from the printer.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to pry the pivot point apart while lifting the feeder up .
there is still a cable holding the part to the rest of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to pry the pivot point apart while lifting the feeder up. There is still a cable holding the part to the rest of the printer.

Lines.Text: use a screwdriver to remove the single 9 mm t10 screw .
remove the wire cover and pull the wire away from the printer . the fax feeder head is now free to be separated from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a screwdriver to remove the single 9mm T10 screw. Remove the wire cover and pull the wire away from the printer. The fax feeder head is now free to be separated from the printer.

Subject: Fax Feeder

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8620 Display Replacement

Lines.Text: place the printer on its back and rotate the display clockwise to gain access to the underside of the display .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the printer on its back and rotate the display clockwise to gain access to the underside of the display.

Lines.Text: locate the control arm on the underside of the display . you will need to detach this to access the screws .
place a finger behind the control arm .
separate the display unit from the control arm by pulling down with your finger and using your other hand to push the display unit up .
removing the control arm takes a moderate amount of force .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the control arm on the underside of the display. You will need to detach this to access the screws. Place a finger behind the control arm. Separate the display unit from the control arm by pulling down with your finger and using your other hand to push the display unit up. Removing the control arm takes a moderate amount of force.

Lines.Text: remove the four 11 mm t9-torx screws on the underside of the display unit by rotating the screwdriver counter clockwise .
open the display unit to expose the circuit board by separating the back and front panels .
remove the ribbon cable by gently releasing the plastic locking mechanism and pulling the cable away from the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 11mm T9-Torx screws on the underside of the display unit by rotating the screwdriver counter clockwise. Open the display unit to expose the circuit board by separating the back and front panels. Remove the ribbon cable by gently releasing the plastic locking mechanism and pulling the cable away from the circuit board.

Lines.Text: remove the four 7 mm t9-torx screws from the circuit board that are holding the screen in place using a t9-torx screwdriver and turning counter clockwise .
lift the circuit board/screen panel from the black frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 7mm T9-Torx screws from the circuit board that are holding the screen in place using a T9-Torx screwdriver and turning counter clockwise. Lift the circuit board/screen panel from the black frame.

Subject: Display

Title: HP Envy 5660 Printhead Replacement

Lines.Text: open the printer so that the underside of the scanner is showing .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the printer so that the underside of the scanner is showing.

Lines.Text: unscrew the black 11.5 mm screw closest to the front right corner using a t10 screw bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the black 11.5 mm screw closest to the front right corner using a T10 screw bit.

Lines.Text: remove right side of the printer using a plastic opening tool or metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove right side of the printer using a plastic opening tool or metal spudger.

Lines.Text: remove spring from the side of the print head rail using a metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove spring from the side of the print head rail using a metal spudger.

Lines.Text: push the metal rail the print head rests on inwards to remove it from its bearings .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the metal rail the print head rests on inwards to remove it from its bearings.

Lines.Text: remove the belt from the back of the print head using a metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the belt from the back of the print head using a metal spudger.

Lines.Text: remove the print head from the metal rail by sliding it off the rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the print head from the metal rail by sliding it off the rail.

Subject: Printhead

Title: HP Envy 5660 Scanner Glass Replacement

Lines.Text: open the cartridge access area .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the cartridge access area.

Lines.Text: remove the three 11.5 mm screws with a t10 bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 11.5 mm screws with a T10 bit.

Lines.Text: locate the cover hinge on the right side of the printer .
pull the hinge off of the scanner to allow the scanner to open to 90 degress .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the cover hinge on the right side of the printer. Pull the hinge off of the scanner to allow the scanner to open to 90 degress.

Lines.Text: remove the 12 mm screws on the left side of the printer with a t10 bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the  12 mm screws on the left side of the printer with a T10 bit.

Lines.Text: remove the 11.5 mm screw with a t10 bit to release the spring-loaded hinge .
since this is a compression spring , the hinge will snap downwards as soon as it is loosened .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 11.5 mm screw with a T10 bit to release the spring-loaded hinge. Since this is a compression spring, the hinge will snap downwards as soon as it is loosened.

Lines.Text: pull the plastic side cover off of the printer .
you may need to lift the printer and push the cover downwards as it is latched onto the bottom of the printer .
plastic opening tools or a metal spudger may also be used .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the plastic side cover off of the printer. You may need to lift the printer and push the cover downwards as it is latched onto the bottom of the printer. Plastic opening tools or a metal spudger may also be used.

Lines.Text: remove the five 11.5 mm screws located at the bottom of the scanner .
steps 3-6 were intended to create easier access to these screws . however , they will still be difficult to reach .
the top of the scanner will now easily pull off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 11.5 mm screws located at the bottom of the scanner. Steps 3-6 were intended to create easier access to these screws. However, they will still be difficult to reach. The top of the scanner will now easily pull off.

Lines.Text: pry the old scanning glass up with a metal spudger .
there are adhesives under the scanning glass . be careful not to break the glass while removing it .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the old scanning glass up with a metal spudger. There are adhesives under the scanning glass. Be careful not to break the glass while removing it.

Subject: Scanner Glass

peel the model sticker off the cover .
this will expose the t10 screw securing the panel .

loosen the panel cover from the printer body .
there is a ribbon cable connected to the backside of the cover . disconnect the cable before separating the panel completely .

Title: HP Deskjet 1000 J110a Plug Ports Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the two 13 mm screws located on the back of the printer using a screwdriver with the t10 torx bit ( star-shaped ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 13 mm screws located on the back of the printer using a screwdriver with the T10 torx bit (star-shaped).

Lines.Text: in the front of the printer , open the tray where the paper comes out and remove the two 13 mm screws located under the top of the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: In the front of the printer, open the tray where the paper comes out and remove the two 13 mm screws located under the top of the printer.

Lines.Text: with the front of the printer facing you , lift and raise the left side of the panel ( like opening a book in reverse ) until it disconnects from the clip on the right side of the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: With the front of the printer facing you, lift and raise the left side of the panel (like opening a book in reverse) until it disconnects from the clip on the right side of the panel.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the two flat ribbon connectors which connect the circuit board to the other printer components .
remove each connector using tweezers if it is too difficult to remove them by hand .

Lines.Text: locate and remove the three multicolored wire connectors which connect the circuit board to the other printer components .
remove each connector by hand , as shown . you can use tweezers if it is too difficult to remove them by hand .

Lines.Text: locate the paper control sensor .

you can find the sensor , with the back of the printer facing you , on the right , and in front of the main circuit board . the paper control sensor will also be attached to a small circuit board . you will be replacing this circuit board .
locate and unplug the connector which connects the sensor board to the main circuit board .
use tweezers if unplugging by hand is too difficult .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the paper control sensor. You can find the sensor, with the back of the printer facing you, on the right, and in front of the main circuit board. The paper control sensor will also be attached to a small circuit board. You will be replacing this circuit board. Locate and unplug the connector which connects the sensor board to the main circuit board. Use tweezers if unplugging by hand is too difficult.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the 8 mm screw with a screwdriver and the t10 torx bit , then remove the paper control sensor board .
in this picture , the main circuit board is removed . it is not necessary to remove the main circuit board unless the paper control sensor is not the only part being replaced .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the 8mm screw with a screwdriver and the T10 torx bit, then remove the paper control sensor board. In this picture, the main circuit board is removed. It is not necessary to remove the main circuit board unless the paper control sensor is not the only part being replaced.

Lines.Text: remove the two 13 mm screws with the screwdriver and a t10 torx bit .
slide the ink dispenser to the center in order to reach the screws .
remove the one 9 mm screw with the screwdriver and a t10 torx bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 13mm screws with the screwdriver and a T10 torx bit. Slide the ink dispenser to the center in order to reach the screws. Remove the one 9mm screw with the screwdriver and a T10 torx bit.

Lines.Text: lift the entire ink dispenser assembly out of the printer .
ignore the following step if you are replacing the paper roller motor instead of the ink carriage motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the entire ink dispenser assembly out of the printer. Ignore the following step if you are replacing the paper roller motor instead of the ink carriage motor.

Lines.Text: remove the two 5 mm screws which hold motor in place .
remove the belt from the round motor gear , then remove the ink carriage motor .
be careful not to allow pulley on right side of belt to fall out and become lost . it will remain in place if the assembly is handled gently .
ignore these instructions if you are replacing the paper roller motor instead of the ink carriage motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 5mm screws which hold motor in place. Remove the belt from the round motor gear, then remove the ink carriage motor. Be careful not to allow pulley on right side of belt to fall out and become lost. It will remain in place if the assembly is handled gently. Ignore these instructions if you are replacing the paper roller motor instead of the ink carriage motor.

Lines.Text: remove the two 13 mm screws which hold the paper roller motor frame in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 13mm screws which hold the paper roller motor frame in place.

Lines.Text: lift the roller arm and motor frame out enough to reach the belt and motor screws .
unscrew the upper 4 mm screw which holds the motor in the metal frame . this allows the motor to slide enough to loosen the belt .
remove the belt from the motor gear .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the roller arm and motor frame out enough to reach the belt and motor screws. Unscrew the upper 4 mm screw which holds the motor in the metal frame. This allows the motor to slide enough to loosen the belt. Remove the belt from the motor gear.

Lines.Text: remove the remaining 4 mm screw from the motor , then take the motor out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the remaining 4mm screw from the motor, then take the motor out.

Subject: Paper Roller Motor

Title: Razer Naga Expert MMO Scroll Wheel Replacement

Lines.Text: peel back the two teflon tape from the top corners and the one larger one from the bottom with a spudger .

unplug the white cord from the circuit board .

Lines.Text: remove the 5 mm screw holding the scroll wheel in place with a phillips head 00 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5mm screw holding the scroll wheel in place with a Phillips head #00 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: unplug the cord that connects the scroll wheel to the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the cord that connects the scroll wheel to the circuit board.

Lines.Text: slide the chip out of the scroll wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the chip out of the scroll wheel.

Lines.Text: gently wiggle the scroll wheel up and back to remove the scroll wheel from the mouse .
use your fingers to simultaneously push the scroll wheel and its frame forward and pull back on the plastic tab directly behind the scroll wheel until it is loose .
use your thumbs to pop the scroll wheel out from its plastic frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently wiggle the scroll wheel up and back to remove the scroll wheel from the mouse. Use your fingers to simultaneously push the scroll wheel and its frame forward and pull back on the plastic tab directly behind the scroll wheel until it is loose. Use your thumbs to pop the scroll wheel out from its plastic frame.

Lines.Text: place the new scroll wheel in the mount .
upon reassembly , be careful to ensure the silver box on the side of the wheel is placed into the frame with the tab facing downward so upon entry into the frame it fits into its slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the new scroll wheel in the mount. Upon reassembly, be careful to ensure the silver box on the side of the wheel is placed into the frame with the tab facing downward so upon entry into the frame it fits into its slot.

Lines.Text: remove the four 7 mm screws using a phillips head 00 screwdriver .

unplug the white cord from the circuit board .

Lines.Text: lightly pull the two plastic sides of the mouse to remove them .

Lines.Text: unplug the cord that connects the scroll wheel to the circuit board .

Lines.Text: slide the chip out of the scroll wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the chip out of the scroll wheel.

Lines.Text: gently wiggle the scroll wheel up and back to remove the scroll wheel from the mouse .
use your fingers to simultaneously push the scroll wheel and its frame forward and pull back on the plastic tab directly behind the scroll wheel until it is loose .
use your thumbs to pop the scroll wheel out from its plastic frame .

when reassembling the mouse , place the loose plastic piece that holds the scroll wheel and wire in place into the rectangular slots in the circuit board .

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus Control Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: lift the scanner lid to a resting position .

Lines.Text: wedge the plastic opening tool into each of the three plugs to pry them from the control panel hinge located above the control panel screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the plastic opening tool into each of the three plugs to pry them from the control panel hinge located above the control panel screen.

Lines.Text: remove the three 10 mm-t10 torx screws .

Lines.Text: disconnect the control panel from the hinge by gently lifting upward , then outward towards you .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the control panel from the hinge by gently lifting upward, then outward towards you.

Lines.Text: detach the control panel from the black plastic latch by gently lifting upward , then outward towards you .
pull up on the left side when sliding up so the panel does not get stuck at the end of the track .

this does not break the cables . they can easily be reconnected by plugging them into their ports again .

Title: Dell c1760nw Clean main mechanics and make it work

Lines.Text: your dell c1760nw ( and some other led/laserprinter models ) shows you incessantly the error 007-371 ? then this repair guide is interesting for you !

Steps.Text_raw: Your Dell C1760nw ( and some other LED/laserprinter models) shows you incessantly the error 007-371? Then this repair guide is interesting for you!

Lines.Text: remove the folding paper pad , by bending it ( careful ) and unfixing it on one site .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the folding paper pad, by bending it (careful) and unfixing it on one site.

Lines.Text: remove the bar at the top and the front .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bar at the top and the front.

Lines.Text: remove two srews from the front . and to take off the cover leverage remove the tabs diagonally from the front over the latching .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two srews from the front. And to take off the cover leverage remove the tabs diagonally from the front over the latching.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the cover ( attention : cable connection to the display is hanging there ) and rack it to the back of the printer ( move it back and forth to unhook the locking nipple ) : unplug the display connector ( yellow lines ) from the i/o board , unroute the cable and remove the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the cover (Attention: cable connection to the display is hanging there) and rack it to the back of the printer (move it back and forth to unhook the locking nipple): unplug the display connector (yellow lines) from the I/O board, unroute the cable and remove the cover.

Lines.Text: place the printer on the right side and remove the left side panel ( there are 2 lugs under the printer )

Steps.Text_raw: Place the printer on the right side and remove the left side panel (there are 2 lugs under the printer)

Lines.Text: reposition the printer and hold the disengaged lugs in the disengaged position . open the rear flap and slide the side panel backwards while moving away from the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Reposition the printer and hold the disengaged lugs in the disengaged position. Open the rear flap and slide the side panel backwards while moving away from the printer.

Lines.Text: the wlan card is secured with a screw- remove it , carefully unplug the wlan card and remove the wlan bracket together with the cable

Steps.Text_raw: The WLAN card is secured with a screw-> remove it, carefully unplug the WLAN card and remove the WLAN bracket together with the cable

Lines.Text: loosen all connectors ( pull plugs carefully out of sockets )

pull both flexible cables out of sockets . caution : the wider flexible cable has a base with lock . lift it carefully with a fingernail , this releases the flexible cable and allows it to be easily pulled out of the socket .
i/o card is secured with 4 screws , loosen all 4.
there is another screw on the usb port : loosen it

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen all connectors (pull plugs carefully out of sockets) Pull both flexible cables out of sockets. Caution: the wider flexible cable has a base with lock. Lift it carefully with a fingernail, this releases the flexible cable and allows it to be easily pulled out of the socket. I/O card is secured with 4 screws, loosen all 4. There is another screw on the USB port: Loosen it

Lines.Text: the metal plate under the i/o card ( holder for i/o card ) is secured with 3 screws . remove all 3 screws

Steps.Text_raw: The metal plate under the I/O card (holder for I/O card) is secured with 3 screws. Remove all 3 screws

Lines.Text: the fan is secured to this plate with a screw ( red arrow ) : loosen the screw and unlock the locking device on the other side of the fan .
remove the fan , disconnect the cables and plugs on the upper control board ( no photo ) .

Steps.Text_raw: The fan is secured to this plate with a screw (red arrow): Loosen the screw and unlock the locking device on the other side of the fan. Remove the fan, disconnect the cables and plugs on the upper control board (no photo).

Lines.Text: unroute all cable harnesses on the left side from the guides .
remove the cable guide bracket and hang it from the remaining cable harnesses on the printer .

Steps.Text_raw: Unroute all cable harnesses on the left side from the guides. Remove the cable guide bracket and hang it from the remaining cable harnesses on the printer.

Lines.Text: a ) remove plastic bracket with gear for paper feed ( 2 screws ) - no photo !
b ) remove board with color control ( 4 screws )
c ) remove main drive

Steps.Text_raw: A) Remove plastic bracket with gear for paper feed (2 screws) - No photo! B) Remove board with color control (4 screws) C) Remove main drive

Lines.Text: carefully pull the upper flexible cable out of the base
on the right side : 4 flexible cables with base lock . with fingernail : open the lock , then carefully lift the flexible cable by the blue tab and remove it from the base . ( hand )

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the upper flexible cable out of the base on the right side: 4 flexible cables with base lock. With fingernail: Open the lock, then carefully lift the flexible cable by the blue tab and remove it from the base. (hand)

Lines.Text: loosen 4 screws
pull the main gearbox carefully and straight off the printer . ( caution : loose gears ! )
last photo : this is what the dismantled main gearbox looks like : the completely muddy ( color grease ) drive gear is the black ( below )

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen 4 screws Pull the main gearbox carefully and straight off the printer. (Caution: loose gears!) Last photo: This is what the dismantled main gearbox looks like: The completely muddy (color & grease) drive gear is the black (below)

Lines.Text: next , we remove the color control gear ( black , large plastic bracket with 15 meshing gears ( 5 screws have to be loosened ) .
caution when removing the bracket so that the gears do not fall out !
2nd photo : removed condition and the central problem : the paint particles have combined to form a sticky mass with the gear grease .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, we remove the color control gear (black, large plastic bracket with 15 meshing gears (5 screws have to be loosened). CAUTION when removing the bracket so that the gears do not fall out! 2nd photo: removed condition and THE central problem: The paint particles have combined to form a sticky mass with the gear grease.

Lines.Text: washing the gearwheels .
a toothbrush with plenty of hand soap brings good success here !
attention : every gear wheel has its position ! do not mix them up !
attention : dry all parts ( brackets , gears ) very well ! knocking the ingredients on paper towels helps !

Steps.Text_raw: Washing the gearwheels. A toothbrush with plenty of hand soap brings good success here! Attention: Every gear wheel has its position! Do not mix them up! Attention: Dry all parts (brackets, gears) very well! "Knocking" the ingredients on paper towels helps!

Lines.Text: the before / after evidence ; - )
i used low-viscosity grease to grease the axles and the teeth . finally , add a splash of balistol to the grease on the axles .

Steps.Text_raw: The "before / after" evidence ;-) I used low-viscosity grease to grease the axles and the teeth. Finally, add a splash of Balistol to the grease on the axles.

Lines.Text: and once again : before and after

Steps.Text_raw: And once again: before and after

Lines.Text: now the chassis should be cleaned ( only for the good feeling ! and because of the care . . . )
moist all-purpose wipes in a resealable plastic cover are ideal for cleaning .

Steps.Text_raw: Now the chassis should be cleaned (only for the good feeling! and because of the care...) Moist all-purpose wipes" in a resealable plastic cover are ideal for cleaning.

Lines.Text: the assembly is done in reverse order . . . until the printer only needs the right and front housing part plus the paper flap .
if the error message 007-371 appears again at the first attempt of the printout , this is nothing unusual . the paint mixing drive usually still needs a boost .

turn the printer off and on again a short time later . now you help the gear a little bit on the jumps : for this you put on a screwdriver as shown in picture 1 , hold it with a little pressure so that you can get the gear wheel touched with it a little in motion when it is released by the small relay .

this usually does not happen by itself during the first printing process ( although the spring in the gearbox , which you probably noticed earlier , should actually trigger this momentum ) . so , put on the screwdriver like this and send a print job .
in picture 2 you can see a better close-up to attach the screwdriver exactly .
if everything works , then reassemble everything else and : done !

Steps.Text_raw: The assembly is done in reverse order... Until the printer only needs the right and front housing part plus the paper flap. If the error message 007-371 appears again at the first attempt of the printout, this is nothing unusual. The paint mixing drive usually still needs a "boost". Turn the printer off and on again a short time later. Now you help the gear a little bit on the jumps: for this you put on a screwdriver as shown in picture 1, hold it with a little pressure so that you can get the gear wheel touched with it a little in motion when it is released by the small relay. This usually does not happen by itself during the first printing process (although the spring in the gearbox, which you probably noticed earlier, should actually trigger this momentum). So, put on the screwdriver like this and send a print job. In picture 2 you can see a better close-up to attach the screwdriver exactly. If everything works, then reassemble everything else and: DONE!

Subject: Main mechanics
